content: Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 1: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 2: Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 3: The Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 4: Master of the Day of Judgment.
Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 5: It is You we worship, and upon You we call for help.
Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 6: Guide us to the straight path.
Surah al-Fatihah, Ayah 7: The path of those You have blessed, not of those against whom there is anger, nor of those who are misguided.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the Verses of the Wise Book.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 2: Is it a wonder to the people that We inspired a man from among them: "Warn mankind, and give good news to those who believe that they are on a sound footing with their Lord"? The disbelievers said, "This is a manifest sorcerer."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 3: Your Lord is God, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then settled over the Throne, governing all things. There is no intercessor except after His permission. Such is God, your Lord-so serve Him. Will you not reflect?

Surah Yunus, Ayah 4: To Him is your return, altogether. The promise of God is true. He originates creation, and then He repeats it, to reward those who believe and do good deeds with equity. As for those who disbelieve, for them is a drink of boiling water, and agonizing torment, on account of their disbelief.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 5: It is He who made the sun radiant, and the moon a light, and determined phases for it-that you may know the number of years and the calculation. God did not create all this except with truth. He details the revelations for a people who know.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 6: In the alternation of night and day, and in what God created in the heavens and the earth, are signs for people who are aware.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 7: Those who do not hope to meet Us, and are content with the worldly life, and are at ease in it, and those who pay no heed to Our signs.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 8: These-their dwelling is the Fire-on account of what they used to do.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 9: As for those who believe and do good deeds, their Lord guides them in their faith. Rivers will flow beneath them in the Gardens of Bliss.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 10: Their call therein is, "Glory be to You, our God." And their greeting therein is, "Peace." And the last of their call is, "Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 11: If God were to accelerate the ill for the people, as they wish to accelerate the good, their term would have been fulfilled. But We leave those who do not expect Our encounter to blunder in their excesses.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 12: Whenever adversity touches the human being, he prays to Us-reclining on his side, or sitting, or standing. But when We have relieved his adversity from him, he goes away, as though he had never called on Us for trouble that had afflicted him. Thus the deeds of the transgressors appear good to them.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 13: We destroyed generations before you when they did wrong. Their messengers came to them with clear signs, but they would not believe. Thus We requite the sinful people.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 14: Then We made you successors on earth after them, to see how you would behave.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 15: And when Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who do not hope to meet Us say, "Bring a Quran other than this, or change it." Say, "It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. I fear, if I disobeyed my Lord, the torment of a terrible Day."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 16: Say, "Had God willed, I would not have recited it to you, and He would not have made it known to you. I have lived among you for a lifetime before it. Do you not understand?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 17: Who does greater wrong than someone who fabricates lies about God, or denies His revelations? The guilty will never prosper.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 18: And they worship, besides God, what neither harms them nor benefits them. And they say, "These are our intercessors with God." Say, "Are you informing God about what He does not know in the heavens or on earth?" Glorified be He, High above the associations they make.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 19: Mankind was a single community; then they differed. Were it not for a prior decree from your Lord, the matters over which they had disputed would have been settled.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 20: And they say, "If only a miracle was sent down to him from his Lord." Say, "The realm of the unseen belongs to God; so wait, I am waiting with you."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 21: When We make the people taste mercy after some adversity has touched them, they begin to scheme against Our revelations. Say, "God is swifter in scheming." Our envoys are writing down what you scheme.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 22: It is He who transports you across land and sea. Until, when you are on ships, sailing in a favorable wind, and rejoicing in it, a raging wind arrives. The waves surge over them from every side, and they realize that they are besieged. Thereupon they pray to God, professing sincere devotion to Him: "If You save us from this, we will be among the appreciative."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 23: But then, when He has saved them, they commit violations on earth, and oppose justice. O people! Your violations are against your own souls. It is the enjoyment of the present life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 24: The likeness of the present life is this: water that We send down from the sky is absorbed by the plants of the earth, from which the people and the animals eat. Until, when the earth puts on its fine appearance, and is beautified, and its inhabitants think that they have mastered it, Our command descends upon it by night or by day, and We turn it into stubble, as if it had not flourished the day before. We thus clarify the revelations for people who reflect.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 25: God invites to the Home of Peace, and guides whomever He wills to a straight path.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 26: For those who have done good is goodness, and more. Neither gloom nor shame will come over their faces. These are the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein forever.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 27: As for those who have earned evil deeds: a reward of similar evil, and shame will cover them. They will have no defense against God-as if their faces are covered with dark patches of night. These are the inmates of the Fire, abiding therein forever.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 28: On the Day when We will gather them altogether, then say to those who ascribed partners, "To your place, you and your partners." Then We will separate between them, and their partners will say, "It was not us you were worshiping."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 29: "God is sufficient witness between us and you. We were unaware of your worshiping us."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 30: There, every soul will experience what it had done previously; and they will be returned to God, their True Master; and what they used to invent will fail them.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 31: Say, "Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? And who controls the hearing and the sight? And who produces the living from the dead, and produces the dead from the living? And who governs the Order?" They will say, "God." Say, "Will you not be careful?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 32: Such is God, your Lord-the True. What is there, beyond the truth, except falsehood? How are you turned away?
Surah Yunus, Ayah 33: Thus your Lord's Word proved true against those who disobeyed, for they do not believe.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 34: Say, "Can any of your partners initiate creation, and then repeat it?" Say, "God initiates creation, and then repeats it. How are you so deluded?"

Surah Yunus, Ayah 35: Say, "Can any of your partners guide to the truth?" Say, "God guides to the truth. Is He who guides to the truth more worthy of being followed, or he who does not guide, unless he himself is guided? What is the matter with you? How do you judge?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 36: Most of them follow nothing but assumptions; and assumptions avail nothing against the truth. God is fully aware of what they do.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 37: This Quran could not have been produced by anyone other than God. In fact, it is a confirmation of what preceded it, and an elaboration of the Book. There is no doubt about it-it is from the Lord of the Universe.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 38: Or do they say, "He has forged it"? Say, "Then produce a single chapter like it, and call upon whomever you can, apart from God, if you are truthful."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 39: In fact, they deny what is beyond the limits of their knowledge, and whose explanation has not yet reached them. Thus those before them refused to believe. So note the consequences for the wrongdoers.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 40: Among them are those who believe in it, and among them are those who do not believe in it. Your Lord is fully aware of the mischief-makers.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 41: If they accuse you of lying, say, "I have my deeds, and you have your deeds. You are quit of what I do, and I am quit of what you do."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 42: And among them are those who listen to you. But can you make the deaf hear, even though they do not understand?
Surah Yunus, Ayah 43: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind, even though they do not see?
Surah Yunus, Ayah 44: God does not wrong the people in the least, but the people wrong their own selves.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 45: On the Day when He rounds them up-as if they had tarried only one hour of a day-they will recognize one another. Those who denied the meeting with God will be the losers. They were not guided.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 46: Whether We show you some of what We promise them, or take you, to Us is their return. God is witness to everything they do.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 47: Every community has a messenger. When their messenger has come, judgment will be passed between them with fairness, and they will not be wronged.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 48: And they say, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

Surah Yunus, Ayah 49: Say, "I have no power to harm or benefit myself, except as God wills. To every nation is an appointed time. Then, when their time arrives, they can neither postpone it by one hour, nor advance it.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 50: Say, "Have you considered? If His punishment overtakes you by night or by day, what part of it will the guilty seek to hasten?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 51: "Then, when it falls, will you believe in it? Now? When before you tried to hasten it?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 52: Then it will be said to those who did wrong, "Taste the torment of eternity. Will you be rewarded except for what you used to do?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 53: And they inquire of you, "Is it true?" Say, "Yes, by my Lord, it is true, and you cannot evade it."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 54: Had every soul which had done wrong possessed everything on earth, it would offer it as a ransom. They will hide the remorse when they witness the suffering, and it will be judged between them equitably, and they will not be wronged.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 55: Assuredly, to God belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. Assuredly, the promise of God is true. But most of them do not know.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 56: He gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 57: O people! There has come to you advice from your Lord, and healing for what is in the hearts, and guidance and mercy for the believers.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 58: Say, "In God's grace and mercy let them rejoice. That is better than what they hoard."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 59: Say, "Have you considered the sustenance God has sent down for you, some of which you made unlawful, and some lawful?" Say, "Did God give you permission, or do you fabricate lies and attribute them to God?"
Surah Yunus, Ayah 60: What will they think-those who fabricate lies and attribute them to God-on the Day of Resurrection? God is bountiful towards the people, but most of them do not give thanks.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 61: You do not get into any situation, nor do you recite any Quran, nor do you do anything, but We are watching over you as you undertake it. Not even the weight of an atom, on earth or in the sky, escapes your Lord, nor is there anything smaller or larger, but is in a clear record.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 62: Unquestionably, God's friends have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 63: Those who believe and are aware.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 64: For them is good news in this life, and in the Hereafter. There is no alteration to the words of God. That is the supreme triumph.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 65: And let not their sayings dishearten you. All power is God's. He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 66: Certainly, to God belongs everyone in the heavens and everyone on earth. Those who invoke other than God do not follow partners; they follow only assumptions, and they only guess.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 67: It is He who made the night for your rest, and the daylight for visibility. Surely in that are signs for people who listen.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 68: And they said, "God has taken a son." Be He glorified. He is the Self-Sufficient. His is everything in the heavens and everything on earth. Do you have any proof for this? Or are you saying about God what you do not know?
Surah Yunus, Ayah 69: Say, "Those who fabricate lies about God will not succeed."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 70: Some enjoyment in this world; then to Us is their return; then We will make them taste the severe punishment on account of their disbelief.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 71: And relate to them the story of Noah, when he said to his people, "O my people, if my presence among you and my reminding you of God's signs is too much for you, then in God I have put my trust. So come to a decision, you and your partners, and do not let the matter perplex you; then carry out your decision on me, and do not hold back."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 72: "But if you turn away, I have not asked you for any wage. My wage falls only on God, and I was commanded to be of those who submit."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 73: But they denounced him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and We made them successors, and We drowned those who rejected Our signs. So consider the fate of those who were warned.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 74: Then, after him, We sent messengers to their people. They came to them with the clear proofs, but they would not believe in anything they had already rejected. Thus We set a seal on the hearts of the hostile.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 75: Then, after them, We sent Moses and Aaron with Our proofs to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. But they acted arrogantly. They were sinful people.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 76: And when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "This is clearly sorcery."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 77: Moses said, "Is this what you say of the truth when it has come to you? Is this sorcery? Sorcerers do not succeed."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 78: They said, "Did you come to us to divert us from what we found our ancestors following, and so that you become prominent in the land? We will never believe in you."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 79: Pharaoh said, "Bring me every experienced sorcerer."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 80: And when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you have to throw."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 81: And when they threw, Moses said, "What you produced is sorcery, and God will make it fail. God does not foster the efforts of the corrupt."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 82: "And God upholds the truth with His words, even though the sinners detest it."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 83: But none believed in Moses except some children of his people, for fear that Pharaoh and his chiefs would persecute them. Pharaoh was high and mighty in the land. He was a tyrant.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 84: Moses said, "O my people, if you have believed in God, then put your trust in Him, if you have submitted."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 85: They said, "In God we have put our trust. Our Lord, do not make us victims of the oppressive people."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 86: "And deliver us, by Your mercy, from the disbelieving people."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 87: And We inspired Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt, and make your homes places of worship, and perform the prayer, and give good news to the believers."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 88: Moses said, "Our Lord, you have given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the worldly life. Our Lord, for them to lead away from Your path. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth, and harden their hearts, they will not believe until they see the painful torment."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 89: He said, "Your prayer has been answered, so go straight, and do not follow the path of those who do not know."

Surah Yunus, Ayah 90: And We delivered the Children of Israel across the sea. Pharaoh and his troops pursued them, defiantly and aggressively. Until, when he was about to drown, he said, "I believe that there is no god except the One the Children of Israel believe in, and I am of those who submit."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 91: Now? When you have rebelled before, and been of the mischief-makers?
Surah Yunus, Ayah 92: Today We will preserve your body, so that you become a sign for those after you. But most people are heedless of Our signs.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 93: And We settled the Children of Israel in a position of honor, and provided them with good things. They did not differ until knowledge came to them. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding their differences.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 94: If you are in doubt about what We revealed to you, ask those who read the Scripture before you. The truth has come to you from your Lord, so do not be of those who doubt.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 95: And do not be of those who deny God's revelations, lest you become one of the losers.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 96: Those against whom your Lord's Word is justified will not believe.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 97: Even if every sign comes to them-until they see the painful punishment.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 98: If only there was one town that believed and benefited by its belief. Except for the people of Jonah. When they believed, We removed from them the suffering of disgrace in the worldly life, and We gave them comfort for a while.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 99: Had your Lord willed, everyone on earth would have believed. Will you compel people to become believers?
Surah Yunus, Ayah 100: No soul can believe except by God's leave; and He lays disgrace upon those who refuse to understand.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 101: Say, "Look at what is in the heavens and the earth." But signs and warnings are of no avail for people who do not believe.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 102: Do they expect anything but the likes of the days of those who passed away before them? Say, "Then wait, I will be waiting with you."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 103: Then We save Our messengers and those who believe. It is binding on Us to save the believers.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 104: Say, "O people, if you are in doubt about my religion-I do not serve those you serve apart from God. But I serve God, the one who will terminate your lives. And I was commanded to be of the believers."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 105: And dedicate yourself to the true religion-a monotheist-and never be of the polytheists.
Surah Yunus, Ayah 106: And do not call, apart from God, on what neither benefits you nor harms you. If you do, you are then one of the wrongdoers.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 107: If God afflicts you with harm, none can remove it except He. And if He wants good for you, none can repel His grace. He makes it reach whomever He wills of His servants. He is the Forgiver, the Merciful.

Surah Yunus, Ayah 108: Say, "O people, the truth has come to you from your Lord. Whoever accepts guidance is guided for his own soul; and whoever strays only strays to its detriment. I am not a guardian over you."
Surah Yunus, Ayah 109: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until God issues His judgment, for He is the Best of judges.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 1: By the racers panting.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 2: Igniting sparks.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 3: Raiding at dawn.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 4: Raising clouds of dust.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 5: Storming into the midst.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 6: Indeed, the human being is ungrateful to his Lord.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 7: And he bears witness to that.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 8: And he is fierce in his love of wealth.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 9: Does he not know? When the contents of the graves are scattered around.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 10: And the contents of the hearts are obtained.
Surah al-'Adiyat , Ayah 11: Their Lord, on that Day, is fully informed of them.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 1: The Shocker.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 2: What is the Shocker?
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 3: What will explain to you what the Shocker is?
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 4: The Day when the people will be like scattered moths.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 5: And the mountains will be like tufted wool.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 6: As for he whose scales are heavy.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 7: He will be in a pleasant life.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 8: But as for he whose scales are light.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 9: His home is the Abyss.
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 10: Do you know what it is?
Surah al-Qari'ah, Ayah 11: A Raging Fire.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 1: Abundance distracts you.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 2: Until you visit the graveyards.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 3: Indeed, you will know.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 4: Certainly, you will know.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 5: If you knew with knowledge of certainty.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 6: You would see the Inferno.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 7: Then you will see it with the eye of certainty.
Surah at-Takatsur, Ayah 8: Then, on that Day, you will be questioned about the Bliss.
Surah al-Ashr, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ashr, Ayah 1: By time.
Surah al-Ashr, Ayah 2: The human being is in loss.
Surah al-Ashr, Ayah 3: Except those who believe, and do good works, and encourage truth, and recommend patience.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 1: Woe to every slanderer backbiter.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 2: Who gathers wealth and counts it over.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 3: Thinking that his wealth has made him immortal.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 4: By no means. He will be thrown into the Crusher.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 5: And what will make you realize what the Crusher is?
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 6: God's kindled Fire.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 7: That laps to the hearts.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 8: It closes in on them.
Surah al-Humazah, Ayah 9: In extended columns.
Surah al-Fil, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Fil, Ayah 1: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with the People of the Elephant?
Surah al-Fil, Ayah 2: Did He not make their plan go wrong?
Surah al-Fil, Ayah 3: He sent against them swarms of birds.
Surah al-Fil, Ayah 4: Throwing at them rocks of baked clay.
Surah al-Fil, Ayah 5: Leaving them like chewed-up leaves.
Surah Quraisy, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Quraisy, Ayah 1: For the security of Quraish.
Surah Quraisy, Ayah 2: Their security during winter and summer journeys.
Surah Quraisy, Ayah 3: Let them worship the Lord of this House.
Surah Quraisy, Ayah 4: Who has fed them against hunger, and has secured them against fear.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 1: Have you considered him who denies the religion?
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 2: It is he who mistreats the orphan.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 3: And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 4: So woe to those who pray.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 5: Those who are heedless of their prayers.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 6: Those who put on the appearance.
Surah al-Ma'un, Ayah 7: And withhold the assistance.
Surah al-Kautsar, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Kautsar, Ayah 1: We have given you plenty.
Surah al-Kautsar, Ayah 2: So pray to your Lord and sacrifice.
Surah al-Kautsar, Ayah 3: He who hates you is the loser.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 1: Say, "O disbelievers.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 2: I do not worship what you worship.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 3: Nor do you worship what I worship.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 4: Nor do I serve what you serve.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 5: Nor do you serve what I serve.
Surah al-Kafirun, Ayah 6: You have your way, and I have my way."
Surah Hud, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Hud, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Ra. A Scripture whose Verses were perfected, then elaborated, from One who is Wise and Informed.
Surah Hud, Ayah 2: That you shall worship none but God. "I am a warner to you from Him, and a bearer of good news."

Surah Hud, Ayah 3: "And ask your Lord for forgiveness, and repent to Him. He will provide you with good sustenance until a stated term, and will bestow His grace on every possessor of virtue. But if you turn away, then I fear for you the punishment of a grievous Day."
Surah Hud, Ayah 4: "To God is your return, and He is Capable of all things."

Surah Hud, Ayah 5: They wrap their chests to hide from Him. But even as they cover themselves with their clothes, He knows what they conceal and what they reveal. He knows what lies within the hearts.
Surah Hud, Ayah 6: There is no moving creature on earth but its sustenance depends on God. And He knows where it lives and where it rests. Everything is in a Clear Book.

Surah Hud, Ayah 7: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days-and His Throne was upon the waters-in order to test you-which of you is best in conduct. And if you were to say, "You will be resurrected after death," those who disbelieve would say, "This is nothing but plain witchcraft."

Surah Hud, Ayah 8: And if We postponed their punishment until a stated time, they would say, "What holds it back?" On the Day when it reaches them, it will not be averted from them, and what they used to ridicule will besiege them.
Surah Hud, Ayah 9: If We give the human being a taste of mercy from Us, and then withdraw it from him, he becomes despairing and ungrateful.
Surah Hud, Ayah 10: And if We give him a taste of prosperity, after some adversity has afflicted him, he will say, "Troubles have gone away from me." He becomes excited and proud.
Surah Hud, Ayah 11: Except those who are patient and do good deeds-these will have forgiveness and a great reward.

Surah Hud, Ayah 12: Perhaps you wish to disregard some of what is revealed to you, and you may be stressed because of it, since they say, "If only a treasure was sent down to him, or an angel came with him." You are only a warner, and God is Responsible for all things.
Surah Hud, Ayah 13: Or do they say, "He invented it?" Say, "Then produce ten chapters like it, invented, and call upon whomever you can, besides God, if you are truthful."
Surah Hud, Ayah 14: But if they fail to answer you, know that it was revealed with God's knowledge, and that there is no god but He. Will you then submit?
Surah Hud, Ayah 15: Whoever desires the worldly life and its glitter-We will fully recompense them for their deeds therein, and therein they will not be defrauded.
Surah Hud, Ayah 16: These-they will have nothing but the Fire in the Hereafter. Their deeds are in vain therein, and their works are null.

Surah Hud, Ayah 17: Is he who possesses a clear proof from his Lord, recited by a witness from Him, and before it the Book of Moses, a guide and a mercy? These believe in it. But whoever defies it from among the various factions, the Fire is his promise. So have no doubt about it. It is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not believe.

Surah Hud, Ayah 18: Who does greater wrong than he who fabricates lies about God? These will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are they who lied about their Lord." Indeed, the curse of God is upon the wrongdoers.
Surah Hud, Ayah 19: Those who hinder others from the path of God, and seek to make it crooked; and regarding the Hereafter, they are in denial.
Surah Hud, Ayah 20: These will not escape on earth, and they have no protectors besides God. The punishment will be doubled for them. They have failed to hear, and they have failed to see.
Surah Hud, Ayah 21: Those are the ones who lost their souls, and what they had invented has strayed away from them.
Surah Hud, Ayah 22: Without a doubt, in the Hereafter, they will be the biggest losers.
Surah Hud, Ayah 23: As for those who believe and do good deeds, and humble themselves before their Lord-these are the inhabitants of Paradise, where they will abide forever.
Surah Hud, Ayah 24: The parable of the two groups is that of the blind and the deaf, and the seeing and the hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Will you not reflect?
Surah Hud, Ayah 25: We sent Noah to his people, "I am to you a clear warner."
Surah Hud, Ayah 26: "That you shall worship none but God. I fear for you the agony of a painful Day."

Surah Hud, Ayah 27: The notables who disbelieved among his people said, "We see in you nothing but a man like us, and we see that only the worst among us have followed you, those of immature judgment. And we see that you have no advantage over us. In fact, we think you are liars."

Surah Hud, Ayah 28: He said, "O my people, Have you considered? If I stand on clear evidence from my Lord, and He has given me a mercy from Himself, but you were blind to it, can we compel you to accept it, even though you dislike it?"

Surah Hud, Ayah 29: "O my people! I ask of you no money for it. My reward lies only with God. And I am not about to dismiss those who believed; they will surely meet their Lord. And I see that you are ignorant people."
Surah Hud, Ayah 30: "O my people! Who will support me against God, if I dismiss them? Will you not give a thought?"

Surah Hud, Ayah 31: "I do not say to you that I possess the treasures of God, nor do I know the future, nor do I say that I am an angel. Nor do I say of those who are despicable in your eyes that God will never give them any good. God is Aware of what lies in their souls. If I did, I would be one of the wrongdoers."
Surah Hud, Ayah 32: They said, "O Noah, you have argued with us, and argued a great deal. Now bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are truthful."
Surah Hud, Ayah 33: He said, "It is God who will bring it upon you, if He wills, and you will not be able to escape."
Surah Hud, Ayah 34: "My advice will not benefit you, much as I may want to advise you, if God desires to confound you. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned."
Surah Hud, Ayah 35: Or do they say, "He made it up?" Say, "If I made it up, upon me falls my crime, and I am innocent of the crimes you commit."
Surah Hud, Ayah 36: And it was revealed to Noah: "None of your people will believe, except those who have already believed, so do not grieve over what they do."
Surah Hud, Ayah 37: "And build the Ark, under Our eyes, and with Our inspiration, and do not address Me regarding those who did wrong; they are to be drowned."
Surah Hud, Ayah 38: As he was building the ark, whenever some of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, we will ridicule you, just as you ridicule."
Surah Hud, Ayah 39: "You will surely know upon whom will come a torment that will abase him, and upon whom will fall a lasting torment."

Surah Hud, Ayah 40: Until, when Our command came, and the volcano erupted, We said, "Board into it a pair of every kind, and your family-except those against whom the sentence has already been passed-and those who have believed." But those who believed with him were only a few.
Surah Hud, Ayah 41: He said, "Embark in it. In the name of God shall be its sailing and its anchorage. My Lord is indeed Forgiving and Merciful."
Surah Hud, Ayah 42: And so it sailed with them amidst waves like hills. And Noah called to his son, who had kept away, "On my son! Embark with us, and do not be with the disbelievers."

Surah Hud, Ayah 43: He said, "I will take refuge on a mountain-it will protect me from the water." He said, "There is no protection from God's decree today, except for him on whom He has mercy." And the waves surged between them, and he was among the drowned.

Surah Hud, Ayah 44: And it was said, "O earth, swallow your waters," and "O heaven, clear up." And the waters receded, and the event was concluded, and it settled on Judi, and it was proclaimed: "Away with the wicked people."
Surah Hud, Ayah 45: And Noah called to his Lord. He said, "O My Lord, my son is of my family, and Your promise is true, and You are the Wisest of the wise."
Surah Hud, Ayah 46: He said, "O Noah, he is not of your family. It is an unrighteous deed. So do not ask Me about something you know nothing about. I admonish you, lest you be one of the ignorant."
Surah Hud, Ayah 47: He said, "O My Lord, I seek refuge with You, from asking You about what I have no knowledge of. Unless You forgive me, and have mercy on me, I will be one of the losers."

Surah Hud, Ayah 48: It was said, "O Noah, disembark with peace from Us; and with blessings upon you, and upon communities from those with you. And other communities We will grant prosperity, and then a painful torment from Us will befall them."
Surah Hud, Ayah 49: These are some stories from the past that we reveal to you. Neither you, nor your people knew them before this. So be patient. The future belongs to the pious.
Surah Hud, Ayah 50: And to Aad, their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship God, you have no other god besides Him. You do nothing but invent lies."
Surah Hud, Ayah 51: "O my people, I ask you no wage for it; my wage lies with Him who originated me. Do you not understand?"

Surah Hud, Ayah 52: "O my people, ask forgiveness from your Lord, and repent to Him. He will release the sky pouring down upon you, and will add strength to your strength. And do not turn away and be wicked."
Surah Hud, Ayah 53: They said, "O Hud, you did not bring us any evidence, and we are not about to abandon our gods at your word, and we are not believers in you."
Surah Hud, Ayah 54: "We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil." He said, "I call God to witness, and you to witness, that I am innocent of what you associate.
Surah Hud, Ayah 55: Besides Him. So scheme against me, all of you, and do not hesitate.
Surah Hud, Ayah 56: I have placed my trust in God, my Lord and your Lord. There is not a creature but He holds it by the forelock. My Lord is on a straight path.

Surah Hud, Ayah 57: If you turn away, I have conveyed to you what I was sent to you with; and my Lord will replace you with another people, and you will not cause Him any harm. My Lord is Guardian over all things."
Surah Hud, Ayah 58: And when Our decree came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by a mercy from Us, and We delivered them from a harsh punishment.
Surah Hud, Ayah 59: That was Aad; they denied the signs of their Lord, and defied His messengers, and followed the lead of every stubborn tyrant.
Surah Hud, Ayah 60: And they were pursued by a curse in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Aad blasphemed against their Lord-so away with Aad, the people of Hud.

Surah Hud, Ayah 61: And to Thamood, their brother Saleh. He said, "O my people, worship God, you have no god other than Him. He initiated you from the earth, and settled you in it. So seek His forgiveness, and repent to Him. My Lord is Near and Responsive."

Surah Hud, Ayah 62: They said, "O Saleh, we had hopes in you before this. Are you trying to prevent us from worshiping what our parents worship? We are in serious doubt regarding what you are calling us to."

Surah Hud, Ayah 63: He said, "O my people, have you considered? If I stand upon clear evidence from my Lord, and He has given me mercy from Him, who would protect me from God, if I disobeyed Him? You add nothing for me except loss."
Surah Hud, Ayah 64: "O my people, this is the she-camel of God, a sign for you. Let her graze on God's land, and do not harm her, lest an imminent punishment overtakes you."
Surah Hud, Ayah 65: But they hamstrung her, and so He said, "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. This is a prophecy that is infallible."
Surah Hud, Ayah 66: Then, when Our command came, We saved Saleh and those who believed with him, by a mercy from Us, from the disgrace of that day. Your Lord is the Strong, the Mighty.
Surah Hud, Ayah 67: And the Scream struck those who transgressed, and they became motionless bodies in their homes.
Surah Hud, Ayah 68: As if they had never prospered therein. Indeed, Thamood rejected their Lord, so away with Thamood.
Surah Hud, Ayah 69: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news. They said, "Peace." He said, "Peace." Soon after, he came with a roasted calf.
Surah Hud, Ayah 70: But when he saw their hands not reaching towards it, he became suspicious of them, and conceived a fear of them. They said, "Do not fear, we were sent to the people of Lot."
Surah Hud, Ayah 71: His wife was standing by, so she laughed. And We gave her good news of Isaac; and after Isaac, Jacob.
Surah Hud, Ayah 72: She said, "Alas for me. Shall I give birth, when I am an old woman, and this, my husband, is an old man? This is truly a strange thing."
Surah Hud, Ayah 73: They said, "Do you marvel at the decree of God? The mercy and blessings of God are upon you, O people of the house. He is Praiseworthy and Glorious."
Surah Hud, Ayah 74: When Abraham's fear subsided, and the good news had reached him, he started pleading with Us concerning the people of Lot.
Surah Hud, Ayah 75: Abraham was gentle, kind, penitent.
Surah Hud, Ayah 76: "O Abraham, refrain from this. The command of your Lord has come; they have incurred an irreversible punishment."
Surah Hud, Ayah 77: And when Our envoys came to Lot, he was anxious for them, and concerned for them. He said, "This is a dreadful day."

Surah Hud, Ayah 78: And his people came rushing towards him-they were in the habit of committing sins. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear God, and do not embarrass me before my guests. Is there not one reasonable man among you?"
Surah Hud, Ayah 79: They said, "You know well that we have no right to your daughters, and you know well what we want."
Surah Hud, Ayah 80: He said, "If only I had the strength to stop you, or could rely on some strong support."

Surah Hud, Ayah 81: They said, "O Lot, we are the envoys of your Lord; they will not reach you. So set out with your family during the cover of the night, and let none of you look back, except for your wife. She will be struck by what will strike them. Their appointed time is the morning. Is not the morning near?"
Surah Hud, Ayah 82: And when Our command came about, We turned it upside down, and We rained down on it stones of baked clay.
Surah Hud, Ayah 83: Marked from your Lord, and never far from the wrongdoers.

Surah Hud, Ayah 84: And to Median, their brother Shuaib. He said, "O my people, worship God; you have no god other than Him. And do not short measure or short weight. I see you in good circumstances, but I fear for you the agony of an encompassing Day."
Surah Hud, Ayah 85: "O my people! Give full measure and full weight, in all fairness, and do not cheat the people out of their rights, and do not spread corruption in the land.
Surah Hud, Ayah 86: What is left by God is best for you, if you are believers. And I am not a guardian over you."

Surah Hud, Ayah 87: They said, "O Shuaib, does your prayer command you that we abandon what our ancestors worshiped, or doing with our wealth what we want? You are the one who is intelligent and wise."

Surah Hud, Ayah 88: He said, "O my people, have you considered? What if I have clear evidence from my Lord, and He has given me good livelihood from Himself? I have no desire to do what I forbid you from doing. I desire nothing but reform, as far as I can. My success lies only with God. In Him I trust, and to Him I turn."

Surah Hud, Ayah 89: "O my people, let not your hostility towards me cause you to suffer what was suffered by the people of Noah, or the people of Hud, or the people of Saleh. The people of Lot are not far away from you."
Surah Hud, Ayah 90: "And ask your Lord for forgiveness, and repent to Him. My Lord is Merciful and Loving."

Surah Hud, Ayah 91: They said, "O Shuaib, we do not understand much of what you say, and we see that you are weak among us. Were it not for your tribe, we would have stoned you. You are of no value to us."
Surah Hud, Ayah 92: He said, "O my people, is my tribe more important to you than God? And you have turned your backs on Him? My Lord comprehends everything you do."
Surah Hud, Ayah 93: "O my people, do as you may, and so will I. You will know to whom will come a punishment that will shame him, and who is a liar. So look out; I am on the lookout with you."

Surah Hud, Ayah 94: And when Our command came, We saved Shuaib and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us, and the Blast struck the wrongdoers, and they became motionless bodies in their homes.
Surah Hud, Ayah 95: As though they never flourished therein. Away with Median, as was done away with Thamood.
Surah Hud, Ayah 96: And We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear mandate.
Surah Hud, Ayah 97: To Pharaoh and his nobles, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not wise.
Surah Hud, Ayah 98: He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection, and will lead them into the Fire. Miserable is the place he placed them in.
Surah Hud, Ayah 99: They were followed by a curse in this, and on the Day of Resurrection. Miserable is the path they followed.
Surah Hud, Ayah 100: These are of the reports of the towns-We relate them to you. Some are still standing, and some have withered away.

Surah Hud, Ayah 101: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. Their gods, whom they invoked besides God, availed them nothing when the command of your Lord arrived. In fact, they added only to their ruin.
Surah Hud, Ayah 102: Such is the grip of your Lord when He seizes the towns in the midst of their sins. His grip is most painful, most severe.
Surah Hud, Ayah 103: In that is a sign for whoever fears the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which humanity will be gathered together-that is a Day to be witnessed.
Surah Hud, Ayah 104: We only postpone it until a predetermined time.
Surah Hud, Ayah 105: On the Day when it arrives, no soul will speak without His permission. Some will be miserable, and some will be happy.
Surah Hud, Ayah 106: As for those who are miserable, they will be in the Fire. They will have therein sighing and wailing.
Surah Hud, Ayah 107: Remaining therein for as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except as your Lord wills. Your Lord is Doer of whatever He wills.
Surah Hud, Ayah 108: And as for those who are happy, they will be in Paradise, remaining therein for as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except as your Lord wills-a reward without end.
Surah Hud, Ayah 109: So be not in doubt regarding what these people worship. They worship only as their ancestors worshiped before. We will pay them their due in full, without any reduction.
Surah Hud, Ayah 110: We gave Moses the Scripture, but it was disputed. Were it not for a prior word from your Lord, it would have been settled between them. They are in serious doubt concerning it.
Surah Hud, Ayah 111: Your Lord will repay each one of them in full for their deeds. He is Aware of everything they do.
Surah Hud, Ayah 112: So be upright, as you are commanded, along with those who repented with you, and do not transgress. He is Seeing of everything you do.
Surah Hud, Ayah 113: And do not incline towards those who do wrong, or the Fire may touch you; and you will have no protectors besides God, and you will not be saved.
Surah Hud, Ayah 114: Perform the prayer at the borders of the day, and during the approaches of the night. The good deeds take away the bad deeds. This is a reminder for those who remember.
Surah Hud, Ayah 115: And be patient. God will not waste the reward of the virtuous.

Surah Hud, Ayah 116: If only there were, among the generations before you, people with wisdom, who spoke against corruption on earth-except for the few whom We saved. But the wrongdoers pursued the luxuries they were indulged in, and thus became guilty.
Surah Hud, Ayah 117: Your Lord would never destroy the towns wrongfully, while their inhabitants are righteous.
Surah Hud, Ayah 118: Had your Lord willed, He could have made humanity one community, but they continue to differ.
Surah Hud, Ayah 119: Except those on whom your Lord has mercy-for that reason He created them. The Word of your Lord is final: "I will fill Hell with jinn and humans, altogether."

Surah Hud, Ayah 120: Everything We narrate to you of the history of the messengers is to strengthen your heart therewith. The truth has come to you in this, and a lesson, and a reminder for the believers.
Surah Hud, Ayah 121: And say to those who do not believe, "Act according to your ability; and so will we."
Surah Hud, Ayah 122: "And wait; we too are waiting."
Surah Hud, Ayah 123: To God belongs the future of the heavens and the earth, and to Him all authority goes back. So worship Him, and rely on Him. Your Lord is never unaware of what you do.
Surah an-Nashr, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Nashr, Ayah 1: When there comes God's victory, and conquest.
Surah an-Nashr, Ayah 2: And you see the people entering God's religion in multitudes.
Surah an-Nashr, Ayah 3: Then celebrate the praise of your Lord, and seek His forgiveness. He is the Accepter of Repentance.
Surah al-Lahab, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Lahab, Ayah 1: Condemned are the hands of Abee Lahab, and he is condemned.
Surah al-Lahab, Ayah 2: His wealth did not avail him, nor did what he acquired.
Surah al-Lahab, Ayah 3: He will burn in a Flaming Fire.
Surah al-Lahab, Ayah 4: And his wife-the firewood carrier.
Surah al-Lahab, Ayah 5: Around her neck is a rope of thorns.
Surah al-Ikhlash, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ikhlash, Ayah 1: Say, "He is God, the One.
Surah al-Ikhlash, Ayah 2: God, the Absolute.
Surah al-Ikhlash, Ayah 3: He begets not, nor was He begotten.
Surah al-Ikhlash, Ayah 4: And there is nothing comparable to Him."
Surah al-Falaq, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Falaq, Ayah 1: Say, "I take refuge with the Lord of Daybreak.
Surah al-Falaq, Ayah 2: From the evil of what He created.
Surah al-Falaq, Ayah 3: And from the evil of the darkness as it gathers.
Surah al-Falaq, Ayah 4: And from the evil of those who practice sorcery.
Surah al-Falaq, Ayah 5: And from the evil of an envious when he envies."
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 1: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind.
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 2: The King of mankind.
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 3: The God of mankind.
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 4: From the evil of the sneaky whisperer.
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 5: Who whispers into the hearts of people.
Surah an-Nas, Ayah 6: From among jinn and among people."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the Verses of the Clear Book.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 2: We have revealed it an Arabic Quran, so that you may understand.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 3: We narrate to you the most accurate history, by revealing to you this Quran. Although, prior to it, you were of the unaware.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 4: When Joseph said to his father, "O my father, I saw eleven planets, and the sun, and the moon; I saw them bowing down to me."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 5: He said, "O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers, lest they plot and scheme against you. Satan is man's sworn enemy.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 6: And thus your Lord will choose you, and will teach you the interpretation of events, and will complete His blessing upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He has completed it before upon your forefathers Abraham and Isaac. Your Lord is Knowing and Wise.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 7: In Joseph and his brothers are lessons for the seekers.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 8: When they said, "Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, although we are a whole group. Our father is obviously in the wrong.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 9: "Kill Joseph, or throw him somewhere in the land, and your father's attention will be yours. Afterwards, you will be decent people."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 10: One of them said, "Do not kill Joseph, but throw him into the bottom of the well; some caravan may pick him up-if you must do something."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 11: They said, "Father, why do you not trust us with Joseph, although we care for him?"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 12: "Send him with us tomorrow, that he may roam and play; we will take care of him."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 13: He said, "It worries me that you would take him away. And I fear the wolf may eat him while you are careless of him."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 14: They said, "If the wolf ate him, and we are many, we would be good for nothing."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 15: So they went away with him, and agreed to put him at the bottom of the well. And We inspired him, "You will inform them of this deed of theirs when they are unaware."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 16: And they came to their father in the evening weeping.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 17: They said, "O father, we went off racing one another, and left Joseph by our belongings; and the wolf ate him. But you will not believe us, even though we are being truthful."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 18: And they brought his shirt, with fake blood on it. He said, "Your souls enticed you to do something. But patience is beautiful, and God is my Help against what you describe."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 19: A caravan passed by, and they sent their water-carrier. He lowered his bucket, and said, "Good news. Here is a boy." And they hid him as merchandise. But God was aware of what they did.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 20: And they sold him for a cheap price-a few coins-they considered him to be of little value.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 21: The Egyptian who bought him said to his wife, "Take good care of him; he may be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son." We thus established Joseph in the land, to teach him the interpretation of events. God has control over His affairs, but most people do not know.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 22: When he reached his maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. We thus reward the righteous.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 23: She in whose house he was living tried to seduce him. She shut the doors, and said, "I am yours." He said, "God forbid! He is my Lord. He has given me a good home. Sinners never succeed."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 24: She desired him, and he desired her, had he not seen the proof of his Lord. It was thus that We diverted evil and indecency away from him. He was one of Our loyal servants.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 25: As they raced towards the door, she tore his shirt from behind. At the door, they ran into her husband. She said, "What is the penalty for him who desired to dishonor your wife, except imprisonment or a painful punishment?"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 26: He said, "It was she who tried to seduce me." A witness from her household suggested: "If his shirt is torn from the front: then she has told the truth, and he is the liar.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 27: But if his shirt is torn from the back: then she has lied, and he is the truthful."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 28: And when he saw that his shirt was torn from the back, he said, "This is a woman's scheme. Your scheming is serious indeed."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 29: "Joseph, turn away from this. And you, woman, ask forgiveness for your sin; you are indeed in the wrong."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 30: Some ladies in the city said, "The governor's wife is trying to seduce her servant. She is deeply in love with him. We see she has gone astray."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 31: And when she heard of their gossip, she invited them, and prepared for them a banquet, and she gave each one of them a knife. She said, "Come out before them." And when they saw him, they marveled at him, and cut their hands. They said, "Good God, this is not a human, this must be a precious angel."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 32: She said, "Here he is, the one you blamed me for. I did try to seduce him, but he resisted. But if he does not do what I tell him to do, he will be imprisoned, and will be one of the despised."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 33: He said, "My Lord, prison is more desirable to me than what they call me to. Unless You turn their scheming away from me, I may yield to them, and become one of the ignorant."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 34: Thereupon his Lord answered him, and diverted their scheming away from him. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 35: Then it occurred to them, after they had seen the signs, to imprison him for a while.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 36: Two youth entered the prison with him. One of them said, "I see myself pressing wine." The other said, "I see myself carrying bread on my head, from which the birds are eating. Tell us their interpretation-we see that you are one of the righteous."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 37: He said, "No food is served to you, but I have informed you about it before you have received it. That is some of what my Lord has taught me. I have forsaken the tradition of people who do not believe in God; and regarding the Hereafter, they are deniers."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 38: "And I have followed the faith of my forefathers, Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob. It is not for us to associate anything with God. This is by virtue of God's grace upon us and upon the people, but most people do not give thanks.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 39: "O My fellow inmates, are diverse lords better, or God, the One, the Supreme?"

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 40: "You do not worship, besides Him, except names you have named, you and your ancestors, for which God has sent down no authority. Judgment belongs to none but God. He has commanded that you worship none but Him. This is the right religion, but most people do not know.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 41: "O my fellow inmates! One of you will serve his master wine; while the other will be crucified, and the birds will eat from his head. Thus the matter you are inquiring about is settled."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 42: And he said to the one he thought would be released, "Mention me to your master." But Satan caused him to forget mentioning him to his master, so he remained in prison for several years.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 43: The king said, "I see seven fat cows being eaten by seven lean ones, and seven green spikes, and others dried up. O elders, explain to me my vision, if you are able to interpret visions."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 44: They said, "Jumbles of dreams, and we know nothing of the interpretation of dreams."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 45: The one who was released said, having remembered after a time, "I will inform you of its interpretation, so send me out."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 46: "Joseph, O man of truth, inform us concerning seven fat cows being eaten by seven lean ones, and seven green spikes, and others dried up, so that I may return to the people, so that they may know."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 47: He said, "You will farm for seven consecutive years. But whatever you harvest, leave it in its spikes, except for the little that you eat."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 48: Then after that will come seven difficult ones, which will consume what you have stored for them, except for the little that you have preserved.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 49: Then after that will come a year that brings relief to the people, and during which they will press.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 50: The king said, "Bring him to me." And when the envoy came to him, he said, "Go back to your master, and ask him about the intentions of the women who cut their hands; my Lord is well aware of their schemes."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 51: He said, "What was the matter with you, women, when you tried to seduce Joseph?" They said, "God forbid! We knew of no evil committed by him." The governor's wife then said, "Now the truth is out. It was I who tried to seduce him, and he is telling the truth."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 52: "This is that he may know that I did not betray him in secret, and that God does not guide the scheming of the betrayers."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 53: "Yet I do not claim to be innocent. The soul commands evil, except those on whom my Lord has mercy. Truly my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 54: The king said, "Bring him to me, and I will reserve him for myself." And when he spoke to him, he said, "This day you are with us established and secure."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 55: He said, "Put me in charge of the storehouses of the land; I am honest and knowledgeable."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 56: And thus We established Joseph in the land, to live therein wherever he wished. We touch with Our mercy whomever We will, and We never waste the reward of the righteous.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 57: But the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believe and observed piety.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 58: And Joseph's brothers came, and entered into his presence. He recognized them, but they did not recognize him.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 59: When he provided them with their provisions, he said, "Bring me a brother of yours from your father. Do you not see that I fill up the measure, and I am the best of hosts?"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 60: "But if you do not bring him to me, you will have no measure from me, and you will not come near me."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 61: They said, "We will solicit him from his father. We will surely do."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 62: He said to his servants, "Put their goods in their saddlebags; perhaps they will recognize them when they return to their families, and maybe they will come back."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 63: When they returned to their father, they said, "O father, we were denied measure, but send our brother with us, and we will obtain measure. We will take care of him."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 64: He said, "Shall I trust you with him, as I trusted you with his brother before? God is the Best Guardian, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 65: And when they opened their baggage, they found that their goods were returned to them. They said, "Father, what more do we want? Here are our goods, returned to us. We will provide for our family, and protect our brother, and have an additional camel-load. This is easy commerce."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 66: He said, "I will not send him with you, unless you give me a pledge before God that you will bring him back to me, unless you get trapped." And when they gave him their pledge, he said, "God is witness to what we say."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 67: And he said, "O my sons, do not enter by one gate, but enter by different gates. I cannot avail you anything against God. The decision rests only with God. On Him I rely, and on Him let the reliant rely."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 68: And when they entered as their father had instructed them, it did not avail them anything against God; it was just a need in the soul of Jacob, which he carried out. He was a person of knowledge inasmuch as We had taught him, but most people do not know.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 69: And when they entered into the presence of Joseph, he embraced his brother, and said, "I am your brother; do not be saddened by what they used to do."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 70: Then, when he provided them with their provisions, he placed the drinking-cup in his brother's saddlebag. Then an announcer called out, "O people of the caravan, you are thieves."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 71: They said, as they came towards them, "What are you missing?"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 72: They said, "We are missing the king's goblet. Whoever brings it will have a camel-load; and I personally guarantee it."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 73: They said, "By God, you know we did not come to cause trouble in the land, and we are not thieves."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 74: They said, "What shall be his punishment, if you are lying?"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 75: They said, "His punishment, if it is found in his bag: he will belong to you. Thus we penalize the guilty."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 76: So he began with their bags, before his brother's bag. Then he pulled it out of his brother's bag. Thus We devised a plan for Joseph; he could not have detained his brother under the king's law, unless God so willed. We elevate by degrees whomever We will; and above every person of knowledge, there is one more learned.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 77: They said, "If he has stolen, a brother of his has stolen before." But Joseph kept it to himself, and did not reveal it to them. He said, "You are in a worse situation, and God is Aware of what you allege."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 78: They said, "O noble prince, he has a father, a very old man, so take one of us in his place. We see that you are a good person."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 79: He said, "God forbid that we should arrest anyone except him in whose possession we found our property; for then we would be unjust."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 80: And when they despaired of him, they conferred privately. Their eldest said, "Don't you know that your father received a pledge from you before God, and in the past you failed with regard to Joseph? I will not leave this land until my father permits me, or God decides for me; for He is the Best of Deciders."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 81: "Go back to your father, and say, 'Our father, your son has stolen. We testify only to what we know, and we could not have prevented the unforeseen.'"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 82: "Ask the town where we were, and the caravan in which we came. We are being truthful."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 83: He said, "Rather, your souls have contrived something for you. Patience is a virtue. Perhaps God will bring them all back to me. He is the Knowing, the Wise."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 84: Then he turned away from them, and said, "O my bitterness for Joseph." And his eyes turned white from sorrow, and he became depressed.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 85: They said, "By God, you will not stop remembering Joseph, until you have ruined your health, or you have passed away."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 86: He said, "I only complain of my grief and sorrow to God, and I know from God what you do not know."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 87: "O my sons, go and inquire about Joseph and his brother, and do not despair of God's comfort. None despairs of God's comfort except the disbelieving people."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 88: Then, when they entered into his presence, they said, "Mighty governor, adversity has befallen us, and our family. We have brought scant merchandise. But give us full measure, and be charitable towards us-God rewards the charitable."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 89: He said, "Do you realize what you did with Joseph and his brother, in your ignorance?"

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 90: They said, "Is that you, Joseph?" He said, "I am Joseph, and this is my brother. God has been gracious to us. He who practices piety and patience-God never fails to reward the righteous."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 91: They said, "By God, God has preferred you over us. We were definitely in the wrong."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 92: He said, "There is no blame upon you today. God will forgive you. He is the Most Merciful of the merciful."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 93: "Take this shirt of mine, and lay it over my father's face, and he will recover his sight. And bring your whole family to me."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 94: As the caravan set out, their father said, "I sense the presence of Joseph, though you may think I am senile."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 95: They said, "By God, you are still in your old confusion."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 96: Then, when the bearer of good news arrived, he laid it over his face, and he regained his sight. He said, "Did I not say to you that I know from God what you do not know?"
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 97: They said, "Father, pray for the forgiveness of our sins; we were indeed at fault."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 98: He said, "I will ask my Lord to forgive you. He is the Forgiver, the Most Merciful."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 99: Then, when they entered into the presence of Joseph, he embraced his parents, and said, "Enter Egypt, God willing, safe and secure."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 100: And he elevated his parents on the throne, and they fell prostrate before him. He said, "Father, this is the fulfillment of my vision of long ago. My Lord has made it come true. He has blessed me, when he released me from prison, and brought you out of the wilderness, after the devil had sown conflict between me and my brothers. My Lord is Most Kind towards whomever He wills. He is the All-knowing, the Most Wise."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 101: "My Lord, You have given me some authority, and taught me some interpretation of events. Initiator of the heavens and the earth; You are my Protector in this life and in the Hereafter. Receive my soul in submission, and unite me with the righteous."
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 102: This is news from the past that We reveal to you. You were not present with them when they plotted and agreed on a plan.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 103: But most people, for all your eagerness, are not believers.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 104: You ask them no wage for it. It is only a reminder for all mankind.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 105: How many a sign in the heavens and the earth do they pass by, paying no attention to them?
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 106: And most of them do not believe in God unless they associate others.
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 107: Do they feel secure that a covering of God's punishment will not come upon them, or that the Hour will not come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?
Surah Yusuf, Ayah 108: Say, "This is my way; I invite to God, based on clear knowledge-I and whoever follows me. Glory be to God; and I am not of the polytheists."

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 109: We did not send before you except men, whom We inspired, from the people of the towns. Have they not roamed the earth and seen the consequences for those before them? The Home of the Hereafter is better for those who are righteous. Do you not understand?

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 110: Until, when the messengers have despaired, and thought that they were rejected, Our help came to them. We save whomever We will, and Our severity is not averted from the guilty people.

Surah Yusuf, Ayah 111: In their stories is a lesson for those who possess intelligence. This is not a fabricated tale, but a confirmation of what came before it, and a detailed explanation of all things, and guidance, and mercy for people who believe.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem, Ra. These are the signs of the Scripture. What is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most people do not believe.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 2: God is He who raised the heavens without pillars that you can see, and then settled on the Throne. And He regulated the sun and the moon, each running for a specified period. He manages all affairs, and He explains the signs, that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 3: And it is He who spread the earth, and placed in it mountains and rivers. And He placed in it two kinds of every fruit. He causes the night to overlap the day. In that are signs for people who reflect.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 4: On earth are adjacent terrains, and gardens of vines, and crops, and date-palms, from the same root or from distinct roots, irrigated with the same water. We make some taste better than others. In that are proofs for people who reason.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 5: Should you wonder-the real wonder is their saying: "When we have become dust, will we be in a new creation?" Those are they who defied their Lord. Those are they who will have yokes around their necks. Those are the inhabitants of the Fire, where they will remain forever.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 6: And they urge you to hasten evil before good, though examples have passed away before them. Your Lord is full of forgiveness towards the people for their wrongdoings, yet your Lord is severe in retribution.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 7: Those who disbelieve say, "Why was a miracle not sent down to him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and to every community is a guide.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 8: God knows what every female bears, and every increase and decrease of the wombs. With Him, everything is by measure.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 9: The Knower of the Invisible and the Visible; the Grand, the Supreme.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 10: It is the same; whether one of you conceals his speech, or declares it; whether he goes into hiding by night, or goes out by day.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 11: He has a succession; before him and behind him, protecting him by God's command. God does not change the condition of a people until they change what is within themselves. And if God wills any hardship for a people, there is no turning it back;, and apart from Him they have no protector.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 12: It is He who shows you the lightening, causing fear and hope. And He produces the heavy clouds.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 13: The thunder praises His glory, and so do the angels, in awe of Him. And He sends the thunderbolts, striking with them whomever He wills. Yet they argue about God, while He is Tremendous in might.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 14: To Him belongs the call to truth. Those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with anything-except as someone who stretches his hands towards water, so that it may reach his mouth, but it does not reach it. The prayers of the unbelievers are only in vain.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 15: To God prostrates everyone in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, as do their shadows, in the morning and in the evening.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 16: Say, "Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?" Say, "God." Say, "Have you taken besides Him protectors, who have no power to profit or harm even themselves?" Say, "Are the blind and the seeing equal? Or are darkness and light equal? Or have they assigned to God associates, who created the likes of His creation, so that the creations seemed to them alike? Say, "God is the Creator of all things, and He is The One, the Irresistible."

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 17: He sends down water from the sky, and riverbeds flow according to their capacity. The current carries swelling froth. And from what they heat in fire of ornaments or utensils comes a similar froth. Thus God exemplifies truth and falsehood. As for the froth, it is swept away, but what benefits the people remains in the ground. Thus God presents the analogies.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 18: For those who respond to their Lord is the best. But as for those who do not respond to Him, even if they possessed everything on earth, and twice as much, they could not redeem themselves with it. Those will have the worst reckoning; and their home is Hell-a miserable destination.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 19: Is he who knows that what was revealed to your from your Lord is the truth, like him who is blind? Only those who reason will remember.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 20: Those who fulfill the promise to God, and do not violate the agreement.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 21: And those who join what God has commanded to be joined, and fear their Lord, and dread the dire reckoning.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 22: And those who patiently seek the presence of their Lord, and pray regularly, and spend from Our provisions to them, secretly and openly, and repel evil with good. These will have the Ultimate Home.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 23: Everlasting Gardens, which they will enter, along with the righteous among their parents, and their spouses, and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 24: "Peace be upon you, because you endured patiently. How excellent is the Final Home."

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 25: As for those who violate the promise to God, after pledging to keep it, and sever what God has commanded to be joined, and spread corruption on earth-these, the curse will be upon them, and they will have the Worst Home.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 26: God dispenses the provisions to whomever He wills, and restricts. And they delight in the worldly life; yet the worldly life, compared to the Hereafter, is only enjoyment.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 27: Those who disbelieve say, "If only a miracle was sent down to him from his Lord." Say, "God leads astray whomever He wills, and He guides to Himself whoever repents."
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 28: Those who believe, and whose hearts find comfort in the remembrance of God. Surely, it is in the remembrance of God that hearts find comfort."
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 29: For those who believe and do righteous deeds-for them is happiness and a beautiful return.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 30: Thus We sent you among a community before which other communities have passed away, that you may recite to them what We revealed to you. Yet they deny the Benevolent One. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no god but He; in Him I trust, and to Him is my repentance."

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 31: Even if there were a Quran, by which mountains could be set in motion, or by which the earth could be shattered, or by which the dead could be made to speak. In fact, every decision rests with God. Did the believers not give up and realize that had God willed, He would have guided all humanity? Disasters will continue to strike those who disbelieve, because of their deeds, or they fall near their homes, until God's promise comes true. God never breaks a promise.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 32: Messengers before you were ridiculed, but I granted the disbelievers respite, and then I seized them. What a punishment it was!

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 33: Is He who is watchful over the deeds of every soul? Yet they ascribe associates to God. Say, "Name them! Or are you informing Him of something on earth He does not know, or is it a show of words?" In fact, the scheming of those who disbelieve is made to appear good to them, and they are averted from the path. Whomever God misguides has no guide.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 34: There is for them torment in the worldly life, but the torment of the Hereafter is harsher. And they have no defender against God.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 35: The likeness of the Garden promised to the righteous: rivers flowing beneath it; its food is perpetual, and so is its shade. Such is the sequel for those who guard against evil, but the sequel of the disbelievers is the Fire.

Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 36: Those to whom We gave the Scripture rejoice in what was revealed to you, while some factions reject parts of it. Say, "I am commanded to worship God, and to never associate anything with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 37: Thus We revealed it an Arabic code of law. Were you to follow their desires, after the knowledge that has come to you, you would have neither ally nor defender against God.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 38: We sent messengers before you, and We assigned for them wives and offspring. No messenger could bring a sign except with the permission of God. For every era is a scripture.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 39: God abolishes whatever He wills, and He affirms. With Him is the source of the Scripture.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 40: Whether We show you some of what We have promised them, or We cause you to die-your duty is to inform, and Ours is the reckoning.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 41: Do they not see how We deal with the earth, diminishing it at its edges? God judges; and nothing can hold back His judgment. And He is quick to settle accounts.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 42: Those before them planned, but the entire plan is up to God. He knows what every soul earns. Those who disbelieve will know to whom the Ultimate Home is.
Surah ar-Ra'd, Ayah 43: Those who disbelieve say, "You are not a messenger." Say, "God is a sufficient witness between me and you, and whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Ra. A Scripture that We revealed to you, that you may bring humanity from darkness to light-with the permission of their Lord-to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 2: God-to whom belongs what is in the heavens and the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe torment.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 3: Those who prefer the present life to the Hereafter, and repel from the path of God, and seek to make it crooked-these are far astray.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 4: We never sent any messenger except in the language of his people, to make things clear for them. God leads astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 5: We sent Moses with Our signs: "Bring your people out of darkness into light, and remind them of the Days of God." In that are signs for every patient and thankful person."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 6: Moses said to his people, "Remember God's blessings upon you, as He delivered you from the people of Pharaoh, who inflicted on you terrible suffering, slaughtering your sons while sparing your daughters. In that was a serious trial from your Lord."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 7: And when your Lord proclaimed: "If you give thanks, I will grant you increase; but if you are ungrateful, My punishment is severe."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 8: And Moses said, "Even if you are ungrateful, together with everyone on earth-God is in no need, Worthy of Praise."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 9: Has not the story reached you, of those before you, the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood-and those after them? None knows them except God. Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs, but they tried to silence them, and said, "We reject what you are sent with, and we are in serious doubt regarding what you are calling us to."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 10: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about God, Maker of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to forgive you your sins, and to defer you until a stated term." They said, "You are only humans like us; you want to turn us away from what our ancestors worshiped; so bring us a clear proof."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 11: Their messengers said to them, "We are only humans like you, but God favors whomever He wills from among His servants. We cannot possibly show you any proof, except by leave of God. In God let the faithful put their trust."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 12: "And why should we not trust in God, when He has guided us in our ways? We will persevere in the face of your persecution. And upon God the reliant should rely."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 13: Those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will expel you from our land, unless you return to our religion." And their Lord inspired them: "We will destroy the wrongdoers."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 14: "And We will settle you in the land after them. That is for him who fears My Majesty, and fears My threats."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 15: And they prayed for victory, and every stubborn tyrant came to disappointment.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 16: Beyond him lies Hell, and he will be given to drink putrid water.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 17: He will guzzle it, but he will not swallow it. Death will come at him from every direction, but he will not die. And beyond this is relentless suffering.
