Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 18: The likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are like ashes, in a fierce wind, on a stormy day. They have no control over anything they have earned. That is the utmost misguidance.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 19: Do you not see that God created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He wills, He can do away with you, and bring a new creation.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 20: And that is not difficult for God.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 21: They will emerge before God, altogether. The weak will say to those who were proud, "We were your followers, can you protect us at all against God's punishment?" They will say, "Had God guided us, we would have guided you. It is the same for us; whether we mourn, or are patient; there is no asylum for us."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 22: And Satan will say, when the issue is settled, "God has promised you the promise of truth, and I promised you, but I failed you. I had no authority over you, except that I called you, and you answered me. So do not blame me, but blame yourselves. I cannot come to your aid, nor can you come to my aid. I reject your associating with me in the past. The wrongdoers will have a torment most painful."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 23: But those who believed and did good deeds will be admitted into gardens beneath which rivers flow, to remain therein forever, by leave of their Lord. Their greeting therein will be: "Peace."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 24: Do you not see how God presents a parable? A good word is like a good tree-its root is firm, and its branches are in the sky.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 25: It yields its fruits every season by the will of its Lord. God presents the parables to the people, so that they may reflect.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 26: And the parable of a bad word is that of a bad tree-it is uprooted from the ground; it has no stability.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 27: God gives firmness to those who believe, with the firm word, in this life, and in the Hereafter. And God leads the wicked astray. God does whatever He wills.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 28: Have you not seen those who exchanged the blessing of God with blasphemy, and landed their people into the house of perdition?
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 29: Hell-they will roast in it. What a miserable settlement.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 30: And they set up rivals to God, in order to lead away from His path. Say, "Enjoy yourselves; your destination is the Fire."

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 31: Tell My servants who have believed to perform the prayers, and to give from what We have given them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there is neither trading nor friendship.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 32: God is He Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down water from the sky, and with it produces fruits for your sustenance. And He committed the ships to your service, sailing through the sea by His command, and He committed the rivers to your service.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 33: And He committed the sun and the moon to your service, both continuously pursuing their courses, and He committed the night and the day to your service.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 34: And He has given you something of all what you asked. And if you were to count God's blessings, you would not be able to enumerate them. The human being is unfair and ungrateful.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 35: Recall that Abraham said, "O my Lord, make this land peaceful, and keep me and my sons from worshiping idols."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 36: "My Lord, they have led many people astray. Whoever follows me belongs with me; and whoever disobeys me-You are Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 37: "Our Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in a valley of no vegetation, by Your Sacred House, our Lord, so that they may perform the prayers. So make the hearts of some people incline towards them, and provide them with fruits, that they may be thankful."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 38: "Our Lord, You know what we conceal and what we reveal. And nothing is hidden from God, on earth or in the heaven."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 39: "Praise be to God, Who has given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac. My Lord is the Hearer of Prayers."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 40: "My Lord, make me one who performs the prayer, and from my offspring. Our Lord, accept my supplication."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 41: "Our Lord, forgive me, and my parents, and the believers, on the Day the Reckoning takes place."
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 42: Do not ever think that God is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only defers them until a Day when the sights stare.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 43: Their necks outstretched, their heads upraised, their gaze unblinking, their hearts void.

Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 44: And warn mankind of the Day when the punishment will come upon them, and the wicked will say, "Our Lord, defer us for a little while, and we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." Did you not swear before that there will be no passing away for you?
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 45: And you inhabited the homes of those who wronged themselves, and it became clear to you how We dealt with them, and We cited for you the examples.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 46: They planned their plans, but their plans are known to God, even if their plans can eliminate mountains.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 47: Do not ever think that God will break His promise to His messengers. God is Strong, Able to Avenge.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 48: On the Day when the earth is changed into another earth, and the heavens, and they will emerge before God, the One, the Irresistible.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 49: On that Day, you will see the sinners bound together in chains.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 50: Their garments made of tar, and the Fire covering their faces.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 51: That God may repay each soul according to what it has earned. God is Quick in reckoning.
Surah Ibrahim, Ayah 52: This is a proclamation for mankind, that they may be warned thereby, and know that He is One God, and that people of understanding may remember.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the Verses of the Book; a Quran that makes things clear.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 2: Perhaps those who disbelieve would like to become Muslims.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 3: Leave them to eat, and enjoy, and be lulled by hope. They will find out.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 4: We have never destroyed a town unless it had a set time.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 5: No nation can bring its time forward, nor can they delay it.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 6: And they said, "O you who received the message, you are insane."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 7: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you are truthful?"
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 8: We do not send the angels down except with reason, and they will not be held back.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 9: Surely We revealed the Message, and We will surely preserve it.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 10: We sent others before you, to the former communities.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 11: But no messenger came to them, but they ridiculed him.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 12: Thus We slip it into the hearts of the guilty.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 13: They do not believe in it, though the ways of the ancients have passed away.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 14: Even if We opened for them a gateway into the sky, and they began to ascend through it.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 15: They would still say, "Our eyes are hallucinating; in fact, we are people bewitched."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 16: We placed constellations in the sky, and made them beautiful to the beholders.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 17: And We guarded them from every outcast devil.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 18: Except one who steals a hearing, and is followed by a visible projectile.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 19: We spread the earth, and placed stabilizers in it, and in it We grew all things in proper measure.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 20: And in it We created livelihoods for you, and for those for whom you are not the providers.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 21: There is not a thing but with Us are its stores, and We send it down only in precise measure.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 22: We send the fertilizing winds; and send down water from the sky, and give it to you to drink, and you are not the ones who store it.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 23: It is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritors.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 24: And We know those of you who go forward, and We know those who lag behind.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 25: It is your Lord who will gather them together. He is the Wise, the Knowing.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 26: We created the human being from clay, from molded mud.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 27: And the jinn We created before, from piercing fire.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 28: Your Lord said to the angels, "I am creating a human being from clay, from molded mud."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 29: "When I have formed him, and breathed into him of My spirit, fall down prostrating before him."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 30: So the angels prostrated themselves, all together.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 31: Except for Satan. He refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 32: He said, "O Satan, what kept you from being among those who prostrated themselves?"
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 33: He said, "I am not about to prostrate myself before a human being, whom You created from clay, from molded mud."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 34: He said, "Then get out of here, for you are an outcast".
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 35: "And the curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 36: He said, "My Lord, reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 37: He said, "You are of those reprieved."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 38: "Until the Day of the time appointed."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 39: He said, "My Lord, since You have lured me away, I will glamorize for them on earth, and I will lure them all away."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 40: "Except for Your sincere servants among them."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 41: He said, "This is a right way with Me."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 42: "Over My servants you have no authority, except for the sinners who follow you."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 43: And Hell is the meeting-place for them all.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 44: "It has seven doors; for each door is an assigned class."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 45: But the righteous will be in gardens with springs.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 46: "Enter it in peace and security."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 47: And We will remove all ill-feelings from their hearts-brothers and sisters, on couches facing one another.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 48: No fatigue will ever touch them therein, nor will they be asked to leave it.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 49: Inform My servants that I am the Forgiver, the Merciful.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 50: And that My punishment is the painful punishment.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 51: And inform them of the guests of Abraham.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 52: When they entered upon him, and said, "Peace." He said, "We are wary of you."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 53: They said, "Do not fear; we bring you good news of a boy endowed with knowledge."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 54: He said, "Do you bring me good news, when old age has overtaken me? What good news do you bring?"
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 55: They said, "We bring you good news in truth, so do not despair."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 56: He said, "And who despairs of his Lord's mercy but the lost?"
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 57: He said, "So what is your business, O envoys?"
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 58: They said, "We were sent to a sinful people."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 59: "Except for the family of Lot; we will save them all."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 60: "Except for his wife." We have determined that she will be of those who lag behind.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 61: And when the envoys came to the family of Lot.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 62: He said, "You are a people unknown to me."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 63: They said, "We bring you what they have doubts about."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 64: "We bring you the truth, and we are truthful."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 65: "Travel with your family at the dead of the night, and follow up behind them, and let none of you look back, and proceed as commanded."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 66: And We informed him of Our decree: the last remnant of these will be uprooted by early morning.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 67: And the people of the town came joyfully.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 68: He said, "These are my guests, so do not embarrass me."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 69: "And fear God, and do not disgrace me."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 70: They said, "Did we not forbid you from strangers?"
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 71: He said, "These are my daughters, if you must."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 72: By your life, they were blundering in their drunkenness.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 73: So the Blast struck them at sunrise.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 74: And We turned it upside down, and rained down upon them stones of baked clay.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 75: Surely in that are lessons for those who read signs.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 76: And it is on an existing road.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 77: Surely in that is a sign for the believers.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 78: The people of the Woods were also wrongdoers.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 79: So We took revenge upon them. Both are clearly documented.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 80: The people of the Rock also rejected the messengers.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 81: We gave them Our revelations, but they turned away from them.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 82: They used to carve homes in the mountains, feeling secure.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 83: But the Blast struck them in the morning.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 84: All they had acquired was of no avail to them.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 85: We did not create the heavens and the earth, and what lies between them, except with truth. The Hour is coming, so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 86: Your Lord is the All-Knowing Creator.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 87: We have given you seven of the pairs, and the Grand Quran.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 88: Do not extend your eyes towards what We have bestowed on some couples of them to enjoy, and do not grieve over them, and lower your wing to the believers.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 89: And say, "I am the clear warner."
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 90: Just as We sent down to the separatists.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 91: Those who made the Quran obsolete.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 92: By your Lord, we will question them all.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 93: About what they used to do.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 94: So proclaim openly what you are commanded, and turn away from the polytheists.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 95: We are enough for you against the mockers.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 96: Those who set up another god with God. They will come to know.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 97: We are aware that your heart is strained by what they say.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 98: So glorify the praise of your Lord, and be among those who bow down.
Surah al-Hijr, Ayah 99: And worship your Lord in order to attain certainty.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 1: The command of God has come, so do not rush it. Glory be to Him; exalted above what they associate.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 2: He sends down the angels with the Spirit by His command, upon whom He wills of His servants: "Give warning that there is no god but Me, and fear Me."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 3: He created the heavens and the earth with justice. He is exalted above the associations they attribute.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 4: He created the human being from a drop of fluid, yet he becomes an open adversary.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 5: And the livestock-He created them for you. In them are warmth and benefits for you, and of them you eat.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 6: And there is beauty in them for you, when you bring them home, and when you drive them to pasture.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 7: And they carry your loads to territory you could not have reached without great hardship. Your Lord is Clement and Merciful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 8: And the horses, and the mules, and the donkeys-for you to ride, and for luxury. And He creates what you do not know.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 9: It is for God to point out the paths, but some of them are flawed. Had He willed, He could have guided you all.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 10: It is He Who sends down for you from the sky water. From it is drink, and with it grows vegetation for grazing.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 11: And He produces for you grains with it, and olives, and date-palms, and grapes, and all kinds of fruits. Surely in that is a sign for people who think.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 12: And He regulated for you the night and the day; and the sun, and the moon, and the stars are disposed by His command. Surely in that are signs for people who ponder.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 13: And whatsoever He created for you on earth is of diverse colors. Surely in that is a sign for people who are mindful.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 14: And it is He who made the sea to serve you, that you may eat from it tender meat, and extract from it ornaments that you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, as you seek His bounties, so that you may give thanks.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 15: And he cast mountains on the earth, lest it shifts with you; and rivers, and roads, so that you may be guided.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 16: And landmarks. And by the stars they guide themselves.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 17: Is He who creates like him who does not create? Will you not take a lesson?
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 18: And if you tried to enumerate the favors of God, you will not be able to count them. God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 19: And God knows what you hide and what you disclose.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 20: Those they invoke besides God create nothing, but are themselves created.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 21: They are dead, not alive; and they do not know when they will be resurrected.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 22: Your God is one God. As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, their hearts are in denial, and they are arrogant.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 23: Without a doubt, God knows what they conceal and what they reveal. He does not like the arrogant.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 24: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Legends of the ancients."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 25: So let them carry their loads complete on the Day of Resurrection, and some of the loads of those they misguided without knowledge. Evil is what they carry.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 26: Those before them also schemed, but God took their structures from the foundations, and the roof caved in on them. The punishment came at them from where they did not perceive.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 27: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them, and say, "Where are My associates for whose sake you used to dispute?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Today shame and misery are upon the disbelievers."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 28: Those wronging their souls while the angels are taking them away-they will propose peace: "We did no wrong." Yes you did. God is aware of what you used to do."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 29: Enter the gates of Hell, to dwell therein forever. Miserable is the residence of the arrogant.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 30: And it will be said to those who maintained piety, "What has your Lord revealed?" They will say, "Goodness." To those who do good in this world is goodness, and the Home of the Hereafter is even better. How wonderful is the residence of the pious.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 31: The Gardens of Perpetuity, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow, where they will have whatever they desire. Thus God rewards the pious.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 32: Those who are in a wholesome state when the angels take them-will say, "Peace be upon you; enter Paradise, for what you used to do."

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 33: Are they but waiting for the angels to come to them, or for the command of your Lord to arrive? Those before them did likewise. God did not wrong them, but they used to wrong their own souls.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 34: So the evils of their deeds assailed them, and what they used to ridicule engulfed them.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 35: The idolaters say, "Had God willed, we would not have worshiped anything besides Him, neither us, nor our ancestors, nor would we have prohibited anything besides His prohibitions." Those before them did likewise. Are the messengers responsible for anything but clear communication?

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 36: To every community We sent a messenger: "Worship God, and avoid idolatry." Some of them God guided, while others deserved misguidance. So travel through the earth, and see what the fate of the deniers was.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 37: Even though you may be concerned about their guidance, God does not guide those who misguide. And they will have no saviors.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 38: And they swear by God with their most solemn oaths, "God will not resurrect anyone who dies." Yes indeed, it is a promise binding on Him, but most people do not know.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 39: To clarify for them what they differed about, and for the faithless to know that they were liars.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 40: When We intend for something to happen, We say to it, "Be," and it becomes.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 41: Those who emigrate for God's sake after being persecuted, We will settle them in a good place in this world; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 42: Those who endure patiently, and in their Lord they put their trust.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 43: We did not send before you except men whom We inspired. So ask the people of knowledge, if you do not know.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 44: With the clarifications and the scriptures. And We revealed to you the Reminder, that you may clarify to the people what was revealed to them, and that they may reflect.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 45: Do those who scheme evils feel secure that God will not cause the earth to cave in with them, or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 46: Or that He will not seize them during their activities? And they will not be able to prevent it.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 47: Or that He will not seize them while in dread? Your Lord is Gentle and Merciful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 48: Have they not observed what God has created? Their shadows revolve from the right and the left, bowing to God as they shrink away.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 49: To God bows down everything in the heavens and everything on earth-every living creature, and the angels, and without being proud.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 50: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 51: God has said: "Do not take two gods; He is only One God; so fear only Me."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 52: To Him belongs everything in the heavens and the earth; and to Him obedience is due always. Do you, then, fear anyone other than God?
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 53: Whatever blessing you have is from God. And when harm touches you, it is to Him that you groan.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 54: But when He lifts the harm from you, some of you associate others with their Lord.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 55: To show ingratitude for what We have given them. Enjoy yourselves. You will soon know.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 56: And they allocate, to something they do not know, a share of what We have provided for them. By God, you will be questioned about what you have been inventing.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 57: And they attribute to God daughters-exalted is He-and for themselves what they desire.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 58: And when one of them is given news of a female infant, his face darkens, and he chokes with grief.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 59: He hides from the people because of the bad news given to him. Shall he keep it in humiliation, or bury it in the dust? Evil is the decision they make.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 60: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter set a bad example, while God sets the Highest Example. He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 61: If God were to hold mankind for their injustices, He would not leave upon it a single creature, but He postpones them until an appointed time. Then, when their time arrives, they will not delay it by one hour, nor will they advance it.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 62: And they attribute to God what they themselves dislike, while their tongues utter the lie that theirs is the goodness. Without a doubt, for them is the Fire, and they will be neglected.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 63: By God, We sent messengers to communities before you, but Satan made their deeds appear alluring to them. He is their master today, and they will have a painful punishment.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 64: We revealed to you the Scripture only to clarify for them what they differ about, and guidance and mercy for people who believe.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 65: God sends down water from the sky, with which He revives the earth after its death. In this is a sign for people who listen.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 66: And there is a lesson for you in cattle: We give you a drink from their bellies, from between waste and blood, pure milk, refreshing to the drinkers.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 67: And from the fruits of date-palms and grapevines, you derive sugar and wholesome food. In this is a sign for people who understand.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 68: And your Lord inspired the bee: "Set up hives in the mountains, and in the trees, and in what they construct."

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 69: Then eat of all the fruits, and go along the pathways of your Lord, with precision. From their bellies emerges a fluid of diverse colors, containing healing for the people. Surely in this is a sign for people who reflect.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 70: God created you; then He takes you away. Some of you will be brought back to the worst age, so that he will no longer know anything, after having acquired knowledge. God is Omniscient and Omnipotent.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 71: God has favored some of you over others in livelihood. Those who are favored would not give their properties to their servants, to the extent of making them partners in it. Will they then renounce God's blessings?

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 72: God has given you mates from among yourselves; and has produced for you, from your mates, children and grandchildren; and has provided you with good things. Will they then believe in falsehood, and refuse God's favors?
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 73: And yet they serve besides God what possesses no provisions for them in the heavens, nor on earth, nor are they capable.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 74: So do not cite the examples for God. God knows, and you do not know.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 75: God cites the example of a bonded slave, who has no power over anything; and someone to whom We have given plentiful provision, from which he gives secretly and openly. Are they equal in comparison? All praise belongs to God, but most of them do not know.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 76: And God cites the example of two men: one of them dumb, unable to do anything, and is a burden on his master; whichever way he directs him, he achieves nothing good. Is he equal to him who commands justice, and is on a straight path?
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 77: To God belongs the unseen of the heavens and the earth. The coming of the Hour is only as the twinkling of the eye, or even nearer. God has power over everything.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 78: God brought you out of your mothers' wombs, not knowing anything; and He gave you the hearing, and the eyesight, and the brains; that you may give thanks.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 79: Have they not seen the birds, flying in the midst of the sky? None sustains them except God. In this are signs for people who believe.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 80: And God has given you in your homes habitats for you, and has provided for you out of the hides of livestock portable homes for you, so you can use them when you travel, and when you camp; and from their wool, and fur, and hair, furnishings and comfort for a while.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 81: And God has made for you shade out of what He has created, and has given you resorts in the mountains, and has given you garments to protect you from the heat, and garments to protect you from your violence. Thus He completes His blessings upon you, so that you may submit.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 82: But if they turn away, your only duty is clear communication.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 83: They recognize God's blessing, but then deny it, as most of them are ungrateful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 84: On the Day when We raise up a witness from every community-those who disbelieved will not be permitted, nor will they be excused.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 85: When those who did wrong see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 86: And when the idolaters see their associates, they will say, "Our Lord, these are our associates whom we used to invoke besides You." They will strike back at them with the saying, "Surely you are liars."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 87: On that Day they will offer their submission to God, and what they had invented will abandon them.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 88: Those who disbelieve and obstruct from God's path-We will add punishment to their punishment, on account of the mischief they used to make.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 89: On the Day when We raise in every community a witness against them, from among them, and bring you as a witness against these. We have revealed to you the Book, as an explanation of all things, and guidance, and mercy and good news for those who submit.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 90: God commands justice, and goodness, and generosity towards relatives. And He forbids immorality, and injustice, and oppression. He advises you, so that you may take heed.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 91: Fulfill God's covenant when you make a covenant, and do not break your oaths after ratifying them. You have made God your guarantor, and God knows what you do.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 92: And do not be like her who unravels her yarn, breaking it into pieces, after she has spun it strongly. Nor use your oaths as means of deception among you, because one community is more prosperous than another. God is testing you thereby. On the Day of Resurrection, He will make clear to you everything you had disputed about.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 93: Had God willed, He would have made you one congregation, but He leaves astray whom He wills, and He guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 94: And do not use your oaths to deceive one another, so that a foot may not slip after being firm, and you taste misery because you hindered from God's path, and incur a terrible torment.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 95: And do not exchange God's covenant for a small price. What is with God is better for you, if you only knew.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 96: What you have runs out, but what is with God remains. We will reward those who are patient according to the best of their deeds.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 97: Whoever works righteousness, whether male or female, while being a believer, We will grant him a good life-and We will reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 98: When you read the Quran, seek refuge with God from Satan the outcast.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 99: He has no authority over those who believe and trust in their Lord.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 100: His authority is only over those who follow him, and those who associate others with Him.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 101: When We substitute a verse in place of another verse-and God knows best what He reveals-they say, "You are an impostor." But most of them do not know.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 102: Say, "The Holy Spirit has brought it down from your Lord, truthfully, in order to stabilize those who believe, and as guidance and good news for those who submit."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 103: We are well aware that they say, "It is a human being who is teaching him." But the tongue of him they allude to is foreign, while this is a clear Arabic tongue.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 104: Those who do not believe in God's revelations-God will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 105: It is those who do not believe in God's revelations who fabricate falsehood. These are the liars.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 106: Whoever renounces faith in God after having believed-except for someone who is compelled, while his heart rests securely in faith-but whoever willingly opens up his heart to disbelief-upon them falls wrath from God, and for them is a tremendous torment.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 107: That is because they have preferred the worldly life to the Hereafter, and because God does not guide the people who refuse.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 108: It is they whom God has sealed their hearts, and their hearing, and their sight. It is they who are the heedless.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 109: There is no doubt that in the Hereafter they will be the losers.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 110: But then your Lord-for those who emigrated after being persecuted, then struggled and persevered-your Lord thereafter is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 111: On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and they will not be wronged.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 112: And God cites the example of a town that was secure and peaceful, with its livelihood coming to it abundantly from every direction. But then it turned unappreciative of God's blessings, so God made it taste the robe of hunger and fear, because of what they used to craft.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 113: A messenger from among them had come to them, but they denounced him, so the punishment seized them in the midst of their wrongdoing.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 114: Eat of the lawful and good things God has provided for you, and be thankful for God's blessings, if it is Him that you serve.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 115: He has forbidden you carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and anything consecrated to other than God. But if anyone is compelled by necessity, without being deliberate or malicious, then God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 116: And do not say of falsehood asserted by your tongues, "This is lawful, and this is unlawful," in order to invent lies and attribute them to God. Those who invent lies and attribute them to God will not succeed.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 117: A brief enjoyment-then they will have a painful punishment.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 118: For those who are Jews, We have prohibited what We related to you before. We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong their own selves.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 119: But towards those who do wrongs in ignorance, and then repent afterwards and reform, your Lord thereafter is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 120: Abraham was an exemplary leader, devoted to God, a monotheist, and was not of the polytheists.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 121: Thankful for His blessings. He chose him, and guided him to a straight path.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 122: And We gave him goodness in this world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 123: Then We inspired you: "Follow the religion of Abraham, the Monotheist. He was not an idol-worshiper."
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 124: The Sabbath was decreed only for those who differed about it. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding their differences.

Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 125: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good advice, and debate with them in the most dignified manner. Your Lord is aware of those who stray from His path, and He is aware of those who are guided.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 126: If you were to retaliate, retaliate to the same degree as the injury done to you. But if you resort to patience-it is better for the patient.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 127: So be patient. Your patience is solely from God. And do not grieve over them, and do not be stressed by their schemes.
Surah an-Nahl, Ayah 128: God is with those who are righteous and those who are virtuous.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 1: Glory to Him who journeyed His servant by night, from the Sacred Mosque, to the Farthest Mosque, whose precincts We have blessed, in order to show him of Our wonders. He is the Listener, the Beholder.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 2: And We gave Moses the Scripture, and made it a guide for the Children of Israel: Take none for protector other than Me.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 3: The descendants of those We carried with Noah. He was an appreciative servant.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 4: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture: You will commit evil on earth twice, and you will rise to a great height.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 5: When the first of the two promises came true, We sent against you servants of Ours, possessing great might, and they ransacked your homes. It was a promise fulfilled.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 6: Then We gave you back your turn against them, and supplied you with wealth and children, and made you more numerous.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 7: If you work righteousness, you work righteousness for yourselves; and if you commit evil, you do so against yourselves. Then, when the second promise comes true, they will make your faces filled with sorrow, and enter the Temple as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy all that falls into their power.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 8: Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you revert, We will revert. We have made Hell a prison for the disbelievers.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 9: This Quran guides to what is most upright; and it gives good news to the believers who do good deeds, that they will have a great reward.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 10: And those who do not believe in the Hereafter-We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 11: The human being prays for evil as he prays for good. The human being is very hasty.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 12: We have made the night and the day two wonders. We erased the wonder of the night, and made the wonder of the day revealing, that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and know the number of years, and the calculation. We have explained all things in detail.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 13: For every person We have attached his fate to his neck. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will bring out for him a book which he will find spread open.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 14: "Read your book; today there will be none but yourself to call you to account."

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 15: Whoever is guided-is guided for his own good. And whoever goes astray-goes astray to his detriment. No burdened soul carries the burdens of another, nor do We ever punish until We have sent a messenger.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 16: When We decide to destroy a town, We command its affluent ones, they transgress in it, so the word becomes justified against it, and We destroy it completely.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 17: How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? Your Lord is sufficient as Knower and Beholder of the sins of his servants.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 18: Whoever desires the fleeting life, We expedite for him what We decide to give him, to whomever We desire. Then We consign him to Hell, where he will roast, condemned and defeated.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 19: But whoever desires the Hereafter, and pursues it as it should be pursued, while he is a believer; these-their effort will be appreciated.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 20: To all-these and those-We extend from the gifts of your Lord. The gifts of your Lord are not restricted.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 21: See how We have favored some of them over others; yet the Hereafter is greater in ranks, and greater in favors.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 22: Do not set up another god with God, lest you become condemned and damned.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 23: Your Lord has commanded that you worship none but Him, and that you be good to your parents. If either of them or both of them reach old age with you, do not say to them a word of disrespect, nor scold them, but say to them kind words.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 24: And lower to them the wing of humility, out of mercy, and say, "My Lord, have mercy on them, as they raised me when I was a child."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 25: Your Lord knows best what is in your minds. If you are righteous-He is Forgiving to the obedient.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 26: And give the relative his rights, and the poor, and the wayfarer, and do not squander wastefully.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 27: The extravagant are brethren of the devils, and the devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 28: But if you turn away from them, seeking mercy from your Lord which you hope for, then say to them words of comfort.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 29: And do not keep your hand tied to your neck, nor spread it out fully, lest you end up liable and regretful.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 30: Your Lord expands the provision for whomever He wills, and restricts it. He is fully Informed, Observant of His servants.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 31: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them, and for you. Killing them is a grave sin.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 32: And do not come near adultery. It is immoral, and an evil way.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 33: And do not kill the soul which God has made sacred, except in the course of justice. If someone is killed unjustly, We have given his next of kin certain authority. But he should not be excessive in killing, for he will be supported.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 34: And do not go near the orphan's property, except with the best of intentions, until he has reached his maturity. And honor your pledge, because the pledge involves responsibility.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 35: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with accurate scales. That is fair, and the best determination.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 36: And do not occupy yourself with what you have no knowledge of. The hearing, and the sight, and the brains-all these will be questioned.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 37: And do not walk proudly on earth. You can neither pierce the earth, nor can you match the mountains in height.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 38: The evil of all these is disliked by your Lord.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 39: That is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. Do not set up with God another god, or else you will be thrown in Hell, rebuked and banished.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 40: Has your Lord favored you with sons, while choosing for Himself daughters from among the angels? You are indeed saying a terrible thing.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 41: We have explained in this Quran in various ways, that they may remember, but it only adds to their rebellion.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 42: Say, "If there were other gods with Him, as they say, they would have sought a way to the Lord of the Throne."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 43: Be He glorified. He is exalted, far above what they say.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 44: Praising Him are the seven heavens, and the earth, and everyone in them. There is not a thing that does not glorify Him with praise, but you do not understand their praises. He is indeed Forbearing and Forgiving.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 45: When you read the Quran, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter an invisible barrier.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 46: And We drape veils over their hearts, preventing them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 47: We know well what they listen to, when they listen to you, as they conspire, when the wrongdoers say, "You only follow a man bewitched."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 48: Note what they compared you to. They are lost, and unable to find a way.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 49: And they say, "When we have become bones and fragments, shall we really be resurrected as a new creation?"
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 50: Say, "Even if you become rocks or iron.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 51: Or some substance, which, in your minds, is even harder." Then they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "The One who originated you the first time." Then they will nod their heads at you, and say, "When will it be?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 52: On the Day when He calls you, you will respond with His praise, and you will realize that you stayed only a little.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 53: Tell My servants to say what is best. Satan sows discord among them. Satan is to man an open enemy.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 54: Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will have mercy on you; and if He wills, He will punish you. We did not send you as their advocate.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 55: Your Lord knows well everyone in the heavens and the earth. We have given some prophets advantage over others; and to David We gave the Psalms.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 56: Say, "Call upon those you claim besides Him. They have no power to relieve your adversity, nor can they change it."

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 57: Those they call upon are themselves seeking means of access to their Lord, vying to be nearer, and hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment. The punishment of your Lord is to be dreaded.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 58: There is no city but We will destroy before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with a severe punishment. This is inscribed in the Book.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 59: Nothing prevents Us from sending miraculous signs, except that the ancients called them lies. We gave Thamood the she-camel, a visible sign, but they mistreated her. We do not send the signs except to instill reverence.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 60: We said to you that your Lord encompasses humanity. We did not make the vision We showed you, except as a test for the people, and the tree cursed in the Quran. We frighten them, but that only increases their defiance.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 61: When We said to the angels, "Bow down before Adam," they bowed down, except for Satan. He said, "Shall I bow down before someone You created from mud?"

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 62: He said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored more than me? If You reprieve me until the Day of Resurrection, I will bring his descendants under my sway, except for a few."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 63: He said, "Begone! Whoever of them follows you-Hell is your reward, an ample reward."

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 64: "And entice whomever of them you can with your voice, and rally against them your cavalry and your infantry, and share with them in wealth and children, and make promises to them." But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 65: "As for My devotees, you have no authority over them." Your Lord is an adequate Guardian.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 66: Your Lord is He who propels for you the ships at sea, that you may seek of His bounty. He is towards you Most Merciful.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 67: When harm afflicts you at sea, those you pray to vanish, except for Him. But when He saves you to land, you turn away. The human being is ever thankless.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 68: Are you confident that He will not cause a track of land to cave in beneath you, or unleash a tornado against you, and then you find no protector?

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 69: Or are you confident that He will not return you to it once again, and unleash a hurricane against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will find no helper against Us.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 70: We have honored the Children of Adam, and carried them on land and sea, and provided them with good things, and greatly favored them over many of those We created.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 71: On the Day when We call every people with their leader. Whoever is given his record in his right hand-these will read their record, and they will not be wronged one bit.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 72: But whoever is blind in this, he will be blind in the Hereafter, and further astray from the way.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 73: They almost lured you away from what We have revealed to you, so that you would invent something else in Our name. In that case, they would have taken you for a friend.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 74: Had We not given you stability, you might have inclined towards them a little.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 75: Then We would have made you taste double in life, and double at death; then you would have found for yourself no helper against Us.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 76: They almost provoked you, to expel you from the land. In that case, they would not have lasted after you, except briefly.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 77: The tradition of the messengers We sent before you-you will find no change in Our rules.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 78: Perform the prayer at the decline of the sun, until the darkness of the night; and the Quran at dawn. The Quran at dawn is witnessed.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 79: And keep vigil with it during parts of the night, as an extra prayer. Perhaps your Lord will raise you to a laudable position.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 80: And say, "My Lord, lead me in through an entry of truth, and lead me out through an exit of truth, and grant me from You a supporting power."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 81: And say, "The truth has come, and falsehood has withered away; for falsehood is bound to wither away."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 82: We send down in the Quran healing and mercy for the believers, but it increases the wrongdoers only in loss.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 83: When We bless the human being, he turns away and distances himself. But when adversity touches him, he is in despair.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 84: Say, "Each does according to his disposition. Your Lord knows best who is better guided in the way."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 85: And they ask you about the Spirit. Say, "The Spirit belongs to the domain of my Lord; and you were given only little knowledge."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 86: If We willed, We could take away what We revealed to you. Then you will find for yourself no protecting guardian against Us.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 87: Except through a mercy from your Lord. His favors upon you have been great.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 88: Say, "If mankind and jinn came together to produce the like of this Quran, they could never produce the like of it, even if they backed up one another."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 89: We have displayed for mankind in this Quran every kind of similitude, but most people insist on denying the truth.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 90: And they said, "We will not believe in you unless you make a spring burst from the ground for us.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 91: Or you have a garden of palms and vines; then cause rivers to gush pouring through them.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 92: Or make the sky fall on us in pieces, as you claim, or bring God and the angels before us.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 93: Or you possess a house of gold. Or you ascend into the sky. Even then, we will not believe in your ascension, unless you bring down for us a book that we can read." Say, "Glory be to my Lord. Am I anything but a human messenger?"
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 94: Nothing prevented the people from believing, when guidance has come to them, except that they said, "Did God send a human messenger?"
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 95: Say, "If there were angels on earth, walking around in peace, We would have sent down to them from heaven an angel messenger."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 96: Say, "God is enough witness between you and me. He is fully aware of His servants, and He sees them well."

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 97: Whomever God guides is the guided one. And whomever He leaves astray-for them you will find no protectors apart from Him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf. Their abode is Hell; whenever it abates, We intensify the blaze for them.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 98: This is their repayment for having blasphemed against Our revelations, and having said, "Shall we, when we have become bones and fragments, be resurrected as a new creation?"

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 99: Do they not consider that God, Who created the heavens and the earth, is Able to create the likes of them? He has assigned for them a term, in which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers persist in denying the truth.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 100: Say, "If you possessed the treasuries of my Lord's mercy, you would have withheld them for fear of spending." The human being has always been stingy.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 101: We gave Moses nine clear signs-ask the Children of Israel. When he went to them, Pharaoh said to him, "I think that you, Moses, are bewitched."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 102: He said, "You know that none sent these down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth-eye openers; and I think that you, Pharaoh, are doomed."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 103: He resolved to scare them off the land, but We drowned him, and those with him, altogether.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 104: After him, We said to the Children of Israel, "Inhabit the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter arrives, We will bring you all together."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 105: With the truth We sent it down, and with the truth it descended. We sent you only as a bearer of good news and a warner.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 106: A Quran which We unfolded gradually, that you may recite to the people over time. And We revealed it in stages.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 107: Say, "Believe in it, or do not believe." Those who were given knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, they fall to their chins, prostrating.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 108: And they say, "Glory to our Lord. The promise of our Lord is fulfilled."
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 109: And they fall to their chins, weeping, and it adds to their humility.

Surah al-Isra', Ayah 110: Say, "Call Him God, or call Him the Most Merciful. Whichever name you use, to Him belong the Best Names." And be neither loud in your prayer, nor silent in it, but follow a course in between.
Surah al-Isra', Ayah 111: And say, "Praise be to God, who has not begotten a son, nor has He a partner in sovereignty, nor has He an ally out of weakness, and glorify Him constantly."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 1: Praise be to God, who revealed the Book to His servant, and allowed in it no distortion.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 2: Valuable-to warn of severe punishment from Himself; and to deliver good news to the believers who do righteous deeds, that they will have an excellent reward.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 3: In which they will abide forever.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 4: And to warn those who say, "God has begotten a son."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 5: They have no knowledge of this, nor did their forefathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths. They say nothing but a lie.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 6: Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief, chasing after them, if they do not believe in this information.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 7: We made what is upon the earth an ornament for it, to test them as to which of them is best in conduct.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 8: And We will turn what is on it into barren waste.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 9: Did you know that the People of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wondrous signs?
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 10: When the youths took shelter in the cave, they said, "Our Lord, give us mercy from Yourself, and bless our affair with guidance."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 11: Then We sealed their ears in the cave for a number of years.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 12: Then We awakened them to know which of the two groups could better calculate the length of their stay.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 13: We relate to you their story in truth. They were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 14: And We strengthened their hearts, when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth; we will not call on any god besides Him, for then we would have spoken an outrage."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 15: "These people, our people, have taken to themselves gods other than Him. Why do they not bring a clear proof concerning them? Who, then, does greater wrong than he who invents lies and attributes them to God?"

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 16: "Now that you have withdrawn from them, and from what they worship besides God, take shelter in the cave. And your Lord will unfold His mercy for you, and will set your affair towards ease."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 17: You would have seen the sun, when it rose, veering away from their cave towards the right, and when it sets, moving away from them to the left, as they lay in the midst of the cave. That was one of God's wonders. He whom God guides is truly guided; but he whom He misguides, for him you will find no directing friend.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 18: You would think them awake, although they were asleep. And We turned them over to the right, and to the left, with their dog stretching its paws across the threshold. Had you looked at them, you would have turned away from them in flight, and been filled with fear of them.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 19: Even so, We awakened them, so that they may ask one another. A speaker among them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We have stayed a day, or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed." "Send one of you to the city, with this money of yours, and let him see which food is most suitable, and let him bring you some provision thereof. And let him be gentle, and let no one become aware of you."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 20: "If they discover you, they will stone you, or force you back into their religion; then you will never be saved."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 21: So it was, that We caused them to be discovered, that they would know that the promise of God is true, and that of the Hour there is no doubt. As they were disputing their case among themselves, they said, "Build over them a building." Their Lord knows best about them. Those who prevailed over their case said, "We will set up over them a place of worship."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 22: They will say, "Three, and their fourth being their dog." And they will say, "Five, and their sixth being their dog," guessing at the unknown. And they will say, "Seven, and their eighth being their dog." Say, "My Lord knows best their number." None knows them except a few. So do not argue concerning them except with an obvious argument, and do not consult any of them about them.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 23: And never say about anything, "I will do that tomorrow."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 24: Without saying, "If God wills." And remember your Lord if you forget, and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to nearer than this in integrity."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 25: And they stayed in their cave for three hundred years, adding nine.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 26: Say, "God knows best how long they stayed." His is the mystery of the heavens and the earth. By Him you see and hear. They have no guardian apart from Him, and He shares His Sovereignty with no one.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 27: And recite what was revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. There is no changing His words, and you will find no refuge except in Him.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 28: And content yourself with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, desiring His Presence. And do not turn your eyes away from them, desiring the glitter of this world. And do not obey him whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance-so he follows his own desires-and his priorities are confused.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 29: And say, "The truth is from your Lord. Whoever wills-let him believe. And whoever wills-let him disbelieve". We have prepared for the unjust a Fire, whose curtains will hem them in. And when they cry for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which scalds the faces. What a miserable drink, and what a terrible place.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 30: As for those who believe and lead a righteous life-We will not waste the reward of those who work righteousness.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 31: These will have the Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow. Reclining on comfortable furnishings, they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and will wear green garments of silk and brocade. What a wonderful reward, and what an excellent resting-place.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 32: And cite for them the parable of two men. To one of them We gave two gardens of vine, and We surrounded them with palms-trees, and We placed between them crops.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 33: Both gardens produced their harvest in full, and suffered no loss. And We made a river flow through them.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 34: And thus he had abundant fruits. He said to his friend, as he conversed with him, "I am wealthier than you, and greater in manpower."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 35: And he entered his garden, wronging himself. He said, "I do not think this will ever perish."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 36: "And I do not think the Hour is coming. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I will find something better than this in return."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 37: His friend said to him, as he conversed with him, "Are you being ungrateful to Him who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then evolved you into a man?
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 38: But as for me, He is God, my Lord, and I never associate with my Lord anyone.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 39: When you entered your garden, why did you not say, "As God wills; there is no power except through God"? Although you see me inferior to you in wealth and children.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 40: Perhaps my Lord will give me something better than your garden, and release upon it thunderbolts from the sky, so it becomes barren waste.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 41: Or its water will sink into the ground, and you will be unable to draw it."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 42: And ruin closed in on his crops, and so he began wringing his hands over what he had invested in it, as it lays fallen upon its trellises. And he was saying, "I wish I never associated anyone with my Lord."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 43: He had no faction to help him besides God, and he was helpless.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 44: That is because authority belongs to God, the True. He is Best in rewarding, and Best in requiting.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 45: And cite for them the parable of the present life: it is like water that We send down from the sky; the plants of the earth absorb it; but then it becomes debris, scattered by the wind. God has absolute power over everything.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 46: Wealth and children are the adornments of the present life. But the things that last, the virtuous deeds, are better with your Lord for reward, and better for hope.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 47: On the Day when We set the mountains in motion; and you see the earth emerging; and We gather them together, and leave none of them behind.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 48: They will be presented before your Lord in a row. "You have come to Us as We created you the first time. Although you claimed We would not set a meeting for you."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 49: And the book will be placed, and you will see the sinners fearful of its contents. And they will say, "Woe to us! What is with this book that leaves nothing, small or big, but it has enumerated it?" They will find everything they had done present. Your Lord does not wrong anyone.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 50: We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam." So they bowed down, except for Satan. He was of the jinn, and he defied the command of his Lord. Will you take him and his offspring as lords instead of Me, when they are an enemy to you? Evil is the exchange for the wrongdoers.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 51: I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation; and I do not take the misleaders for assistants.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 52: On the Day when He will say, "Call on My partners whom you have claimed." They will call on them, but they will not answer them. And We will place between them a barrier.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 53: And the sinners will see the Fire, and will realize that they will tumble into it. They will find no deliverance from it.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 54: We have elaborated in this Quran for the people every kind of example, but the human being is a most argumentative being.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 55: What prevented people from accepting faith, when guidance has come to them, and from seeking their Lord's forgiveness? Unless they are waiting for the precedent of the ancients to befall them, or to have the punishment come upon them face to face.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 56: We send the messengers only as deliverers of good news and warners. Those who disbelieve argue with false argument, in order to defeat the truth thereby. They take My Verses, and the warnings, for a joke.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 57: Who does greater wrong than he, who, when reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them, and forgets what his hands have put forward? We have placed coverings over their hearts, lest they understand it, and heaviness in their ears. And if you call them to guidance, they will not be guided, ever.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 58: Your Lord is the Forgiver, Possessor of Mercy. Were He to call them to account for what they have earned, He would have hastened the punishment for them. But they have an appointment from which they will find no escape.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 59: And these towns-We destroyed them when they committed injustices, and We set for their destruction an appointed time.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 60: Recall when Moses said to his servant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two rivers, even if it takes me years."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 61: Then, when they reached the junction between them, they forgot about their fish. It found its way into the river, slipping away.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 62: When they went further, he said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch; we were exposed in our travel to much fatigue."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 63: He said, "Do you remember when we rested by the rock? I forgot about the fish. It was only the devil who made me forget it. And so it found its way to the river, amazingly."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 64: He said, "This is what we were seeking." And so they turned back retracing their steps.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 65: Then they came upon a servant of Ours, whom We had blessed with mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our Own.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 66: Moses said to him, "May I follow you, so that you may teach me some of the guidance you were taught?"
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 67: He said, "You will not be able to endure with me.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 68: And how will you endure what you have no knowledge of?"
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 69: He said, "You will find me, God willing, patient; and I will not disobey you in any order of yours."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 70: He said, "If you follow me, do not ask me about anything, until I myself make mention of it to you."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 71: So they set out. Until, when they had boarded the boat, he holed it. He said, "Did you hole it, to drown its passengers? You have done something awful."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 72: He said, "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?"
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 73: He said, "Do not rebuke me for forgetting, and do not make my course difficult for me."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 74: Then they set out. Until, when they encountered a boy, he killed him. He said, "Did you kill a pure soul, who killed no one? You have done something terrible."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 75: He said, "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?"
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 76: He said, "If I ask you about anything after this, then do not keep company with me. You have received excuses from me."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 77: So they set out. Until, when they reached the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. There they found a wall about to collapse, and he repaired it. He said, "If you wanted, you could have obtained a payment for it."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 78: He said, "This is the parting between you and me. I will tell you the interpretation of what you were unable to endure.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 79: As for the boat, it belonged to paupers working at sea. I wanted to damage it because there was a king coming after them seizing every boat by force.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 80: As for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared he would overwhelm them with oppression and disbelief.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 81: So we wanted their Lord to replace him with someone better in purity, and closer to mercy.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 82: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys in the town. Beneath it was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man. Your Lord wanted them to reach their maturity, and then extract their treasure-as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it of my own accord. This is the interpretation of what you were unable to endure."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 83: And they ask you about Zul-Qarnain. Say, "I will tell you something about him."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 84: We established him on earth, and gave him all kinds of means.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 85: He pursued a certain course.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 86: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a murky spring, and found a people in its vicinity. We said, "O Zul-Qarnain, you may either inflict a penalty, or else treat them kindly."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 87: He said, "As for him who does wrong, we will penalize him, then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with an unheard-of torment.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 88: "But as for him who believes and acts righteously, he will have the finest reward, and We will speak to him of Our command with ease."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 89: Then he pursued a course.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 90: Until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 91: And so it was. We had full knowledge of what he had.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 92: Then he pursued a course.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 93: Until, when he reached the point separating the two barriers, he found beside them a people who could barely understand what is said.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 94: They said, "O Zul-Qarnain, the Gog and Magog are spreading chaos in the land. Can we pay you, to build between us and them a wall?"
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 95: He said, "What my Lord has empowered me with is better. But assist me with strength, and I will build between you and them a dam."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 96: "Bring me blocks of iron." So that, when he had leveled up between the two cliffs, he said, "Blow." And having turned it into a fire, he said, "Bring me tar to pour over it."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 97: So they were unable to climb it, and they could not penetrate it.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 98: He said, "This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes true, He will turn it into rubble, and the promise of my Lord is always true."
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 99: On that Day, We will leave them surging upon one another. And the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather them together.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 100: On that Day, We will present the disbelievers to Hell, all displayed.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 101: Those whose eyes were screened to My message, and were unable to hear.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 102: Do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants for masters instead of Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of the faithless.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 103: Say, "Shall We inform you of the greatest losers in their works?"
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 104: "Those whose efforts in this world are misguided, while they assume that they are doing well."

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 105: It is they who rejected the communications of their Lord, and the encounter with Him. So their works are in vain. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will consider them of no weight.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 106: That is their requital-Hell-on account of their disbelief, and their taking My revelations and My messengers in mockery.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 107: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, they will have the Gardens of Paradise for hospitality.
Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 108: Abiding therein forever, without desiring any change therefrom.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 109: Say, "If the ocean were ink for the words of my Lord, the ocean would run out, before the words of my Lord run out," even if We were to bring the like of it in addition to it.

Surah al-Kahfi, Ayah 110: Say, "I am only a human being like you, being inspired that your god is One God. Whoever hopes to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and never associate anyone with the service of his Lord."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 1: Kaf, Ha, Ya, Ayn, Saad.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 2: A mention of the mercy of your Lord towards His servant Zechariah.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 3: When he called on his Lord, a call in seclusion.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 4: He said, "My Lord, my bones have become feeble, and my hair is aflame with gray, and never, Lord, have I been disappointed in my prayer to you.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 5: "And I fear for my dependents after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me, from Yourself, an heir.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 6: To inherit me, and inherit from the House of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, pleasing."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 7: "O Zechariah, We give you good news of a son, whose name is John, a name We have never given before."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 8: He said, "My Lord, how can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have become decrepit with old age?"
Surah Maryam, Ayah 9: He said, "It will be so, your Lord says, 'it is easy for me, and I created you before, when you were nothing.'"
Surah Maryam, Ayah 10: He said, "My Lord, give me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights straight."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 11: And he came out to his people, from the sanctuary, and signaled to them to praise morning and evening.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 12: "O John, hold on to the Scripture firmly," and We gave him wisdom in his youth.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 13: And tenderness from Us, and innocence. He was devout.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 14: And kind to his parents; and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 15: And peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the Day he is raised alive.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 16: And mention in the Scripture Mary, when she withdrew from her people to an eastern location.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 17: She screened herself away from them, and We sent to her Our spirit, and He appeared to her as an immaculate human.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 18: She said, "I take refuge from you in the Most Merciful, should you be righteous."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 19: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord, to give you the gift of a pure son."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 20: She said, "How can I have a son, when no man has touched me, and I was never unchaste?"
Surah Maryam, Ayah 21: He said, "Thus said your Lord, `It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign for humanity, and a mercy from Us. It is a matter already decided.'"
Surah Maryam, Ayah 22: So she carried him, and secluded herself with him in a remote place.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 23: The labor-pains came upon her, by the trunk of a palm-tree. She said, "I wish I had died before this, and been completely forgotten."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 24: Whereupon he called her from beneath her: "Do not worry; your Lord has placed a stream beneath you.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 25: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you, and it will drop ripe dates by you."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 26: "So eat, and drink, and be consoled. And if you see any human, say, 'I have vowed a fast to the Most Gracious, so I will not speak to any human today.'"
Surah Maryam, Ayah 27: Then she came to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have done something terrible.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 28: O sister of Aaron, your father was not an evil man, and your mother was not a whore."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 29: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to an infant in the crib?"
Surah Maryam, Ayah 30: He said, "I am the servant of God. He has given me the Scripture, and made me a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 31: And has made me blessed wherever I may be; and has enjoined on me prayer and charity, so long as I live.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 32: And kind to my mother, and He did not make me a disobedient rebel.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 33: So Peace is upon me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the Day I get resurrected alive."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 34: That is Jesus son of Mary-the Word of truth about which they doubt.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 35: It is not for God to have a child-glory be to Him. To have anything done, He says to it, "Be," and it becomes.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 36: "God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 37: But the various factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who disbelieve from the scene of a tremendous Day.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 38: Listen to them and watch for them the Day they come to Us. But the wrongdoers today are completely lost.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 39: And warn them of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded. Yet they are heedless, and they do not believe.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 40: It is We who will inherit the earth and everyone on it, and to Us they will be returned.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 41: And mention in the Scripture Abraham. He was a man of truth, a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 42: He said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship what can neither hear, nor see, nor benefit you in any way?
Surah Maryam, Ayah 43: O my father, there has come to me knowledge that never came to you. So follow me, and I will guide you along a straight way.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 44: O my father, do not worship the devil. The devil is disobedient to the Most Gracious.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 45: O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Gracious will afflict you, and you become an ally of the devil."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 46: He said, "Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will stone you. So leave me alone for a while."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 47: He said, "Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been Kind to me.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 48: And I will withdraw from you, and from what you pray to instead of God. And I will pray to my Lord, and I hope I will not be disappointed in my prayer to my Lord."
Surah Maryam, Ayah 49: When he withdrew from them, and from what they worship besides God, We granted him Isaac and Jacob. And each We made a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 50: And We gave them freely of Our mercy, and gave them a noble reputation of truth.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 51: And mention in the Scripture Moses. He was dedicated. He was a messenger and a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 52: And We called him from the right side of the Mount, and brought him near in communion.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 53: And We granted him, out of Our mercy, his brother Aaron, a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 54: And mention in the Scripture Ishmael. He was true to his promise, and was a messenger, a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 55: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and charity, and he was pleasing to his Lord.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 56: And mention in the Scripture Enoch. He was a man of truth, a prophet.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 57: And We raised him to a high position.

Surah Maryam, Ayah 58: These are some of the prophets God has blessed, from the descendants of Adam, and from those We carried with Noah, and from the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and from those We guided and selected. Whenever the revelations of the Most Gracious are recited to them, they would fall down, prostrating and weeping.
Surah Maryam, Ayah 59: But they were succeeded by generations who lost the prayers and followed their appetites. They will meet perdition.
