Surah Thaha, Ayah 81: Eat of the good things We have provided for you, but do not be excessive therein, lest My wrath descends upon you. He upon whom My wrath descends has fallen.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 82: And I am Forgiving towards him who repents, believes, acts righteously, and then remains guided.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 83: "And what made you rush ahead of your people, O Moses?"
Surah Thaha, Ayah 84: He said, "They are following in my footsteps; and I hurried on to You, my Lord, that you may be pleased."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 85: He said, "We have tested your people in your absence, and the Samarian misled them."

Surah Thaha, Ayah 86: So Moses returned to his people, angry and disappointed. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not promise you a good promise? Was the time too long for you? Or did you want wrath from your Lord to descend upon you, so you broke your promise to me?"

Surah Thaha, Ayah 87: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our choice, but we were made to carry loads of the people's ornaments, and we cast them in. That was what the Samarian suggested."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 88: So he produced for them a calf-a mere body which lowed. And they said, "This is your god, and the god of Moses, but he has forgotten."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 89: Did they not see that it cannot return a word to them, and has no power to harm them or benefit them?
Surah Thaha, Ayah 90: Aaron had said to them before, "O my people, you are being tested by this. And your Lord is the Merciful, so follow me, and obey my command."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 91: They said, "We will not give up our devotion to it, until Moses returns to us."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 92: He said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 93: From following me? Did you disobey my command?"
Surah Thaha, Ayah 94: He said, "Son of my mother, do not seize me by my beard or my head. I feared you would say, `You have caused division among the Children of Israel, and did not regard my word.'"
Surah Thaha, Ayah 95: He said, "What do you have to say, O Samarian?"
Surah Thaha, Ayah 96: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I grasped a handful from the Messenger's traces, and I flung it away. Thus my soul prompted me."

Surah Thaha, Ayah 97: He said, "Begone! Your lot in this life is to say, 'No contact.' And you have an appointment that you will not miss. Now look at your god that you remained devoted to-we will burn it up, and then blow it away into the sea, as powder."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 98: Surely your god is God, the One besides whom there is no other god. He comprehends everything in knowledge.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 99: Thus We narrate to you reports of times gone by; and We have given you a message from Our Presence.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 100: Whoever turns away from it will carry on the Day of Resurrection a burden.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 101: Abiding therein forever. And wretched is their burden on the Day of Resurrection.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 102: On the Day when the Trumpet is blown-We will gather the sinners on that Day, blue.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 103: Murmuring among themselves: "You have lingered only for ten."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 104: We are fully aware of what they say, when the most exemplary of them in conduct will say, "You have lingered only a day."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 105: And they ask you about the mountains. Say, "My Lord will crumble them utterly."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 106: And leave them desolate waste.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 107: You will see in them neither crookedness, nor deviation."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 108: On that Day, they will follow the caller, without any deviation. Voices will be hushed before the Merciful, and you will hear nothing but murmur.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 109: On that Day, intercession will not avail, except for him permitted by the Merciful, and whose words He has approved.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 110: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot comprehend Him in their knowledge.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 111: Faces will be humbled before the Living, the Eternal. Whoever carries injustice will despair.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 112: But whoever has done righteous deeds, while being a believer-will fear neither injustice, nor grievance.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 113: Thus We have revealed it an Arabic Quran, and We have diversified the warnings in it, that perhaps they would become righteous, or it may produce a lesson for them.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 114: Exalted is God, the True King. Do not be hasty with the Quran before its inspiration to you is concluded, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 115: And We covenanted with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found in him no resolve.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 116: And when We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam." They bowed down, except for Satan; he refused.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 117: We said, "O Adam, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him make you leave the Garden, for then you will suffer.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 118: In it you will never go hungry, nor be naked.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 119: Nor will you be thirsty in it, nor will you swelter."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 120: But Satan whispered to him. He said, "O Adam, shall I show you the Tree of Immortality, and a kingdom that never decays?"

Surah Thaha, Ayah 121: And so they ate from it; whereupon their bodies became visible to them, and they started covering themselves with the leaves of the Garden. Thus Adam disobeyed his Lord, and fell.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 122: But then his Lord recalled him, and pardoned him, and guided him.

Surah Thaha, Ayah 123: He said, "Go down from it, altogether; some of you enemies of some others. But whenever guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance, will not go astray, nor suffer.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 124: But whoever turns away from My Reminder, for him is a confined life. And We will raise him on the Day of Resurrection blind."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 125: He will say, "My Lord, why did You raise me blind, though I was seeing?"
Surah Thaha, Ayah 126: He will say, "Just as Our revelations came to you, and you forgot them, today you will be forgotten."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 127: Thus We recompense him who transgresses and does not believe in the revelations of his Lord. The punishment of the Hereafter is more severe, and more lasting.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 128: Is it not instructive to them, how many generations before them We destroyed, in whose settlements they walk? Surely in that are signs for people of understanding.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 129: Were it not for a word that issued from your Lord, the inevitable would have happened, but there is an appointed term.

Surah Thaha, Ayah 130: So bear patiently what they say, and celebrate the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun, and before its setting. And during the hours of the night glorify Him, and at the borders of the day, that you may be satisfied.

Surah Thaha, Ayah 131: And do not extend your glance towards what We have given some classes of them to enjoy-the splendor of the life of this world-that We may test them thereby. Your Lord's provision is better, and more lasting.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 132: And exhort your people to pray, and patiently adhere to it. We ask of you no sustenance, but it is We who sustain you. The good ending is that for righteousness.
Surah Thaha, Ayah 133: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a miracle from his Lord?" Were they not given enough miracles in the former scriptures?

Surah Thaha, Ayah 134: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before we were humiliated and disgraced."
Surah Thaha, Ayah 135: Say, "Everybody is waiting, so wait. You will know who the people of the straight path are, and who is rightly-guided.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 1: Mankind's reckoning has drawn near, but they turn away heedlessly.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 2: No fresh reminder comes to them from their Lord, but they listen to it playfully.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 3: Their hearts distracted, the wrongdoers confer secretly, "Is this anything but a mortal like you? Will you take to sorcery, with open-eyes?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 4: He said, "My Lord knows what is said in the heaven and the earth; and He is the Hearer, the Knower."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 5: And they said, "A jumble of dreams," and, "He made it up," and, "He is a poet," "let him bring us a sign, like those sent to the ancients."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 6: None of the towns We destroyed before them had believed. Will they, then, believe?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 7: We did not send before you except men, whom We inspired. Ask the people of knowledge, if you do not know.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 8: We did not make them mere bodies that ate no food, nor were they immortal.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 9: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, and We saved them together with whomever We willed, and We destroyed the extravagant.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 10: We have sent down to you a Book, containing your message. Do you not understand?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 11: How many a guilty town have We crushed, and established thereafter another people?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 12: Then, when they sensed Our might, they started running away from it.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 13: Do not run, but come back to your luxuries, and to your homes, that you may be questioned.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 14: They said, "Woe to us; we were unfair."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 15: This continued to be their cry, until We made them silent ashes.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 16: We did not create the sky and the earth and what is between them for amusement.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 17: If We wanted amusement, We could have found it within Us, were We to do so.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 18: In fact, We hurl the truth against falsehood, and it crushes it, so it vanishes. Woe unto you, for what you describe.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 19: To Him belongs everyone in the heavens and the earth. Those near Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they waver.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 20: They praise night and day, without ever tiring.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 21: Or have they taken to themselves gods from the earth who resurrect?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 22: If there were in them gods other than God, they would have gone to ruin. So glory be to God, Lord of the Throne, beyond what they allege.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 23: He will not be questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 24: Or have they taken, besides Him, other gods? Say, "Bring your proof. This is a message for those with me, and a message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 25: We never sent a messenger before you without inspiring him that: "There is no god but I, so worship Me."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 26: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken to himself a son." Be He glorified; they are but honored servants.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 27: They never speak before He has spoken, and they only act on His command.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 28: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them; and they do not intercede except for him whom He approves; and they tremble in awe of Him.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 29: And whoever of them says, "I am a god besides Him," We will reward him with Hell. Thus We reward the wrongdoers.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 30: Do the disbelievers not see that the heavens and the earth were one mass, and We tore them apart? And We made from water every living thing. Will they not believe?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 31: And We placed on earth stabilizers, lest it sways with them, and We placed therein signposts and passages, that they may be guided.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 32: And We made the sky a protected ceiling; yet they turn away from its wonders.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 33: It is He who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon; each floating in an orbit.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 34: We did not grant immortality to any human being before you. Should you die, are they then the immortal?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 35: Every soul will taste death. We burden you with adversity and prosperity-a test. And to Us you will be returned.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 36: When those who disbelieve see you, they treat you only with ridicule: "Is this the one who mentions your gods?" And they reject the mention of the Merciful.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 37: The human being was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not seek to rush Me.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 38: And they say, "When will this promise come true, if you are truthful?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 39: If those who disbelieve only knew, when they cannot keep the fire off their faces and off their backs, and they will not be helped.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 40: In fact, it will come upon them suddenly, and bewilder them. They will not be able to repel it, and they will not be reprieved.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 41: Messengers before you were also ridiculed, but those who jeered were surrounded by what they had ridiculed.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 42: Say, "Who guards you against the Merciful by night and by day?" But they turn away from the mention of their Lord.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 43: Or do they have gods who can defend them against Us? They cannot help themselves, nor will they be protected from Us.

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 44: We have given these enjoyments, and their ancestors, until time grew long upon them. Do they not see how We gradually reduce the land from its extremities? Are they then the victors?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 45: Say, "I am warning you through inspiration." But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are being warned.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 46: And when a breath of your Lord's punishment touches them, they say, "Woe to us, we were truly wicked."

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 47: We will set up the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so that no soul will suffer the least injustice. And even if it be the weight of a mustard-seed, We will bring it up. Sufficient are We as Reckoners.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 48: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and illumination, and a reminder for the righteous.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 49: Those who fear their Lord in private, and are apprehensive of the Hour.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 50: This too is a blessed message that We revealed. Are you going to deny it?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 51: We gave Abraham his integrity formerly, and We knew him well.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 52: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 53: They said, "We found our parents worshiping them."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 54: He said, "You and your parents are in evident error."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 55: They said, "Are you telling us the truth, or are you just playing?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 56: He said, "Your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the One who created them, and I bear witness to that.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 57: "By God, I will have a plan for your statues after you have gone away."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 58: So he reduced them into pieces, except for their biggest, that they may return to it.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 59: They said, "Who did this to our gods? He is certainly one of the wrongdoers."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 60: They said, "We heard a youth mentioning them. He is called Abraham."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 61: They said, "Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 62: They said, "Are you the one who did this to our gods, O Abraham?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 63: He said, "But it was this biggest of them that did it. Ask them, if they can speak."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 64: Then they turned to one another, and said, "You yourselves are the wrongdoers."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 65: But they reverted to their old ideas: "You certainly know that these do not speak."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 66: He said, "Do you worship, instead of God, what can neither benefit you in anything, nor harm you?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 67: Fie on you, and on what you worship instead of God. Do you not understand?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 68: They said, "Burn him and support your gods, if you are going to act."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 69: We said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 70: They planned to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 71: And We delivered him, and Lot, to the land that We blessed for all people.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 72: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob as a gift; and each We made righteous.

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 73: And We made them leaders, guiding by Our command; and We inspired them to do good works, and to observe the prayer, and to give out charity. They were devoted servants to Us.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 74: And Lot-We gave him judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him from the town that practiced the abominations. They were wicked and perverted people.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 75: And We admitted him into Our mercy; for He was one of the righteous.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 76: And Noah, when he called before. So We answered him, and delivered him and his family from the great disaster.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 77: And We supported him against the people who rejected Our signs. They were an evil people, so We drowned them all.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 78: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the case of the field, when some people's sheep wandered therein by night; and We were witnesses to their judgment.

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 79: And so We made Solomon understand it, and to each We gave wisdom and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains along with David to sing Our praises, and the birds as well-surely We did.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 80: And We taught him the making of shields for you, to protect you from your violence. Are you, then, appreciative?
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 81: And to Solomon the stormy wind, blowing at His command towards the land that We have blessed. We are aware of everything.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 82: And of the devils were some that dived for him, and performed other, lesser tasks. But We kept them restrained.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 83: And Job, when he cried out to his Lord: "Great harm has afflicted me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 84: So We answered him, lifted his suffering, and restored his family to him, and their like with them-a mercy from Us, and a reminder for the worshipers.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 85: And Ishmael, and Enoch, and Ezekiel; each was one of the steadfast.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 86: And We admitted them into Our mercy. They were among the righteous.

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 87: And Jonah, when he stormed out in fury, thinking We had no power over him. But then He cried out in the darkness, "There is no god but You! Glory to You! I was one of the wrongdoers!"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 88: So We answered him, and saved him from the affliction. Thus We save the faithful.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 89: And Zechariah, when he called out to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone, even though you are the Best of heirs."

Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 90: So We answered him, and gave him John. And We cured his wife for him. They used to vie in doing righteous deeds, and used to call on Us in love and awe, and they used to humble themselves to Us.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 91: And she who guarded her virginity. We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a sign to the world.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 92: This community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 93: But they splintered themselves into factions. They will all return to Us.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 94: Whoever does righteous deeds, and is a believer, his effort will not be denied. We are writing it down for him.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 95: There is a ban on the town that We had destroyed-that they will not return.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 96: Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they swarm down from every mound.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 97: The promise of truth has drawn near. The eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in horror: "Woe to us. We were oblivious to this. In fact, we were wrongdoers."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 98: You and what you worship besides God are fuel for Hell. You will descend into it.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 99: Had these been gods, they would not have descended into it. All will abide in it.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 100: In it they will wail. In it they will not hear.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 101: As for those who deserved goodness from Us-these will be kept away from it.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 102: They will not hear its hissing, and they will forever abide in what their hearts desire.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 103: The Supreme Fear will not worry them, and the angels will receive them: "This is your Day which you were promised."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 104: On the Day when We fold the heaven, like the folding of a book. Just as We began the first creation, We will repeat it-a promise binding on Us. We will act.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 105: We have written in the Psalms, after the Reminder, that the earth will be inherited by My righteous servants.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 106: Indeed, in this is a message for people who worship.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 107: We did not send you except as mercy to mankind.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 108: Say, "It is revealed to me that your God is One God. Are you going to submit?"
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 109: But if they turn away, say, "I have informed you sufficiently. Although I do not know whether what you are promised is near or far."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 110: He knows what is said openly, and He knows what you conceal.
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 111: "And I do not know whether it is perhaps a trial for you, and an enjoyment for a while."
Surah al-Anbiya, Ayah 112: He said, "My Lord, judge with justice." And, "Our Lord is the Gracious, Whose help is sought against what you allege."
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 1: O people, be conscious of your Lord. The quaking of the Hour is a tremendous thing.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 2: On the Day when you will see it: every nursing mother will discard her infant, and every pregnant woman will abort her load, and you will see the people drunk, even though they are not drunk-but the punishment of God is severe.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 3: Among the people is he who argues about God without knowledge, and follows every defiant devil.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 4: It was decreed for him, that whoever follows him-he will misguide him, and lead him to the torment of the Blaze.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 5: O people! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection-We created you from dust, then from a small drop, then from a clinging clot, then from a lump of flesh, partly developed and partly undeveloped. In order to clarify things for you. And We settle in the wombs whatever We will for a designated term, and then We bring you out as infants, until you reach your full strength. And some of you will pass away, and some of you will be returned to the vilest age, so that he may not know, after having known. And you see the earth still; but when We send down water on it, it vibrates, and swells, and grows all kinds of lovely pairs.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 6: That is because God is the truth, and because He gives life to the dead, and because He is Capable of everything.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 7: And because the Hour is coming-there is no doubt about it-and because God will resurrect those in the graves.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 8: And among the people is he who argues about God without knowledge, or guidance, or an enlightening scripture.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 9: Turning aside in contempt, to lead away from the path of God. He will have humiliation in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection We will make him taste the agony of burning.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 10: That is for what your hands have advanced, and because God is not unjust to the servants.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 11: And among the people is he who worships God on edge. When something good comes his way, he is content with it. But when an ordeal strikes him, he makes a turnaround. He loses this world and the next. That is the obvious loss.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 12: He invokes, instead of God, what can neither harm him nor benefit him. That is the far straying.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 13: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit. What a miserable master. What a miserable companion.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 14: God will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow. God does whatever He wills.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 15: Whoever thinks that God will not help him in this life and in the Hereafter-let him turn to heaven, then sever, and see if his cunning eliminates what enrages him.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 16: Thus We revealed it as clarifying signs, and God guides whomever He wills.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 17: Those who believe, and those who are Jewish, and the Sabeans, and the Christians, and the Zoroastrians, and the Polytheists-God will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. God is witness to all things.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 18: Do you not realize that to God prostrates everyone in the heavens and everyone on earth, and the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the mountains, and the trees, and the animals, and many of the people? But many are justly deserving of punishment. Whomever God shames, there is none to honor him. God does whatever He wills.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 19: Here are two adversaries feuding regarding their Lord. As for those who disbelieve, garments of fire will be tailored for them, and scalding water will be poured over their heads.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 20: Melting their insides and their skins.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 21: And they will have maces of iron.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 22: Whenever they try to escape the gloom, they will be driven back to it: "Taste the suffering of burning."

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 23: But God will admit those who believe and do good deeds into Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be decorated therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be of silk.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 24: They were guided to purity of speech. They were guided to the path of the Most Praised.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 25: As for those who disbelieve and repel from God's path and from the Sacred Mosque-which We have designated for all mankind equally, whether residing therein or passing through-and seek to commit sacrilege therein-We will make him taste of a painful punishment.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 26: We showed Abraham the location of the House: "Do not associate anything with Me; and purify My House for those who circle around, and those who stand to pray, and those who kneel and prostrate."
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 27: And announce the pilgrimage to humanity. They will come to you on foot, and on every transport. They will come from every distant point.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 28: That they may witness the benefits for themselves, and celebrate the name of God during the appointed days, for providing them with the animal livestock. So eat from it, and feed the unfortunate poor.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 29: Then let them perform their acts of cleansing, and fulfill their vows, and circle around the Ancient House.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 30: All that. Whoever venerates the sanctities of God-it is good for him with his Lord. All livestock are permitted to you, except what is recited to you. So stay away from the abomination of idols, and stay away from perjury.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 31: Being true to God, without associating anything with Him. Whoever associates anything with God-it is as though he has fallen from the sky, and is snatched by the birds, or is swept away by the wind to a distant abyss.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 32: So it is. Whoever venerates the sacraments of God-it is from the piety of the hearts.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 33: In them are benefits for you until a certain time. Then their place is by the Ancient House.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 34: We have appointed a rite for every nation, that they may commemorate God's name over the livestock He has provided for them. Your God is One God, so to Him submit, and announce good news to the humble.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 35: Those whose hearts tremble when God is mentioned, and those who endure what has befallen them, and those who perform the prayer and spend from what We have provided for them.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 36: We have made the animal offerings emblems of God for you. In them is goodness for you. So pronounce God's name upon them as they line up. Then, when they have fallen on their sides, eat of them and feed the contented and the beggar. Thus We have subjected them to you, that you may be thankful.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 37: Neither their flesh, nor their blood, ever reaches God. What reaches Him is the righteousness from you. Thus He subdued them to you, that you may glorify God for guiding you. And give good news to the charitable.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 38: God defends those who believe. God does not love any ungrateful traitor.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 39: Permission is given to those who are fought against, and God is Able to give them victory.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 40: Those who were unjustly evicted from their homes, merely for saying, "Our Lord is God." Were it not that God repels people by means of others: monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques-where the name of God is mentioned much-would have been demolished. God supports whoever supports Him. God is Strong and Mighty.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 41: Those who, when We empower them in the land, observe the prayer, and give regular charity, and command what is right, and forbid what is wrong. To God belongs the outcome of events.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 42: If they deny you-before them the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood also denied.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 43: And the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 44: And the inhabitants of Median. And Moses was denied. Then I reprieved those who disbelieved, but then I seized them. So how was My rejection?
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 45: How many a town have We destroyed while it was doing wrong? They lie in ruins; with stilled wells, and lofty mansions.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 46: Have they not journeyed in the land, and had minds to reason with, or ears to listen with? It is not the eyes that go blind, but it is the hearts, within the chests, that go blind.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 47: And they ask you to hasten the punishment. But God never breaks His promise. A day with your Lord is like a thousand years of your count.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 48: How many a town have I reprieved, although it was unjust? Then I seized it. To Me is the destination.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 49: Say, "O people, I am only a plain warner to you."
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 50: Those who believe and work righteousness-for them is forgiveness and a generous provision.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 51: But those who strive against Our revelations-these are the inmates of Hell.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 52: We never sent a messenger before you, or a prophet, but when he had a desire Satan interfered in his wishes. But God nullifies what Satan interjects, and God affirms His revelations. God is Omniscient and Wise.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 53: In order to make Satan's suggestions a trial for those whose hearts are diseased, and those whose hearts are hardened. The wrongdoers are in profound discord.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 54: And so that those endowed with knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and so believe in it, and their hearts soften to it. God guides those who believe to a straight path.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 55: Those who disbelieve will continue to be hesitant about it, until the Hour comes upon them suddenly, or there comes to them the torment of a desolate Day.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 56: Sovereignty on that Day belongs to God; He will judge between them. Those who believe and do good deeds will be in the Gardens of Bliss.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 57: But those who disbelieve and reject Our revelations-these will have a humiliating punishment.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 58: Those who emigrate in God's cause, then get killed, or die, God will provide them with fine provisions. God is the Best of Providers.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 59: He will admit them an admittance that will please them. God is Knowing and Clement.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 60: That is so! Whoever retaliates similarly to the affliction he was made to suffer, and then he is wronged again, God will definitely assist him. God is Pardoning and Forgiving.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 61: That is because God merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night, and because God is Hearing and Seeing.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 62: That is because God is the Reality, and what they invoke besides Him is vanity, and because God is the Sublime, the Grand.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 63: Do you not see that God sends down water from the sky, and the land becomes green? God is Kind and Aware.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 64: To Him belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. God is the Rich, the Praised.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 65: Do you not see that God made everything on earth subservient to you? How the ships sail at sea by His command? That He holds up the sky lest it falls on earth-except by His permission? God is Gracious towards the people, Most Merciful.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 66: And it is He who gives you life, then makes you die, then revives you. The human being is unappreciative.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 67: For every congregation We have appointed acts of devotion, which they observe. So do not let them dispute with you in this matter. And invite to your Lord; you are upon a straight guidance.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 68: But if they dispute with you, say, "God is fully aware of what you do."
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 69: God will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection regarding what you disagree about.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 70: Do you not know that God knows everything in the heavens and the earth? This is in a book. That is easy for God.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 71: Yet they worship, besides God, things for which He sent down no warrant, and what they have no knowledge of. There is no savior for the transgressors.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 72: And when Our Clear Verses are recited to them, you will recognize disgust on the faces of those who disbelieve. They nearly assault those who recite to them Our Verses. Say, "Shall I inform you of something worse than that? The Fire! God has promised it to those who disbelieve. And what a wretched outcome!"

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 73: O people! A parable is presented, so listen to it: Those you invoke besides God will never create a fly, even if they banded together for that purpose. And if the fly steals anything from them, they cannot recover it from it. Weak are the pursuer and the pursued.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 74: They do not value God as He should be valued. God is Strong and Powerful.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 75: God chooses messengers from among the angels, and from among the people. God is Hearing and Seeing.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 76: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them. To God all matters are referred.
Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 77: O you who believe! Kneel, and prostrate, and worship your Lord, and do good deeds, so that you may succeed.

Surah al-Hajj, Ayah 78: And strive for God, with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you, and has not burdened you in religion-the faith of your father Abraham. It is he who named you Muslims before, and in this. So that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over the people. So pray regularly, and give regular charity, and cleave to God. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector, and what an excellent Helper.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 1: Successful are the believers.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 2: Those who are humble in their prayers.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 3: Those who avoid nonsense.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 4: Those who work for charity.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 5: Those who safeguard their chastity.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 6: Except from their spouses, or their dependents-for then they are free from blame.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 7: But whoever seeks anything beyond that-these are the transgressors.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 8: Those who are faithful to their trusts and pledges.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 9: Those who safeguard their prayers.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 10: These are the inheritors.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 11: Who will inherit Paradise, wherein they will dwell forever.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 12: We created man from an extract of clay.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 13: Then We made him a seed, in a secure repository.

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 14: Then We developed the seed into a clot. Then We developed the clot into a lump. Then We developed the lump into bones. Then We clothed the bones with flesh. Then We produced it into another creature. Most Blessed is God, the Best of Creators.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 15: Then, after that, you will die.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 16: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be resurrected.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 17: We created above you seven pathways, and We are never heedless of the creation.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 18: And We sent down water from the sky in proper quantity, and settled it in the ground, and We are Able to take it away.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 19: With it We produce for you gardens of palms and vines, yielding abundant fruit for you to eat.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 20: And a tree springing out of Mount Sinai, producing oil, and seasoning for those who eat.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 21: And there is a lesson for you in livestock: We give you to drink from what is in their bellies, and you have many benefits in them, and from them you eat.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 22: And on them, and on the ships, you are transported.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 23: We sent Noah to his people. He said, "O my people, worship God, you have no deity other than Him. Will you not take heed?"

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 24: But the notables of his people, who disbelieved, said, "This is nothing but a human like you, who wants to gain superiority over you. Had God willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of this from our forefathers of old.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 25: He is nothing but a man possessed. Just ignore him for a while."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 26: He said, "My Lord, help me, for they have rejected me."

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 27: So We inspired him: "Build the Ark under Our observation and by Our inspiration. And when Our decree comes to pass, and the oven boils over, load into it two pairs of every kind, together with your family, except those of them against whom the word has already been pronounced. And do not speak to me concerning those who did wrong; for they are to be drowned."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 28: Then, when you and those with you are settled in the Ark, say, "Praise be to God, who has saved us from the wrongdoing people."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 29: And say, "My Lord, land me with a blessed landing, as you are the best of transporters."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 30: Surely in that are signs. We are always testing.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 31: Then, after them, We established another generation.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 32: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves: "Serve God. You have no god other than Him. Will you not be cautious?"

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 33: But the dignitaries of his people, those who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and We had indulged them in the present life, said, "This is nothing but a human like you; he eats what you eat, and he drinks what you drink.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 34: If you obey a human being like yourselves, then you will be losers.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 35: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones, you will be brought out?
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 36: Farfetched, farfetched is what you are promised.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 37: There is nothing but our life in this world. We die, and we live, and we are not resurrected.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 38: He is nothing but a man, making up lies about God. We have no faith in him."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 39: He said, "My Lord, help me, for they have rejected me."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 40: He said, "Soon they will be filled with regret."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 41: Then the Blast struck them, justifiably, and We turned them into scum. So away with the wicked people.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 42: Then, after them, We raised other generations.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 43: No nation can advance its time, nor can they postpone it.

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 44: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time a messenger came to his community, they called him a liar. So We made them follow one another, and made them history. So away with a people who do not believe.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 45: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our signs and a clear authority.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 46: To Pharaoh and his nobles, but they turned arrogant. They were oppressive people.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 47: They said, "Are we to believe in two mortals like us, and their people are our slaves?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 48: So they called them liars, and thus were among those destroyed.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 49: And We gave Moses the Scripture, that they may be guided.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 50: And We made Mary's son and his mother a sign, and We sheltered them on high ground with security and flowing springs.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 51: O messengers, eat of the good things, and act with integrity. I am aware of what you do.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 52: This nation of yours is one nation, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 53: But they tore themselves into sects; each party happy with what they have.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 54: So leave them in their bewilderment until a time.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 55: Do they assume that, in furnishing them with wealth and children.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 56: We race to give them the good things? In fact, they have no idea.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 57: Those who, from awe of their Lord, are fearful.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 58: And those who believe in their Lord's Verses.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 59: And those who associate no partners with their Lord.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 60: And those who give what they give, while their hearts quake, knowing that to their Lord they will return.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 61: It is they who race towards goodness. It is they who will reach it first.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 62: We never burden any soul beyond its capacity. And with Us is a record that tells the truth, and they will not be wronged.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 63: But their hearts are puzzled because of this; and they have deeds that do not conform to this, which they continue to perpetrate.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 64: Until, when We seize the decadent among them with torment, they begin to groan.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 65: Do not groan today. You will receive no help from Us.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 66: My Verses were recited to you, but you turned back on your heels.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 67: Arrogant towards it-talked nonsense about it-disregarded it.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 68: Have they not pondered the Word? Or has there come to them what came not to their forefathers of old?
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 69: Or is it that they did not recognize their messenger, so they are denying him?
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 70: Or do they say, "He is possessed?" In fact, he brought them the truth, but most of them hate the truth.

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 71: If the truth conformed to their desires, the heavens, the earth, and everyone in them would have gone to ruin. In fact, We have given them their message, but they keep avoiding their message.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 72: Or are you asking them for a payment? The revenue from your Lord is better, and He is the Best of providers.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 73: You are inviting them to a straight path.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 74: But those who do not believe in the Hereafter are swerving from the path.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 75: Even if We had mercy on them, and relieved their problems, they would still blindly persist in their defiance.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 76: We have already gripped them with suffering, but they did not surrender to their Lord, nor did they humble themselves.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 77: Until, when We have opened before them a gate of intense agony, at once they will despair.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 78: It is He who produced for you the hearing, and the eyesight, and the feelings. But little gratitude you show.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 79: And it is He who multiplied you on earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 80: And it is He who gives life and brings death, and to Him is the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand?
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 81: But they say the like of what the ancients said.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 82: They say, "After we have died, and become dust and bones, will we be resurrected?
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 83: We were promised this before-we and our ancestors-these are nothing but legends of the ancients."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 84: Say, "To whom does the earth belong, and everyone in it, if you happen to know?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 85: They will say, "To God." Say, "Will you not reflect?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 86: Say, "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Splendid Throne?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 87: They will say, "To God." Say, "Will you not become righteous?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 88: Say, "In whose hand is the dominion of all things, and He protects and cannot be protected from, if you happen to know?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 89: They will say, "To God." Say, "Then are you bewitched?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 90: In fact, We have given them the truth, and they are liars.

Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 91: God has never begotten a son, nor is there any god besides Him. Otherwise, each god would have taken away what it has created, and some of them would have gained supremacy over others. Glory be to God, far beyond what they describe.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 92: The Knower of the hidden and the manifest. He is exalted, far above what they associate.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 93: Say, "My Lord, if You would show me what they are promised.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 94: My Lord, do not place me among the wicked people."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 95: We are surely Able to show you what We promise them.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 96: Repel evil by what is better. We are aware of what they describe.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 97: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge with You from the urgings of the devils.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 98: And I seek refuge with You, my Lord, lest they become present."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 99: Until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 100: That I may do right in what I have neglected." By no means! It is just a word that he utters. And behind them is a barrier, until the Day they are resurrected.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 101: When the Horn is blown, no relations between them will exist on that Day, and they will not ask after one another.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 102: Those whose scales are heavy-those are the successful.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 103: But those whose scales are light-those are they who have lost their souls; in Hell they will dwell forever.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 104: The Fire lashes their faces, and therein they grimace.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 105: "Were not My revelations recited to you, and you kept on rejecting them?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 106: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness prevailed over us, and we were a people astray.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 107: Our Lord! Bring us out of this. If we ever returned, we would truly be evil."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 108: He will say, "Be despised therein, and do not speak to Me.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 109: There was a group of My servants who would say, `Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us, and have mercy on us; You are the Best of the merciful.'
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 110: But you made then a target of ridicule, until they made you forget My remembrance; and you used to laugh at them.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 111: Today, I have rewarded them for their endurance. They are the ones who are the triumphant."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 112: He will say, "How many years did you remain on earth?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 113: They will say, "We remained a day, or part of a day; but ask those who keep count."
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 114: He will say, "You remained only for a little while, if you only knew.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 115: Did you think that We created you in vain, and that to Us you will not be returned?"
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 116: So Exalted is God, the Ruler, the Real. There is no god except He, the Lord of the Noble Throne.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 117: Whoever invokes another god besides God-he has no proof thereof-his reckoning rests with his Lord. The disbelievers will not succeed.
Surah al-Mu'minun, Ayah 118: And say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for You are the Best of the merciful."
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 1: A chapter that We have revealed, and made obligatory, and revealed in it clear Verses, that you may take heed.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 2: The adulteress and the adulterer-whip each one of them a hundred lashes, and let no pity towards them overcome you regarding God's Law, if you believe in God and the Last Day. And let a group of believers witness their punishment.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 3: The adulterer shall marry none but an adulteress or an idolatress; and the adulteress shall marry none but an adulterer or an idolater. That has been prohibited for the believers.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 4: Those who accuse chaste women, then cannot bring four witnesses, whip them eighty lashes, and do not ever accept their testimony. For these are the immoral.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 5: Except for those who repent afterwards, and reform; for God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 6: As for those who accuse their own spouses, but have no witnesses except themselves, the testimony of one of them is equivalent to four testimonies, if he swears by God that he is truthful.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 7: And the fifth time, that God's curse be upon him, if he is a liar.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 8: But punishment shall be averted from her, if she swears four times by God, that he is a liar.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 9: And the fifth time, that God's wrath be upon her, if he is truthful.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 10: Were it not for God's grace upon you, and His mercy, and that God is Conciliatory and Wise.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 11: Those who perpetrated the slander are a band of you. Do not consider it bad for you, but it is good for you. Each person among them bears his share in the sin. As for him who played the major role-for him is a terrible punishment.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 12: Why, when you heard about it, the believing men and women did not think well of one another, and say, "This is an obvious lie"?
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 13: Why did they not bring four witnesses to testify to it? If they fail to bring the witnesses, then in God's sight, they are liars.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 14: Were it not for God's favor upon you, and His mercy, in this world and the Hereafter, you would have suffered a great punishment for what you have ventured into.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 15: When you rumored it with your tongues, and spoke with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, and you considered it trivial; but according to God, it is serious.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 16: When you heard it, you should have said, "It is not for us to repeat this. By Your glory, this is a serious slander."
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 17: God cautions you never to return to the like of it, if you are believers.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 18: God explains the Verses to you. God is Knowing and Wise.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 19: Those who love to see immorality spread among the believers-for them is a painful punishment, in this life and in the Hereafter. God knows, and you do not know.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 20: Were it not for God's grace upon you, and His mercy, and that God is Clement and Merciful.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 21: O you who believe! Do not follow Satan's footsteps. Whoever follows Satan's footsteps-he advocates obscenity and immorality. Were it not for God's grace towards you, and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever. But God purifies whomever He wills. God is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 22: Those of you who have affluence and means should not refuse to give to the relatives, and the needy, and the emigrants for the sake of God. And let them pardon, and let them overlook. Do you not love for God to pardon you? God is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 23: Those who slander honorable, innocent, believing women are cursed in this life and in the Hereafter. They will have a terrible punishment.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 24: On the Day when their tongues, and their hands, and their feet will testify against them regarding what they used to do.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 25: On that Day, God will pay them their account in full, and they will know that God is the Evident Reality.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 26: Bad women are for bad men, and bad men are for bad women, and good women are for good men, and good men are for good women. Those are acquitted of what they say. There is forgiveness for them, and a generous provision.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 27: O you who believe! Do not enter homes other than your own, until you have asked permission and greeted their occupants. That is better for you, that you may be aware.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 28: And if you find no one in them, do not enter them until you are given permission. And if it is said to you, "Turn back," then turn back. That is more proper for you. God is aware of what you do.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 29: There is no blame on you for entering uninhabited houses, in which are belongings of yours. God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 30: Tell the believing men to restrain their looks, and to guard their privates. That is purer for them. God is cognizant of what they do.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 31: And tell the believing women to restrain their looks, and to guard their privates, and not display their beauty except what is apparent thereof, and to draw their coverings over their breasts, and not expose their beauty except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, what their right hands possess, their male attendants who have no sexual desires, or children who are not yet aware of the nakedness of women. And they should not strike their feet to draw attention to their hidden beauty. And repent to God, all of you believers, so that you may succeed.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 32: And wed the singles among you, and those who are fit among your servants and maids. If they are poor, God will enrich them from His bounty. God is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 33: And let those who do not find the means to marry abstain, until God enriches them from His bounty. If any of your servants wish to be freed, grant them their wish, if you recognize some good in them. And give them of God's wealth which he has given you. And do not compel your girls to prostitution, seeking the materials of this life, if they desire to remain chaste. Should anyone compel them-after their compulsion, God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 34: We have sent down to you clarifying revelations, and examples of those who passed on before you, and advice for the righteous.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 35: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The allegory of His light is that of a pillar on which is a lamp. The lamp is within a glass. The glass is like a brilliant planet, fueled by a blessed tree, an olive tree, neither eastern nor western. Its oil would almost illuminate, even if no fire has touched it. Light upon Light. God guides to His light whomever He wills. God thus cites the parables for the people. God is cognizant of everything.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 36: In houses which God has permitted to be raised, and His name is celebrated therein. He is glorified therein, morning and evening.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 37: By men who neither trading nor commerce distracts them from God's remembrance, and from performing the prayers, and from giving alms. They fear a Day when hearts and sights are overturned.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 38: God will reward them according to the best of what they did, and He will increase them from His bounty. God provides for whomever He wills without reckoning.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 39: As for those who disbelieve, their works are like a mirage in a desert. The thirsty assumes it is to be water. Until, when he has reached it, he finds it to be nothing, but there he finds God, Who settles his account in full. God is swift in reckoning.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 40: Or like utter darkness in a vast ocean, covered by waves, above which are waves, above which is fog. Darkness upon darkness. If he brings out his hand, he will hardly see it. He to whom God has not granted a light has no light.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 41: Do you not realize that God is glorified by whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and even by the birds in formation? Each knows its prayer and its manner of praise. God knows well what they do.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 42: To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to God is the ultimate return.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 43: Have you not seen how God propels the clouds, then brings them together, then piles them into a heap, and you see rain drops emerging from its midst? How He brings down loads of hail from the sky, striking with it whomever He wills, and diverting it from whomever He wills? The flash of its lightening almost snatches the sight away.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 44: God alternates the night and the day. In that is a lesson for those who have insight.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 45: God created every living creature from water. Some of them crawl on their bellies, and some walk on two feet, and others walk on four. God creates whatever He wills. God is Capable of everything.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 46: We sent down enlightening revelations, and God guides whomever He wills to a straight path.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 47: And they say, "We have believed in God and the Messenger, and we obey," but some of them turn away afterwards. These are not believers.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 48: And when they are called to God and His Messenger, in order to judge between them, some of them refuse.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 49: But if justice is on their side, they accept it willingly.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 50: Is there sickness in their hearts? Or are they suspicious? Or do they fear that God may do them injustice? Or His Messenger? In fact, they themselves are the unjust.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 51: The response of the believers, when they are called to God and His Messenger in order to judge between them, is to say, "We hear and we obey." These are the successful.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 52: Whoever obeys God and His Messenger, and fears God, and is conscious of Him-these are the winners.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 53: And they swear by God with their solemn oaths, that if you commanded them, they would mobilize. Say, "Do not swear. Obedience will be recognized. God is experienced with what you do."

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 54: Say, "Obey God and obey the Messenger." But if they turn away, then he is responsible for his obligations, and you are responsible for your obligations. And if you obey him, you will be guided. It is only incumbent on the Messenger to deliver the Clarifying Message.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 55: God has promised those of you who believe and do righteous deeds, that He will make them successors on earth, as He made those before them successors, and He will establish for them their religion-which He has approved for them-and He will substitute security in place of their fear. They worship Me, never associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that-these are the sinners.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 56: Pray regularly, and give regular charity, and obey the Messenger, so that you may receive mercy.
Surah an-Nur, Ayah 57: Never think that those who disbelieve can escape on earth. Their place is the Fire; a miserable destination.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 58: O you who believe! Permission must be requested by your servants and those of you who have not reached puberty. On three occasions: before the Dawn Prayer, and at noon when you change your clothes, and after the Evening Prayer. These are three occasions of privacy for you. At other times, it is not wrong for you or them to intermingle with one another. God thus clarifies the revelations for you. God is Knowledgeable and Wise.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 59: When the children among you reach puberty, they must ask permission, as those before them asked permission. God thus clarifies His revelations for you. God is Knowledgeable and Wise.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 60: Women past the age of childbearing, who have no desire for marriage, commit no wrong by taking off their outer clothing, provided they do not flaunt their finery. But to maintain modesty is better for them. God is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 61: There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick, nor on yourselves for eating at your homes, or your fathers' homes, or your mothers' homes, or your brothers' homes, or your sisters' homes, or the homes of your paternal uncles, or the homes of your paternal aunts, or the homes of your maternal uncles, or the homes of your maternal aunts, or those whose keys you own, or the homes of your friends. You commit no wrong by eating together or separately. But when you enter any home, greet one another with a greeting from God, blessed and good. God thus explains the revelations for you, so that you may understand.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 62: The believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger, and when they are with him for a matter of common interest, they do not leave until they have asked him for permission. Those who ask your permission are those who believe in God and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission to attend to some affair of theirs, give permission to any of them you wish, and ask God's forgiveness for them. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 63: Do not address the Messenger in the same manner you address one another. God knows those of you who slip away using flimsy excuses. So let those who oppose his orders beware, lest an ordeal strikes them, or a painful punishment befalls them.

Surah an-Nur, Ayah 64: Surely, to God belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. He knows what you are about. And on the Day they are returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. God has full knowledge of all things.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 1: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His servant, to be a warning to humanity.

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 2: He to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, who took to Himself no son, who never had a partner in His kingship; who created everything and determined its measure.

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 3: And yet, instead of Him, they produce for themselves gods that create nothing, but are themselves created; that have no power to harm or benefit themselves; and no power over life, death, or resurrection.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 4: Those who disbelieve say, "This is nothing but a lie that he made up, and others have helped him at it." They have committed an injustice and a perjury.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 5: And they say, "Tales of the ancients; he wrote them down; they are dictated to him morning and evening."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 6: Say, "It was revealed by He who knows the Secret in the heavens and the earth. He is always Forgiving and Merciful."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 7: And they say, "What sort of messenger is this, who eats food, and walks in the marketplaces? If only an angel was sent down with him, to be alongside him a warner."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 8: Or, "If only a treasure was dropped on him." Or, "If only he had a garden from which he eats." The evildoers also say, "You are following but a man under spell."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 9: Look how they invent examples for you. They have gone astray, and cannot find a way.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 10: Blessed is He who, if He wills, can provide you with better than that-gardens beneath which rivers flow-and He will give you palaces.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 11: In fact, they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 12: When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 13: And when they are thrown into it, into a tight place, shackled, they will plead there for death.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 14: "Do not plead for one death today, but plead for a great many deaths."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 15: Say, "Is this better, or the Garden of Eternity promised to the righteous? It is for them a reward and a destination.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 16: They will have therein whatever they desire, forever. That is upon your Lord a binding promise.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 17: On the Day when He gathers them, and what they worshiped besides God, He will say, "Was it you who misled these servants of Mine, or was it they who lost the way?"

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 18: They will say, "Glory be to You. It was not for us to take any lords besides You. But you gave them enjoyments, and their ancestors, until they forgot the Message, and became ruined people."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 19: They have denied you because of what you say; so you can neither avert, nor help. Whoever among you commits injustice, We will make him taste a grievous punishment.

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 20: We never sent any messengers before you, but they ate food and walked in the marketplaces. And We made some of you tempters for one another-will you be patient? Your Lord is always Observing.

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 21: Those who do not expect to meet Us say, "If only the angels were sent down to us, or we could see our Lord." They have grown arrogant within themselves, and have become excessively defiant.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 22: On the Day when they see the angels-there will be no good news for sinners on that Day; and they will say, "A protective refuge."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 23: We will proceed to the works they did, and will turn them into scattered dust.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 24: The companions of Paradise on that Day will be better lodged, and more fairly accommodated.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 25: The Day when the sky is cleft with clouds, and the angels are sent down in streams.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 26: On that Day, true sovereignty will belong to the Merciful, and it will be a difficult Day for the disbelievers.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 27: On that Day, the wrongdoer will bite his hands, and say, "If only I had followed the way with the Messenger.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 28: Oh, woe to me; I wish I never took so-and-so for a friend.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 29: He led me away from the Message after it had come to me; for Satan has always been a betrayer of man."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 30: And the Messenger will say, "My Lord, my people have abandoned this Quran."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 31: Likewise, to every prophet We assign enemies from among the wicked. But your Lord suffices as a Guide and Savior.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 32: Those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Quran not revealed to him at once?" Thus in order to strengthen your heart thereby, and We revealed it in stages.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 33: Whatever argument they come to you with, We provide you with the truth, and a better exposition.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 34: Those who are herded into Hell on their faces-those are in a worse position, and further astray from the way.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 35: We gave Moses the Scripture, and appointed his brother Aaron as his assistant.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 36: We said, "Go to the people who rejected Our signs," and We destroyed them completely.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 37: And the people of Noah: when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and made them a lesson for mankind. We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful retribution.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 38: And Aad, and Thamood, and the inhabitants of Arras, and many generations in between.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 39: To each We presented the parables; and each We devastated utterly.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 40: And they came upon the city that was drenched by the terrible rain. Did they not see it? But they do not expect resurrection.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 41: And when they see you, they take you for nothing but mockery: "Is this the one God sent as a messenger?"
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 42: "He nearly led us away from our gods, had we not patiently adhered to them." But they will know, when they witness the torment, who is further away from the way.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 43: Have you seen him who chose his desire as his god? Would you be an agent for him?
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 44: Or do you assume that most of them hear or understand? They are just like cattle, but even more errant in their way.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 45: Do you not see how your Lord extends the shadow? Had He willed, He could have made it still. And We made the sun a pointer to it.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 46: Then We withdraw it towards Us gradually.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 47: And it is He who made the night a covering for you, and sleep for rest; and He made the day a revival.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 48: And it is He who sends the winds, bringing advance news of His mercy; and We send down from the sky pure water.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 49: To revive dead lands thereby, and to provide drink for the multitude of animals and humans We created.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 50: We have circulated it among them, that they may reflect, but most people persist in thanklessness.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 51: Had We willed, We could have sent to every town a warner.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 52: So do not obey the disbelievers, but strive against them with it, a mighty struggle.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 53: And it is He who merged the two seas; this one fresh and sweet, and that one salty and bitter; and He placed between them a barrier, and an impassable boundary.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 54: And it is He who, from fluid, created the human being. Then He made relationships through marriage and mating. Your Lord is Omnipotent.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 55: And yet, instead of God, they serve what neither profits them nor harms them. The disbeliever has always turned his back on his Lord.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 56: We sent you only as a herald of good news and a warner.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 57: Say, "I ask of you no payment for this-only that whoever wills may take a path to his Lord."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 58: And put your trust in the Living, the One who never dies; and celebrate His praise. He suffices as the All-Informed Knower of the faults of His creatures.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 59: He who created the heavens and the earth and everything between them in six days, then settled on the Throne. The Most Merciful. Ask about Him a well-informed.

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 60: And when it is said to them, "Bow down to the Merciful," they say, "And what is the Merciful? Are we to bow down to whatever you command us?" And it increases their aversion.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 61: Blessed is He who placed constellations in the sky, and placed in it a lamp, and an illuminating moon.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 62: And it is He who made the night and the day alternate-for whoever desires to reflect, or desires to show gratitude.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 63: The servants of the Merciful are those who walk the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them, they say, "Peace."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 64: And those who pass the night prostrating themselves to their Lord and standing up.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 65: And those who say, ''Our Lord, avert from us the suffering of Hell, for its suffering is continuous.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 66: It is indeed a miserable residence and destination."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 67: And those who, when they spend, are neither wasteful nor stingy, but choose a middle course between that.

Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 68: And those who do not implore besides God any other god, and do not kill the soul which God has made sacred-except in the pursuit of justice-and do not commit adultery. Whoever does that will face penalties.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 69: The punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will dwell therein in humiliation forever.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 70: Except for those who repent, and believe, and do good deeds. These-God will replace their bad deeds with good deeds. God is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 71: Whoever repents and acts righteously-has inclined towards God with repentance.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 72: And those who do not bear false witness; and when they come across indecencies, they pass by with dignity.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 73: And those who, when reminded of the revelations of their Lord, do not fall before them deaf and blind.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 74: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us delight in our spouses and our children, and make us a good example for the righteous."
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 75: Those will be awarded the Chamber for their patience, and will be greeted therein with greetings and peace.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 76: Abiding therein forever-it is an excellent residence and destination.
Surah al-Furqan, Ayah 77: Say, "What are you to my Lord without your prayers? You have denied the truth, and the inevitable will happen."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 1: Ta, Seen, Meem.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 2: These are the Verses of the Clarifying Book.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 3: Perhaps you will destroy yourself with grief, because they do not become believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 4: If We will, We can send down upon them a sign from heaven, at which their necks will stay bent in humility.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 5: No fresh reminder comes to them from the Most Merciful, but they turn their backs at it.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 6: They have denied the truth, but soon will come to them the news of what they ridiculed.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 7: Have they not seen the earth, and how many beautiful pairs We produced therein?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 8: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 9: Most surely, your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 10: Your Lord called to Moses, "Go to the tyrannical people.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 11: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 12: He said, "My Lord, I fear they will reject me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 13: And I become stressed, and my tongue is not fluent, so send Aaron too.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 14: And they have a charge against me, so I fear they will kill me."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 15: He said, "No. Go, both of you, with Our proofs. We will be with you, listening.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 16: Go to Pharaoh, and say, 'We are the Messengers of the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 17: Let the Children of Israel go with us.'"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 18: He said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you stayed among us for many of your years?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 19: And you committed that deed you committed, and you were ungrateful."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 20: He said, "I did it then, when I was of those astray.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 21: And I fled from you when I feared you; but my Lord gave me wisdom, and made me one of the messengers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 22: Is that the favor you taunt me with, although you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 23: Pharaoh said, "And what is the Lord of the Worlds?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 24: He said, "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, if you are aware."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 25: He said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 26: He said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of old."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 27: He said, "This messenger of yours, who is sent to you, is crazy."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 28: He said, "Lord of the East and the West, and everything between them, if you understand."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 29: He said, "If you accept any god other than me, I will make you a prisoner."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 30: He said, "What if I bring you something convincing?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 31: He said, "Bring it, if you are being truthful."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 32: So he cast his staff; and it was a serpent, plain to see.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 33: And he pulled his hand; and it was white, for all to see.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 34: He said to the dignitaries around him, "This is a skilled magician.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 35: He intends to drive you out of your land with his magic, so what do you recommend?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 36: They said, "Delay him and his brother, and send recruiters to the cities.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 37: To bring you every experienced magician."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 38: So the magicians were gathered for the appointment on a specified day.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 39: And it was said to the people, "Are you all gathered?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 40: That we may follow the magicians, if they are the winners."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 41: When the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there a reward for us, if we are the winners?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 42: He said, "Yes, and you will be among those favored."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 43: Moses said to them, "Present what you intend to present."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 44: So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said, "By the majesty of Pharaoh, we will be the winners."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 45: Then Moses threw his staff, and behold, it began swallowing their trickery.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 46: And the magicians fell down prostrating.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 47: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 48: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 49: He said, "Did you believe in Him before I have given you permission? He must be your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon know. I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 50: They said, "No problem. To our Lord we will return.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 51: We are eager for our Lord to forgive us our sins, since we are the first of the believers."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 52: And We inspired Moses: "Travel with My servants by night. You will be followed."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 53: Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 54: "These are a small gang.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 55: And they are enraging us.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 56: But we are a vigilant multitude."
