Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 57: So We drove them out of gardens and springs.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 58: And treasures and noble dwellings.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 59: So it was. And We made the Children of Israel inherit them.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 60: And they pursued them at sunrise.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 61: When the two groups sighted each other, the followers of Moses said, "We are being overtaken."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 62: He said, "No; my Lord is with me, He will guide me."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 63: We inspired Moses: "Strike the sea with your staff." Whereupon it parted, and each part was like a huge hill.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 64: And there We brought the others near.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 65: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 66: Then We drowned the others.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 67: In that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 68: Surely, your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 69: And relate to them the story of Abraham.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 70: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 71: They said, "We worship idols, and we remain devoted to them."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 72: He said, "Do they hear you when you pray?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 73: Or do they benefit you, or harm you?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 74: They said, "But we found our ancestors doing so."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 75: He said, "Have you considered what you worship.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 76: You and your ancient ancestors?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 77: They are enemies to me, but not so the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 78: He who created me, and guides me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 79: He who feeds me, and waters me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 80: And when I get sick, He heals me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 81: He who makes me die, and then revives me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 82: He who, I hope, will forgive my sins on the Day of the Reckoning."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 83: "My Lord! Grant me wisdom, and include me with the righteous.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 84: And give me a reputation of truth among the others.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 85: And make me of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 86: And forgive my father-he was one of the misguided.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 87: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are resurrected.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 88: The Day when neither wealth nor children will help.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 89: Except for him who comes to God with a sound heart."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 90: And Paradise will be brought near for the righteous.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 91: And the Blaze will be displayed to the deviators.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 92: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 93: Besides God? Can they help you, or help themselves?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 94: Then they will be toppled into it, together with the seducers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 95: And the soldiers of Satan, all of them.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 96: They will say, as they feud in it.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 97: "By God, We were in evident error.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 98: For equating you with the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 99: No one misled us except the sinners.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 100: Now we have no intercessors.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 101: And no sincere friend.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 102: If only we could have another chance, we would be among the faithful."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 103: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 104: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 105: The people of Noah disbelieved the messengers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 106: Their brother Noah said to them, "Do you not fear?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 107: I am to you a faithful messenger.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 108: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 109: I ask of you no payment for this. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 110: So fear God, and obey me."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 111: They said, "Shall we believe in you, when it is the lowliest who follow you?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 112: He said, "What do I know about what they do?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 113: Their account rests only with my Lord, if you have sense.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 114: And I am not about to drive away the believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 115: I am only a clear warner."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 116: They said, "If you do not refrain, O Noah, you will be stoned."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 117: He said, "My Lord, my people have denied me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 118: So judge between me and them decisively, and deliver me and the believers who are with me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 119: So We delivered him and those with him in the laden Ark.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 120: Then We drowned the rest.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 121: In that is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 122: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 123: Aad disbelieved the messengers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 124: When their brother Hud said to them, "Do you not fear?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 125: I am to you a faithful messenger.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 126: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 127: I ask of you no payment for this. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 128: Do you build a monument on every height for vanity's sake?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 129: And you set up fortresses, hoping to live forever?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 130: And when you strike, you strike mercilessly?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 131: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 132: And reverence Him, who supplied you with everything you know.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 133: He supplied you with livestock and children.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 134: And gardens and springs.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 135: I fear for you the punishment of an awesome Day."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 136: They said, "It is the same for us, whether you lecture us, or do not lecture.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 137: This is nothing but morals of the ancients.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 138: And we will not be punished."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 139: So they denied him, and We destroyed them. Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 140: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 141: Thamood disbelieved the messengers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 142: When their brother Saleh said to them, "Do you not fear?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 143: I am to you a faithful messenger.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 144: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 145: I ask of you no payment for it. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 146: Will you be left secure in what is here?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 147: In gardens and springs?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 148: And fields, and palm-trees whose fruits are delicious?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 149: And you skillfully carve houses in the mountains?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 150: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 151: And do not obey the command of the extravagant.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 152: Who spread turmoil on earth, and do not reform."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 153: They said, "You are surely one of the bewitched.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 154: You are nothing but a man like us. So bring us a sign, if you are truthful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 155: He said, "This is a she-camel; she has her turn of drinking, and you have your turn of drinking-on a specified day.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 156: And do not touch her with harm, lest the punishment of a great day seizes you."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 157: But they slaughtered her, and became full of remorse.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 158: So the punishment overtook them. Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 159: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 160: The people of Lot disbelieved the messengers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 161: When their brother Lot said to them, "Do you not fear?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 162: I am to you a faithful messenger.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 163: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 164: I ask of you no payment for it. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 165: Do you approach the males of the world?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 166: And forsake the wives your Lord created for you? Indeed, you are intrusive people."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 167: They said, "Unless you refrain, O Lot, you will be expelled."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 168: He said, "I certainly deplore your conduct."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 169: "My Lord, save me and my family from what they do."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 170: So We saved him and his family, altogether.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 171: Except for an old woman among those who tarried.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 172: Then We destroyed the others.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 173: And We rained down on them a rain. Dreadful is the rain of those forewarned.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 174: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 175: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 176: The People of the Woods disbelieved the messengers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 177: When Shuaib said to them, "Do you not fear?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 178: I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 179: So fear God, and obey me.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 180: I ask of you no payment for it. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 181: Give full measure, and do not cheat.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 182: And weigh with accurate scales.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 183: And do not defraud people of their belongings, and do not work corruption in the land.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 184: And fear Him who created you and the masses of old."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 185: They said, "You are one of those bewitched.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 186: And you are nothing but a man like us; and we think that you are a liar.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 187: So bring down on us pieces from the sky, if you are truthful."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 188: He said, "My Lord is Well Aware of what you do."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 189: But they denied him. So the punishment of the day of gloom gripped them. It was the punishment of a great day.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 190: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 191: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 192: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 193: The Honest Spirit came down with it.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 194: Upon your heart, that you may be one of the warners.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 195: In a clear Arabic tongue.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 196: And it is in the scriptures of the ancients.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 197: Is it not a sign for them that the scholars of the Children of Israel recognized it?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 198: Had We revealed it to one of the foreigners.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 199: And he had recited it to them, they still would not have believed in it.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 200: Thus We make it pass through the hearts of the guilty.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 201: They will not believe in it until they witness the painful punishment.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 202: It will come to them suddenly, while they are unaware.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 203: Then they will say, "Are we given any respite?"
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 204: Do they seek to hasten Our punishment?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 205: Have you considered: if We let them enjoy themselves for some years.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 206: Then there comes to them what they were promised.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 207: Of what avail to them will be their past enjoyments?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 208: Never did We destroy a town, but it had warners.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 209: As a reminder-We are never unjust.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 210: It was not the devils that revealed it.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 211: It is not in their interests, nor in their power.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 212: They are barred from hearing.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 213: So do not pray to another god with God, else you will be of those tormented.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 214: And warn your close relatives.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 215: And lower your wing to those of the believers who follow you.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 216: And if they disobey you, say, "I am innocent of what you do."
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 217: And put your trust in the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 218: He Who sees you when you rise.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 219: And your devotions amidst the worshipers.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 220: He is indeed the Hearer, the Aware.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 221: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 222: They descend upon every sinful liar.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 223: They give ear, and most of them are liars.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 224: And as for the poets-the deviators follow them.
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 225: Do you not see how they ramble in every style?
Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 226: And how they say what they do not do?

Surah asy-Syu'ara, Ayah 227: Except for those who believe, and do good deeds, and remember God frequently, and defend themselves after they are wronged. As for those who do wrong, they will know by what overturning they will be overturned.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 1: Ta, Seen. These are the Signs of the Quran-a book that makes things clear.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 2: Guidance and good news for the believers.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 3: Those who observe the prayers, and give charity regularly, and are certain of the Hereafter.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 4: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter: We made their deeds appear good to them, so they wander aimlessly.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 5: It is they who will receive the grievous punishment-and in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 6: You are receiving the Quran from an All-Wise, All-Knowing.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 7: When Moses said to his family, "I have glimpsed a fire. I will bring you some news from it; or bring you a firebrand, that you may warm yourselves."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 8: Then, when he reached it, he was called: "Blessed is He who is within the fire, and He who is around it, and glorified be God, Lord of the Worlds.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 9: O Moses, it is I, God, the Almighty, the Wise.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 10: Throw down your staff." But when he saw it quivering, as though it were a demon, he turned around not looking back. "O Moses, do not fear; the messengers do not fear in My presence.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 11: But whoever has done wrong, and then substituted goodness in place of evil. I am Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 12: Put your hand inside your pocket, and it will come out white, without blemish-among nine miracles to Pharaoh and his people, for they are immoral people."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 13: Yet when Our enlightening signs came to them, they said, "This is obvious witchcraft."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 14: And they rejected them, although their souls were certain of them, out of wickedness and pride. So see how the outcome was for the mischief-makers.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 15: And We gave David and Solomon knowledge. They said, "Praise God, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 16: And Solomon succeeded David. He said, "O people, we were taught the language of birds, and we were given from everything. This is indeed a real blessing."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 17: To the service of Solomon were mobilized his troops of sprites, and men, and birds-all held in strict order.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 18: Until, when they came upon the Valley of Ants, an ant said, "O ants! Go into your nests, lest Solomon and his troops crush you without noticing."

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 19: He smiled and laughed at her words, and said, "My Lord, direct me to be thankful for the blessings you have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to do good works that please You. And admit me, by Your grace, into the company of Your virtuous servants."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 20: Then he inspected the birds, and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees?
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 21: I will punish him most severely, or slay him, unless he gives me a valid excuse."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 22: But he did not stay for long. He said, "I have learnt something you did not know. I have come to you from Sheba, with reliable information.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 23: I found a woman ruling over them, and she was given of everything, and she has a magnificent throne.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 24: I found her and her people worshiping the sun, instead of God. Satan made their conduct appear good to them, and diverted them from the path, so they are not guided.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 25: If only they would worship God, who brings to light the mysteries of the heavens and the earth, and knows what you conceal and what you reveal.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 26: God-There is no god but He, the Lord of the Sublime Throne."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 27: He said, "We will see, whether you have spoken the truth, or whether you are a liar.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 28: Go with this letter of mine, and deliver it to them; then withdraw from them, and see how they respond."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 29: She said, "O Counselors, a gracious letter was delivered to me.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 30: It is from Solomon, and it is, 'In the Name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 31: Do not defy me, and come to me submissively.'"
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 32: She said, "O counselors, advise me in this matter of mine. I never make a decision unless you are present."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 33: They said, "We are a people of might and great courage, but the decision is yours, so consider what you wish to command."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 34: She said, "When kings enter a city, they devastate it, and subjugate its dignified people. Thus they always do.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 35: I am sending them a gift, and will see what the envoys bring back."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 36: When he came to Solomon, he said, "Are you supplying me with money? What God has given me is better than what He has given you. It is you who delight in your gift.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 37: Go back to them. We will come upon them with troops they cannot resist; and we will expel them from there, disgraced and humiliated."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 38: He said, "O notables, which one of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 39: An imp of the sprites said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your seat. I am strong and reliable enough to do it."

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 40: He who had knowledge from the Book said, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when he saw it settled before him, he said, "This is from the grace of my Lord, to test me, whether I am grateful or ungrateful. He who is grateful, his gratitude is to his own credit; but he who is ungrateful-my Lord is Independent and Generous."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 41: He said, "Disguise her throne for her, and we shall see whether she will be guided, or remains one of the misguided."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 42: When she arrived, it was said, "Is your throne like this?" She said, "As if this is it." "We were given knowledge before her, and we were submissive."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 43: But she was prevented by what she worshiped besides God; she belonged to a disbelieving people.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 44: It was said to her, "Go inside the palace." And when she saw it, she thought it was a deep pond, and she bared her legs. He said, "It is a palace paved with glass." She said, "My Lord, I have done wrong to myself, and I have submitted with Solomon, to God, Lord of the Worlds."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 45: And We sent to Thamood their brother Saleh: "Worship God." But they became two disputing factions.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 46: He said, "O my people, why are you quick to do evil rather than good? If only you would seek God's forgiveness, so that you may be shown mercy."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 47: They said, "We consider you an ill omen, and those with you." He said, "Your omen is with God. In fact, you are a people being tested."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 48: In the city was a gang of nine who made mischief in the land and did no good.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 49: They said, "Swear by God to one another that we will attack him and his family by night, and then tell his guardian, 'We did not witness the murder of his family, and we are being truthful.'"
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 50: They planned a plan, and We planned a plan, but they did not notice.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 51: So note the outcome of their planning; We destroyed them and their people, altogether.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 52: Here are their homes, in ruins, on account of their iniquities. Surely in this is a sign for people who know.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 53: And We saved those who believed and were pious.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 54: And Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit lewdness with open eyes?
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 55: Do you lust after men instead of women? You are truly ignorant people."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 56: But the only response of his people was to say, "Expel the family of Lot from your town. They are purist people."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 57: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife, whom We destined to be among the laggards.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 58: And We rained upon them a rain. Miserable was the rain of those forewarned.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 59: Say, "Praise God, and peace be upon His servants whom He has selected. Is God better, or what they associate?"

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 60: Or, who created the heavens and the earth, and rains down water from the sky for you? With it We produce gardens full of beauty, whose trees you could not have produced. Is there another god with God? But they are a people who equate.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 61: Or, who made the earth habitable, and made rivers flow through it, and set mountains on it, and placed a partition between the two seas? Is there another god with God? But most of them do not know.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 62: Or, who answers the one in need when he prays to Him, and relieves adversity, and makes you successors on earth? Is there another god with God? How hardly you pay attention.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 63: Or, who guides you through the darkness of land and sea, and who sends the winds as heralds of His mercy? Is there another god with God? Most exalted is God, above what they associate.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 64: Or, who originates the creation and then repeats it, and who gives you livelihood from the sky and the earth? Is there another god with God? Say, "Produce your evidence, if you are truthful."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 65: Say, "No one in the heavens or on earth knows the future except God; and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 66: In fact, their knowledge of the Hereafter is confused. In fact, they are in doubt about it. In fact, they are blind to it.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 67: Those who disbelieve say, "When we have become dust, and our ancestors, shall we be brought out?
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 68: We were promised that before, we and our ancestors-these are nothing but legends of the ancients."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 69: Say, travel through the earth, and observe the fate of the guilty."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 70: But do not grieve over them, and do not be troubled by what they plot.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 71: And they say, "When is this promise, if you are truthful?"
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 72: Say, "Perhaps some of what you are impatient for has drawn near."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 73: Your Lord is gracious towards humanity, but most of them are not thankful.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 74: And your Lord knows what their hearts conceal, and what they reveal.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 75: There is no mystery in the heaven and the earth, but it is in a Clear Book.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 76: This Quran relates to the Children of Israel most of what they differ about.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 77: And it is guidance and mercy for the believers.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 78: Your Lord will judge between them by His wisdom. He is the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 79: So rely on God. You are upon the clear truth.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 80: You cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call if they turn their backs and flee.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 81: Nor can you guide the blind out of their straying. You can make no one listen, except those who believe in Our verses; for they are Muslims.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 82: And when the Word has fallen on them, We will bring out for them from the earth a creature which will say to them that the people are uncertain of Our revelations.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 83: On the Day when We gather from every community a group of those who rejected Our revelations; and they will be restrained.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 84: Until, when they arrive, He will say, "Did you reject My revelations without comprehending them? Or what is it you were doing?"
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 85: The Word will come down upon them for their wrongdoing, and they will not speak.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 86: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest therein, and the day for visibility? Surely in that are signs for people who believe.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 87: On the Day when the Trumpet is blown, everyone in the heavens and the earth will be horrified, except whomever God wills; and everyone will come before Him in humility.

Surah an-Naml, Ayah 88: And you see the mountains, and imagine them fixed, yet they pass, as the passing of the clouds-the making of God, who has perfected everything. He is fully Informed of what you do.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 89: Whoever brings a virtue will receive better than it-and they will be safe from the horrors of that Day.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 90: But whoever brings evil-their faces will be tumbled into the Fire. Will you be rewarded except for what you used to do?
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 91: "I was commanded to worship the Lord of this town, who has sanctified it, and to Whom everything belongs; and I was commanded to be of those who submit.
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 92: And to recite the Quran." Whoever is guided-is guided to his own advantage. And whoever goes astray, then say, "I am one of the warners."
Surah an-Naml, Ayah 93: And say, "Praise belongs to God; He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. Your Lord is not heedless of what you do."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 1: Ta, Seen, Meem.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 2: These are the Verses of the Clear Book.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 3: We narrate to you from the history of Moses and Pharaoh-in truth-for people who believe.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 4: Pharaoh exalted himself in the land, and divided its people into factions. He persecuted a group of them, slaughtering their sons, while sparing their daughters. He was truly a corrupter.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 5: But We desired to favor those who were oppressed in the land, and to make them leaders, and to make them the inheritors.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 6: And to establish them in the land; and to show Pharaoh, Hamaan, and their troops, the very thing they feared.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 7: We inspired the mother of Moses: "Nurse him; then, when you fear for him, cast him into the river, and do not fear, nor grieve; We will return him to you, and make him one of the messengers."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 8: Pharaoh's household picked him up, to be an opponent and a sorrow for them. Pharaoh, Hamaan, and their troops were sinners.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 9: Pharaoh's wife said, "An eye's delight for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he will be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son." But they did not foresee.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 10: The heart of Moses' mother became vacant. She was about to disclose him, had We not steadied her heart, that she may remain a believer.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 11: She said to his sister, "Trail him." So she watched him from afar, and they were unaware.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 12: We forbade him breastfeeding at first. So she said, "Shall I tell you about a family that can raise him for you, and will look after him?"
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 13: Thus We returned him to his mother, that she may be comforted, and not grieve, and know that God's promise is true. But most of them do not know.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 14: And when he reached his maturity, and became established, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus do We reward the virtuous.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 15: Once he entered the city, unnoticed by its people. He found in it two men fighting-one of his own sect, and one from his enemies. The one of his sect solicited his assistance against the one from his enemies; so Moses punched him, and put an end to him. He said, "This is of Satan's doing; he is an enemy that openly misleads."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 16: He said, "My Lord, I have wronged myself, so forgive me." So He forgave him. He is the Forgiver, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 17: He said, "My Lord, in as much as you have favored me, I will never be a supporter of the criminals."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 18: The next morning, he went about in the city, fearful and vigilant, when the man who had sought his assistance the day before was shouting out to him. Moses said to him, "You are clearly a troublemaker."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 19: As he was about to strike the one who was their enemy, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me, as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a bully in the land, and do not want to be a peacemaker."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 20: And a man came from the farthest part of the city running. He said, "O Moses, the authorities are considering killing you, so leave; I am giving you good advice."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 21: So he left, fearful and vigilant. He said, "My Lord, deliver me from the wrongdoing people."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 22: As he headed towards Median, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the right way."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 23: And when he arrived at the waters of Median, he found there a crowd of people drawing water, and he noticed two women waiting on the side. He said, "What is the matter with you?" They said, "We cannot draw water until the shepherds depart, and our father is a very old man."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 24: So he drew water for them, and then withdrew to the shade, and said, "My Lord, I am in dire need of whatever good you might send down to me."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 25: Then, one of the two women approached him, walking bashfully. She said, "My father is calling you, to reward you for drawing water for us." And when he came to him, and told him the story, he said, "Do not fear, you have escaped from the wrongdoing people."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 26: One of the two women said, "Father, hire him; the best employee for you is the strong and trustworthy."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 27: He said, "I want to marry you to one of these two daughters of mine, provided you work for me for eight years. But if you complete ten, that is up to you. I do not intend to impose any hardship on you. You will find me, God willing, one of the righteous."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 28: He said, "Let this be an agreement between you and me. Whichever of the two terms I fulfill, there shall be no reprisal against me; and God is witness over what we say."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 29: When Moses had completed the term, and departed with his family, he noticed a fire by the side of the Mount. He said to his family, "Stay here, I have glimpsed a fire. Perhaps I can bring you some information from there, or an ember from the fire, that you may warm yourselves."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 30: When he reached it, he was called from the right side of the valley, at the Blessed Spot, from the bush: "O Moses, it is I, God, the Lord of the Worlds.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 31: Throw down your staff." And when he saw it wiggling, as if it were possessed, he turned his back to flee, and did not look back. "O Moses, come forward, and do not fear, you are perfectly safe.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 32: Put your hand inside your pocket, and it will come out white, without blemish. And press your arm to your side, against fear. These are two proofs from your Lord, to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. They are truly sinful people."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 33: He said, "My Lord, I have killed one of them, and I fear they will kill me.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 34: And my brother Aaron, he is more eloquent than me, so send him with me, to help me, and to confirm my words, for I fear they will reject me."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 35: He said, "We will strengthen your arm with your brother, and We will give you authority, so they will not touch you. By virtue of Our signs, you and those who follow you will be the triumphant."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 36: But when Moses came to them with Our signs, clear and manifest, they said, "This is nothing but fabricated magic, and We never heard of this from our ancestors of old."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 37: Moses said, "My Lord is well aware of him who brings guidance from Him, and him who will have the sequel of the abode. The wrongdoers will not succeed."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 38: Pharaoh said, "O nobles, I know of no god for you other than me. So fire-up the bricks for me O Hamaan, and build me a tower, that I may ascend to the God of Moses, though I think he is a liar."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 39: He and his troops acted arrogantly in the land, with no justification. They thought they would not be returned to Us.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 40: So We seized him, and his troops, and We threw them into the sea. Observe, therefore, what was the end of the oppressors.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 41: And We made them leaders calling to the Fire. And on Resurrection Day, they will not be saved.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 42: And We pursued them in this world with a curse. And on Resurrection Day, they will be among the despised.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 43: We gave Moses the Scripture after We had annihilated the previous generations; as an illumination for mankind, and guidance, and mercy, so that they may remember.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 44: You were not on the Western Side when We decreed the command to Moses, nor were you among the witnesses.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 45: But We established many generations, and time took its toll on them. Nor were you among the people of Median, reciting Our revelations to them. But We kept sending messengers.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 46: Nor were you by the side of the Mount when We proclaimed. Rather, it was a mercy from your Lord, that you may warn people who received no warner before you, so that they may take heed.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 47: Otherwise, if a calamity befell them as a result of what their hands have perpetrated, they would say, "Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations, and been among the believers."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 48: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "If only he was given the like of what was given to Moses." Did they not disbelieve in what was given to Moses in the past? They said, "Two works of magic backing one another." And they said, "We are disbelieving in both."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 49: Say, "Then bring a scripture from God, more conductive to guidance than both, and I will follow it, if you are truthful."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 50: But if they fail to respond to you, know that they follow their fancies. And who is more lost than him who follows his fancy without guidance from God? God does not guide the unjust people.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 51: We have delivered the Word to them, that they may remember.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 52: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it believe in it.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 53: When it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; it is the truth from our Lord; we were Muslims prior to it."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 54: These will be given their reward twice, because they persevered; and they counter evil with good; and from Our provisions to them, they give.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 55: And when they hear vain talk, they avoid it, and say, "We have our deeds, and you have your deeds; peace be upon you; we do not desire the ignorant."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 56: You cannot guide whom you love, but God guides whom He wills, and He knows best those who are guided.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 57: And they say, "If we follow the guidance with you, we will be snatched from our land." Did We not establish for them a Safe Sanctuary, to which are brought all kinds of fruits, as provision from Ourselves? But most of them do not know.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 58: And how many a city did We destroy for turning unappreciative of its livelihood? Here are their homes, uninhabited after them, except for a few. And We became the Inheritors.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 59: Your Lord never destroys cities without first sending a messenger in their midst, reciting to them Our revelations. And We never destroy the cities, unless their people are wrongdoers.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 60: Whatever thing you are given is but the material of this world, and its glitter. But what is with God is better, and longer lasting. Do you not comprehend?

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 61: Can someone to whom We have made a fine promise-which he will attain-be equal to someone to whom We have given enjoyments in this world, but who will be, on Resurrection Day, among the arraigned?
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 62: On the Day when He will call to them, and say, "Where are My associates whom you used to claim?"

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 63: Those against whom the sentence is justified will say, "Our Lord, these are they whom we misled. We misled them, as we were misled. We beg Your forgiveness; it was not us they used to worship."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 64: And it will be said, "Call on your partners." And they will call on them, but they will not respond to them. And they will see the suffering. If only they were guided.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 65: On the Day when He will call to them, and say, "What did you answer the Messengers?"
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 66: They will be blinded by the facts on that Day, and they will not question each other.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 67: But he who repents, and believes, and does righteous deeds, may well be among the winners.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 68: Your Lord creates whatever He wills, and He chooses. The choice is not theirs. Glory be to God, and exalted be He above the associations they make.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 69: And your Lord knows what their hearts conceal, and what they reveal.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 70: And He is God. There is no god but He. To Him belongs all praise in this life, and in the next. And His is the decision, and to Him you will be returned.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 71: Say, "Have you considered? Had God made the night perpetual over you until the Day of Resurrection, which god other than God will bring you illumination? Do you not hear?"
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 72: Say, "Have you considered? Had God made the day perpetual over you until the Day of Resurrection, which god other than God will bring you night to rest in? Do you not see?"
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 73: It is out of His mercy that He made for you the night and the day, that you may rest in it, and seek some of His bounty; and that you may give thanks.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 74: On the Day when He will call to them, and say, "Where are My associates whom you used to claim?"

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 75: And We will draw out from every community a witness, and say, "Produce your evidence." Then they will realize that the truth is God's, and those they used to invent have forsaken them.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 76: Quaroon belonged to the clan of Moses, but he oppressed them. We had given him treasures, the keys of which would weigh down a group of strong men. His people said to him, "Do not exult; God does not love the exultant.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 77: But seek, with what God has given you, the Home of the Hereafter, and do not neglect your share of this world. And be charitable, as God has been charitable to you. And do not seek corruption in the land. God does not like the seekers of corruption."

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 78: He said, "I was given all this on account of knowledge I possess." Did he not know that God destroyed many generations before him, who were stronger than he, and possessed greater riches? But the guilty will not be asked about their sins.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 79: And he went out before his people in his splendor. Those who desired the worldly life said, "If only we possessed the likes of what Quaroon was given. He is indeed very fortunate."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 80: But those who were given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of God is better for those who believe and do righteous deeds." Yet none attains it except the steadfast.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 81: So We caused the earth to cave in on him and his mansion. He had no company to save him from God, and he could not defend himself.

Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 82: Those who had wished they were in his position the day before were saying, "Indeed, it is God who spreads the bounty to whomever He wills of His servants, and restricts it. Had God not been gracious to us, He would have caved in on us. No wonder the ungrateful never prosper."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 83: That Home of the Hereafter-We assign it for those who seek no superiority on earth, nor corruption. And the outcome is for the cautious.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 84: Whoever brings a virtue will receive better than it. But whoever brings evil-the evildoers will be rewarded only according to what they used to do.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 85: He Who ordained the Quran for you will return you Home. Say, "My Lord knows best who comes with guidance, and who is in manifest error."
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 86: You did not expect the Scripture to be transmitted to you, except as mercy from your Lord. Therefore, do not be a supporter of the disbelievers.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 87: And do not let them divert you from God's revelations after they have been revealed to you. And pray to your Lord, and never be of the polytheists.
Surah al-Qashash, Ayah 88: And do not invoke with God any other god. There is no god but He. All things perish, except His presence. His is the judgment, and to Him you will be returned.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 2: Have the people supposed that they will be left alone to say, "We believe," without being put to the test?
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 3: We have tested those before them. God will surely know the truthful, and He will surely know the liars.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 4: Or do those who commit sins think they can fool Us? Terrible is their opinion!
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 5: Whoever looks forward to the meeting with God-the appointed time of God is coming. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 6: Whoever strives, strives only for himself. God is Independent of the beings.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 7: Those who believe and do righteous deeds-We will remit their sins, and We will reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 8: We have advised the human being to be good to his parents. But if they urge you to associate with Me something you have no knowledge of, do not obey them. To Me is your return; and I will inform you of what you used to do.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 9: Those who believe and do good works-We will admit them into the company of the righteous.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 10: Among the people is he who says, "We have believed in God." Yet when he is harmed on God's account, he equates the people's persecution with God's retribution. And if help comes from your Lord, he says, "We were actually with you." Is not God aware of what is inside the hearts of the people?
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 11: God certainly knows those who believe, and He certainly knows the hypocrites.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 12: Those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Follow our way, and we will carry your sins." In no way can they carry any of their sins. They are liars.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 13: They will carry their own loads, and other loads with their own. And they will be questioned on the Day of Resurrection concerning what they used to fabricate.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 14: We sent Noah to his people, and He stayed among them for a thousand years minus fifty years. Then the Deluge swept them; for they were wrongdoers.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 15: But We saved him, together with the company of the Ark, and We made it a sign for all peoples.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 16: And Abraham, when he said to his people, "Worship God, and fear Him. That is better for you, if you only knew.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 17: You worship idols besides God, and you fabricate falsehoods. Those you worship, instead of God, cannot provide you with livelihood. So seek your livelihood from God, and worship Him, and thank Him. To Him you will be returned."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 18: If you disbelieve, communities before you have also disbelieved. The Messenger is only responsible for clear transmission.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 19: Have they not seen how God originates the creation, and then reproduces it? This is easy for God.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 20: Say, "Roam the earth, and observe how He originated the creation." Then God will bring about the next existence. God has power over all things."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 21: He punishes whom He wills, and He grants mercy to whom He wills, and to Him you will be restored.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 22: You cannot escape, on earth or in the heaven; and you have no protector and no savior besides God.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 23: Those who disbelieved in God's signs and His encounter-these have despaired of My mercy. For them is a painful torment.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 24: But the only response from his people was their saying, "Kill him, or burn him." But God saved him from the fire. Surely in that are signs for people who believe.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 25: And he said, "You have chosen idols instead of God, out of affection for one another in the worldly life. But then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will disown one another, and curse one another. Your destiny is Hell, and you will have no saviors."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 26: Then Lot believed in him, and said, "I am emigrating to my Lord. He is the Noble, the Wise."

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 27: And We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and conferred on his descendants the Prophethood and the Book, and gave him his reward in this life; and in the Hereafter he will be among the upright.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 28: And Lot, when he said to his people, "You are committing an obscenity not perpetrated before you by anyone in the whole world.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 29: You approach men, and cut off the way, and commit lewdness in your gatherings." But the only response from his people was to say, "Bring upon us God's punishment, if you are truthful."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 30: He said, "My Lord, help me against the people of corruption."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 31: And when Our envoys brought Abraham the good news, they said, "We are going to destroy the people of this town; its people are wrongdoers."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 32: He said, "Yet Lot is in it." They said, "We are well aware of who is in it. We will save him, and his family, except for his wife, who will remain behind."

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 33: Then, when Our envoys came to Lot, they were mistreated, and he was troubled and distressed on their account. They said, "Do not fear, nor grieve. We will save you and your family, except for your wife, who will remain behind."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 34: "We will bring down upon the people of this town a scourge from heaven, because of their wickedness."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 35: And We left behind a clear trace of it, for people who understand.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 36: And to Median, their brother Shuaib. He said, "O my people, worship God and anticipate the Last Day, and do not spread corruption in the land."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 37: But they rejected him, so the tremor overtook them, and they were left motionless in their homes.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 38: And Aad and Thamood. It has become clear to you from their dwellings. Satan embellished for them their deeds, barring them from the path, even though they could see.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 39: And Quaroon, and Pharaoh, and Hamaan-Moses went to them with clear arguments, but they acted arrogantly in the land. And they could not get ahead.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 40: Each We seized by his sin. Against some We sent a sandstorm. Some were struck by the Blast. Some We caused the ground to cave in beneath them. And some We drowned. It was not God who wronged them, but it was they who wronged their own selves.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 41: The likeness of those who take to themselves protectors other than God is that of the spider. It builds a house. But the most fragile of houses is the spider's house. If they only knew.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 42: God knows what they invoke besides Him. He is the Almighty, the Wise.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 43: These examples-We put them forward to the people; but none grasps them except the learned.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 44: God created the heavens and the earth with truth. Surely in that is a sign for the believers.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 45: Recite what is revealed to you of the Scripture, and perform the prayer. The prayer prevents indecencies and evils. And the remembrance of God is greater. And God knows what you do.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 46: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in the best manner possible, except those who do wrong among them. And say, "We believe in what was revealed to us, and in what was revealed to you; and our God and your God is One; and to Him we are submissive."

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 47: Likewise, We revealed to you the Scripture. Those to whom We gave the Scripture believe in it, and some of these believe in it. None renounce Our communications except the disbelievers.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 48: You did not read any scripture before this, nor did you write it down with your right hand; otherwise the falsifiers would have doubted.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 49: In fact, it is clear signs in the hearts of those given knowledge. No one renounce Our signs except the unjust.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 50: And they said, "If only a miracle from his Lord was sent down to him." Say, "Miracles are only with God, and I am only a clear warner."
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 51: Does it not suffice them that We revealed to you the Scripture, which is recited to them? In that is mercy and a reminder for people who believe.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 52: Say, "God suffices as witness between you and me. He knows everything in the heavens and the Earth. Those who believe in vanity and reject God-it is they who are the losers."

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 53: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. Were it not for a specified time, the punishment would have come to them. But it will come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 54: They urge you to hasten the punishment. But Hell will engulf the disbelievers.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 55: On the Day when the punishment will envelop them, from above them, and from beneath their feet, He will say, "Taste what you used to do!"
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 56: O My servants who have believed: My earth is vast, so worship Me alone.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 57: Every soul will taste death. Then to Us you will be returned.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 58: Those who believe and work righteousness-We will settle them in Paradise, in mansions under which rivers flow, dwelling therein forever. Excellent is the compensation for the workers.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 59: Those who endure patiently, and in their Lord they trust.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 60: How many a creature there is that does not carry its provision? God provides for them, and for you. He is the Hearer, the Knowledgeable.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 61: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth and regulated the sun and the moon?" They would say, "God." Why then do they deviate?
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 62: God expands the provision for whomever He wills of His servants, and restricts it. God is Cognizant of all things.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 63: And if you asked them, "Who sends water down from the sky, with which He revives the earth after it had died?" They would say, "God." Say, "Praise be to God." But most of them do not understand.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 64: The life of this world is nothing but diversion and play, and the Home of the Hereafter is the Life, if they only knew.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 65: When they embark on a vessel, they pray to God, devoting their faith to Him; but once He has delivered them safely to land, they attribute partners to Him.
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 66: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy themselves. They will surely come to know.

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 67: Do they not see that We established a Secure Sanctuary, while all around them the people are being carried away? Do they believe in falsehood, and reject the blessings of God?

Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 68: And who does greater wrong than he who fabricates lies and attributes them to God, or calls the truth a lie when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a dwelling for the blasphemers?
Surah al-'Ankabut, Ayah 69: As for those who strive for Us-We will guide them in Our ways. God is with the doers of good.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 2: God, there is no god but He, the Living, the Eternal.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 3: He sent down to you the Book with the Truth, confirming what came before it; and He sent down the Torah and the Gospel.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 4: Aforetime, as guidance for mankind; and He sent down the Criterion. Those who have rejected God's signs will have a severe punishment. God is Mighty, Able to take revenge.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 5: Nothing is hidden from God, on earth or in the heaven.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 6: It is He who forms you in the wombs as He wills. There is no god except He, the Almighty, the Wise.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 7: It is He who revealed to you the Book. Some of its verses are definitive; they are the foundation of the Book, and others are unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation, they follow the unspecific part, seeking descent, and seeking to derive an interpretation. But none knows its interpretation except God and those firmly rooted in knowledge say, "We believe in it; all is from our Lord." But none recollects except those with understanding.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 8: "Our Lord, do not cause our hearts to swerve after You have guided us, and bestow on us mercy from Your presence; You are the Giver."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 9: "Our Lord, You will gather the people for a Day in which there is no doubt." God will never break His promise.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 10: As for those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their children will avail them anything against God. These will be fuel for the Fire.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 11: Like the behavior of Pharaoh's people and those before them. They rejected Our signs, so God seized them for their sins. God is Strict in retribution.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 12: Say to those who disbelieve, "You will be defeated, and rounded up into Hell-an awful resting-place."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 13: There was a sign for you in the two parties that met. One party fighting in the way of God, and the other was disbelieving. They saw them with their own eyes twice their number. But God supports with His help whomever He wills. In that is a lesson for those with insight.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 14: Adorned for the people is the love of desires, such as women, and children, and piles upon piles of gold and silver, and branded horses, and livestock, and fields. These are the conveniences of the worldly life, but with God lies the finest resort.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 15: Say, "Shall I inform you of something better than that? For those who are righteous, with their Lord are Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will remain forever, and purified spouses, and acceptance from God." God is Observant of the servants.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 16: Those who say, "Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us our sins, and save us from the suffering of the Fire."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 17: The patient, and the truthful, and the reverent, and the charitable, and the seekers of forgiveness at dawn.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 18: God bears witness that there is no god but He, as do the angels, and those endowed with knowledge-upholding justice. There is no god but He, the Mighty, the Wise.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 19: Religion with God is Islam. Those to whom the Scripture was given differed only after knowledge came to them, out of envy among themselves. Whoever rejects the signs of God-God is quick to take account.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 20: If they argue with you, say, "I have surrendered myself to God, and those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture, and to the unlearned, "Have you surrendered?" If they have surrendered, then they are guided; but if they turn away, then your duty is to convey. God is Seeing of the servants.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 21: As for those who defy God's revelations, and kill the prophets unjustly, and kill those who advocate justice among the people-promise them a painful retribution.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 22: They are those whose deeds will come to nothing, in this world and in the Hereafter; and they will have no saviors.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 23: Have you not considered those who were given a share of the Scripture, as they were called to the Scripture of God to arbitrate between them; then some of them turned back, and declined?
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 24: That is because they said, "The Fire will not touch us except for a limited number of days." They have been misled in their religion by the lies they fabricated.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 25: How about when We gather them for a Day in which there is no doubt, and each soul will be paid in full for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged?

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 26: Say, "O God, Owner of Sovereignty. You grant sovereignty to whom You will, and You strip sovereignty from whom you will. You honor whom you will, and You humiliate whom you will. In Your hand is all goodness. You are Capable of all things."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 27: "You merge the night into the day, and You merge the day into the night; and you bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living; and You provide for whom you will without measure."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 28: Believers are not to take disbelievers for friends instead of believers. Whoever does that has nothing to do with God, unless it is to protect your own selves against them. God warns you to beware of Him. To God is the destiny.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 29: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your hearts, or disclose it, God knows it." He knows everything in the heavens and the earth. God is Powerful over everything.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 30: On the Day when every soul finds all the good it has done presented. And as for the evil it has done, it will wish there were a great distance between them. God cautions you of Himself. God is Kind towards the servants.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 31: Say, "If you love God, then follow me, and God will love you, and will forgive you your sins." God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 32: Say, "Obey God and the Messenger." But if they turn away-God does not love the faithless.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 33: God chose Adam, and Noah, and the family of Abraham, and the family of Imran, over all mankind.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 34: Offspring one of the other. God is Hearer and Knower.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 35: The wife of Imran said, "My Lord, I have vowed to You what is in my womb, dedicated, so accept from me; You are the Hearer and Knower."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 36: And when she delivered her, she said, "My Lord, I have delivered a female," and God was well aware of what she has delivered, "and the male is not like the female, and I have named her Mary, and have commended her and her descendants to Your protection, from Satan the outcast."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 37: Her Lord accepted her with a gracious reception, and brought her a beautiful upbringing, and entrusted her to the care of Zechariah. Whenever Zechariah entered upon her in the sanctuary, he found her with provision. He said, "O Mary, where did you get this from?" She said, "It is from God; God provides to whom He wills without reckoning."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 38: Thereupon Zechariah prayed to his Lord; he said, "My Lord, bestow on me good offspring from Your presence; You are the Hearer of Prayers."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 39: Then the angels called out to him, as he stood praying in the sanctuary: "God gives you good news of John; confirming a Word from God, and honorable, and moral, and a prophet; one of the upright."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 40: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a son, when old age has overtaken me, and my wife is barren?" He said, "Even so, God does whatever He wills."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 41: He said, "My Lord, give me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you shall not speak to the people for three days, except by gestures. And remember your Lord much, and praise in the evening and the morning."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 42: The angels said, "O Mary, God has chosen you, and has purified you. He has chosen you over all the women of the world.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 43: "O Mary, be devoted to your Lord, and bow down, and kneel with those who kneel."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 44: These are accounts from the Unseen, which We reveal to you. You were not with them when they cast their lots as to which of them would take charge of Mary; nor were you with them as they quarreled.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 45: The Angels said, "O Mary, God gives you good news of a Word from Him. His name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, well-esteemed in this world and the next, and one of the nearest.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 46: He will speak to the people from the crib, and in adulthood, and will be one of the righteous."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 47: She said, "My Lord, how can I have a child, when no man has touched me?" He said, "It will be so. God creates whatever He wills. To have anything done, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 48: And He will teach him the Scripture and wisdom, and the Torah and the Gospel.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 49: A messenger to the Children of Israel: "I have come to you with a sign from your Lord. I make for you out of clay the figure of a bird; then I breathe into it, and it becomes a bird by God's leave. And I heal the blind and the leprous, and I revive the dead, by God's leave. And I inform you concerning what you eat, and what you store in your homes. In that is a sign for you, if you are believers."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 50: "And verifying what lies before me of the Torah, and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. I have come to you with a sign from your Lord; so fear God, and obey me."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 51: "God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 52: When Jesus sensed disbelief on their part, he said, "Who are my allies towards God?" The disciples said, "We are God's allies; we have believed in God, and bear witness that we submit."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 53: "Our Lord, we have believed in what You have revealed, and we have followed the Messenger, so count us among the witnesses."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 54: They planned, and God planned; but God is the Best of planners.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 55: God said, "O Jesus, I am terminating your life, and raising you to Me, and clearing you of those who disbelieve. And I will make those who follow you superior to those who disbelieve, until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return; then I will judge between you regarding what you were disputing.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 56: As for those who disbelieve, I will punish them with a severe punishment, in this world and the next, and they will have no helpers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 57: And as for those who believe and do good works, He will give them their rewards in full. God does not love the unjust."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 58: This is what We recite to you of the Verses and the Wise Reminder.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 59: The likeness of Jesus in God's sight is that of Adam: He created him from dust, then said to him, "Be," and he was.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 60: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be of those who doubt.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 61: And if anyone disputes with you about him, after the knowledge that has come to you, say, "Come, let us call our children and your children, and our women and your women, and ourselves and yourselves, and let us invoke God's curse on the liars."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 62: This is the narrative of truth: there is no god but God. God is the Mighty, the Wise.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 63: But if they turn away-God knows the corrupt.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 64: Say, "O People of the Book, come to terms common between us and you: that we worship none but God, and that we associate nothing with Him, and that none of us takes others as lords besides God." And if they turn away, say, "Bear witness that we have submitted."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 65: O People of the Book! Why do you argue about Abraham, when the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Will you not reason?
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 66: Here you are-you argue about things you know, but why do you argue about things you do not know? God knows, and you do not know.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 67: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was a Monotheist, a Muslim. And he was not of the Polytheists.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 68: The people most deserving of Abraham are those who followed him, and this prophet, and those who believe. God is the Guardian of the believers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 69: A party of the People of the Book would love to lead you astray, but they only lead themselves astray, and they do not realize it.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 70: O People of the Book! Why do you reject the revelations of God, even as you witness?
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 71: O People of the Book! Why do you confound the truth with falsehood, and knowingly conceal the truth?
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 72: Some of the People of the Book say, "Believe in what was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day, and reject it at its end, so that they may return."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 73: And trust none except those who follow your religion." Say, "Guidance is God's guidance. If someone is given the like of what you were given, or they argue with you before your Lord, say, "All grace is in God's hand; He gives it to whomever He wills." God is Bounteous and Knowing.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 74: He specifies His mercy for whomever He wills. God is Possessor of Sublime Grace.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 75: Among the People of the Book is he, who, if you entrust him with a heap of gold, he will give it back to you. And among them is he, who, if you entrust him with a single coin, he will not give it back to you, unless you keep after him. That is because they say, "We are under no obligation towards the gentiles." They tell lies about God, and they know it.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 76: Indeed, whoever fulfills his commitments and maintains piety-God loves the pious.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 77: Those who exchange the covenant of God, and their vows, for a small price, will have no share in the Hereafter, and God will not speak to them, nor will He look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. They will have a painful punishment.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 78: And among them are those who twist the Scripture with their tongues, that you may think it from the Scripture, when it is not from the Scripture. And they say, "It is from God," when it is not from God. They tell lies and attribute them to God, knowingly.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 79: No person to whom God has given the Scripture, and wisdom, and prophethood would ever say to the people, "Be my worshipers rather than God's." Rather, "Be people of the Lord, according to the Scripture you teach, and the teachings you learn."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 80: Nor would he command you to take the angels and the prophets as lords. Would he command you to infidelity after you have submitted?

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 81: God received the covenant of the prophets, "Inasmuch as I have given you of scripture and wisdom; should a messenger come to you verifying what you have, you shall believe in him, and support him." He said, "Do you affirm My covenant and take it upon yourselves?" They said, "We affirm it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 82: Whoever turns away after that-these are the deceitful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 83: Do they desire other than the religion of God, when to Him has submitted everything in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will be returned?

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 84: Say, "We believe in God, and in what was revealed to us; and in what was revealed to Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the Patriarchs; and in what was given to Moses, and Jesus, and the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and to Him we submit."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 85: Whoever seeks other than Islam as a religion, it will not be accepted from him, and in the Hereafter he will be among the losers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 86: How will God guide a people who disbelieved after having believed, and had witnessed that the Messenger is true, and the clear proofs had come to them? God does not guide the unjust people.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 87: Those-their penalty is that upon them falls the curse of God, and of the angels, and of all mankind.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 88: Remaining in it eternally, without their punishment being eased from them, and without being reprieved.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 89: Except those who repent afterwards, and reform; for God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 90: As for those who disbelieve after having believed, then plunge deeper into disbelief, their repentance will not be accepted; these are the lost.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 91: As for those who disbelieve and die disbelievers, even the earth full of gold would not be accepted from any of them, were he to offer it for ransom. These will have a painful torment, and will have no saviors.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 92: You will not attain virtuous conduct until you give of what you cherish. Whatever you give away, God is aware of it.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 93: All food was permissible to the Children of Israel, except what Israel forbade for itself before the Torah was revealed. Say, "Bring the Torah, and read it, if you are truthful."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 94: Whoever forges lies about God after that-these are the unjust.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 95: Say, "God has spoken the truth, so follow the religion of Abraham the Monotheist; he was not a Pagan."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 96: The first house established for mankind is the one at Bekka; blessed, and guidance for all people.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 97: In it are evident signs; the Station of Abraham. Whoever enters it attains security. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty to God for all who can make the journey. But as for those who refuse-God is Independent of the worlds.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 98: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you reject the Revelations of God, when God witnesses what you do?"

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 99: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you hinder from God's path those who believe, seeking to distort it, even though you are witnesses? God is not unaware of what you do."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 100: O you who believe! If you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they will turn you, after your belief, into disbelievers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 101: And how could you disbelieve, when God's revelations are being recited to you, and among you is His Messenger? Whoever cleaves to God has been guided to a straight path.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 102: O you who believe! Revere God with due reverence, and do not die except as Muslims.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 103: And hold fast to the rope of God, altogether, and do not become divided. And remember God's blessings upon you; how you were enemies, and He reconciled your hearts, and by His grace you became brethren. And you were on the brink of a pit of fire, and He saved you from it. God thus clarifies His revelations for you, so that you may be guided.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 104: And let there be among you a community calling to virtue, and advocating righteousness, and deterring from evil. These are the successful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 105: And do not be like those who separated and disputed after the clear proofs came to them; for them is a great punishment.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 106: On the Day when some faces will be whitened, and some faces will be blackened. As for those whose faces are blackened: "Did you disbelieve after your belief?" Then taste the punishment for having disbelieved.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 107: But as for those whose faces are whitened: they are in God's mercy, remaining in it forever.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 108: These are the revelations of God. We recite them to you in truth. God desires no injustice for mankind.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 109: To God belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth, and to God all events are referred.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 110: You are the best community that ever emerged for humanity: you advocate what is moral, and forbid what is immoral, and believe in God. Had the People of the Scripture believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are the believers, but most of them are sinners.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 111: They will do you no harm, beyond insulting you. And if they fight you, they will turn around and flee, then they will not be helped.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 112: They shall be humiliated wherever they are encountered, except through a rope from God, and a rope from the people; and they incurred wrath from God, and were stricken with misery. That is because they rejected God's revelations, and killed the prophets unjustly. That is because they rebelled and committed aggression.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 113: They are not alike. Among the People of the Scripture is a community that is upright; they recite God's revelations throughout the night, and they prostrate themselves.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 114: They believe in God and the Last Day, and advocate righteousness and forbid evil, and are quick to do good deeds. These are among the righteous.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 115: Whatever good they do, they will not be denied it. God knows the righteous.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 116: As for those who disbelieve, neither their possessions nor their children will avail them anything against God. These are the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein forever.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 117: The parable of what they spend in this worldly life is that of a frosty wind that strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged their souls, and destroys it. God did not wrong them, but they wronged their own selves.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 118: O you who believe! Do not befriend outsiders who never cease to wish you harm. They love to see you suffer. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, but what their hearts conceal is worse. We have made the messages clear for you, if you understand.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 119: There you are, you love them, but they do not love you, and you believe in the entire scripture. And when they meet you, they say, "We believe;" but when they are alone, they bite their fingers in rage at you. Say, "Die in your rage; God knows what is within the hearts."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 120: If something good happens to you, it upsets them; but if something bad befalls you, they rejoice at it. But if you persevere and maintain righteousness, their schemes will not harm you at all. God comprehends what they do.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 121: Remember when you left your home in the morning, to assign battle-positions for the believers. God is Hearing and Knowing.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 122: When two groups among you almost faltered, but God was their Protector. So in God let the believers put their trust.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 123: God had given you victory at Badr, when you were weak. So fear God, that you may be thankful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 124: When you said to the believers, "Is it not enough for you that your Lord has reinforced you with three thousand angels, sent down?"
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 125: It is; but if you persevere and remain cautious, and they attack you suddenly, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels, well trained.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 126: God made it but a message of hope for you, and to reassure your hearts thereby. Victory comes only from God the Almighty, the Wise.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 127: He thus cuts off a section of those who disbelieved, or subdues them, so they retreat disappointed.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 128: It is no concern of yours whether He redeems them or punishes them. They are wrongdoers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 129: To God belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. God is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 130: O you who believe! Do not feed on usury, compounded over and over, and fear God, so that you may prosper.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 131: And guard yourselves against the Fire that is prepared for the disbelievers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 132: And obey God and the Messenger, that you may obtain mercy.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 133: And race towards forgiveness from your Lord, and a Garden as wide as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the righteous.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 134: Those who give in prosperity and adversity, and those who restrain anger, and those who forgive people. God loves the doers of good.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 135: And those who, when they commit an indecency or wrong themselves, remember God and ask forgiveness for their sins-and who forgives sins except God? And they do not persist in their wrongdoing while they know.
