Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 136: Those-their reward is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. How excellent is the reward of the workers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 137: Many societies have passed away before you. So travel the earth and note the fate of the deniers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 138: This is a proclamation to humanity, and guidance, and advice for the righteous.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 139: And do not waver, nor feel remorse. You are the superior ones, if you are believers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 140: If a wound afflicts you, a similar wound has afflicted the others. Such days We alternate between the people, that God may know those who believe, and take martyrs from among you. God does not love the evildoers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 141: So that God may prove those who believe, and eliminate the disbelievers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 142: Or do you expect to enter Paradise, before God has distinguished those among you who strive, and before He has distinguished the steadfast?
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 143: You used to wish for death before you have faced it. Now you have seen it before your own eyes.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 144: Muhammad is no more than a messenger. Messengers have passed on before him. If he dies or gets killed, will you turn on your heels? He who turns on his heels will not harm God in any way. And God will reward the appreciative.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 145: No soul can die except by God's leave, at a predetermined time. Whoever desires the reward of the world, We will give him some of it; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter, We will give him some of it; and We will reward the appreciative.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 146: How many a prophet fought alongside him numerous godly people? They did not waver for what afflicted them in the cause of God, nor did they weaken, nor did they give in. God loves those who endure.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 147: Their only words were, "Our Lord, forgive us our offences, and our excesses in our conduct, and strengthen our foothold, and help us against the disbelieving people."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 148: So God gave them the reward of this world, and the excellent reward of the Hereafter. God loves the doers of good.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 149: O you who believe! If you obey those who disbelieve, they will turn you back on your heels, and you end up losers.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 150: God is your Master, and He is the Best of Helpers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 151: We will throw terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve, because they attribute to God partners for which He revealed no sanction. Their lodging is the Fire. Miserable is the lodging of the evildoers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 152: God has fulfilled His promise to you, and you defeated them by His leave; until when you faltered, and disputed the command, and disobeyed after He had shown you what you like. Some of you want this world, and some of you want the next. Then He turned you away from them, to test you; but He pardoned you. God is Gracious towards the believers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 153: Remember when you fled, not caring for anyone, even though the Messenger was calling you from your rear. Then He repaid you with sorrow upon sorrow, so that you would not grieve over what you missed, or for what afflicted you. God is Informed of what you do.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 154: Then after the setback, He sent down security upon you. Slumber overcame some of you, while others cared only for themselves, thinking of God thoughts that were untrue-thoughts of ignorance-saying, "Is anything up to us?" Say, "Everything is up to God." They conceal within themselves what they do not reveal to you. And they say, "If it was up to us, none of us would have been killed here." Say, "Even if you Had stayed in your homes, those destined to be killed would have marched into their death beds." God thus tests what is in your minds, and purifies what is in your hearts. God knows what the hearts contain.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 155: Those of you who turned back on the day when the two armies clashed-it was Satan who caused them to backslide, on account of some of what they have earned. But God has forgiven them. God is Forgiving and Prudent.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 156: O you who believe! Do not be like those who disbelieved, and said of their brethren who marched in the land, or went on the offensive, "Had they stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed." So that God may make it a cause of regret in their hearts. God gives life and causes death. God is Seeing of what you do.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 157: If you are killed in the cause of God, or die-forgiveness and mercy from God are better than what they hoard.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 158: If you die, or are killed-to God you will be gathered up.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 159: It is by of grace from God that you were gentle with them. Had you been harsh, hardhearted, they would have dispersed from around you. So pardon them, and ask forgiveness for them, and consult them in the conduct of affairs. And when you make a decision, put your trust in God; God loves the trusting.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 160: If God supports you, there is none who can overcome you. But if He fails you, who is there to help you after Him? So in God let the believers put their trust.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 161: It is not for a prophet to act dishonestly. Whoever acts dishonestly will bring his dishonesty on the Day of Resurrection. Then every soul will be paid in full for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 162: Is someone who pursues God's approval the same as someone who incurs God's wrath and his refuge is Hell-the miserable destination?
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 163: They have different ranks with God, and God is Seeing of what they do.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 164: God has blessed the believers, as He raised up among them a messenger from among themselves, who recites to them His revelations, and purifies them, and teaches them the Scripture and wisdom; although before that they were in evident error.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 165: And when a calamity befell you, even after you had inflicted twice as much, you said, "How is this?" Say, "It is from your own selves." God is Able to do all things.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 166: What befell you on the day the two armies clashed was with God's permission; that He may know the believers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 167: And that He may know the hypocrites. And it was said to them, "Come, fight in the cause of God, or contribute." They said, "If we knew how to fight, we would have followed you." On that day they were closer to infidelity than they were to faith. They say with their mouths what is not in their hearts; but God knows what they hide.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 168: Those who said of their brethren, as they stayed behind, "Had they obeyed us, they would not have been killed." Say, "Then avert death from yourselves, if you are truthful."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 169: Do not consider those killed in the cause of God as dead. In fact, they are alive, at their Lord, well provided for.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 170: Delighting in what God has given them out of His grace, and happy for those who have not yet joined them; that they have nothing to fear, nor will they grieve.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 171: They rejoice in grace from God, and bounty, and that God will not waste the reward of the faithful.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 172: Those who responded to God and the Messenger, despite the persecution they had suffered. For the virtuous and the pious among them is a great reward.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 173: Those to whom the people have said, "The people have mobilized against you, so fear them." But this only increased them in faith, and they said, "God is enough for us; He is the Excellent Protector."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 174: So they came back with grace from God, and bounty, and no harm having touched them. They pursued what pleases God. God possesses immense grace.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 175: That is only Satan frightening his partisans; so do not fear them, but fear Me, if you are believers.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 176: And do not be saddened by those who rush into disbelief. They will not harm God in the least. God desires to give them no share in the Hereafter. A terrible torment awaits them.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 177: Those who exchange blasphemy for faith will not harm God in the least. A painful torment awaits them.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 178: Those who disbelieve should not assume that We respite them for their own good. In fact, We only respite them so that they may increase in sinfulness. A humiliating torment awaits them.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 179: God will not leave the believers as you are, without distinguishing the wicked from the sincere. Nor will God inform you of the future, but God elects from among His messengers whom He wills. So believe in God and His messengers. If you believe and practice piety, you will have a splendid reward.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 180: Those who withhold what God has given them of his bounty should not assume that is good for them. In fact, it is bad for them. They will be encircled by their hoardings on the Day of Resurrection. To God belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth, and God is well acquainted with what you do.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 181: God has heard the statement of those who said, "God is poor, and we are rich." We will write down what they said, and their wrongful killing of the prophets; and We will say, "Taste the torment of the burning."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 182: "This is on account of what your hands have forwarded, and because God is not unjust towards the creatures."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 183: Those who said, "God has made a covenant with us, that we shall not believe in any messenger unless he brings us an offering to be consumed by fire." Say, "Messengers have come to you before me with proofs, and with what you asked for; so why did you assassinate them, if you are truthful?"
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 184: If they accuse you of lying, messengers before you were accused of lying. They came with the proofs, and the Psalms, and the Illuminating Scripture.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 185: Every soul will have a taste of death, and you will receive your recompense on the Day of Resurrection. Whoever is swayed from the Fire, and admitted to Paradise, has won. The life of this world is merely enjoyment of delusion.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 186: You will be tested through your possessions and your persons; and you will hear from those who received the Scripture before you, and from the idol worshipers, much abuse. But if you persevere and lead a righteous life-that indeed is a mark of great determination.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 187: God received a pledge from those who were given the Scripture: "You shall proclaim it to the people, and not conceal it." But they disregarded it behind their backs, and exchanged it for a small price. What a miserable exchange they made.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 188: Do not think that those who rejoice in what they have done, and love to be praised for what they have not done-do not think they can evade the punishment. They will have a painful punishment.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 189: To God belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. God has power over all things.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 190: In the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, are signs for people of understanding.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 191: Those who remember God while standing, and sitting, and on their sides; and they reflect upon the creation of the heavens and the earth: "Our Lord, You did not create this in vain, glory to You, so protect us from the punishment of the Fire."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 192: "Our Lord, whomever You commit to the Fire, You have disgraced. The wrongdoers will have no helpers."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 193: "Our Lord, we have heard a caller calling to the faith: `Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins, and remit our misdeeds, and make us die in the company of the virtuous."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 194: "Our Lord, and give us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Surely You never break a promise."

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 195: And so their Lord answered them: "I will not waste the work of any worker among you, whether male or female. You are one of another. For those who emigrated, and were expelled from their homes, and were persecuted because of Me, and fought and were killed-I will remit for them their sins, and will admit them into gardens beneath which rivers flow-a reward from God. With God is the ultimate reward."
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 196: Do not be impressed by the disbelievers' movements in the land.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 197: A brief enjoyment, then their abode is Hell. What a miserable resort.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 198: As for those who feared their Lord: for them will be gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever-hospitality from God. What God possesses is best for the just.

Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 199: Among the People of the Scripture are those who believe in God, and in what was revealed to you, and in what was revealed to them. They are humble before God, and they do not sell God's revelations for a cheap price. These will have their reward with their Lord. God is swift in reckoning.
Surah Ali Imran, Ayah 200: O you who believe! Be patient, and advocate patience, and be united, and revere God, so that you may thrive.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 2: The Romans have been defeated.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 3: In a nearby territory. But following their defeat, they will be victorious.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 4: In a few years. The matter is up to God, in the past, and in the future. On that day, the believers will rejoice.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 5: In God's support. He supports whomever He wills. He is the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 6: The promise of God-God never breaks His promise, but most people do not know.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 7: They know an outer aspect of the worldly life, but they are heedless of the Hereafter.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 8: Do they not reflect within themselves? God did not create the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, except with reason, and for a specific duration. But most people, regarding meeting their Lord, are disbelievers.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 9: Have they not travelled the earth and seen how those before them ended up? They were more powerful than them, and they cultivated the land and developed it more than they developed it, and their messengers came to them with clear signs. God would never wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 10: Then, evil was the end of those who committed evil. That is because they rejected God's revelations, and used to ridicule them.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 11: God originates creation, and then repeats it. Then to Him you will be returned.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 12: On the Day when the Hour takes place, the guilty will despair.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 13: They will have no intercessors from among their idols, and they will disown their partners.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 14: On the Day when the Hour takes place-on that Day they will separate.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 15: As for those who believed and did good deeds-they will be delighted in meadows.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 16: But as for those who disbelieved, and rejected Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter-those will be hauled into the torment.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 17: So glorify God when you retire at night, and when you rise in the morning.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 18: His is the praise in the heavens and on earth, and in the evening, and when you reach midday.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 19: He brings the living out of the dead, and He brings the dead out of the living, and He revives the land after it had died. Likewise you will be resurrected.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 20: And of His signs is that He created you from dust; and behold, you become humans spreading out.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 21: And of His signs is that He created for you mates from among yourselves, so that you may find tranquility in them; and He planted love and compassion between you. In this are signs for people who reflect.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 22: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of your languages and colors. In this are signs for those who know.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 23: And of His signs are your sleep by night and day, and your pursuit of His bounty. In this are signs for people who listen.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 24: And of His signs is that He shows you the lightning, causing fear and hope. And He brings down water from the sky, and with it He revives the earth after it was dead. In this are signs for people who understand.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 25: And of His signs is that the heaven and the earth stand at His disposal. And then, when He calls you out of the earth, you will emerge at once.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 26: To Him belongs everyone in the heavens and the earth. All are submissive to Him.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 27: It is He who initiates creation, and then repeats it, something easy for Him. His is the highest attribute, in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, the Wise.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 28: He illustrates an example for you, from your own selves: do you make your servants full partners in the wealth We have given you? Do you revere them as you revere one another? We thus explain the revelations for a people who understand.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 29: Yet the wrongdoers follow their desires without knowledge. But who can guide whom God leaves astray? They will have no helpers.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 30: So devote yourself to the religion of monotheism-the natural instinct God has instilled in mankind. There is no altering God's creation. This is the true religion, but most people do not know.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 31: Turning towards Him-and be conscious of Him, and perform the prayer, and do not be of the idolaters.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 32: Of those who divided their religion, and became sects; each faction pleased with what they have.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 33: When affliction touches the people, they call on their Lord, turning to Him in repentance. But then, when He gives them a taste of His mercy, some of them attribute partners to their Lord.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 34: To show ingratitude for what We have given them. Indulge yourselves-you will surely know.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 35: Have We sent down to them any authority, which speaks in support of their idols?
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 36: When We give people a taste of mercy, they rejoice in it. But when adversity befalls them, because of what their hands have perpetrated, they begin to despair.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 37: Do they not see that God expands the provision for whomever He wills, or restricts it? Surely in this are signs for people who believe.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 38: So give the relative his rights, and the destitute, and the wayfarer. That is best for those who seek God's presence. Those are the prosperous.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 39: The usury you practice, seeking thereby to multiply people's wealth, will not multiply with God. But what you give in charity, desiring God's approval-these are the multipliers.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 40: God is He who created you, then provides for you, then makes you die, then brings you back to life. Can any of your idols do any of that? Glorified is He, and Exalted above what they associate.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 41: Corruption has appeared on land and sea, because of what people's hands have earned, in order to make them taste some of what they have done, so that they might return.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 42: Say, "Roam the earth, and observe the fate of those who came before. Most of them were idolaters."
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 43: So devote yourself to the upright religion, before there comes from God a Day that cannot be averted. On that Day, they will be shocked.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 44: Whoever disbelieves, upon him falls his disbelief. And whoever acts righteously-they are preparing for themselves.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 45: So that He may reward those who have believed and done the righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not love the ungrateful.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 46: And of His signs is that He sends the winds bearing good news, to give you a taste of His mercy, and so that the ships may sail by His command, and so that you may seek of His bounty, and so that you may give thanks.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 47: Before you, We sent messengers to their people. They came to them with clear proofs. Then We took revenge on those who sinned. It is incumbent on Us to help the believers.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 48: God is He who sends the winds. They stir up clouds. Then He spreads them in the sky as He wills. And He breaks them apart. Then you see rain drops issuing from their midst. Then, when He makes it fall upon whom He wills of His servants, behold, they rejoice.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 49: Although they were before this-before it was sent down upon them-in despair.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 50: So observe the effects of God's mercy-how He revives the earth after it was dead. Indeed, He is the Reviver of the dead. He is Capable of everything.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 51: But if We send a wind, and they see it turning things yellow, they would continue thereafter to disbelieve.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 52: You cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn away.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 53: Nor can you guide the blind out of their error. You can make hear only those who believe in Our signs, and so have submitted.

Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 54: God is He Who created you weak, then after weakness gave you strength, then after strength gave you weakness and gray hair. He creates whatever He wills. He is the Omniscient, the Omnipotent.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 55: On the Day when the Hour takes place, the sinners will swear they had stayed but an hour. Thus they were deluded.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 56: But those endowed with knowledge and faith will say, "You remained in God's Book until the Day of Resurrection. This is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know."
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 57: On that Day, the sinners' excuses will not benefit them, nor will they be excused.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 58: We have cited in this Quran for the people every sort of parable. But even if you bring them a miracle, those who disbelieve will say, "You are nothing but fakers."
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 59: God thus seals the hearts of those who do not know.
Surah ar-Rum, Ayah 60: So be patient. The promise of God is true. And do not let those who lack certainty belittle you.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 2: These are the Verses of the Wise Book.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 3: A guide and a mercy for the righteous.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 4: Those who observe the prayer, and pay the obligatory charity, and are certain of the Hereafter.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 5: These are upon guidance from their Lord. These are the successful.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 6: Among the people is he who trades in distracting tales; intending, without knowledge, to lead away from God's way, and to make a mockery of it. These will have a humiliating punishment.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 7: And when Our Verses are recited to him, he turns away in pride, as though he did not hear them, as though there is deafness in his ears. So inform him of a painful punishment.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 8: As for those who believe and do good deeds-for them are the Gardens of Bliss.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 9: Dwelling therein forever. The promise of God is true. He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 10: He created the heavens without pillars that you can see, and placed stabilizers on earth lest it shifts with you, and scattered throughout it all kinds of creatures. And from the sky We sent down water, and caused to grow therein of every noble pair.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 11: Such is God's creation. Now show me what those besides Him have created. In fact, the wicked are in obvious error.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 12: We endowed Luqman with wisdom: "Give thanks to God." Whoever is appreciative-is appreciative for the benefit of his own soul. And whoever is unappreciative-God is Sufficient and Praiseworthy.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 13: When Luqman said to his son, as he advised him, "O my son, do not associate anything with God, for idolatry is a terrible wrong."

Surah Luqman, Ayah 14: We have entrusted the human being with the care of his parents. His mother carried him through hardship upon hardship, weaning him in two years. So give thanks to Me, and to your parents. To Me is the destination.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 15: But if they strive to have you associate with Me something of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. But keep them company in this life, in kindness, and follow the path of him who turns to Me. Then to Me is your return; and I will inform you of what you used to do.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 16: "O my son, even if it were the weight of a mustard-seed, in a rock, or in the heavens, or on earth, God will bring it to light. God is Kind and Expert.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 17: O my son, observe the prayer, advocate righteousness, forbid evil, and be patient over what has befallen you. These are of the most honorable traits.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 18: And do not treat people with arrogance, nor walk proudly on earth. God does not love the arrogant showoffs.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 19: And moderate your stride, and lower your voice. The most repulsive of voices is the donkey's voice."

Surah Luqman, Ayah 20: Do you not see how God placed at your service everything in the heavens and the earth? How He showered you with His blessings, both outward and inward? Yet among the people is he who argues about God without knowledge, without guidance, and without an enlightening Scripture.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 21: And when it is said to them, "Follow what God has revealed," they say, "Rather, we follow what we found our parents devoted to." Even if Satan is calling them to the suffering of the Blaze?
Surah Luqman, Ayah 22: Whoever submits himself wholly to God, and is a doer of good, has grasped the most trustworthy handle. With God rests the outcome of all events.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 23: Whoever disbelieves-let not his disbelief sadden you. To Us is their return. Then We will inform them of what they did. God knows what lies within the hearts.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 24: We give them a little comfort; then We compel them to a harsh torment.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 25: And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" They will say, "God." Say, "Praise be to God." But most of them do not know.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 26: To God belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. God is the Rich, the Praised.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 27: If all the trees on earth were pens, filled by the ocean, with seven more oceans besides, the Words of God would not run out. God is Majestic and Wise.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 28: Your creation and your resurrection are only as a single soul. God is Hearing and Seeing.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 29: Have you not seen how God merges the night into the day, and merges the day into the night? That He subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a stated term? And that God is Cognizant of everything you do?
Surah Luqman, Ayah 30: That is because God is the Reality, and what they worship besides Him is falsehood, and because God is the Exalted, the Supreme.
Surah Luqman, Ayah 31: Have you not seen how the ships sail through the sea, by the grace of God, to show you of His wonders? In that are signs for every persevering, thankful person.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 32: When waves, like canopies, cover them, they call upon God, devoting their religion to Him. But when He has delivered them to dry land, some of them waver. No one renounces Our revelations except the treacherous blasphemer.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 33: O people! Be conscious of your Lord, and dread a Day when no parent can avail his child, nor can a child avail his parent, in anything. The promise of God is true. Therefore, do not let this life deceive you, nor let illusions deceive you regarding God.

Surah Luqman, Ayah 34: With God rests the knowledge of the Hour. He sends down the rain, and He knows what the wombs contain. No soul knows what it will reap tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. God is All-Knowing, Well-Informed.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 2: The revelation of the Book, without a doubt, is from the Lord of the Universe.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 3: Yet they say, "He made it up." In fact, it is the Truth from your Lord, to warn a people who received no warner before you, that they may be guided.

Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 4: God is He who created the heavens and the earth and everything between them in six days, and then established Himself on the Throne. Apart from Him, you have no master and no intercessor. Will you not reflect?
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 5: He regulates all affairs, from the heavens, to the earth. Then it ascends to Him on a Day the length of which is a thousand years by your count.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 6: That is the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, the Powerful, the Merciful.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 7: He who perfected everything He created, and originated the creation of man from clay.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 8: Then made his reproduction from an extract of an insignificant fluid.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 9: Then He proportioned him, and breathed into him of His Spirit. Then He gave you the hearing, and the eyesight, and the brains-but rarely do you give thanks.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 10: And they say, "When we are lost into the earth, shall we be in a new creation?" In fact, they deny the meeting with their Lord.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 11: Say, "The angel of death put in charge of you will reclaim you. Then to your Lord you will be returned."

Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 12: If only you could see the guilty, bowing their heads before their Lord: "Our Lord, we have seen and we have heard, so send us back, and we will act righteously; we are now convinced."
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 13: Had We willed, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the declaration from Me will come true: "I will fill Hell with jinn and humans, altogether."
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 14: So taste, because you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours; We have forgotten you; so taste the eternal torment for what you used to do.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 15: They believe in Our communications, those who, when reminded of them, fall down prostrate, and glorify their Lord with praise, and are not proud.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 16: Their sides shun their beds, as they pray to their Lord, out of reverence and hope; and from Our provisions to them, they give.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 17: No soul knows what eye's delight awaits them-a reward for what they used to do.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 18: Is someone who is faithful like someone who is a sinner? They are not equal.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 19: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them are the Gardens of Shelter-hospitality for what they used to do.

Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 20: But as for those who transgressed, their shelter is the Fire. Every time they try to get out of it, they will be brought back into it, and it will be said to them, "Taste the suffering of the Fire which you used to deny."
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 21: We will make them taste the lesser torment, prior to the greater torment, so that they may return.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 22: Who is more wrong than he, who, when reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them? We will certainly wreak vengeance upon the criminals.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 23: We gave Moses the Book; so do not be in doubt regarding His encounter; and We made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 24: And We appointed leaders from among them, guiding by Our command, as long as they persevered and were certain of Our communications.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 25: Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding everything they had disputed.
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 26: Is it not a lesson for them, how many generations We have destroyed before them, in whose habitations they walk? Surely in that are signs. Do they not hear?
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 27: Do they not see how We conduct the water to a dry land, and with it We produce vegetation, from which their livestock eat, and themselves? Do they not see?
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 28: And they say, "When is this victory, if you are truthful?"
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 29: Say, "On the day of victory, the faith of those who disbelieved will be of no avail to them, and they will not be granted respite."
Surah as-Sajdah, Ayah 30: So turn away from them, and wait. They too are waiting.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 1: O Prophet! Fear God, and do not obey the unbelievers and the hypocrites. God is Knowledgeable and Wise.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 2: And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. God is fully aware of what you do.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 3: And put your trust in God. God is enough as a trustee.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 4: God did not place two hearts inside any man's body. Nor did He make your wives whom you equate with your mothers, your actual mothers. Nor did He make your adopted sons, your actual sons. These are your words coming out of your mouths. God speaks the truth, and guides to the path.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 5: Call them after their fathers; that is more equitable with God. But if you do not know their fathers, then your brethren in faith and your friends. There is no blame on you if you err therein, barring what your hearts premeditates. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 6: The Prophet is more caring of the believers than they are of themselves, and his wives are mothers to them. And blood-relatives are closer to one another in God's Book than the believers or the emigrants, though you should do good to your friends. That is inscribed in the Book.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 7: Recall that We received a pledge from the prophets, and from you, and from Noah, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus son of Mary. We received from them a solemn pledge.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 8: That He may ask the sincere about their sincerity. He has prepared for the disbelievers a painful punishment.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 9: O you who believe! Remember God's blessings upon you, when forces came against you, and We sent against them a wind, and forces you did not see. God is Observant of what you do.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 10: When they came upon you, from above you, and from beneath you; and the eyes became dazed, and the hearts reached the throats, and you harbored doubts about God.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 11: There and then the believers were tested, and were shaken most severely.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 12: When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is sickness said, "God and His Messenger promised us nothing but illusion."

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 13: And when a group of them said, "O people of Yathrib, you cannot make a stand, so retreat." And a faction of them asked the Prophet to excuse them, saying, "Our homes are exposed," although they were not exposed. They only wanted to flee.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 14: Had it been invaded from its sides, and they were asked to dissent, they would have done so with little hesitation.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 15: Although they had made a pledged to God, in the past, that they will not turn their backs. A pledge to God is a responsibility.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 16: Say, "Flight will not benefit you, if you flee from death or killing, even then you will be given only brief enjoyment."

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 17: Say, "Who is it who will shield you from God, if He intends adversity for you, or intends mercy for you?" Besides God, they will find for themselves neither friend nor helper.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 18: God already knows the hinderers among you, and those who say to their brethren, "Come and join us." Rarely do they mobilize for battle.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 19: Being stingy towards you. And when fear approaches, you see them staring at you-their eyes rolling-like someone fainting at death. Then, when panic is over, they whip you with sharp tongues. They resent you any good. These have never believed, so God has nullified their works; a matter easy for God.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 20: They assumed that the confederates had not withdrawn. But were the confederates to advance, they would wish they were in the desert with the Bedouins, inquiring about your news. And if they were among you, they would have done little fighting.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 21: You have an excellent example in the Messenger of God; for anyone who seeks God and the Last Day, and remembers God frequently.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 22: And when the believers saw the confederates, they said, "This is what God and His messenger have promised us; and God and His messenger have told the truth." And it only increased them in faith and submission.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 23: Of the believers are men who are true to what they pledged to God. Some of them have fulfilled their vows; and some are still waiting, and never wavering.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 24: That God may reward the truthful for their truthfulness; and punish the hypocrites, if He wills, or pardon them. God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 25: God repelled the disbelievers in their rage; they gained no advantage. God thus spared the believers combat. God is Strong and Mighty.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 26: And He brought down from their strongholds those of the People of the Book who backed them, and He threw terror into their hearts. Some of them you killed, and others you took captive.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 27: And He made you inherit their land, and their homes, and their possessions, and a region you have never stepped on. God has power over all things.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 28: O Prophet! Say to your wives, "If you desire the life of this world and its finery, then let me compensate you, and release you kindly.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 29: But if you desire God, His Messenger, and the Home of the Hereafter, then God has prepared for the righteous among you a magnificent compensation."
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 30: O wives of the Prophet! Whoever of you commits a proven indecency, the punishment for her will be doubled. And that would be easy for God.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 31: But whoever of you remains obedient to God and His Messenger, and acts righteously, We will give her a double reward; and We have prepared for her a generous provision.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 32: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women, if you observe piety. So do not speak too softly, lest the sick at heart lusts after you, but speak in an appropriate manner.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 33: And settle in your homes; and do not display yourselves, as in the former days of ignorance. And perform the prayer, and give regular charity, and obey God and His Messenger. God desires to remove all impurity from you, O People of the Household, and to purify you thoroughly.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 34: And remember what is recited in your homes of God's revelations and wisdom. God is Kind and Informed.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 35: Muslim men and Muslim women, believing men and believing women, obedient men and obedient women, truthful men and truthful women, patient men and patient women, humble men and humble women, charitable men and charitable women, fasting men and fasting women, men who guard their chastity and women who guard, men who remember God frequently and women who remember-God has prepared for them a pardon, and an immense reward.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 36: It is not for any believer, man or woman, when God and His Messenger have decided a matter, to have liberty of choice in their decision. Whoever disobeys God and His Messenger has gone far astray.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 37: When you said to him whom God had blessed, and you had favored, "Keep your wife to yourself, and fear God." But you hid within yourself what God was to reveal. And you feared the people, but it was God you were supposed to fear. Then, when Zaid ended his relationship with her, We gave her to you in marriage, that there may be no restriction for believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons, when their relationship has ended. The command of God was fulfilled.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 38: There is no blame on the Prophet regarding what God has ordained for him. Such is the pattern of God among those who passed before. The command of God is an absolute decree.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 39: Those who deliver the messages of God, and fear Him, and never fear anyone except God. God is sufficient as a reckoner.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 40: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men; but he is the Messenger of God, and the seal of the prophets. God is Cognizant of everything.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 41: O you who believe, remember God with frequent remembrance.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 42: And glorify Him morning and evening.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 43: It is He who reaches out to you, and His angels, to bring you out of darkness into the light. And He is Ever-Merciful towards the believers.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 44: Their greeting on the Day they meet Him is, "Peace," and He has prepared for them a generous reward.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 45: O prophet! We have sent you as a witness, and a bearer of good news, and a warner.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 46: And a caller towards God by His leave, and an illuminating beacon.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 47: And give the believers the good news that for them is a great reward.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 48: And do not obey the blasphemers and the hypocrites, and ignore their insults, and rely on God. God is a sufficient protector.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 49: O you who believe! When you marry believing women, but then divorce them before you have touched them, there is no waiting period for you to observe in respect to them; but compensate them, and release them in a graceful manner.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 50: O Prophet! We have permitted to you your wives to whom you have given their dowries, and those you already have, as granted to you by God, and the daughters of your paternal uncle, and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncle, and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you, and a believing woman who has offered herself to the Prophet, if the Prophet desires to marry her, exclusively for you, and not for the believers. We know what We have ordained for them regarding their wives and those their right-hands possess. This is to spare you any difficulty. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 51: You may defer any of them you wish, and receive any of them you wish. Should you desire any of those you had deferred, there is no blame on you. This is more proper, so that they will be comforted, and not be grieved, and be content with what you have given each one of them. God knows what is within your hearts. God is Omniscient and Clement.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 52: Beyond that, no other women are permissible for you, nor can you exchange them for other wives, even if you admire their beauty, except those you already have. God is Watchful over all things.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 53: O you who believe! Do not enter the homes of the Prophet, unless you are given permission to come for a meal; and do not wait for its preparation. And when you are invited, go in. And when you have eaten, disperse, without lingering for conversation. This irritates the Prophet, and he shies away from you, but God does not shy away from the truth. And when you ask his wives for something, ask them from behind a screen; that is purer for your hearts and their hearts. You must never offend the Messenger of God, nor must you ever marry his wives after him, for that would be an enormity with God.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 54: Whether you declare a thing, or hide it, God is Aware of all things.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 55: There is no blame on them concerning their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their women, or their female servants. But they should remain conscious of God. God is Witness over all things.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 56: God and His angels give blessings to the Prophet. O you who believe, call for blessings on him, and greet him with a prayer of peace.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 57: Those who insult God and His Messenger, God has cursed them in this life and in the Hereafter, and has prepared for them a demeaning punishment.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 58: Those who harm believing men and believing women, for acts they did not commit, bear the burden of perjury and a flagrant sin.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 59: O Prophet! Tell your wives, and your daughters, and the women of the believers, to lengthen their garments. That is more proper, so they will be recognized and not harassed. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 60: If the hypocrites, and those with sickness in their hearts, and the rumormongers in the City, do not desist, We will incite you against them; then they will not be your neighbors there except for a short while.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 61: They are cursed; wherever they are found, they should be captured and killed outright.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 62: Such has been God's precedent with those who passed away before. You will find no change in God's system.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 63: The people ask you about the Hour. Say, "The knowledge thereof rests with God. But what do you know? Perhaps the hour is near."
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 64: God has cursed the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a Blaze.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 65: Dwelling therein forever, not finding a protector or a savior.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 66: The Day when their faces are flipped into the Fire, they will say, "If only we had obeyed God and obeyed the Messenger."
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 67: And they will say, "Lord, we have obeyed our superiors and our dignitaries, but they led us away from the way.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 68: Lord, give them double the punishment, and curse them with a great curse."
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 69: O you who believe! Do not be like those who abused Moses; but God cleared him of what they said. He was distinguished with God.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 70: O you who believe! Be conscious of God, and speak in a straightforward manner.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 71: He will rectify your conduct for you, and will forgive you your sins. Whoever obeys God and His Messenger has won a great victory.

Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 72: We offered the Trust to the heavens, and the earth, and the mountains; but they refused to bear it, and were apprehensive of it; but the human being accepted it. He was unfair and ignorant.
Surah al-Ahzab, Ayah 73: God will punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the idolaters, men and women. And God will redeem the believers, men and women. God is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Surah Saba', Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Saba', Ayah 1: Praise be to God, to Whom belongs everything in the heavens and the earth; and praise be to Him in the Hereafter. He is the Wise, the Expert.
Surah Saba', Ayah 2: He knows what penetrates into the earth, and what comes out of it, and what descends from the sky, and what ascends to it. He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

Surah Saba', Ayah 3: Those who disbelieve say, "The Hour will not come upon us." Say, "Yes indeed, by my Lord, it will come upon you. He is the Knower of the unseen." Not an atom's weight in the heavens and the earth, or anything smaller or larger, escapes His knowledge. All are in a Clear Record.
Surah Saba', Ayah 4: That He may recompense those who believe and do good works. Those will have forgiveness, and a generous provision.
Surah Saba', Ayah 5: As for those who strive against Our revelations, seeking to undermine them-for them is a punishment of a painful plague.
Surah Saba', Ayah 6: Those who received knowledge know that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth; and it guides to the path of the Majestic, the Praiseworthy.
Surah Saba', Ayah 7: Those who disbelieved said, "Shall we point out to you a man, who will tell you that, once torn into shreds, you will be in a new creation?
Surah Saba', Ayah 8: Did he invent a lie about God, or is there madness in him?" Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in torment, and far astray.

Surah Saba', Ayah 9: Do they not reflect upon what lies before them and behind them, of the heaven and the earth? If We will, We can make the earth cave in beneath them, or make pieces of the sky fall down on them. In that is a sign for every devout servant.
Surah Saba', Ayah 10: We bestowed upon David favor from Us: "O mountains, and birds: echo with him." And We softened iron for him.
Surah Saba', Ayah 11: "Make coats of armor, and measure the links well; and work righteousness. I am Observant of everything you do."

Surah Saba', Ayah 12: And for Solomon the wind-its outward journey was one month, and its return journey was one month. And We made a spring of tar flow for him. And there were sprites that worked under him, by the leave of his Lord. But whoever of them swerved from Our command, We make him taste of the punishment of the Inferno.

Surah Saba', Ayah 13: They made for him whatever he wished: sanctuaries, statues, bowls like pools, and heavy cauldrons. "O House of David, work with appreciation," but a few of My servants are appreciative.

Surah Saba', Ayah 14: Then, when We decreed death for him, nothing indicated his death to them except an earthworm eating at his staff. Then, when he fell down, it became clear to the sprites that, had they known the unseen, they would not have remained in the demeaning torment.

Surah Saba', Ayah 15: In Sheba's homeland there used to be a wonder: two gardens, on the right, and on the left. "Eat of your Lord's provision, and give thanks to Him." A good land, and a forgiving Lord.

Surah Saba', Ayah 16: But they turned away, so We unleashed against them the flood of the dam; and We substituted their two gardens with two gardens of bitter fruits, thorny shrubs, and meager harvest.
Surah Saba', Ayah 17: We thus penalized them for their ingratitude. Would We penalize any but the ungrateful?
Surah Saba', Ayah 18: Between them and the towns We had blessed, We placed prominent towns, and We made the travel between them easy. "Travel between them by night and day, in safety."

Surah Saba', Ayah 19: But they said, "Our Lord, lengthen the distances of our journeys." They wronged themselves; so We made them history, and We scattered them in every direction. In this are lessons for every steadfast and appreciative person.
Surah Saba', Ayah 20: Satan was correct in his assessment of them. They followed him, except for a group of believers.
Surah Saba', Ayah 21: He had no authority over them; except that We willed to distinguish him who believes in the Hereafter, from him who is doubtful about it. Your Lord is Guardian over all things.

Surah Saba', Ayah 22: Say, "Call upon those whom you claim besides God. They possess not an atom's weight in the heavens or the earth, and they possess no share of either, and He has no backers from among them."

Surah Saba', Ayah 23: Intercession with Him is of no value, except for someone He has permitted. Until, when fear has subsided from their hearts, they will say, "What did your Lord say?" They will say, "The truth, and He is the High, the Great."
Surah Saba', Ayah 24: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "God. And Either you, or we, are rightly guided, or in evident error."
Surah Saba', Ayah 25: Say, "You will not be asked about our misdeeds, nor will we be asked about what you do."
Surah Saba', Ayah 26: Say, "Our Lord will bring us together; then He will judge between us equitably. He is the All-Knowing Judge."
Surah Saba', Ayah 27: Say, "Show me those you have attached to Him as associates. No indeed! But He is God, the Powerful, the Wise."
Surah Saba', Ayah 28: We sent you only universally to all people, a herald and warner, but most people do not know.
Surah Saba', Ayah 29: And they say, "When is this promise due, if you are truthful?"
Surah Saba', Ayah 30: Say, "You are promised a Day, which you cannot postpone by one hour, nor bring forward."

Surah Saba', Ayah 31: Those who disbelieve say, "We will never believe in this Quran, nor in what came before it." If you could only see the wrongdoers, captive before their Lord, throwing back allegations at one another. Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Were it not for you, we would have been believers."
Surah Saba', Ayah 32: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Was it us who turned you away from guidance when it came to you? No indeed, you yourselves were sinful."

Surah Saba', Ayah 33: And those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "It was your scheming by night and day; as you instructed us to reject God, and to set up rivals to Him." They will hide their remorse when they see the retribution. We will put yokes around the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be repaid for anything other than what they used to do?
Surah Saba', Ayah 34: We sent no warner to any town, without its affluent saying, "We reject what you are sent with."
Surah Saba', Ayah 35: And they say, "We have more wealth and more children, and we will not be punished."
Surah Saba', Ayah 36: Say, "My Lord spreads out His bounty to whomever He wills, or restricts it; but most people do not know."

Surah Saba', Ayah 37: It is neither your wealth nor your children that bring you closer to Us, but it is he who believes and does good deeds. These will have a double reward for what they did; and they will reside in the Chambers, in peace and security.
Surah Saba', Ayah 38: But those who work against Our revelations, seeking to undermine them-those will be summoned to the punishment.
Surah Saba', Ayah 39: Say, "My Lord extends the provision to whomever He wills of His servants, or withholds it. Anything you spend, He will replace it. He is the Best of providers."
Surah Saba', Ayah 40: On the Day when He gathers them all together, then say to the angels, "Was it you these used to worship?"
Surah Saba', Ayah 41: They will say, "Be You glorified; You are our Master, not them. In fact, they used to worship the jinn, and most of them had faith in them."
Surah Saba', Ayah 42: "Today, none of you has the power to profit or harm the other." And We will say to those who did wrong, "Taste the agony of the Fire which you used to deny."

Surah Saba', Ayah 43: And when Our enlightening Verses are recited to them, they say, "This is nothing but a man who wants to divert you from what your ancestors used to worship." And they say, "This is nothing but a fabricated lie." And when the Truth comes to them, the blasphemers say of the Truth, "This is nothing but plain magic."
Surah Saba', Ayah 44: But We gave them no book to study, and We did not send them any warner before you.
Surah Saba', Ayah 45: Those before them also denied the Truth, yet they have not attained one-tenth of what We had given them. They rejected My messengers, so how was My disapproval?

Surah Saba', Ayah 46: Say, "I offer you a single advice: devote yourselves to God, in pairs, or individually; and reflect. There is no madness in your friend. He is just a warner to you, before the advent of a severe punishment."
Surah Saba', Ayah 47: Say, "Whatever compensation I have asked of you, is yours. My compensation comes only from God, and He is Witness over all things."
Surah Saba', Ayah 48: Say, "My Lord projects the truth. He is the Knower of the Unseen."
Surah Saba', Ayah 49: Say, "The Truth has come; while falsehood can neither originate, nor regenerate."
Surah Saba', Ayah 50: Say, "If I err, I err only to my own loss; but if I am guided, it is by what my Lord inspires me. He is Hearing and Near."
Surah Saba', Ayah 51: If you could only see when they are terrified, and there is no escape, and they are seized from a nearby place.
Surah Saba', Ayah 52: And they say, "We have believed in it." But how can they attain it from a distant place?
Surah Saba', Ayah 53: They have rejected it in the past, and made allegations from a far-off place.
Surah Saba', Ayah 54: A barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done formerly with their counterparts. They were in disturbing doubt.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 1: Praise be to God, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Maker of the angels messengers with wings-double, triple, and quadruple. He adds to creation as He wills. God is Able to do all things.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 2: Whatever mercy God unfolds for the people, none can withhold it. And if He withholds it, none can release it thereafter. He is the Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 3: O people! Remember God's blessings upon you. Is there a creator other than God who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no god but He. So how are you misled?
Surah Fathir, Ayah 4: If they reject you, messengers before you were also rejected. To God all matters are returned.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 5: O people! The promise of God is true; so let not the lowly life seduce you, and let not the Tempter tempt you away from God.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 6: Satan is an enemy to you, so treat him as an enemy. He only invites his gang to be among the inmates of the Inferno.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 7: Those who disbelieve will suffer a harsh punishment, but those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 8: What of him whose evil deed was made attractive to him, and so he regards it as good? God leads astray whomever He wills, and He guides whomever He wills. Therefore, do not waste yourself sorrowing over them. God knows exactly what they do.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 9: God is He who sends the winds, which agitate clouds, which We drive to a dead land, and thereby revive the ground after it had died. Likewise is the Resurrection.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 10: Whoever desires honor-all honor belongs to God. To Him ascends speech that is pure, and He elevates righteous conduct. As for those who plot evil, a terrible punishment awaits them, and the planning of these will fail.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 11: God created you from dust, then from a small drop; then He made you pairs. No female conceives, or delivers, except with His knowledge. No living thing advances in years, or its life is shortened, except it be in a Record. That is surely easy for God.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 12: The two seas are not the same. One is fresh, sweet, good to drink, while the other is salty and bitter. Yet from each you eat tender meat, and extract jewelry which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through them, so that you may seek of His bounty, so that you may give thanks.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 13: He merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night; and He regulates the sun and the moon, each running for a stated term. Such is God, your Lord; His is the sovereignty. As for those you call upon besides Him, they do not possess a speck.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 14: If you pray to them, they cannot hear your prayer. And even if they heard, they would not answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection, they will reject your partnership. None informs you like an Expert.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 15: O people! It is you who are the poor, in need of God; while God is the Rich, the Praiseworthy.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 16: If He wills, He can do away with you, and produce a new creation.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 17: And that would not be difficult for God.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 18: No burdened soul can carry the burden of another. Even if one weighted down calls for help with its burden, nothing can be lifted from it, even if they were related. You are to warn those who fear their Lord inwardly, and perform the prayer. He who purifies himself purifies himself for his own good. To God is the ultimate return.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 19: Not equal are the blind and the seeing.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 20: Nor are the darkness and the light.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 21: Nor are the shade and the torrid heat.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 22: Nor are equal the living and the dead. God causes whomever He wills to hear, but you cannot make those in the graves hear.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 23: You are only a warner.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 24: We sent you with the truth; a bearer of good news, and a warner. There is no community but a warner has passed through it.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 25: If they disbelieve you, those before them also disbelieved. Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs, with the Psalms, and with the Enlightening Scripture.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 26: Then I seized those who disbelieved-so how was My rejection?

Surah Fathir, Ayah 27: Have you not seen that God sends down water from the sky? With it We produce fruits of various colors. And in the mountains are streaks of white and red-varying in their hue-and pitch-black.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 28: Likewise, human beings, animals, and livestock come in various colors. From among His servants, the learned fear God. God is Almighty, Oft-Forgiving.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 29: Those who recite the Book of God, and perform the prayer, and spend of what We have provided for them, secretly and publicly, expect a trade that will not fail.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 30: He will pay them their dues in full, and will increase them from His bounty. He is Forgiving and Appreciative.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 31: What We inspired in you, of the Book, is the truth, confirming what preceded it. God is Well-Informed of His servants, All-Seeing.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 32: Then We passed the Book to those of Our servants whom We chose. Some of them wrong their souls, and some follow a middle course, and some are in the foremost in good deeds by God's leave; that is the greatest blessing.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 33: The Gardens of Eden, which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with gold bracelets and pearls, and their garments therein will be of silk.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 34: And they will say, "Praise God, who has lifted all sorrow from us. Our Lord is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 35: He Who settled us in the Home of Permanence, by His grace, where boredom will not touch us, and fatigue will not afflict us."

Surah Fathir, Ayah 36: As for those who disbelieve, for them is the Fire of Hell, wherein they will never be finished off and die, nor will its punishment be lightened for them. Thus We will repay every ingrate.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 37: And they will scream therein, "Our Lord, let us out, and we will act righteously, differently from the way we used to act." Did We not give you a life long enough, in which anyone who wanted to understand would have understood? And the warner did come to you. So taste. The evildoers will have no helper.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 38: God is the Knower of the future of the heavens and the earth. He knows what the hearts contain.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 39: It is He who made you successors on earth. Whoever disbelieves, his disbelief will recoil upon him. The disbelief of the disbelievers adds only to their Lord's disfavor of them. The disbelief of the disbelievers adds only to their perdition.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 40: Say, "Have you considered those partners of yours that you worship instead of God? Show me what they have created on earth. Or do they have any share in the heavens?" Or have We given them a book whose clear teachings they follow? In fact, the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusions.
Surah Fathir, Ayah 41: God holds the heavens and the earth, lest they fall apart. And were they to fall apart, there is none to hold them together except He. He is Most Clement, Most Forgiving.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 42: And they swore by God with their solemn oaths, that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than any other people. Yet when a warner came to them, it only increased them in aversion.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 43: Priding themselves on earth, and scheming evil. But evil scheming overwhelms none but its authors. Do they expect anything but the precedent of the ancients? You will not find any change in God's practice, and you will not find any substitute to God's practice.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 44: Have they not journeyed in the land and observed the fate of those who preceded them? They were superior to them in strength. But nothing can defeat God in the heavens or on Earth. He is indeed Omniscient and Omnipotent.

Surah Fathir, Ayah 45: If God were to punish the people for what they have earned, He would not leave a single living creature on its surface. But He defers them until a stated time. Then, when their time has arrived-God is Observant of His creatures.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 1: Ya, Seen.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 2: By the Wise Quran.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 3: You are one of the messengers.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 4: On a straight path.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 5: The revelation of the Almighty, the Merciful.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 6: To warn a people whose ancestors were not warned, and so they are unaware.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 7: The Word was realized against most of them, for they do not believe.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 8: We placed shackles around their necks, up to their chins, so they are stiff-necked.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 9: And We placed a barrier in front of them, and a barrier behind them, and We have enshrouded them, so they cannot see.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 10: It is the same for them, whether you warn them, or do not warn them-they will not believe.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 11: You warn only him who follows the Message, and fears the Most Gracious inwardly. So give him good news of forgiveness, and a generous reward.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 12: It is We who revive the dead; and We write down what they have forwarded, and their traces. We have tallied all things in a Clear Record.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 13: And cite for them the parable of the landlords of the town-when the messengers came to it.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 14: We sent them two messengers, but they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third. They said, "We are messengers to you."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 15: They said, "You are nothing but humans like us, and the Gracious did not send down anything; you are only lying."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 16: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 17: And our only duty is clear communication."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 18: They said, "We see an evil omen in you; if you do not give up, we will stone you, and a painful punishment from us will befall you."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 19: They said, "Your evil omen is upon you. Is it because you were reminded? But you are an extravagant people."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 20: Then a man came running from the remotest part of the city. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 21: Follow those who ask you of no wage, and are themselves guided.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 22: "And why should I not worship Him Who created me, and to Whom you will be returned?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 23: Shall I take other gods instead of Him? If the Merciful desires harm for me, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor will they save me.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 24: In that case, I would be completely lost.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 25: I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 26: It was said, "Enter Paradise." He said, "If only my people knew.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 27: How my Lord has forgiven me, and made me one of the honored."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 28: After him, We sent down no hosts from heaven to his people; nor would We ever send any down.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 29: It was just one Cry, and they were stilled.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 30: Alas for the servants. No messenger ever came to them, but they ridiculed him.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 31: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them; and that unto them they will not return?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 32: All of them, every single one of them, will be arraigned before Us.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 33: And there is a sign for them in the dead land: We give it life, and produce from it grains from which they eat.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 34: And We place in it gardens of palm-trees and vines, and cause springs to gush out of it.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 35: That they may eat from its fruits, although their hands did not make it. Will they not be appreciative?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 36: Glory be to Him who created all the pairs; of what the earth produces, and of their own selves, and of what they do not know.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 37: Another sign for them is the night: We strip the day out of it-and they are in darkness.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 38: And the sun runs towards its destination. Such is the design of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 39: And the moon: We have disposed it in phases, until it returns like the old twig.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 40: The sun is not to overtake the moon, nor is the night to outpace the day. Each floats in an orbit.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 41: Another sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the laden Ark.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 42: And We created for them the like of it, in which they ride.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 43: If We will, We can drown them-with no screaming to be heard from them, nor will they be saved.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 44: Except by a mercy from Us, and enjoyment for a while.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 45: Yet when it is said to them, "Beware of what lies before you, and what lies behind you, that you may receive mercy."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 46: Yet never came to them a sign of their Lord's signs, but they turned away from it.

Surah Yasin, Ayah 47: And when it is said to them, "Spend of what God has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Shall we feed someone whom God could feed, if He so willed? You must be deeply misguided."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 48: And they say, "When will this promise be, if you are truthful?"
Surah Yasin, Ayah 49: All they can expect is a single blast, which will seize them while they feud.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 50: They will not be able to make a will, nor will they return to their families.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 51: The Trumpet will be blown, then behold, they will rush from the tombs to their Lord.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 52: They will say, "Woe to us! Who resurrected us from our resting-place?" This is what the Most Gracious had promised, and the messengers have spoken the truth."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 53: It will be but a single scream; and behold, they will all be brought before Us.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 54: On that Day, no soul will be wronged in the least, and you will be recompensed only for what you used to do.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 55: The inhabitants of Paradise, on that Day, will be happily busy.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 56: They and their spouses, in shades, reclining on couches.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 57: They will have therein fruits. They will have whatever they call for.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 58: Peace-a saying from a Most Merciful Lord.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 59: But step aside today, you criminals.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 60: Did I not covenant with you, O Children of Adam, that you shall not serve the devil? That he is your sworn enemy?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 61: And that you shall serve Me? This is a straight path.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 62: He has misled a great multitude of you. Did you not understand?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 63: This is Hellfire, which you were promised.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 64: Roast in it today, because you persistently disbelieved.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 65: On this Day, We will seal their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to everything they had done.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 66: If We will, We can blind their eyes as they rush towards the path-but how will they see?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 67: And if We will, We can cripple them in their place; so they can neither move forward, nor go back.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 68: Whomever We grant old age, We reverse his development. Do they not understand?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 69: We did not teach him poetry, nor is it proper for him. It is only a reminder, and a Clear Quran.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 70: That he may warn whoever is alive, and prove the Word against the faithless.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 71: Have they not seen that We created for them, of Our Handiwork, livestock that they own?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 72: And We subdued them for them. Some they ride, and some they eat.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 73: And they have in them other benefits, and drinks. Will they not give thanks?
Surah Yasin, Ayah 74: Yet they have taken to themselves gods other than God, that perhaps they may be helped.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 75: They cannot help them, although they are arrayed as troops for them.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 76: So let their words not sadden you. We know what they conceal, and what they reveal.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 77: Does the human being not consider that We created him from a seed? Yet he becomes a fierce adversary.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 78: And he produces arguments against Us, and he forgets his own creation. He says, "Who will revive the bones when they have decayed?"
Surah Yasin, Ayah 79: Say, "He who initiated them in the first instance will revive them. He has knowledge of every creation."
Surah Yasin, Ayah 80: He who produced fuel for you from the green trees, with which you kindle a fire.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 81: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Certainly. He is the Supreme All-Knowing Creator.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 82: His command, when He wills a thing, is to say to it, "Be," and it comes to be.
Surah Yasin, Ayah 83: So glory be to Him in whose hand is the dominion of everything, and to Him you will be returned.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 1: By the aligners aligning.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 2: And the drivers driving.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 3: And the reciters of the Reminder.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 4: Your God is indeed One.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 5: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them; and Lord of the Easts.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 6: We have adorned the lower heaven with the beauty of the planets.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 7: And guarded it against every defiant devil.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 8: They cannot eavesdrop on the Supernal Elite, for they get bombarded from every side.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 9: Repelled-they will have a lingering torment.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 10: Except for him who snatches a fragment-he gets pursued by a piercing projectile.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 11: Inquire of them, "Are they more difficult to create, or the others We created?" We created them from sticky clay.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 12: But you wonder, and they ridicule.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 13: And when reminded, they pay no attention.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 14: And when they see a sign, they ridicule.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 15: And they say, "This is nothing but plain magic.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 16: When we have died and become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 17: And our ancestors of old?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 18: Say, "Yes indeed, and you will be totally subdued."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 19: It will be a single nudge, and they will be staring.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 20: They will say, "Woe to us. This is the Day of Judgment."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 21: "This is the Day of Separation which you used to deny.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 22: Gather those who did wrong, and their mates, and what they used to worship.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 23: Besides God, and lead them to the way to Hell.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 24: And stop them. They are to be questioned."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 25: What is the matter with you? Why do you not help one another?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 26: In fact, on that Day, they will be submissive.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 27: They will come to one another, questioning one another.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 28: They will say, "You used to come at us from the right."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 29: They will say, "You yourselves were not believers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 30: We had no authority over you. You yourselves were rebellious people.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 31: The Word of our Lord has been realized against us. We are tasting it.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 32: We seduced you. We were seducers."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 33: On that Day, they will share in the punishment.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 34: Thus We deal with the sinners.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 35: When it was said to them, "There is no god except God," they grew arrogant.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 36: And said, "Are we to abandon our gods for a mad poet?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 37: In fact, he came with the truth, and he confirmed the messengers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 38: Most assuredly, you will taste the painful punishment.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 39: And you will be repaid only for what you used to do.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 40: Except for God's sincere servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 41: For them is a known provision.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 42: Fruits; and they will be honored.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 43: In the Gardens of Bliss.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 44: On furnishings, facing one another.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 45: They will be offered a cup of pure drink.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 46: White; a delight to those who drink.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 47: Never polluted, and never intoxicating.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 48: With them will be bashful women with lovely eyes.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 49: As if they were closely guarded pearls.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 50: Then they will approach one another, questioning.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 51: One of them will say, "I used to have a friend.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 52: Who used to say, "Are you of those who believe?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 53: That after we die and become dust and bones, we will be called to account?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 54: He will say, "Will you have a look?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 55: He will look, and will see him in the pit of Hell.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 56: He will say, "By God, you almost ruined me.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 57: Were it not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among the arraigned."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 58: "We will not die.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 59: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 60: This is the supreme triumph.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 61: For the like of this let the workers work.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 62: Is this a better hospitality, or the Tree of Bitterness?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 63: We made it an ordeal for the unjust.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 64: It is a tree that grows from the bottom of Hell.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 65: Its fruits are like the devils' heads.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 66: They will eat from it, and fill their bellies with it.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 67: Then, on top of it, they will have a brew of boiling liquid.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 68: Then their return will be to the Blaze.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 69: They had found their parents astray.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 70: And rushed along in their footsteps.
