Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 71: And most of the ancients before them went astray.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 72: Even though We sent messengers to warn them.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 73: So observe the end of those who were warned.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 74: Except for the sincere servants of God.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 75: And Noah called out to Us, and We are the Best of responders.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 76: And We saved him and his family from the great calamity.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 77: And We made his descendants the survivors.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 78: And We left mention of him among those who succeeded.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 79: Peace be upon Noah among all people.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 80: We thus reward the righteous.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 81: He was one of Our believing servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 82: Then We drowned the others.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 83: Of his kind was Abraham.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 84: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 85: He said to his father and his people, "What are you worshiping?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 86: Is it falsified gods, instead of God, that you want?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 87: So what is your opinion about the Lord of the Worlds?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 88: Then he took a glance at the stars.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 89: And said, "I am sick."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 90: But they turned their backs on him, and went away.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 91: Then he turned to their gods, and said, "will you not eat?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 92: What is it with you, that you do not speak?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 93: Then he turned on them, striking with his right hand.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 94: And they came running towards him.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 95: He said, "Do you worship what you carve?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 96: When God created you, and what you manufacture?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 97: They said, "Build a pyre for him, and throw him into the furnace."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 98: They wished him ill, but We made them the losers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 99: He said, "I am going towards my Lord, and He will guide me."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 100: "My Lord, give me one of the righteous."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 101: So We gave him good news of a clement boy.

Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 102: Then, when he was old enough to accompany him, he said, "O My son, I see in a dream that I am sacrificing you; see what you think." He said, "O my Father, do as you are commanded; you will find me, God willing, one of the steadfast."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 103: Then, when they had submitted, and he put his forehead down.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 104: We called out to him, "O Abraham!
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 105: You have fulfilled the vision." Thus We reward the doers of good.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 106: This was certainly an evident test.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 107: And We redeemed him with a great sacrifice.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 108: And We left with him for later generations.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 109: Peace be upon Abraham.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 110: Thus We reward the doers of good.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 111: He was one of Our believing servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 112: And We gave him good news of Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 113: And We blessed him, and Isaac. But among their descendants are some who are righteous, and some who are clearly unjust to themselves.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 114: And We blessed Moses and Aaron.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 115: And We delivered them and their people from the terrible disaster.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 116: And We supported them, and so they were the victors.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 117: And We gave them the Clarifying Scripture.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 118: And We guided them upon the straight path.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 119: And We left with them for later generations.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 120: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 121: Thus We reward the righteous.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 122: They were of Our believing servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 123: Also Elijah was one of the messengers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 124: He said to his people, "Do you not fear?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 125: Do you call on Baal, and forsake the Best of creators?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 126: God is your Lord, and the Lord of your ancestors."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 127: But they called him a liar, and thus they will be brought forward.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 128: Except for God's sincere servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 129: And We left with him for later generations.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 130: Peace be upon the House of Elijah.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 131: Thus We reward the virtuous.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 132: He was one of Our believing servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 133: And Lot was one of the messengers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 134: We saved him and his family, all of them.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 135: Except for an old woman who lagged behind.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 136: Then We annihilated the others.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 137: You pass by them in the morning.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 138: And at night. Do you not understand?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 139: And Jonah was one of the messengers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 140: When he fled to the laden boat.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 141: He gambled and lost.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 142: Then the fish swallowed him, and he was to blame.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 143: Had he not been one of those who praised.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 144: He would have stayed in its belly until the Day they are raised.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 145: Then We threw him into the wilderness, and he was sick.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 146: And We made a gourd tree grow over him.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 147: Then We sent him to a hundred thousand, or more.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 148: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment for a while.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 149: Ask them, "Are the daughters for your Lord, while for them the sons?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 150: Or did We create the angels females, as they witnessed?"
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 151: No indeed! It is one of their lies when they say.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 152: "God has begotten." They are indeed lying.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 153: So He preferred girls over boys?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 154: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 155: Will you not reflect?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 156: Or do you have some clear proof?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 157: Then bring your book, if you are telling the truth.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 158: And they invented a relationship between Him and the jinn. But the jinn know that they will be arraigned.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 159: God be glorified, far above what they allege.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 160: Except for God's sincere servants.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 161: Surely, you and what you serve.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 162: Cannot seduce away from Him.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 163: Except for he who will be roasting in Hell.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 164: "There is not one of us but has an assigned position.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 165: And we are the arrangers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 166: And we are the glorifiers."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 167: Even though they used to say.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 168: "Had we received advice from the ancients.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 169: We would have been God's faithful servants."
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 170: But they rejected it, so they will find out.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 171: Our Word has already gone out to our servant messengers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 172: It is they who will be supported.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 173: And Our troops will be the victors.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 174: So disregard them for a while.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 175: And watch them-they will soon see.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 176: Are they seeking to hasten Our punishment?
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 177: When it descends into their yard, miserable will be the morning of those forewarned.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 178: So avoid them for a while.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 179: And watch-they will soon see.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 180: Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, beyond their allegations.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 181: And peace be upon the messengers.
Surah as-Shaffat, Ayah 182: And praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah Shad, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Shad, Ayah 1: Saad. By the renowned Quran.
Surah Shad, Ayah 2: Those who disbelieve are steeped in arrogance and defiance.
Surah Shad, Ayah 3: How many generations have We destroyed before them? They cried out when it was too late to escape.
Surah Shad, Ayah 4: And they marveled that a warner has come to them from among them. The disbelievers said, "This is a lying magician."
Surah Shad, Ayah 5: "Did he turn all the gods into one God? This is something strange."
Surah Shad, Ayah 6: The notables among them announced: "Go on, and hold fast to your gods. This is something planned.
Surah Shad, Ayah 7: We never heard of this in the former faith. This is nothing but a fabrication.
Surah Shad, Ayah 8: Was the message sent down to him, out of all of us?" In fact, they are doubtful of My warning. In fact, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
Surah Shad, Ayah 9: Or do they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord-the Majestic, the Giver?
Surah Shad, Ayah 10: Or do they possess the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend the ropes.
Surah Shad, Ayah 11: An army of confederates with be defeated there.
Surah Shad, Ayah 12: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth; as did Aad, and Pharaoh of the Stakes.
Surah Shad, Ayah 13: And Thamood, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the Woods-these were the confederates.
Surah Shad, Ayah 14: None of them but denied the messengers, so My retribution was deserved.
Surah Shad, Ayah 15: These can expect only a single scream, from which there is no recovery.
Surah Shad, Ayah 16: And they say, "Our Lord, hasten Your writ upon us, before the Day of Account."
Surah Shad, Ayah 17: Be patient in the face of what they say, and mention Our servant David, the resourceful. He was obedient.
Surah Shad, Ayah 18: We committed the mountains to glorify with him, in the evening and at daybreak.
Surah Shad, Ayah 19: And the birds, gathered together. All obedient to him.
Surah Shad, Ayah 20: And We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.
Surah Shad, Ayah 21: Has the story of the two disputants reached you? When they scaled the sanctuary?

Surah Shad, Ayah 22: When they entered upon David, and he was startled by them. They said, "Do not fear. Two disputants; one of us has wronged the other; so judge between us fairly, and do not be biased, and guide us to the straight way."
Surah Shad, Ayah 23: "This brother of mine has ninety nine ewes, and I have one ewe, and he said, 'Entrust it to me,' and he pressured me with words."

Surah Shad, Ayah 24: He said, "He has done you wrong by asking your ewe in addition to his ewes. Many partners take advantage of one another, except those who believe and do good deeds, but these are so few." David realized that We were testing him, so he sought forgiveness from his Lord, and fell down to his knees, and repented.
Surah Shad, Ayah 25: So We forgave him that. And for him is nearness to Us, and a good place of return.

Surah Shad, Ayah 26: "O David, We made you a ruler in the land, so judge between the people with justice, and do not follow desire, lest it diverts you from God's path. Those who stray from God's path will have a painful punishment, for having ignored the Day of Account."
Surah Shad, Ayah 27: We did not create the heaven and the earth and everything between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve-so woe to those who disbelieve because of the Fire.
Surah Shad, Ayah 28: Or are We to treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who make trouble on earth? Or are We to treat the pious like the shameless?
Surah Shad, Ayah 29: A blessed Book that We sent down to you, that they may ponder its Verses, and for those with intelligence to take heed.
Surah Shad, Ayah 30: And We granted David, Solomon, an excellent servant. He was penitent.
Surah Shad, Ayah 31: When the beautiful horses were paraded before him in the evening.
Surah Shad, Ayah 32: He said, "I have preferred the love of niceties to the remembrance of my Lord-until it disappeared behind the veil.
Surah Shad, Ayah 33: Bring them back to me." And he began caressing their legs and necks.
Surah Shad, Ayah 34: We tested Solomon, and placed a body on his throne; then he repented.
Surah Shad, Ayah 35: He said, "My Lord, forgive me, and grant me a kingdom never to be attained by anyone after me. You are the Giver."
Surah Shad, Ayah 36: So We placed the wind at his service, blowing gently by his command, wherever he directed.
Surah Shad, Ayah 37: And the demons-every builder and diver.
Surah Shad, Ayah 38: And others fettered in chains.
Surah Shad, Ayah 39: "This is Our gift; so give generously, or withhold; without account."
Surah Shad, Ayah 40: For him is nearness to Us, and a beautiful resort.
Surah Shad, Ayah 41: And mention Our servant Job, when he called out to his Lord, "Satan has afflicted me with hardship and pain."
Surah Shad, Ayah 42: "Stamp with your foot-here is cool water to wash with, and to drink."
Surah Shad, Ayah 43: And We restored his family for him, and their like with them; as a mercy from Us, and a lesson for those who possess insight.
Surah Shad, Ayah 44: "Take with your hand a bundle, and strike with it, and do not break your oath." We found him patient. What an excellent servant! He was obedient.
Surah Shad, Ayah 45: And mention Our servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob-endowed with ability and vision.
Surah Shad, Ayah 46: We distinguished them with a distinct quality: the remembrance of the Home.
Surah Shad, Ayah 47: To Us they are among the chosen, the outstanding.
Surah Shad, Ayah 48: And mention Ishmael, Elisha, and Ezekiel; all are among the outstanding.
Surah Shad, Ayah 49: This is a reminder. The devout will have a good place of return.
Surah Shad, Ayah 50: The Gardens of Eden, with their doors wide-open for them.
Surah Shad, Ayah 51: Relaxing therein, and calling for abundant fruit and beverage.
Surah Shad, Ayah 52: With them will be attendants with modest gaze, of same age.
Surah Shad, Ayah 53: This is what you are promised for the Day of Account.
Surah Shad, Ayah 54: Such is Our bounty, inexhaustible.
Surah Shad, Ayah 55: All This. But the transgressors will have a miserable return.
Surah Shad, Ayah 56: Hell; in which they will roast; what a miserable abode!
Surah Shad, Ayah 57: All this. Let them taste it-boiling and bitter cold.
Surah Shad, Ayah 58: And similar torments of diverse kinds.
Surah Shad, Ayah 59: "This is a crowd rushing headlong with you." There is no welcome for them. They will be scorched by the Fire.
Surah Shad, Ayah 60: They will say, "But it is you! There is no welcome for you! It is you who brought it upon us! What a miserable end!"
Surah Shad, Ayah 61: They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us, give him double torment in the Fire."
Surah Shad, Ayah 62: And they will say, "What is it with us that we do not see men we used to count among the wicked?
Surah Shad, Ayah 63: Did we take them for mockery, or have our eyes swerved from them?
Surah Shad, Ayah 64: This is certainly true-the feuding of the people of the Fire.
Surah Shad, Ayah 65: Say, "I am only a warner, and there is no god except God-the One, the Conqueror.
Surah Shad, Ayah 66: The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them; the Mighty, the Forgiver."
Surah Shad, Ayah 67: Say, "It is a message of great importance.
Surah Shad, Ayah 68: From which you are turning away.
Surah Shad, Ayah 69: I have no knowledge of the Highest Assembly as they dispute.
Surah Shad, Ayah 70: It is only revealed to me that I am a clear warner."
Surah Shad, Ayah 71: Your Lord said to the angels, "I am creating a human being from clay.
Surah Shad, Ayah 72: When I have formed him, and breathed into him of My spirit, fall prostrate before him.
Surah Shad, Ayah 73: So the angels fell prostrate, all of them.
Surah Shad, Ayah 74: Except for Satan. He was too proud, and one of the faithless.
Surah Shad, Ayah 75: He said, "O Satan, what prevented you from prostrating before what I created with My Own hands? Are you too proud, or were you one of the exalted?"
Surah Shad, Ayah 76: He said, "I am better than he; You created me from fire, and You created him from clay."
Surah Shad, Ayah 77: He said, "Then get out of here! You are an outcast!
Surah Shad, Ayah 78: And My curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment."
Surah Shad, Ayah 79: He said, "Lord, defer me until the Day they are resurrected."
Surah Shad, Ayah 80: He said, "You are one of those deferred.
Surah Shad, Ayah 81: Until the Day of the Time Appointed."
Surah Shad, Ayah 82: He said, "By Your majesty, I will seduce them all.
Surah Shad, Ayah 83: Except for your loyal servants among them."
Surah Shad, Ayah 84: He said, "The truth is, and I say the truth.
Surah Shad, Ayah 85: I will fill Hell with you, and with every one of them who follows you."
Surah Shad, Ayah 86: Say, "I ask of you no wage for this, and I am not a pretender.
Surah Shad, Ayah 87: It is but a reminder to mankind.
Surah Shad, Ayah 88: And you will know its message after a while."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 1: The revelation of the Book is from God, the Mighty and Wise.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 2: We sent down to you the Book with the truth, so serve God, devoting your religion to Him.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 3: Is not to God that sincere faith is due? As for those who take guardians besides Him, "We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to God." God will judge between them regarding their differences. God does not guide the lying blasphemer.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 4: If God wanted to have a son, He could have selected from His creation at will. Glory be to Him. He is God, the One, the Prevailing.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 5: He created the heavens and the earth with reason. He wraps the night around the day, and He wraps the day around the night. And He regulates the sun and the moon, each running along a specific course. He is indeed the Almighty, the Forgiver.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 6: He created you from one person, then made from it its mate, and brought down livestock for you-eight kinds in pairs. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, in successive formations, in a triple darkness. Such is God, your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no god but He. So what made you deviate?

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 7: If you disbelieve, God is Independent of you, yet He does not approve ingratitude on the part of His servants. And if you are thankful, He will approve that in you. No bearer of burden can bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return; and He will inform you of what you used to do. He is aware of what the hearts contain.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 8: When some adversity touches the human being, he prays to his Lord, repenting to Him. But then, when He confers on him a grace of His, he forgets what he was praying for before, and he attributes rivals to God, in order to lead astray from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little while; you will be among the inmates of the Fire."

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 9: Is he who worships devoutly during the watches of the night, prostrating himself and standing up, mindful of the Hereafter, and placing his hope in the mercy of his Lord? Say, "Are those who know and those who do not know equal?" Only those possessed of reason will remember.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 10: Say, "O My devotees who have believed, keep your duty to your Lord. For those who do good in this world, is goodness. And God's earth is vast. The steadfast will be paid their wages in full, without reckoning."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 11: Say, "I was commanded to serve God, devoting my religion exclusively to Him.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 12: And I was commanded to be the first of those who submit."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 13: Say, "I fear, if I disobeyed my Lord, the punishment of a horrendous Day."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 14: Say, "It is God I worship, sincere in my faith in Him."

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 15: "But you can worship whatever you wish besides Him." Say, "The losers are those who lose their souls and their people on the Day of Resurrection." That is indeed the obvious loss.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 16: They will have layers of Fire above them, and layers beneath them. That is how God strikes fear into His servants-"O My servants! Beware of Me!"
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 17: As for those who avoid the worship of idols, and devote themselves to God-theirs is the good news. So give good news to My servants.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 18: Those who listen to the Word, and follow the best of it. These are they whom God has guided. These are they who possess intellect.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 19: What about someone who has deserved the sentence of punishment? Is it you who can save those in the Fire?
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 20: But those who fear their Lord will have mansions upon mansions, built high, with streams flowing beneath them. The promise of God; and God never breaks a promise.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 21: Have you not considered how God sends down water from the sky, then He makes it flow into underground wells, then He produces with it plants of various colors, then they wither and you see them yellowing, then He turns them into debris? Surely in this is a reminder for those with understanding.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 22: What about someone whose heart God has opened to Islam, so that he follows a light from His Lord? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the mention of God. Those are in manifest error.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 23: God has sent down the best of narrations: a Scripture consistent and paired. The skins of those who reverence their Lord shiver from it, then their skins and their hearts soften up to the remembrance of God. Such is God's guidance; He guides with it whomever He wills. But whomever God leaves astray, for him there is no guide.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 24: What about someone who covers his face against the terrible misery of the Day of Resurrection? To the evildoers it will be said, "Taste what you used to earn."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 25: Those before them also denied the truth, so the penalty came upon them from where they did not perceive.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 26: God made them taste disgrace in the present life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is worse, if they only knew.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 27: We have cited in this Quran for mankind every ideal, that they may take heed.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 28: An Arabic Quran, without any defect, so they may become righteous.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 29: God cites the example of a man shared by partners at odds, and a man belonging exclusively to one man. Are they equal in status? Praise be to God, but most of them do not know.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 30: You will die, and they will die.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 31: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be quarrelling before your Lord.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 32: Who is more evil than he who lies about God, and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell room for the ungrateful?
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 33: But he who promotes the truth, and testifies to it-these are the righteous.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 34: They will have whatever they please with their Lord. Such is the reward for the virtuous.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 35: God will acquit them of the worst of their deeds, and will reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 36: Is God not enough for His servant? And they frighten you with those besides Him. Whomever God sends astray, for him there is no guide.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 37: And whomever God guides, for him there is no misleader. Is God not Powerful and Vengeful?

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 38: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would say, "God." Say, "Have you seen those you pray to instead of God? If God willed any harm for me, can they lift His harm? And if He willed a blessing for me, can they hold back His mercy?" Say, "God suffices for me. On Him the reliant rely."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 39: Say: "O my people, work according to your ability; and so will I. Then you will know.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 40: Who will receive a humiliating punishment, and on whom will fall a lasting torment."

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 41: We sent down upon you the Book for mankind in truth. He who follows guidance does so for the good of his soul. And he who strays in error does so to its detriment. You are not their overseer.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 42: God takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that have not died during their sleep. He retains those for which He has decreed death, and He releases the others until a predetermined time. In that are signs for people who reflect.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 43: Or have they chosen intercessors other than God? Say, "Even though they have no power over anything, and are devoid of reason?"
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 44: Say, "All intercession is up to God. To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 45: When God alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with resentment. But when those other than Him are mentioned, they become filled with joy.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 46: Say, "Our God, Initiator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of all secrets and declarations. You will judge between your servants regarding what they had differed about."

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 47: If those who did wrong owned everything on earth, and the like of it with it, they would redeem themselves with it from the terrible suffering on the Day of Resurrection. But there will appear to them from God what they never anticipated.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 48: There will appear to them the evils of their deeds, and they will be surrounded by what they used to ridicule.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 49: When adversity touches the human being, he calls on Us. But then, when We favor him with a blessing from Us, he says, "I have attained this by virtue of my knowledge." However, it is a test, but most of them do not know.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 50: Those before them said it, but what they had earned did not avail them.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 51: The evils of their deeds caught up with them. And the wrongdoers among these will also be afflicted by the evils of what they earned, and they cannot prevent it.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 52: Do they not know that God extends the provision to whomever He wills, and constricts it? In that are signs for people who believe.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 53: Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves: do not despair of God's mercy, for God forgives all sins. He is indeed the Forgiver, the Clement."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 54: And turn to your Lord, and submit to Him, before the retribution comes upon you. Then you will not be helped.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 55: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord, before the punishment comes upon you suddenly, while you are unaware.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 56: So that a soul may not say, "How sorry I am, for having neglected my duty to God, and for having been of the scoffers."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 57: Or say, "Had God guided me; I would have been of the pious."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 58: Or say, when it sees the penalty, "If only I had another chance, I would be of the virtuous."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 59: Yes indeed! My Verses did come to you, but you called them lies, turned arrogant, and were of the faithless.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 60: On the Day of Resurrection, you will see those who told lies about God with their faces blackened. Is there not a place in Hell for the arrogant?
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 61: And God will save those who maintained righteousness to their place of salvation. No harm will touch them, nor will they grieve.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 62: God is the Creator of all things, and He is in Charge of all things.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 63: To Him belong the reins of the heavens and the earth. But those who blaspheme against the revelations of God-it is they who are the losers.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 64: Say, "Is it other than God you instruct me to worship, you ignorant ones?"
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 65: It was revealed to you, and to those before you, that if you idolize, your works will be in vain, and you will be of the losers.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 66: Rather, worship God, and be of the appreciative.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 67: They have not esteemed God as He ought to be esteemed. The entire earth will be in His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His righ. Immaculate is He, and Transcendent He is beyond the associations they make.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 68: And the Trumpet will be sounded, whereupon everyone in the heavens and the earth will be stunned, except whomever God wills. Then it will be sounded another time, whereupon they will rise up, looking on.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 69: And the earth will shine with the Light of its Lord; and the Book will be put in place; and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought in; and Judgment will be passed among them equitably, and they will not be wronged.
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 70: And every soul will be fully compensated for what it had done. He is well aware of what they do.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 71: Those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in throngs. Until, when they have reached it, and its gates are opened, its keepers will say to them, "Did not messengers from among you come to you, reciting to you the revelations of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the verdict of punishment is justified against the disbelievers."
Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 72: It will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell, to abide therein eternally." How wretched is the destination of the arrogant.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 73: And those who feared their Lord will be led to Paradise in throngs. Until, when they have reached it, and its gates are opened, its keepers will say to them, "Peace be upon you, you have been good, so enter it, to abide therein eternally."

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 74: And they will say, "Praise be to God, who has fulfilled His promise to us, and made us inherit the land, enjoying Paradise as we please." How excellent is the reward of the workers.

Surah az-Zumar, Ayah 75: And you will see the angels hovering around the Throne, glorifying their Lord with praise. And it will be judged between them equitably, and it will be said, "Praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds."
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 1: O people! Fear your Lord, who created you from a single soul, and created from it its mate, and propagated from them many men and women. And revere God whom you ask about, and the parents. Surely, God is Watchful over you.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 2: And give orphans their properties, and do not substitute the bad for the good. And do not consume their properties by combining them with yours, for that would be a serious sin.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 3: If you fear you cannot act fairly towards the orphans-then marry the women you like-two, or three, or four. But if you fear you will not be fair, then one, or what you already have. That makes it more likely that you avoid bias.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 4: Give women their dowries graciously. But if they willingly forego some of it, then consume it with enjoyment and pleasure.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 5: Do not give the immature your money which God has assigned to you for support. But provide for them from it, and clothe them, and speak to them with kind words.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 6: Test the orphans until they reach the age of marriage. If you find them to be mature enough, hand over their properties to them. And do not consume it extravagantly or hastily before they grow up. The rich shall not charge any wage, but the poor may charge fairly. When you hand over their properties to them, have it witnessed for them. God suffices as a Reckoner.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 7: Men receive a share of what their parents and relatives leave, and women receive a share of what their parents and relatives leave; be it little or much-a legal share.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 8: If the distribution is attended by the relatives, and the orphans, and the needy, give them something out of it, and speak to them kindly.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 9: Those who are concerned about the fate of their weak children, in case they leave them behind, should fear God, and speak appropriate words.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 10: Those who consume the wealth of orphans illicitly consume only fire into their bellies; and they will roast in a Blaze.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 11: God instructs you regarding your children: The male receives the equivalent of the share of two females. If they are daughters, more than two, they get two-thirds of what he leaves. If there is only one, she gets one-half. As for the parents, each gets one-sixth of what he leaves, if he had children. If he had no children, and his parents inherit from him, his mother gets one-third. If he has siblings, his mother gets one-sixth. After fulfilling any bequest and paying off debts. Your parents and your children-you do not know which are closer to you in welfare. This is God's Law. God is Knowing and Judicious.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 12: You get one-half of what your wives leave behind, if they had no children. If they had children, you get one-fourth of what they leave. After fulfilling any bequest and paying off debts. They get one-fourth of what you leave behind, if you have no children. If you have children, they get one-eighth of what you leave. After fulfilling any bequest and paying off debts. If a man or woman leaves neither parents nor children, but has a brother or sister, each of them gets one-sixth. If there are more siblings, they share one-third. After fulfilling any bequest and paying off debts, without any prejudice. This is a will from God. God is Knowing and Clement.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 13: These are the bounds set by God. Whoever obeys God and His Messenger, He will admit him into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever. That is the great attainment.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 14: But whoever disobeys God and His Messenger, and oversteps His bounds, He will admit him into a Fire, wherein he abides forever, and he will have a shameful punishment.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 15: Those of your women who commit lewdness, you must have four witnesses against them, from among you. If they testify, confine them to the homes until death claims them, or God makes a way for them.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 16: If two men among you commit it, punish them both. But if they repent and reform, leave them alone. God is Redeemer, Full of Mercy.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 17: Repentance is available from God for those who commit evil out of ignorance, and then repent soon after. These-God will relent towards them. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 18: But repentance is not available for those who commit evils, until when death approaches one of them, he says, "Now I repent," nor for those who die as disbelievers. These-We have prepared for them a painful torment.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 19: O you who believe! It is not permitted for you to inherit women against their will. And do not coerce them in order to take away some of what you had given them, unless they commit a proven adultery. And live with them in kindness. If you dislike them, it may be that you dislike something in which God has placed much good.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 20: If you wish to replace one wife with another, and you have given one of them a fortune, take nothing back from it. Would you take it back fraudulently and sinfully?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 21: And how can you take it back, when you have been intimate with one another, and they have received from you a solid commitment?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 22: Do not marry women whom your fathers married, except what is already past. That is improper, indecent, and a bad custom.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 23: Forbidden for you are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your paternal aunts, your maternal aunts, your brother's daughters, your sister's daughters, your foster-mothers who nursed you, your sisters through nursing, your wives' mothers, and your stepdaughters in your guardianship-born of wives you have gone into-but if you have not gone into them, there is no blame on you. And the wives of your genetic sons, and marrying two sisters simultaneously. Except what is past. God is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 24: And all married women, except those you rightfully possess. This is God's decree, binding upon you. Permitted for you are those that lie outside these limits, provided you seek them in legal marriage, with gifts from your property, seeking wedlock, not prostitution. If you wish to enjoy them, then give them their dowry-a legal obligation. You commit no error by agreeing to any change to the dowry. God is All-Knowing, Most Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 25: If any of you lack the means to marry free believing women, he may marry one of the believing maids under your control. God is well aware of your faith. You are from one another. Marry them with the permission of their guardians, and give them their recompense fairly-to be protected-neither committing adultery, nor taking secret lovers. When they are married, if they commit adultery, their punishment shall be half that of free women. That is for those among you who fear falling into decadence. But to practice self-restraint is better for you. God is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 26: God intends to make things clear to you, and to guide you in the ways of those before you, and to redeem you. God is Most Knowing, Most Wise.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 27: God intends to redeem you, but those who follow their desires want you to turn away utterly.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 28: God intends to lighten your burden, for the human being was created weak.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 29: O you who believe! Do not consume each other's wealth illicitly, but trade by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves, for God is Merciful towards you.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 30: Whoever does that, out of hostility and wrongdoing, We will cast him into a Fire. And that would be easy for God.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 31: If you avoid the worst of what you are forbidden, We will remit your sins, and admit you by a Gate of Honor.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 32: Do not covet what God has given to some of you in preference to others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask God of his bounty. God has knowledge of everything.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 33: To everyone We have assigned beneficiaries in what is left by parents and relatives. Those with whom you have made an agreement, give them their share. God is Witness over all things.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 34: Men are the protectors and maintainers of women, as God has given some of them an advantage over others, and because they spend out of their wealth. The good women are obedient, guarding what God would have them guard. As for those from whom you fear disloyalty, admonish them, and abandon them in their beds, then strike them. But if they obey you, seek no way against them. God is Sublime, Great.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 35: If you fear a breach between the two, appoint an arbiter from his family and an arbiter from her family. If they wish to reconcile, God will bring them together. God is Knowledgeable, Expert.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 36: Worship God, and ascribe no partners to Him, and be good to the parents, and the relatives, and the orphans, and the poor, and the neighbor next door, and the distant neighbor, and the close associate, and the traveler, and your servants. God does not love the arrogant showoff.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 37: Those who are stingy, and exhort people to stinginess, and conceal what God has given them from His bounty. We have prepared for the disbelievers a disgraceful punishment.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 38: And those who spend their money to be seen by people, and believe neither in God nor in the Last Day. Whoever has Satan as a companion-what an evil companion.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 39: What would they have lost, had they believed in God and the Last Day, and gave out of what God has provided for them? God knows them very well.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 40: God does not commit an atom's weight of injustice; and if there is a good deed, He doubles it, and gives from His Presence a sublime compensation.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 41: Then how will it be, when We bring a witness from every community, and We bring you as a witness against these?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 42: On that Day, those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger will wish that the earth were leveled over them. They will conceal nothing from God.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 43: O you who believe! Do not approach the prayer while you are drunk, so that you know what you say; nor after sexual orgasm-unless you are travelling-until you have bathed. If you are sick, or traveling, or one of you comes from the toilet, or you have had intercourse with women, and cannot find water, find clean sand and wipe your faces and your hands with it. God is Pardoning and Forgiving.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 44: Have you not considered those who were given a share of the Book? They buy error, and wish you would lose the way.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 45: But God knows your enemies best. God is sufficient as a Protector, and God is sufficient as a Supporter.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 46: Among the Jews are some who take words out of context, and say, "We hear and we disobey", and "Hear without listening", and "Observe us," twisting with their tongues and slandering the religion. Had they said, "We hear and we obey", and "Listen", and "Give us your attention," it would have been better for them, and more upright. But God has cursed them for their disbelief; they do not believe except a little.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 47: O you who were given the Book! Believe in what We sent down, confirming what you have, before We obliterate faces and turn them inside out, or curse them as We cursed the Sabbath-breakers. The command of God is always done.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 48: God does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives anything less than that to whomever He wills. Whoever associates anything with God has devised a monstrous sin.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 49: Have you not considered those who claim purity for themselves? Rather, God purifies whom He wills, and they will not be wronged a whit.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 50: See how they devise lies against God. That alone is an outright sin.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 51: Have you not considered those who were given a share of the Book? They believe in superstition and evil powers, and say of those who disbelieve, "These are better guided on the way than the believers."
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 52: Those are they whom God has cursed. Whomever God curses, you will find no savior for him.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 53: Or do they own a share of the kingdom? Then they would not give people a speck.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 54: Or do they envy the people for what God has given them of His grace? We have given the family of Abraham the Book and wisdom, and We have given them a great kingdom.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 55: Among them are those who believed in it, and among them are those who held back from it. Hell is a sufficient Inferno.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 56: Those who reject Our revelations-We will scorch them in a Fire. Every time their skins are cooked, We will replace them with other skins, so they will experience the suffering. God is Most Powerful, Most Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 57: As for those who believe and do good deeds, We will admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. They will have purified spouses therein, and We will admit them into a shady shade.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 58: God instructs you to give back things entrusted to you to their owners. And when you judge between people, judge with justice. God's instructions to you are excellent. God is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 59: O you who believe! Obey God and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you dispute over anything, refer it to God and the Messenger, if you believe in God and the Last Day. That is best, and a most excellent determination.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 60: Have you not observed those who claim that they believe in what was revealed to you, and in what was revealed before you, yet they seek Satanic sources for legislation, in spite of being commanded to reject them? Satan means to mislead them far away.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 61: And when it is said to them, "Come to what God has revealed, and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites shunning you completely.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 62: How about when a disaster strikes them because what their hands have put forward, and then they come to you swearing by God: "We only intended goodwill and reconciliation"?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 63: They are those whom God knows what is in their hearts. So ignore them, and admonish them, and say to them concerning themselves penetrating words.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 64: We did not send any messenger except to be obeyed by God's leave. Had they, when they wronged themselves, come to you, and prayed for God's forgiveness, and the Messenger had prayed for their forgiveness, they would have found God Relenting and Merciful.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 65: But no, by your Lord, they will not believe until they call you to arbitrate in their disputes, and then find within themselves no resentment regarding your decisions, and submit themselves completely.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 66: Had We decreed for them: "Kill yourselves," or "Leave your homes," they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But had they done what they were instructed to do, it would have been better for them, and a firmer confirmation.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 67: And We would have given them from Our presence a rich compensation.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 68: And We would have guided them on a straight path.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 69: Whoever obeys God and the Messenger-these are with those whom God has blessed-among the prophets, and the sincere, and the martyrs, and the upright. Excellent are those as companions.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 70: That is the grace from God. God suffices as Knower.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 71: O you who believe! Take your precautions, and mobilize in groups, or mobilize altogether.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 72: Among you is he who lags behind. Then, when a calamity befalls you, he says, "God has favored me, that I was not martyred with them."
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 73: But when some bounty from God comes to you, he says-as if no affection existed between you and him-"If only I had been with them, I would have achieved a great victory."

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 74: Let those who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter fight in the cause of God. Whoever fights in the cause of God, and then is killed, or achieves victory, We will grant him a great compensation.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 75: And why would you not fight in the cause of God, and the helpless men, and women, and children, cry out, "Our Lord, deliver us from this town whose people are oppressive, and appoint for us from Your Presence a Protector, and appoint for us from Your Presence a Victor."

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 76: Those who believe fight in the cause of God, while those who disbelieve fight in the cause of Evil. So fight the allies of the Devil. Surely the strategy of the Devil is weak.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 77: Have you not considered those who were told, "Restrain your hands, and perform your prayers, and spend in regular charity"? But when fighting was ordained for them, a faction of them feared the people as God is ought to be feared, or even more. And they said, "Our Lord, why did You ordain fighting for us? If only You would postpone it for us for a short while." Say, "The enjoyments of this life are brief, but the Hereafter is better for the righteous, and you will not be wronged one bit."

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 78: Wherever you may be, death will catch up with you, even if you were in fortified towers. When a good fortune comes their way, they say, "This is from God." But when a misfortune befalls them, they say, "This is from you." Say, "All is from God." So what is the matter with these people, that they hardly understand a thing?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 79: Whatever good happens to you is from God, and whatever bad happens to you is from your own self. We sent you to humanity as a messenger, and God is Witness enough.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 80: Whoever obeys the Messenger is obeying God. And whoever turns away-We did not send you as a watcher over them.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 81: They profess obedience, but when they leave your presence, some of them conspire something contrary to what you said. But God writes down what they conspire. So avoid them, and put your trust in God. God is Guardian enough.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 82: Do they not ponder the Quran? Had it been from any other than God, they would have found in it much discrepancy.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 83: When some news of security or alarm comes their way, they broadcast it. But had they referred it to the Messenger, and to those in authority among them, those who can draw conclusions from it would have comprehended it. Were it not for God's blessing and mercy upon you, you would have followed the Devil, except for a few.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 84: So fight in the cause of God; you are responsible only for yourself. And rouse the believers. Perhaps God will restrain the might of those who disbelieve. God is Stronger in Might, and More Punishing.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 85: Whoever intercedes for a good cause has a share in it, and whoever intercedes for an evil cause shares in its burdens. God keeps watch over everything.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 86: When you are greeted with a greeting, respond with a better greeting, or return it. God keeps count of everything.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 87: God-there is no god except He. He will gather you to the Day of Resurrection, in which there is no doubt. And who speaks more truly than God?

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 88: What is the matter with you, divided into two factions regarding the hypocrites, when God Himself has overwhelmed them on account of what they did? Do you want to guide those whom God has led astray? Whomever God leads astray-you will never find for him a way.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 89: They would love to see you disbelieve, just as they disbelieve, so you would become equal. So do not befriend any of them, unless they emigrate in the way of God. If they turn away, seize them and execute them wherever you may find them; and do not take from among them allies or supporters.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 90: Except those who join people with whom you have a treaty, or those who come to you reluctant to fight you or fight their own people. Had God willed, He would have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. If they withdraw from you, and do not fight you, and offer you peace, then God assigns no excuse for you against them.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 91: You will find others who want security from you, and security from their own people. But whenever they are tempted into civil discord, they plunge into it. So if they do not withdraw from you, nor offer you peace, nor restrain their hands, seize them and execute them wherever you find them. Against these, We have given you clear authorization.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 92: Never should a believer kill another believer, unless by error. Anyone who kills a believer by error must set free a believing slave, and pay compensation to the victim's family, unless they remit it as charity. If the victim belonged to a people who are hostile to you, but is a believer, then the compensation is to free a believing slave. If he belonged to a people with whom you have a treaty, then compensation should be handed over to his family, and a believing slave set free. Anyone who lacks the means must fast for two consecutive months, by way of repentance to God. God is All-Knowing, Most Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 93: Whoever kills a believer deliberately, the penalty for him is Hell, where he will remain forever. And God will be angry with him, and will curse him, and will prepare for him a terrible punishment.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 94: O you who believe! When you journey in the way of God, investigate, and do not say to him who offers you peace, "You are not a believer," aspiring for the goods of this world. With God are abundant riches. You yourselves were like this before, and God bestowed favor on you; so investigate. God is well aware of what you do.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 95: Not equal are the inactive among the believers-except the disabled-and the strivers in the cause of God with their possessions and their persons. God prefers the strivers with their possessions and their persons above the inactive, by a degree. But God has promised goodness to both. Yet God favors the strivers, over the inactive, with a great reward.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 96: Degrees from Him, and forgiveness, and mercy. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 97: While the angels are removing the souls of those who have wronged themselves, they will say, "What was the matter with you?" They will say, "We were oppressed in the land." They will say, "Was God's earth not vast enough for you to emigrate in it?" These-their refuge is Hell. What a wretched retreat!
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 98: Except for the weak among men, and women, and children who have no means to act, and no means to find a way out.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 99: These-God may well pardon them. God is Pardoning and Forgiving.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 100: Anyone who emigrates for the sake of God will find on earth many places of refuge, and plentitude. Anyone who leaves his home, emigrating to God and His Messenger, and then is overtaken by death, his compensation falls on God. God is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 101: When you travel in the land, there is no blame on you for shortening the prayers, if you fear that the disbelievers may harm you. The disbelievers are your manifest enemies.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 102: When you are among them, and you stand to lead them in prayer, let a group of them stand with you, and let them hold their weapons. Then, when they have done their prostrations, let them withdraw to the rear, and let another group, that have not prayed yet, come forward and pray with you; and let them take their precautions and their weapons. Those who disbelieve would like you to neglect your weapons and your equipment, so they can attack you in a single assault. You commit no error, if you are hampered by rain or are sick, by putting down your weapons; but take precautions. Indeed, God has prepared for the disbelievers a demeaning punishment.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 103: When you have completed the prayer, remember God, standing, or sitting, or on your sides. And when you feel secure, perform the prayer. The prayer is obligatory for believers at specific times.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 104: And do not falter in the pursuit of the enemy. If you are aching, they are aching as you are aching, but you expect from God what they cannot expect. God is Knowledgeable and Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 105: We have revealed to you the Scripture, with the truth, so that you judge between people in accordance with what God has shown you. And do not be an advocate for the traitors.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 106: And ask God for forgiveness. God is Forgiver and Merciful.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 107: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. God does not love the deceitful sinner.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 108: They hide from the people, but they cannot hide from God. He is with them, as they plot by night with words He does not approve. God comprehends what they do.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 109: There you are, arguing on their behalf in the present life, but who will argue with God on their behalf on the Day of Resurrection? Or who will be their representative?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 110: Whoever commits evil, or wrongs his soul, then implores God for forgiveness, will find God Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 111: And Whoever earns a sin, earns it against himself. God is Aware and Wise.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 112: And whoever commits a mistake, or a sin, and then blames it on an innocent person, has taken a slander and a clear sin.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 113: Were it not for God's grace towards you, and His mercy, a faction of them would have managed to mislead you. But they only mislead themselves, and they cannot harm you in any way. God has revealed to you the Scripture and wisdom, and has taught you what you did not know. God's goodness towards you is great.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 114: There is no good in much of their private counsels, except for him who advocates charity, or kindness, or reconciliation between people. Whoever does that, seeking God's approval, We will give him a great compensation.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 115: Whoever makes a breach with the Messenger, after the guidance has become clear to him, and follows other than the path of the believers, We will direct him in the direction he has chosen, and commit him to Hell-what a terrible destination!

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 116: God will not forgive that partners be associated with Him; but will forgive anything less than that, to whomever He wills. Anyone who ascribes partners to God has strayed into far error.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 117: They invoke in His stead only females. In fact, they invoke none but a rebellious devil.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 118: God has cursed him. And he said, "I will take to myself my due share of Your servants."

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 119: "And I will mislead them, and I will entice them, and I will prompt them to slit the ears of cattle, and I will prompt them to alter the creation of God." Whoever takes Satan as a lord, instead of God, has surely suffered a profound loss.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 120: He promises them, and he raises their expectations, but Satan promises them nothing but delusions.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 121: These-their place is Hell, and they will find no escape from it.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 122: But as for those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will admit them into gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will abide forever. The promise of God is true-and who is more truthful in speech than God?

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 123: It is not in accordance with your wishes, nor in accordance with the wishes of the People of the Scripture. Whoever works evil will pay for it, and will not find for himself, besides God, any protector or savior.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 124: But whoever works righteousness, whether male or female, and is a believer-those will enter Paradise, and will not be wronged a whit.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 125: And who is better in religion than he who submits himself wholly to God, and is a doer of good, and follows the faith of Abraham the Monotheist? God has chosen Abraham for a friend.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 126: To God belongs what is in the heavens and what is on earth, and God encompasses everything.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 127: They ask you for a ruling about women. Say, "God gives you a ruling about them, and so does what is stated to you in the Book about widowed women from whom you withhold what is decreed for them, yet you desire to marry them, and about helpless children: that you should treat the orphans fairly." Whatever good you do, God knows it.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 128: If a woman fears maltreatment or desertion from her husband, there is no fault in them if they reconcile their differences, for reconciliation is best. Souls are prone to avarice; yet if you do what is good, and practice piety-God is Cognizant of what you do.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 129: You will not be able to treat women with equal fairness, no matter how much you desire it. But do not be so biased as to leave another suspended. If you make amends, and act righteously-God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 130: And if they separate, God will enrich each from His abundance. God is Bounteous and Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 131: To God belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. We have instructed those who were given the Book before you, and you, to be conscious of God. But if you refuse-to God belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. God is in no need, Praiseworthy.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 132: To God belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. God suffices as Manager.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 133: If He wills, He can do away with you, O people, and bring others. God is Able to do that.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 134: Whoever desires the reward of this world-with God is the reward of this world and the next. God is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 135: O you who believe! Stand firmly for justice, as witnesses to God, even if against yourselves, or your parents, or your relatives. Whether one is rich or poor, God takes care of both. So do not follow your desires, lest you swerve. If you deviate, or turn away-then God is Aware of what you do.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 136: O you who believe! Believe in God and His messenger, and the Book He sent down to His messenger, and the Book He sent down before. Whoever rejects God, His angels, His Books, His messengers, and the Last Day, has strayed far in error.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 137: Those who believe, then disbelieve, then believe, then disbelieve, then increase in disbelief, God will not forgive them, nor will He guide them to a way.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 138: Inform the hypocrites that they will have a painful punishment.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 139: Those who ally themselves with the disbelievers instead of the believers. Do they seek glory in them? All glory belongs to God.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 140: He has revealed to you in the Book that when you hear God's revelations being rejected, or ridiculed, do not sit with them until they engage in some other subject. Otherwise, you would be like them. God will gather the hypocrites and the disbelievers, into Hell, altogether.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 141: Those who lie in wait for you: if you attain victory from God, they say, "Were we not with you?" But if the disbelievers get a turn, they say, "Did we not side with you, and defend you from the believers?" God will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection; and God will give the disbelievers no means of overcoming the believers.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 142: The hypocrites try to deceive God, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing off in front of people, and remembering God only a little.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 143: Wavering in between, neither with these, nor with those. Whomever God sends astray, you will never find for him a way.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 144: O you who believe! Do not befriend disbelievers rather than believers. Do you want to give God a clear case against you?
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 145: The hypocrites will be in the lowest level of the Fire, and you will find no helper for them.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 146: Except those who repent, and reform, and hold fast to God, and dedicate their religion to God alone. These are with the believers; and God will give the believers a great reward.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 147: What would God accomplish by your punishment, if you have given thanks, and have believed? God is Appreciative and Cognizant.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 148: God does not like the public uttering of bad language, unless someone was wronged. God is Hearing and Knowing.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 149: If you let a good deed be shown, or conceal it, or pardon an offense-God is Pardoning and Capable.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 150: Those who disbelieve in God and His messengers, and want to separate between God and His messengers, and say, "We believe in some, and reject some," and wish to take a path in between.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 151: These are the unbelievers, truly. We have prepared for the unbelievers a shameful punishment.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 152: As for those who believe in God and His messengers, and make no distinction between any of them-He will give them their rewards. God is Forgiver and Merciful.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 153: The People of the Scripture challenge you to bring down to them a book from the sky. They had asked Moses for something even greater. They said, "Show us God plainly." The thunderbolt struck them for their wickedness. Then they took the calf for worship, even after the clear proofs had come to them. Yet We pardoned that, and We gave Moses a clear authority.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 154: And We raised the Mount above them in accordance with their covenant, and We said to them, "Enter the gate humbly", and We said to them, "Do not violate the Sabbath", and We received from them a solemn pledge.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 155: But for their violation of their covenant, and their denial of God's revelations, and their killing of the prophets unjustly, and their saying, "Our minds are closed." In fact, God has sealed them for their disbelief, so they do not believe, except for a few.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 156: And for their faithlessness, and their saying against Mary a monstrous slander.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 157: And for their saying, "We have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the Messenger of God." In fact, they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him, but it appeared to them as if they did. Indeed, those who differ about him are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it, except the following of assumptions. Certainly, they did not kill him.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 158: Rather, God raised him up to Himself. God is Mighty and Wise.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 159: There is none from the People of the Scripture but will believe in him before his death, and on the Day of Resurrection he will be a witness against them.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 160: Due to wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We forbade them good things that used to be lawful for them; and for deterring many from God's path.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 161: And for their taking usury, although they were forbidden it; and for their consuming people's wealth dishonestly. We have prepared for the faithless among them a painful torment.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 162: But those among them firmly rooted in knowledge, and the believers, believe in what was revealed to you, and in what was revealed before you; and the observers of prayers, and the givers of charity, and the believers in God and the Last Day-upon these We will bestow an immense reward.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 163: We have inspired you, as We had inspired Noah and the prophets after him. And We inspired Abraham, and Ishmael, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the Patriarchs, and Jesus, and Job, and Jonah, and Aaron, and Solomon. And We gave David the Psalms.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 164: Some messengers We have already told you about, while some messengers We have not told you about. And God spoke to Moses directly.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 165: Messengers delivering good news, and bringing warnings; so that people may have no excuse before God after the coming of the messengers. God is Powerful and Wise.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 166: But God bears witness to what He revealed to you. He revealed it with His knowledge. And the angels bear witness. Though God is a sufficient witness.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 167: Those who disbelieve and repel from God's path have gone far astray.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 168: Those who disbelieve and transgress; God is not about to forgive them, nor will He guide them to any path.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 169: Except to the path of Hell, where they will dwell forever. And that is easy for God.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 170: O people! The Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe-that is best for you. But if you disbelieve, to God belongs everything in the heavens and the earth. God is Omniscient and Wise.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 171: O People of the Scripture! Do not exaggerate in your religion, and do not say about God except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, is the Messenger of God, and His Word that He conveyed to Mary, and a Spirit from Him. So believe in God and His messengers, and do not say, "Three." Refrain-it is better for you. God is only one God. Glory be to Him-that He should have a son. To Him belongs everything in the heavens and the earth, and God is a sufficient Protector.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 172: The Messiah does not disdain to be a servant of God, nor do the favored angels. Whoever disdains His worship, and is too arrogant-He will round them up to Himself altogether.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 173: But as for those who believe and do good works, He will pay them their wages in full, and will increase His grace for them. But as for those who disdain and are too proud, He will punish them with an agonizing punishment. And they will find for themselves, apart from God, no lord and no savior.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 174: O people! A proof has come to you from your Lord, and We sent down to you a clear light.
Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 175: As for those who believe in God, and hold fast to Him, He will admit them into mercy and grace from Him, and will guide them to Himself in a straight path.

Surah an-Nisa', Ayah 176: They ask you for a ruling. Say, "God gives you a ruling concerning the person who has neither parents nor children." If a man dies, and leaves no children, and he had a sister, she receives one-half of what he leaves. And he inherits from her if she leaves no children. But if there are two sisters, they receive two-thirds of what he leaves. If the siblings are men and women, the male receives the share of two females." God makes things clear for you, lest you err. God is Aware of everything.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 2: The sending down of the Scripture is from God the Almighty, the Omniscient.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 3: Forgiver of sins, Accepter of repentance, Severe in punishment, Bountiful in bounty. There is no god but He. To Him is the ultimate return.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 4: None argues against God's revelations except those who disbelieve. So do not be impressed by their activities in the land.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 5: Before them the people of Noah rejected the truth, as did the confederates after them. Every community plotted against their messenger, to capture him. And they argued with falsehood, to defeat with it the truth. But I seized them. What a punishment it was!
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 6: Thus the sentence of your Lord became realized against those who disbelieve, that they are to be inmates of the Fire.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 7: Those who carry the Throne, and those around it, glorify their Lord with praise, and believe in Him, and ask for forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord, You have encompassed everything in mercy and knowledge; so forgive those who repent and follow Your path, and protect them from the agony of the Blaze.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 8: And admit them, Our Lord, into the Gardens of Eternity, which You have promised them, and the righteous among their parents, and their spouses, and their offspring. You are indeed the Almighty, the Most Wise.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 9: And shield them from the evil deeds. Whomever You shield from the evil deeds, on that Day, You have had mercy on him. That is the supreme achievement."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 10: Those who disbelieved will be addressed, "The loathing of God is greater than your loathing of yourselves-for you were invited to the faith, but you refused."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 11: They will say, "Our Lord, you made us die twice, and twice you gave us life. Now we acknowledge our sins. Is there any way out?"
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 12: That is because when God alone was called upon, you disbelieved; but when others were associated with Him, you believed. Judgment rests with God the Sublime, the Majestic.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 13: It is He who shows you His wonders, and sends down sustenance from the sky for you. But none pays heed except the repentant.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 14: So call upon God, with sincere devotion to Him, even though the disbelievers resent it.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 15: Exalted in rank, Owner of the Throne. He conveys the Spirit, by His command, upon whomever He wills of His servants, to warn of the Day of Encounter.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 16: The Day when they will emerge, nothing about them will be concealed from God. "To whom does the sovereignty belong today?" "To God, the One, the Irresistible."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 17: On that Day, every soul will be recompensed for what it had earned. There will be no injustice on that Day. God is quick to settle accounts.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 18: And warn them of the Day of Imminence, when the hearts are at the throats, choking them. The evildoers will have no intimate friend, and no intercessor to be obeyed.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 19: He knows the deceptions of the eyes, and what the hearts conceal.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 20: God judges with justice, while those whom they invoke besides Him cannot judge with anything. It is God who is the Hearing, the Seeing.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 21: Have they not travelled through the earth, and seen the consequences for those before them? They were stronger than them, and they left more impact on earth. But God seized them for their sins, and they had no defender against God.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 22: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so God seized them. He is Strong, Severe in retribution.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 23: We sent Moses with Our signs, and a clear authority.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 24: To Pharaoh, Hamaan, and Quaroon. But they said, "A lying sorcerer."

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 25: Then, when he came to them with the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him, and spare their daughters." But the scheming of the unbelievers can only go astray.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 26: Pharaoh said, "Leave me to kill Moses, and let him appeal to his Lord. I fear he may change your religion, or spread disorder in the land."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 27: Moses said, "I have sought the protection of my Lord and your Lord, from every tyrant who does not believe in the Day of Account."

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 28: A believing man from Pharaoh's family, who had concealed his faith, said, "Are you going to kill a man for saying, `My Lord is God,' and he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is a liar, his lying will rebound upon him; but if he is truthful, then some of what he promises you will befall you. God does not guide the extravagant imposter.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 29: O my people! Yours is the dominion today, supreme in the land; but who will help us against God's might, should it fall upon us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the path of prudence."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 30: The one who had believed said, "O my people, I fear for you the like of the day of the confederates.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 31: Like the fate of the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood, and those after them. God wants no injustice for the servants.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 32: O my people, I fear for you the Day of Calling Out.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 33: The Day when you will turn and flee, having no defender against God. Whomever God misguides has no guide."

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 34: Joseph had come to you with clear revelations, but you continued to doubt what he came to you with. Until, when he perished, you said, "God will never send a messenger after him." Thus God leads astray the outrageous skeptic.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 35: Those who argue against God's revelations, without any proof having come to them-a heinous sin in the sight of God, and of those who believe. Thus God seals the heart of every proud bully.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 36: And Pharaoh said, "O Hamaan, build me a tower, that I may reach the pathways.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 37: The pathways of the heavens, so that I may glance at the God of Moses; though I think he is lying." Thus Pharaoh's evil deeds were made to appear good to him, and he was averted from the path. Pharaoh's guile was only in defeat.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 38: The one who had believed said, "O my people, follow me, and I will guide you to the path of rectitude."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 39: "O my people, the life of this world is nothing but fleeting enjoyment, but the Hereafter is the Home of Permanence.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 40: Whoever commits a sin will be repaid only with its like. But whoever works righteousness, whether male or female, and is a believer-these will enter Paradise, where they will be provided for without account.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 41: O my people, how is it that I call you to salvation, and you call me to the Fire?
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 42: You call me to reject God, and to associate with Him what I have no knowledge of, while I call you to the Mighty Forgiver.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 43: Without a doubt, what you call me to has no say in this world, or in the Hereafter; and our turning back is to God; and the transgressors are the inmates of the Fire.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 44: You will remember what I am telling you, so I commit my case to God. God is Observant of the servants."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 45: So God protected him from the evils of their scheming, while a terrible torment besieged Pharaoh's clan.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 46: The Fire. They will be exposed to it morning and evening. And on the Day the Hour takes place: "Admit the clan of Pharaoh to the most intense agony."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 47: As they quarrel in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "We were followers of yours; will you then spare us a portion of the Fire?"
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 48: Those who were arrogant will say, "We are all in it; God has judged between the servants."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 49: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Call to your Lord to lessen our suffering for one day."

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 50: They will say, "Did not your messengers come to you with clear signs?" They will say, "Yes." They will say, "Then pray, but the prayers of the disbelievers will always be in vain."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 51: Most surely We will support Our messengers and those who believe, in this life, and on the Day the witnesses arise.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 52: The Day when their excuses will not profit the wrongdoers, and the curse will be upon them, and they will have the Home of Misery.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 53: We gave Moses guidance, and made the Children of Israel inherit the Scripture.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 54: A guide and a reminder for those endowed with reason.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 55: So be patient. The promise of God is true. And ask forgiveness for your sin, and proclaim the praise of your Lord evening and morning.
