Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 56: Those who dispute regarding God's revelations without any authority having come to them-there is nothing in their hearts but the feeling of greatness, which they will never attain. So seek refuge in God; for He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 57: Certainly the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of humanity, but most people do not know.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 58: Not equal are the blind and the seeing. Nor are those who believe and work righteousness equal to the sinners. How little you reflect.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 59: Indeed, the Hour is coming; there is no doubt about it; but most people do not believe.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 60: Your Lord has said, "Pray to Me, and I will respond to you. But those who are too proud to worship Me will enter Hell forcibly."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 61: It is God Who made the night for you, that you may rest therein; and the day allowing sight. God is gracious towards the people, but most people do not give thanks.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 62: Such is God, your Lord, Creator of all things. There is no god except Him; so how could you turn away?
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 63: Thus are turned away those who dispute the signs of God.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 64: It is God who made the earth a habitat for you, and the sky a structure. And He designed you, and designed you well; and He provided you with the good things. Such is God, your Lord; so Blessed is God, Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 65: He is the Living One. There is no god except He. So pray to Him, devoting your religion to Him. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 66: Say, "I was prohibited from worshiping those you invoke besides God, now that clear revelations have come to me from my Lord; and I was commanded to submit to the Lord of the Worlds."

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 67: It is He who created you from dust, then from a seed, then from an embryo, then He brings you out as an infant, then He lets you reach your maturity, then you become elderly-although some of you die sooner-so that you may reach a predetermined age, so that you may understand.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 68: It is He who gives life and death; and when He decides on a thing, He just says to it, "Be," and it comes to be.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 69: Have you not observed those who dispute regarding God's revelations, how they have deviated?
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 70: Those who call the Book a lie, and what We sent Our messengers with-they will surely know.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 71: When the yokes are around their necks, and they will be dragged by the chains.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 72: Into the boiling water, then in the Fire they will be consumed.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 73: Then it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to deify?
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 74: Instead of God?" They will say, "They have abandoned us. In fact, we were praying to nothing before." Thus God sends the disbelievers astray.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 75: That is because you used to rejoice on earth in other than the truth, and because you used to behave with vanity.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 76: Enter the gates of Hell, to remain therein forever. What a terrible dwelling for the arrogant.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 77: So be patient. The promise of God is true. Whether We show you some of what We have promised them, or take you to Us, to Us they will be returned.

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 78: We sent messengers before you. Some of them We told you about, and some We did not tell you about. No messenger can bring a miracle except by leave of God. Then, when the command of God is issued, fair judgment will be passed, and there and then the seekers of vanity will lose.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 79: God is He who created the domestic animals for you-some for you to ride, and some you eat.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 80: And in them you have other benefits as well, and through them you satisfy your needs. And on them, and on the ships, you are transported.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 81: And He shows you His signs. So which of God's signs will you deny?

Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 82: Have they not journeyed through the land, and seen the outcome for those before them? They were more numerous than they, and had greater power and influence in the land. But what they had achieved availed them nothing.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 83: When their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in the knowledge they had, and the very things they used to ridicule besieged them.
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 84: Then, when they witnessed Our might, they said, "We believe in God alone, and we reject what we used to associate with Him."
Surah al-Mu'min, Ayah 85: But their faith could not help them once they witnessed Our might. This has been God's way of dealing with His servants. And there and then the disbelievers lost.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 2: A revelation from the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 3: A Scripture whose Verses are detailed, a Quran in Arabic for people who know.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 4: Bringing good news, and giving warnings. But most of them turn away, so they do not listen.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 5: And they say, "Our hearts are screened from what you call us to, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a barrier. So do what you want, and so will we."
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 6: Say, "I am only a human like you; it is inspired in me that your God is One God. So be upright towards Him, and seek forgiveness from Him." And woe to the idolaters.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 7: Those who do not pay the alms; and regarding the Hereafter, they are disbelievers.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 8: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds-for them is a reward uninterrupted.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 9: Say, "Do you reject the One who created the earth in two days? And you attribute equals to Him? That is the Lord of the Universe."
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 10: He placed stabilizers over it; and blessed it; and planned its provisions in four days, equally to the seekers.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 11: Then He turned to the sky, and it was smoke, and said to it and to the earth, "Come, willingly or unwillingly." They said, "We come willingly."

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 12: So He completed them as seven universes in two days, and He assigned to each universe its laws. And We decorated the lower universe with lamps, and for protection. That is the design of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 13: But if they turn away, say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt, like the thunderbolt of Aad and Thamood."

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 14: Their messengers came to them, from before them and from behind them, saying, "Do not worship anyone but God." They said, "Had our Lord willed, He would have sent down angels; Therefore, we reject what you are sent with."

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 15: As for Aad, they turned arrogant on earth, and opposed justice, and said, "Who is more powerful than us?" Have they not considered that God, who created them, is more powerful than they? And they went on denying Our revelations.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 16: So We unleashed upon them a screaming wind, for a few miserable days, to make them taste the punishment of shame in this life; but the punishment of the Hereafter is more shameful; and they will not be saved.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 17: And as for Thamood, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance. So the thunderbolt of the humiliating punishment seized them, because of what they used to earn.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 18: And We saved those who believed and were righteous.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 19: The Day when God's enemies are herded into the Fire, forcibly.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 20: Until, when they have reached it, their hearing, and their sight, and their skins will testify against them regarding what they used to do.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 21: And they will say to their skins, "Why did you testify against us?" They will say, "God, Who made all things speak, made us speak. It is He who created you the first time, and to Him you are returned."

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 22: You were unable to hide yourselves from your hearing, and your sight, and your skins, to prevent them from testifying against you, and you imagined that God was unaware of much of what you do.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 23: It is that thought of yours about your Lord that led you to ruin-so you became of the losers.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 24: If they endure patiently, the Fire will be their residence; and if they make up excuses, they will not be pardoned.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 25: We had assigned companions for them, who glamorized to them what was in front of them, and what was behind them. And the Word proved true against them in communities of jinn and humans that have passed away before them. They were losers.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 26: Those who disbelieve say, "Do not listen to this Quran, and talk over it, so that you may prevail."
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 27: We will make those who disbelieve taste an intense agony, and We will recompense them according to the worst of what they used to do.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 28: Such is the recompense of God's enemies-the Fire-where they will have their permanent home, in recompense for having disregarded Our revelations.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 29: Those who disbelieved will say, "Our Lord, show us those who led us astray-among jinn and humans-and we will trample them under our feet, so they become among of the lowest."

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 30: Surely, those who say: "Our Lord is God," and then go straight, the angels will descend upon them: "Do not fear, and do not grieve, but rejoice in the news of the Garden which you were promised.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 31: We are your allies in this life and in the Hereafter, wherein you will have whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you call for.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 32: As Hospitality from an All-Forgiving, Merciful One."
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 33: And who is better in speech than someone who calls to God, and acts with integrity, and says, "I am of those who submit"?
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 34: Good and evil are not equal. Repel evil with good, and the person who was your enemy becomes like an intimate friend.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 35: But none will attain it except those who persevere, and none will attain it except the very fortunate.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 36: When a temptation from the Devil provokes you, seek refuge in God; He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 37: And of His signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Do not bow down to the sun, nor to the moon, but bow down to God, Who created them both, if it is Him that you serve.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 38: But if they are too proud-those in the presence of your Lord praise Him night and day, and without ever tiring.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 39: And of His signs is that you see the land still. But when We send down water upon it, it stirs and grows. Surely, He Who revived it will revive the dead. He is Able to do all things.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 40: Those who despise Our revelations are not hidden from Us. Is he who is hurled into the Fire better? Or he who arrives safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you please; He is Seeing of everything you do.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 41: Those who reject the Reminder when it has come to them-it is an invincible Book.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 42: Falsehood cannot approach it, from before it or behind it. It is a revelation from One Wise and Praiseworthy.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 43: Nothing is said to you but was said to the Messengers before you: your Lord is Possessor of Forgiveness, and Possessor of Painful Repayment.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 44: Had We made it a Quran in a foreign language, they would have said, "If only its verses were made clear." Non-Arabic and an Arab? Say, "For those who believe, it is guidance and healing. But as for those who do not believe: there is heaviness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. These are being called from a distant place."

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 45: We gave Moses the Book, but disputes arose concerning it. Were it not for a prior decree from your Lord, judgment would have been pronounced between them. But they are in perplexing doubt concerning it.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 46: Whoever acts righteously does so for himself; and whoever works evil does so against himself. Your Lord is not unjust to the servants.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 47: To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour. No fruit emerges from its sheath, and no female conceives or delivers, except with His knowledge. And on the Day when He calls out to them, "Where are My associates?" They will say, "We admit to you, none of us is a witness."
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 48: What they used to pray to before will forsake them, and they will realize that they have no escape.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 49: The human being never tires of praying for good things; but when adversity afflicts him, he despairs and loses hope.

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 50: And when We let him taste a mercy from Us, after the adversity that had afflicted him, he will say, "This is mine, and I do not think that the Hour is coming; and even if I am returned to my Lord, I will have the very best with Him." We will inform those who disbelieve of what they did, and We will make them taste an awful punishment.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 51: When We provide comfort for the human being, he withdraws and distances himself; but when adversity befalls him, he starts lengthy prayers.
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 52: Say, "Have you considered? If it is from God and you reject it-who is further astray than he who is cutoff and alienated?"

Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 53: We will show them Our proofs on the horizons, and in their very souls, until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is witness over everything?
Surah Fushshilat, Ayah 54: Surely they are in doubt about the encounter with their Lord. Surely He comprehends everything.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 2: Ayn, Seen, Qaf.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 3: Thus He inspires you, and those before you-God the Almighty, the Wise.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 4: To him belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. He is the Sublime, the Magnificent.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 5: The heavens above them almost burst apart, while the angels glorify the praises of their Lord, and ask forgiveness for those on earth. God is indeed the Forgiver, the Merciful.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 6: As for those who take masters other than Him: God is in charge of them, and you are not responsible for them.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 7: Thus We inspired you with an Arabic Quran, that you may warn the Central City and whoever is around it, and to warn of the Day of Assembly, of which there is no doubt; a group in the Garden, and a group in the Furnace.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 8: Had God willed, He could have made them one community, but He admits into His mercy whomever He wills. As for the wrongdoers, they will have no protector and no savior.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 9: Or have they adopted protectors besides him? But God is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He has power over all things.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 10: Whatever matter you differ about, its judgment rests with God. "Such is God, my Lord, in Whom I trust, and unto Him I repent."

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 11: Originator of the heavens and the earth. He made for you mates from among yourselves, and pairs of animals, by means of which He multiplies you. There is nothing like Him. He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 12: To Him belongs absolute control of the heavens and the earth. He spreads the bounties to whomever He wills, or reduces it. He is aware of all things.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 13: He prescribed for you the same religion He enjoined upon Noah, and what We inspired to you, and what We enjoined upon Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus: "You shall uphold the religion, and be not divided therein." As for the idolaters, what you call them to is outrageous to them. God chooses to Himself whom He wills, and He guides to Himself whoever repents.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 14: They became divided only after knowledge came to them, out of resentment among themselves. Were it not for a predetermined decision from your Lord, judgment would have been pronounced between them. Indeed, those who were made to inherit the Book after them are in grave doubt about it.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 15: To this go on inviting, and be upright as you were commanded, and do not follow their inclinations, and say, "I believe in whatever Book God has sent down, and I was commanded to judge between you equitably. God is our Lord and your Lord. We have our deeds, and you have your deeds. Let there be no quarrel between us and you. God will bring us together, and to Him is the ultimate return."
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 16: As for those who dispute about God after having answered His call, their argument is invalid with their Lord; and upon them falls wrath; and a grievous torment awaits them.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 17: It is God who revealed the Book with the truth, and the Balance. And what will make you realize that perhaps the Hour is near?

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 18: Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it; but those who believe are apprehensive of it, and they know it to be the truth. Absolutely, those who question the Hour are in distant error.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 19: God is kind towards His worshipers. He provides for whomever He wills. He is the Powerful, the Honorable.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 20: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We increase for him his harvest; and whoever desires the harvest of this world, We give him thereof, and he has no share of the Hereafter.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 21: Or is it that they have partners who litigate for them religious laws never authorized by God? Were it not for the conclusive decision, it would have been settled between them. The wicked will have a painful punishment.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 22: You will see the unjust terrified of what they have earned, and it will befall them. As for those who believe and do good deeds, they will be in the Meadows of the Gardens; they will have whatever they please in the presence of their Lord; that is the supreme blessing.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 23: That is the good news God gives to His servants who believe and do good deeds. Say, "I ask of you no wage for it, except affection among the near of kin." Whoever does a good deed, We will increase its goodness for him. God is Forgiving and Appreciative.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 24: Or do they say, "He forged a lie about God." If God so willed, He could have sealed your heart. But God obliterates the false, and confirm the true by His Words. He knows what is in the hearts.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 25: It is He who accepts the repentance of His worshipers, and remits the sins, and knows what you do.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 26: And He answers those who believe and do good deeds, and He increases them of His grace. But the disbelievers will suffer a terrible punishment.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 27: If God were to increase the provision to His servants, they would transgress on earth; but He sends down in precise measure whatever He wills. Surely, regarding His servants, He is Expert and Observant.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 28: It is He who brings down the rain after they have despaired, and unfolds His mercy. He is the Guardian, the Praised.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 29: And of His signs are the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the creatures He has spread throughout them; and He is Able to gather them at will.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 30: Whatever misfortune befalls you, it is because of what your hands have earned; and yet He pardons much.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 31: You are not the ones to interfere on earth; and besides God, you have no ally, and no helper.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 32: And of His signs are the ships sailing the sea like flags.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 33: If He willed, He could have stilled the winds, leaving them motionless on its surface. Surely in that are signs for every disciplined, grateful person.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 34: Or He could wreck them, because of what they have earned. And yet He pardons much.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 35: Those who dispute Our signs know that there is no asylum for them.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 36: Whatever thing you are given is only the provision of this life. But what God possesses is better and more lasting for those who believe and rely on their Lord.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 37: And those who avoid major sins and indecencies; and if they become angry, they forgive.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 38: And those who respond to their Lord, and pray regularly, and conduct their affairs by mutual consultation, and give of what We have provided them.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 39: And those who, when wronged, defend themselves.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 40: The repayment of a bad action is one equivalent to it. But whoever pardons and makes reconciliation, his reward lies with God. He does not love the unjust.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 41: As for those who retaliate after being wronged, there is no blame on them.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 42: Blame lies on those who wrong people, and commit aggression in the land without right. These will have a painful punishment.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 43: But whoever endures patiently and forgives-that is a sign of real resolve.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 44: Whoever God leaves astray has no protector apart from Him. And you will see the transgressors, when they see the torment, saying, "Is there a way of going back?"

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 45: And you will see them exposed to it, cowering from disgrace, looking with concealed eyes. Those who believed will say, "The losers are those who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection." Indeed, the evildoers are in a lasting torment.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 46: They will have no allies to support them against God. Whomever God leaves astray has no way out.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 47: Respond to your Lord before there comes from God a Day that cannot be turned back. You will have no refuge on that Day, and no possibility of denial.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 48: But if they turn away-We did not send you as a guardian over them. Your only duty is communication. Whenever We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but when misfortune befalls them, as a consequence of what their hands have perpetrated, man turns blasphemous.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 49: To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills. He grants daughters to whomever He wills, and He grants sons to whomever He wills.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 50: Or He combines them together, males and females; and He renders whomever He wills sterile. He is Knowledgeable and Capable.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 51: It is not for any human that God should speak to him, except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger to reveal by His permission whatever He wills. He is All-High, All-Wise.

Surah as-Syura, Ayah 52: We thus inspired you spiritually, by Our command. You did not know what the Scripture is, nor what faith is, but We made it a light, with which We guide whomever We will of Our servants. You surely guide to a straight path.
Surah as-Syura, Ayah 53: The path of God, to whom belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. Indeed, to God all matters revert.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 2: By the Book that makes things clear.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 3: We made it an Arabic Quran, so that you may understand.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 4: And it is with Us, in the Source Book, sublime and wise.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 5: Shall We hold back the Reminder from you, since you are a transgressing people?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 6: How many a prophet did We send to the ancients?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 7: No messenger came to them, but they ridiculed him.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 8: We destroyed people more powerful than they, and so the example of the ancients has passed away.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 9: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" They would say, "The Mighty, the Knower created them."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 10: He who made the earth a habitat for you, and traced pathways for you on it, that you may be guided.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 11: He who sends down water from the sky in due proportion; and so We revive thereby a dead land. Thus you will be brought out.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 12: He Who created all the pairs; and provided you with ships, and animals on which you ride.

Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 13: That you may mount their backs, and remember the favor of your Lord as you sit firmly upon them, and say, "Glory be to Him Who placed these at our service; surely we could not have done it by ourselves.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 14: And surely, to our Lord we will return."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 15: Yet they turn one of His servants into a part of Him. Man is clearly ungrateful.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 16: Or has He chosen for Himself daughters from what He creates, and favored you with sons?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 17: Yet when one of them is given news of what he attributes to the Most Gracious, his face darkens, and he suppresses grief.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 18: "Someone brought up to be beautiful, and unable to help in a fight?"

Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 19: And they appoint the angels, who are servants to the Most Gracious, as females. Have they witnessed their creation? Their claim will be recorded, and they will be questioned.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 20: And they say, "Had the Most Gracious willed, we would not have worshiped them." But they have no knowledge of that; they are merely guessing.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 21: Or have We given them a book prior to this one, to which they adhere?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 22: But they say, "We found our parents on a course, and we are guided in their footsteps."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 23: Likewise, We sent no warner before you to any town, but the wealthy among them said, "We found our parents on a course, and we are following in their footsteps."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 24: He would say, "Even if I bring you better guidance than what you found your parents following?" They would say, "We reject what you are sent with."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 25: So We wreaked vengeance upon them. Behold, then, what was the fate of those who deny.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 26: When Abraham said to his father and his people, "I am innocent of what you worship.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 27: Except for He who created me, for He will guide me."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 28: And he made it an enduring word in his progeny, so that they may return.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 29: I gave these and their forefathers some enjoyment, until the truth and a manifest messenger came to them.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 30: But when the truth came to them, they said, "This is sorcery, and we refuse to believe in it."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 31: They also said, "If only this Quran was sent down to a man of importance from the two cities."

Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 32: Is it they who allocate the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have allocated their livelihood in this life, and We elevated some of them in rank above others, that some of them would take others in service. But your Lord's mercy is better than what they amass.

Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 33: Were it not that humanity would become a single community, We would have provided those who disbelieve in the Most Gracious with roofs of silver to their houses, and stairways by which they ascend.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 34: And doors to their houses, and furnishings on which they recline.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 35: And decorations. Yet all that is nothing but the stuff of this life. Yet the Hereafter, with your Lord, is for the righteous.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 36: Whoever shuns the remembrance of the Most Gracious, We assign for him a devil, to be his companion.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 37: They hinder them from the path, though they think they are guided.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 38: Until, when He comes to Us, he will say, "If only there were between me and you the distance of the two Easts." What an evil companion!
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 39: It will not benefit you on that Day, since you did wrong. You are partners in the suffering.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 40: Can you make the deaf hear, or guide the blind, and him who is in evident error?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 41: Even if We take you away, We will wreak vengeance upon them.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 42: Or show you what We have promised them; for We have absolute power over them.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 43: So adhere to what is revealed to you. You are upon a straight path.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 44: It is a message for you, and for your people; and you will be questioned.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 45: Ask those of Our messengers We sent before you: "Did We appoint gods besides the Most Gracious to be worshiped?"
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 46: We sent Moses with Our revelations to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. He said, "I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 47: But when he showed them Our signs, they started laughing at them.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 48: Each sign We showed them was more marvelous than its counterpart. And We afflicted them with the plagues, so that they may repent.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 49: They said, "O sorcerer, pray to your Lord for us, according to His pledge to you, and then we will be guided."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 50: But when We lifted the torment from them, they immediately broke their promise.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 51: Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying, "O my people, do I not own the Kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flow beneath me? Do you not see?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 52: Am I not better than this miserable wretch, who can barely express himself?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 53: Why are bracelets of gold not dropped on him, or they angels came with him in procession?"
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 54: Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him. They were wicked people.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 55: And when they provoked Our wrath, We took retribution from them, and We drowned them all.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 56: Thus We made them a precedent and an example for the others.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 57: And when the son of Mary was cited as an example, your people opposed.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 58: They said, "Are our gods better, or he?" They cited him only for argument. In fact, they are a quarrelsome people.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 59: He was just a servant whom We blessed, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 60: Had We willed, We would have made of you angels to be successors on earth.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 61: He is a portent of the Hour, so have no doubt about it, and follow Me. This is a straight way.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 62: And let not Satan divert you. He is an open enemy to you.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 63: When Jesus came with the clarifications, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom, and to clarify for you some of what you differ about. So fear God, and obey me.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 64: God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him-this is a straight path."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 65: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to the wrongdoers from the suffering of a painful Day.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 66: Are they only waiting for the Hour to come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 67: On that Day, friends will be enemies of one another, except for the righteous.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 68: O My servants, you have nothing to fear on that Day, nor will you grieve.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 69: Those who believed in Our revelations, and were submissive.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 70: Enter the Garden, you and your spouses, Joyfully.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 71: They will be served around with trays of gold, and cups. Therein is whatever the souls desire and delights the eyes. Therein you will stay forever.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 72: Such is the Garden you are made to inherit, because of what you used to do.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 73: Therein you will have abundant fruit, from which you eat.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 74: As for the sinners, they will be in the torment of Hell forever.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 75: It will never be eased for them. In it, they will be devastated.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 76: We did them no injustice, but it was they who were the unjust.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 77: And they will cry, "O Malek, let your Lord finish us off." He will say, "You are staying."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 78: We have given you the truth, but most of you hate the truth.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 79: Have they contrived some scheme? We too are contriving.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 80: Or do they think that We cannot hear their secrets and their conspiracies? Yes indeed, Our messengers are by them, writing down.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 81: Say, "If the Most Gracious had a son, I would be the first to worship."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 82: Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, beyond what they describe.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 83: So leave them to blunder and play, until they encounter their Day which they are promised.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 84: It is He who is God in heaven, and God on earth. He is the Wise, the Knower.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 85: And blessed is He Who has sovereignty over the heavens and the earth and what is between them. He alone has knowledge of the Hour, and to Him you will be returned.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 86: Those they invoke besides Him are incapable of intercession; only those who testify to the truth and have knowledge.
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 87: And if you asked them, "Who created them?", they would say, "God." Why then do they deviate?
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 88: As for his statement: "My Lord, these are a people who do not believe."
Surah az-Zukhruf, Ayah 89: Pardon them, and say, "Peace." They will come to know.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 2: By the Enlightening Scripture.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 3: We have revealed it on a Blessed Night-We have warned.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 4: In it is distinguished every wise command.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 5: A decree from Us. We have been sending messages.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 6: As mercy from your Lord. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 7: Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you know for sure.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 8: There is no god but He. He gives life and causes death-your Lord and Lord of your ancestors of old.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 9: Yet they play around in doubt.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 10: So watch out for the Day when the sky produces a visible smoke.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 11: Enveloping mankind; this is a painful punishment.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 12: "Our Lord, lift the torment from us, we are believers."
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 13: But how can they be reminded? An enlightening messenger has already come to them.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 14: But they turned away from him, and said, "Educated, but crazy!"
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 15: We will ease the punishment a little, but you will revert.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 16: The Day when We launch the Great Assault-We will avenge.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 17: Before them We tested the people of Pharaoh; a noble messenger came to them.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 18: Saying, "Hand over God's servants to me. I am an honest messenger to you."
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 19: And, "Do not exalt yourselves above God. I come to you with clear authority.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 20: I have taken refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 21: But if you do not believe in me, keep away from me."
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 22: He appealed to his Lord: "These are a sinful people."
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 23: "Set out with My servants by night-you will be followed.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 24: And cross the sea quickly; they are an army to be drowned."
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 25: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind?
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 26: And plantations, and splendid buildings.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 27: And comforts they used to enjoy.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 28: So it was; and We passed it on to another people.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 29: Neither heaven nor earth wept over them, nor were they reprieved.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 30: And We delivered the Children of Israel from the humiliating persecution.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 31: From Pharaoh. He was a transgressing tyrant.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 32: And We chose them knowingly over all other people.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 33: And We gave them many signs, in which was an obvious test.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 34: These people say.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 35: "There is nothing but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 36: Bring back our ancestors, if you are truthful."
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 37: Are they better, or the people of Tubba and those before them? We annihilated them. They were evildoers.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 38: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them to play.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 39: We created them only for a specific purpose, but most of them do not know.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 40: The Day of Sorting Out is the appointed time for them all.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 41: The Day when no friend will avail a friend in any way, and they will not be helped.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 42: Except for him upon whom God has mercy. He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 43: The Tree of Bitterness.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 44: The food of the sinner.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 45: Like molten lead; boiling inside the bellies.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 46: Like the boiling of seething water.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 47: Seize him and drag him into the midst of Hell!
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 48: Then pour over his head the suffering of the Inferno!
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 49: Taste! You who were powerful and noble.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 50: This is what you used to doubt.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 51: As for the righteous, they will be in a secure place.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 52: Amidst gardens and springs.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 53: Dressed in silk and brocade, facing one another.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 54: So it is, and We will wed them to lovely companions.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 55: They will call therein for every kind of fruit, in peace and security.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 56: Therein they will not taste death, beyond the first death; and He will protect them from the torment of Hell.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 57: A favor from your Lord. That is the supreme salvation.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 58: We made it easy in your language, so that they may remember.
Surah ad-Dukhan, Ayah 59: So wait and watch. They too are waiting and watching.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 2: The revelation of the Book is from God, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 3: In the heavens and the earth are proofs for the believers.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 4: And in your own creation, and in the creatures He scattered, are signs for people of firm faith.

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 5: And in the alternation of night and day, and in the sustenance God sends down from the sky, with which He revives the earth after its death, and in the circulation of the winds, are marvels for people who reason.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 6: These are God's Verses which We recite to you in truth. In which message, after God and His revelations, will they believe?
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 7: Woe to every sinful liar.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 8: Who hears God's revelations being recited to him, yet he persists arrogantly, as though he did not hear them. Announce to him a painful punishment.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 9: And when he learns something of Our revelations, he takes them in mockery. For such there is a shameful punishment.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 10: Beyond them lies Hell. What they have earned will not benefit them at all, nor will those they adopted as lords instead of God. They will have a terrible punishment.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 11: This is guidance. Those who blaspheme their Lord's revelations will have a punishment of agonizing pain.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 12: It is God who placed the sea at your service, so that ships may run through it by His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may give thanks.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 13: And He placed at your service whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth-all is from Him. In that are signs for a people who think.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 14: Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not hope for the Days of God. He will fully recompense people for whatever they have earned.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 15: Whoever does a good deed, it is for his soul; and whoever commits evil, it is against it; then to your Lord you will be returned.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 16: We gave the Children of Israel the Book, and wisdom, and prophecy; and We provided them with the good things; and We gave them advantage over all other people.

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 17: And We gave them precise rulings. They fell into dispute only after knowledge came to them, out of mutual rivalry. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding the things they differed about.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 18: Then We set you upon a pathway of faith, so follow it, and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 19: They will not help you against God in any way. The wrongdoers are allies of one another, while God is the Protector of the righteous.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 20: This is an illumination for mankind, and guidance, and mercy for people who believe with certainty.

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 21: Do those who perpetrate the evil deeds assume that We will regard them as equal to those who believe and do righteous deeds, whether in their life or their death? Evil is their judgment!
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 22: God created the heavens and the earth with justice, so that every soul will be repaid for what it has earned. And they will not be wronged.

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 23: Have you considered him who has taken his desire for his god? God has knowingly led him astray, and has sealed his hearing and his heart, and has placed a veil over his vision. Who will guide him after God? Will you not reflect?

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 24: And they say, "There is nothing but this our present life; we die and we live, and nothing destroys us except time." But they have no knowledge of that; they are only guessing.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 25: When Our clarifying Verses are recited to them, their only argument is to say, "Bring back our ancestors, if you are truthful."
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 26: Say, "God gives you life, then He makes you die; then He gathers you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. But most people do not know."
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 27: To God belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth. On the Day when the Hour takes place, on that Day the falsifiers will lose.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 28: You will see every community on its knees; every community will be called to its Book: "Today you are being repaid for what you used to do.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 29: This Book of Ours speaks about you in truth. We have been transcribing what you have been doing."
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 30: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the clear triumph.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 31: But as for those who disbelieved: "Were My revelations not recited to you? But you turned arrogant, and were guilty people."

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 32: And when it was said, "The promise of God is true, and of the Hour there is no doubt," you said, "We do not know what the Hour is; we think it is only speculation; we are not convinced."
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 33: The evils of what they did will become evident to them, and the very thing they ridiculed will haunt them.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 34: And it will be said, "Today We forget you, as you forgot the encounter of this Day of yours. Your abode is the Fire, and there are no saviors for you.

Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 35: That is because you took God's revelations for a joke, and the worldly life lured you." So today they will not be brought out of it, and they will not be allowed to repent.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 36: Praise belongs to God; Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of humanity.
Surah al-Jatsiyah, Ayah 37: To Him belongs all supremacy in the heavens and the earth. He is the Majestic, the Wise.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 1: Ha, Meem.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 2: The sending down of the Scripture is from God, the Honorable, the Wise.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 3: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what lies between them except with reason, and for a finite period. But the blasphemers continue to ignore the warnings they receive.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 4: Say, "Have you considered those you worship instead of God? Show me which portion of the earth they have created. Or do they own a share of the heavens? Bring me a scripture prior to this one, or some trace of knowledge, if you are truthful."
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 5: Who is more wrong than him who invokes, besides God, those who will not answer him until the Day of Resurrection, and are heedless of their prayers?
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 6: And when humanity is gathered, they will be enemies to them, and will renounce their worship of them.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 7: When Our revelations are recited to them, plain and clear, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obviously magic."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 8: Or do they say, "He invented it himself"? Say, "If I invented it myself, there is nothing you can do to protect me from God. He knows well what you are engaged in. He is sufficient witness between me and you. He is the Forgiver, the Merciful."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 9: Say, "I am not different from the other messengers; and I do not know what will be done with me, or with you. I only follow what is inspired in me, and I am only a clear warner."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 10: Say, "Have you considered? What if it is from God and you disbelieve in it? A witness from the Children of Israel testified to its like, and has believed, while you turned arrogant. God does not guide the unjust people."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 11: Those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "If it were anything good, they would not have preceded us to it." And since they were not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient lie."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 12: And before it was the Book of Moses, a model and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book, in the Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong-and good news for the doers of good.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 13: Those who say, "Our Lord is God," then lead a righteous life-they have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 14: These are the inhabitants of Paradise, where they will dwell forever-a reward for what they used to do.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 15: We have enjoined upon man kindness to his parents. His mother carried him with difficulty, and delivered him with difficulty. His bearing and weaning takes thirty months. Until, when he has attained his maturity, and has reached forty years, he says, "Lord, enable me to appreciate the blessings You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to act with righteousness, pleasing You. And improve my children for me. I have sincerely repented to You, and I am of those who have surrendered."
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 16: Those are they from whom We accept the best of their deeds, and We overlook their misdeeds, among the dwellers of Paradise-the promise of truth which they are promised.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 17: As for him who says to his parents, "Enough of you! Are you promising me that I will be raised up, when generations have passed away before me?" While they cry for God's help, "Woe to you! Believe! The promise of God is true!" But he says, "These are nothing but tales of the ancients."
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 18: Those are they upon whom the sentence is justified, among the communities that have passed away before them, of jinn and humans. They are truly losers.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 19: There are degrees for everyone, according to what they have done, and He will repay them for their works in full, and they will not be wronged.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 20: On the Day when the faithless will be paraded before the Fire: "You have squandered your good in your worldly life, and you took pleasure in them. So today you are being repaid with the torment of shame, because of your unjust arrogance on earth, and because you used to sin."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 21: And mention the brother of Aad, as he warned his people at the dunes. Warnings have passed away before him, and after him: "Worship none but God; I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day."
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 22: They said, "Did you come to us to divert us from our gods? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are being truthful."
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 23: He said, "The knowledge is only with God, and I inform you of what I was sent with; but I see you are an ignorant people."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 24: Then, when they saw a cloud approaching their valley, they said, "This is a cloud that will bring us rain." "In fact, it is what you were impatient for: a wind in which is grievous suffering."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 25: It will destroy everything by the command of its Lord. And when the morning came upon them, there was nothing to be seen except their dwellings. Thus We requite the guilty people.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 26: We had empowered them in the same way as We empowered you; and We gave them the hearing, and the sight, and the minds. But neither their hearing, nor their sight, nor their minds availed them in any way. That is because they disregarded the revelations of God; and so they became surrounded by what they used to ridicule.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 27: We have destroyed many townships around you, and diversified the signs, so that they may return.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 28: Why then did the idols, whom they worshiped as means of nearness to God, not help them? In fact, they abandoned them. It was their lie, a fabrication of their own making.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 29: Recall when We dispatched towards you a number of jinn, to listen to the Quran. When they came in its presence, they said, "Pay attention!" Then, when it was concluded, they rushed to their people, warning them.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 30: They said, "O our people, we have heard a Scripture, sent down after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth, and to a straight path.
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 31: O our people! Answer the caller to God, and believe in Him; and He will forgive you your sins, and will save you from a painful punishment."
Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 32: He who does not answer the caller to God will not escape on earth, and has no protectors besides Him. Those are in obvious error.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 33: Do they not realize that God, who created the heavens and the earth, and was never tired by creating them, is Able to revive the dead? Yes indeed; He is Capable of everything.

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 34: On the Day when those who disbelieved are presented to the Fire: "Is this not real?" They will say, "Yes, indeed, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the suffering for having disbelieved."

Surah al-Ahqaf, Ayah 35: So be patient, as the messengers with resolve were patient, and do not be hasty regarding them. On the Day when they witness what they are promised, it will seem as if they had lasted only for an hour of a day. A proclamation: Will any be destroyed except the sinful people?
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 1: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of God-He nullifies their works.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 2: While those who believe, and work righteousness, and believe in what was sent down to Muhammad-and it is the truth from their Lord-He remits their sins, and relieves their concerns.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 3: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehoods, while those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. God thus cites for the people their examples.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 4: When you encounter those who disbelieve, strike at their necks. Then, when you have routed them, bind them firmly. Then, either release them by grace, or by ransom, until war lays down its burdens. Had God willed, He could have defeated them Himself, but He thus tests some of you by means of others. As for those who are killed in the way of God, He will not let their deeds go to waste.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 5: He will guide them, and will improve their state of mind.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 6: And will admit them into Paradise, which He has identified for them.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 7: O you who believe! If you support God, He will support you, and will strengthen your foothold.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 8: But as for those who disbelieve, for them is perdition, and He will waste their deeds.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 9: That is because they hated what God revealed, so He nullified their deeds.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 10: Have they not journeyed through the earth and seen the consequences for those before them? God poured destruction upon them, and for the unbelievers is something comparable.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 11: That is because God is the Master of those who believe, while the disbelievers have no master.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 12: God will admit those who believe and do good deeds into gardens beneath which rivers flow. As for those who disbelieve, they enjoy themselves, and eat as cattle eat, and the Fire will be their dwelling.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 13: How many a town was more powerful than your town which evicted you? We destroyed them, and there was no helper for them.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 14: Is he who stands upon evidence from his Lord, like someone whose evil deed is made to appear good to him? And they follow their own desires?

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 15: The likeness of the Garden promised to the righteous: in it are rivers of pure water, and rivers of milk forever fresh, and rivers of wine delightful to the drinkers, and rivers of strained honey. And therein they will have of every fruit, and forgiveness from their Lord. Like one abiding in the Fire forever, and are given to drink boiling water, that cuts-up their bowels?

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 16: Among them are those who listen to you, but when they leave your presence, they say to those given knowledge, "What did he say just now?" Those are they whose hearts God has sealed, and they follow their own desires.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 17: As for those who are guided, He increases them in guidance, and He has granted them their righteousness.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 18: Are they just waiting until the Hour comes to them suddenly? Its tokens have already come. But how will they be reminded when it has come to them?
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 19: Know that there is no god but God, and ask forgiveness for your sin, and for the believing men and believing women. God knows your movements, and your resting-place.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 20: Those who believe say, "If only a chapter is sent down." Yet when a decisive chapter is sent down, and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those in whose hearts is sickness looking at you with the look of someone fainting at death. So woe to them!
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 21: Obedience and upright speech. Then, when the matter is settled, being true to God would have been better for them.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 22: If you turn away, you are likely to make mischief on earth, and sever your family ties.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 23: Those are they whom God has cursed. He made them deaf, and blinded their sight.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 24: Will they not ponder the Quran? Or are there locks upon their hearts?
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 25: Those who reverted after the guidance became clear to them-Satan has enticed them, and has given them latitude.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 26: That is because they said to those who hated what God has revealed, "We will obey you in certain matters." But God knows their secret thoughts.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 27: How about when the angels take them at death, beating their faces and their backs?
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 28: That is because they pursued what displeases God, and they disliked His approval, so He nullified their works.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 29: Do those in whose hearts is sickness think that God will not expose their malice?

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 30: Had We willed, We could have shown them to you, and you would have recognized them by their marks. Yet you will recognize them by their tone of speech. And God knows your actions.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 31: We will certainly test you, until We know those among you who strive, and those who are steadfast, and We will test your reactions.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 32: Those who disbelieve, and hinder from the path of God, and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them-they will not hurt God in the least, but He will nullify their deeds.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 33: O you who believe! obey God, and obey the Messenger, and do not let your deeds go to waste.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 34: Those who disbelieve, and hinder from God's path, and then die as disbelievers-God will not forgive them.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 35: So do not waver and call for peace while you have the upper hand. God is with you, and He will not waste your efforts.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 36: The life of this word is nothing but play and pastime. But if you have faith and lead a righteous life, He will grant you your rewards, and He will not ask you for your possessions.
Surah Muhammad, Ayah 37: Were He to ask you for it, and press you, you would become tightfisted, and He would expose your unwillingness.

Surah Muhammad, Ayah 38: Here you are, being called to spend in the cause of God. Among you are those who withhold; but whoever withholds is withholding against his own soul. God is the Rich, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people, and they will not be like you.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 1: We have granted you a conspicuous victory.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 2: That God may forgive you your sin, past and to come, and complete His favors upon you, and guide you in a straight path.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 3: And help you with an unwavering support.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 4: It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers, to add faith to their faith. To God belong the forces of the heavens and the earth. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 5: He will admit the believers, male and female, into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever, and He will remit their sins. That, with God, is a great triumph.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 6: And He will punish the hypocrites, male and female, and the idolaters, male and female, those who harbor evil thoughts about God. They are surrounded by evil; and God is angry with them, and has cursed them, and has prepared for them Hell-a miserable destination.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 7: To God belong the troops of the heavens and the earth. God is Mighty and Wise.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 8: We sent you as a witness, and a bearer of good news, and a warner.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 9: That you may believe in God and His Messenger, and support Him, and honor Him, and praise Him morning and evening.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 10: Those who pledge allegiance to you are pledging allegiance to God. The hand of God is over their hands. Whoever breaks his pledge breaks it to his own loss. And whoever fulfills his covenant with God, He will grant him a great reward.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 11: The Desert-Arabs who remained behind will say to you, "Our belongings and our families have preoccupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, "Who can avail you anything against God, if He desires loss for you, or desires gain for you?" In fact, God is Informed of what you do.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 12: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers will never return to their families, and this seemed fine to your hearts; and you harbored evil thoughts, and were uncivilized people.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 13: He who does not believe in God and His Messenger-We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blazing Fire.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 14: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whomever He wills, and He punishes whomever He wills. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 15: Those who lagged behind will say when you depart to collect the gains, "Let us follow you." They want to change the Word of God. Say, "You will not follow us; God has said so before." Then they will say, "But you are jealous of us." In fact, they understand only a little.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 16: Say to the Desert-Arabs who lagged behind, "You will be called against a people of great might; you will fight them, unless they submit. If you obey, God will give you a fine reward. But if you turn away, as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 17: There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick. Whoever obeys God and His Messenger-He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away-He will punish him with a painful punishment.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 18: God was pleased with the believers, when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, and sent down serenity upon them, and rewarded them with an imminent conquest.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 19: And abundant gains for them to capture. God is Mighty and Wise.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 20: God has promised you abundant gains, which you will capture. He has expedited this for you, and has restrained people's hands from you; that it may be a sign to the believers, and that He may guide you on a straight path.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 21: And other things, of which you were incapable, but God has encompassed them. God is Capable of everything.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 22: If those who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned back and fled, then found neither protector nor helper.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 23: It is God's pattern, ongoing since the past. You will never find any change in God's pattern.
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 24: It is He who withheld their hands from you, and your hands from them, in the valley of Mecca, after giving you advantage over them. God is Observer of what you do.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 25: It is they who disbelieved, and barred you from the Sacred Mosque, and prevented the offering from reaching its destination. Were it not for faithful men and faithful women, whom you did not know, you were about to hurt them, and became guilty of an unintentional crime. Thus God admits into His mercy whomever He wills. Had they dispersed, We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with a painful penalty.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 26: Those who disbelieved filled their hearts with rage-the rage of the days of ignorance. But God sent His serenity down upon His Messenger, and upon the believers, and imposed on them the words of righteousness-of which they were most worthy and deserving. God is aware of everything.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 27: God has fulfilled His Messenger's vision in truth: "You will enter the Sacred Mosque, God willing, in security, heads shaven, or hair cut short, not fearing. He knew what you did not know, and has granted besides that an imminent victory."
Surah al-Fath, Ayah 28: It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all religions. God suffices as Witness.

Surah al-Fath, Ayah 29: Muhammad is the Messenger of God. Those with him are stern against the disbelievers, yet compassionate amongst themselves. You see them kneeling, prostrating, seeking blessings from God and approval. Their marks are on their faces from the effects of prostration. Such is their description in the Torah, and their description in the Gospel: like a plant that sprouts, becomes strong, grows thick, and rests on its stem, impressing the farmers. Through them He enrages the disbelievers. God has promised those among them who believe and do good deeds forgiveness and a great reward.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 1: O you who believe! Do not place your opinions above that of God and His Messenger, and fear God. God is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 2: O you who believe! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and do not speak loudly to him, as you speak loudly to one another, lest your works be in vain without you realizing.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 3: Those who lower their voices before God's Messenger-those are they whose hearts God has tested for piety. They will have forgiveness and a great reward.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 4: Those who call you from behind the chambers-most of them do not understand.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 5: Had they remained patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. But God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 6: O you who believe! If a troublemaker brings you any news, investigate, lest you harm people out of ignorance, and you become regretful for what you have done.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 7: And know that among you is the Messenger of God. Had he obeyed you in many things, you would have suffered hardship. But God has given you the love of faith, and adorned it in your hearts, and made disbelief, mischief, and rebellion hateful to you. These are the rightly guided.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 8: A Grace and Favor from God. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 9: If two groups of believers fight each other, reconcile between them. But if one group aggresses against the other, fight the aggressing group until it complies with God's command. Once it has complied, reconcile between them with justice, and be equitable. God loves the equitable.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 10: The believers are brothers, so reconcile between your brothers, and remain conscious of God, so that you may receive mercy.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 11: O you who believe! No people shall ridicule other people, for they may be better than they. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than they. Nor shall you slander one another, nor shall you insult one another with names. Evil is the return to wickedness after having attained faith. Whoever does not repent-these are the wrongdoers.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 12: O you who believe! Avoid most suspicion-some suspicion is sinful. And do not spy on one another, nor backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would detest it. So remain mindful of God. God is Most Relenting, Most Merciful.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 13: O people! We created you from a male and a female, and made you races and tribes, that you may know one another. The best among you in the sight of God is the most righteous. God is All-Knowing, Well-Experienced.

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 14: The Desert-Arabs say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not believed; but say, 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. But if you obey God and His Messenger, He will not diminish any of your deeds. God is Forgiving and Merciful."

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 15: The believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger, and then have not doubted, and strive for God's cause with their wealth and their persons. These are the sincere.
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 16: Say, "Are you going to teach God about your religion, when God knows everything in the heavens and the earth, and God is aware of all things?"

Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 17: They regarded it a favor to you that they have submitted. Say, "Do not consider your submission a favor to me; it is God who has done you a favor by guiding you to the faith, if you are sincere."
Surah al-Hujurat, Ayah 18: God knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and God is seeing of everything you do.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 1: O you who believe! Fulfill your commitments. Livestock animals are permitted for you, except those specified to you; but not wild game while you are in pilgrim sanctity. God decrees whatever He wills.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 2: O you who believe! Do not violate God's sacraments, nor the Sacred Month, nor the offerings, nor the garlanded, nor those heading for the Sacred House seeking blessings from their Lord and approval. When you have left the pilgrim sanctity, you may hunt. And let not the hatred of people who barred you from the Sacred Mosque incite you to aggression. And cooperate with one another in virtuous conduct and conscience, and do not cooperate with one another in sin and hostility. And fear God. God is severe in punishment.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 3: Prohibited for you are carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, and animals dedicated to other than God; also the flesh of animals strangled, killed violently, killed by a fall, gored to death, mangled by wild animals-except what you rescue, and animals sacrificed on altars; and the practice of drawing lots. For it is immoral. Today, those who disbelieve have despaired of your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me. Today I have perfected your religion for you, and have completed My favor upon you, and have approved Islam as a religion for you. But whoever is compelled by hunger, with no intent of wrongdoing-God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 4: They ask you what is permitted for them. Say, "Permitted for you are all good things, including what trained dogs and falcons catch for you." You train them according to what God has taught you. So eat from what they catch for you, and pronounce God's name over it. And fear God. God is Swift in reckoning.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 5: Today all good things are made lawful for you. And the food of those given the Scripture is lawful for you, and your food is lawful for them. So are chaste believing women, and chaste women from the people who were given the Scripture before you, provided you give them their dowries, and take them in marriage, not in adultery, nor as mistresses. But whoever rejects faith, his work will be in vain, and in the Hereafter he will be among the losers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 6: O you who believe! When you rise to pray, wash your faces and your hands and arms to the elbows, and wipe your heads, and your feet to the ankles. If you had intercourse, then purify yourselves. If you are ill, or travelling, or one of you returns from the toilet, or you had contact with women, and could not find water, then use some clean sand and wipe your faces and hands with it. God does not intend to burden you, but He intends to purify you, and to complete His blessing upon you, that you may be thankful.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 7: And Remember God's blessings upon you, and His covenant which He covenanted with you; when you said, "We hear and we obey." And remain conscious of God, for God knows what the hearts contain.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 8: O you who believe! Be upright to God, witnessing with justice; and let not the hatred of a certain people prevent you from acting justly. Adhere to justice, for that is nearer to piety; and fear God. God is informed of what you do.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 9: God has promised those who believe and work righteousness: they will have forgiveness and a great reward.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 10: As for those who disbelieve and reject Our revelations-these are the inmates of Hell.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 11: O you who believe! Remember God's blessings upon you; when certain people intended to extend their hands against you, and He restrained their hands from you. So reverence God, and in God let the believers put their trust.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 12: God received a pledge from the Children of Israel, and We raised among them twelve chiefs. God said, "I am with you; if you perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and believe in My messengers and support them, and lend God a loan of righteousness; I will remit your sins, and admit you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever among you disbelieves afterwards has strayed from the right way."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 13: Because of their breaking their pledge, We cursed them, and made their hearts hard. They twist the words out of their context, and they disregarded some of what they were reminded of. You will always witness deceit from them, except for a few of them. But pardon them, and overlook. God loves the doers of good.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 14: And from those who say, "We are Christians," We received their pledge, but they neglected some of what they were reminded of. So We provoked enmity and hatred among them until the Day of Resurrection; God will then inform them of what they used to craft.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 15: O People of the Book! Our Messenger has come to you, clarifying for you much of what you kept hidden of the Book, and overlooking much. A light from God has come to you, and a clear Book.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 16: God guides with it whoever follows His approval to the ways of peace, and He brings them out of darkness into light, by His permission, and He guides them in a straight path.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 17: They disbelieve those who say, "God is the Christ, the son of Mary." Say, "Who can prevent God, if He willed, from annihilating the Christ son of Mary, and his mother, and everyone on earth?" To God belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and what is between them. He creates whatever He wills, and God has power over everything.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 18: The Jews and the Christians say, "We are the children of God, and His beloved." Say, "Why then does He punish you for your sins?" In fact, you are humans from among those He created. He forgives whom He wills, and He punishes whom He wills. To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what lies between them, and to Him is the return.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 19: O People of the Book! Our Messenger has come to you, making things clear to you-after a cessation of messengers-so that you cannot say, "No preacher has come to us, and no warner." In fact, a preacher has come to you, and a warner; and God is Capable of everything.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 20: When Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember God's blessings upon you, when He placed prophets among you, and made you kings, and gave you what He never gave any other people."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 21: "O my people, enter the Holy Land which God has assigned for you, and do not turn back, lest you return as losers."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 22: They said, "O Moses, there are tyrannical people in it; we will not enter it until they leave it. If they leave it, we will be entering."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 23: Two men of those who feared, but whom God had blessed, said, "Go at them by the gate; and when you have entered it, you will prevail. And put your trust in God, if you are believers."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 24: They said, "O Moses, we will not enter it, ever, as long as they are in it. So go ahead, you and your Lord, and fight. We are staying right here."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 25: He said, "My Lord! I have control only over myself and my brother, so separate between us and between the wicked people."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 26: He said, "It is forbidden for them for forty years. They will wander aimlessly in the land. So do not grieve over the defiant people."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 27: And relate to them the true story of Adam's two sons: when they offered an offering, and it was accepted from one of them, but it was not accepted from the other. He Said, "I will kill you." He Said, "God accepts only from the righteous."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 28: "If you extend your hand to kill me, I will not extend my hand to kill you; for I fear God, Lord of the Worlds."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 29: "I would rather you bear my sin and your sin, and you become among the inmates of the Fire. Such is the reward for the evildoers."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 30: Then His soul prompted him to kill his brother, so he killed him, and became one of the losers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 31: Then God sent a raven digging the ground, to show him how to cover his brother's corpse. He said, "Woe to me! I was unable to be like this raven, and bury my brother's corpse." So he became full of regrets.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 32: Because of that We ordained for the Children of Israel: that whoever kills a person-unless it is for murder or corruption on earth-it is as if he killed the whole of mankind; and whoever saves it, it is as if he saved the whole of mankind. Our messengers came to them with clarifications, but even after that, many of them continue to commit excesses in the land.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 33: The punishment for those who fight God and His Messenger, and strive to spread corruption on earth, is that they be killed, or crucified, or have their hands and feet cut off on opposite sides, or be banished from the land. That is to disgrace them in this life; and in the Hereafter they will have a terrible punishment.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 34: Except for those who repent before you apprehend them. So know that God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 35: O you who believe! Be conscious of God, and seek the means of approach to Him, and strive in His cause, so that you may succeed.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 36: As for those who disbelieve, even if they owned everything on earth, and the like of it with it, and they offered it to ransom themselves from the torment of the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them. For them is a painful punishment.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 37: They will want to leave the Fire, but they will not leave it. For them is a lasting punishment.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 38: As for the thief, whether male or female, cut their hands as a penalty for what they have reaped-a deterrent from God. God is Mighty and Wise.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 39: But whoever repents after his crime, and reforms, God will accept his repentance. God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 40: Do you not know that to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills, and He forgives whom He wills. And God is Capable of everything.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 41: O Messenger!
