Do not let those who are quick to disbelief grieve you-from among those who say with their mouths, "We believe," but their hearts do not believe; and from among the Jews-listeners to lies, listeners to other people who did not come to you. They distort words from their places, and they say, "If you are given this, accept it; but if you are not given it, beware." Whomever God has willed to divert, you have nothing for him from God. Those are they whose hearts God does not intend to purify. For them is disgrace in this world, and for them is a great punishment in the Hereafter.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 42: Listeners to falsehoods, eaters of illicit earnings. If they come to you, judge between them, or turn away from them. If you turn away from them, they will not harm you in the least. But if you judge, judge between them equitably. God loves the equitable.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 43: But why do they come to you for judgment, when they have the Torah, in which is God's Law? Yet they turn away after that. These are not believers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 44: We have revealed the Torah, wherein is guidance and light. The submissive prophets ruled the Jews according to it, so did the rabbis and the scholars, as they were required to protect God's Book, and were witnesses to it. So do not fear people, but fear Me. And do not sell My revelations for a cheap price. Those who do not rule according to what God revealed are the unbelievers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 45: And We wrote for them in it: a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and an equal wound for a wound; but whoever forgoes it in charity, it will serve as atonement for him. Those who do not rule according to what God revealed are the evildoers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 46: In their footsteps, We sent Jesus son of Mary, fulfilling the Torah that preceded him; and We gave him the Gospel, wherein is guidance and light, and confirming the Torah that preceded him, and guidance and counsel for the righteous.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 47: So let the people of the Gospel rule according to what God revealed in it. Those who do not rule according to what God revealed are the sinners.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 48: And We revealed to you the Book, with truth, confirming the Scripture that preceded it, and superseding it. So judge between them according to what God revealed, and do not follow their desires if they differ from the truth that has come to you. For each of you We have assigned a law and a method. Had God willed, He could have made you a single nation, but He tests you through what He has given you. So compete in righteousness. To God is your return, all of you; then He will inform you of what you had disputed.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 49: And judge between them according to what God revealed, and do not follow their desires. And beware of them, lest they lure you away from some of what God has revealed to you. But if they turn away, know that God intends to strike them with some of their sins. In fact, a great many people are corrupt.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 50: Is it the laws of the time of ignorance that they desire? Who is better than God in judgment for people who are certain?

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 51: O you who believe! Do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies; some of them are allies of one another. Whoever of you allies himself with them is one of them. God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 52: You will see those in whose hearts is sickness racing towards them. They say, "We fear the wheel of fate may turn against us." But perhaps God will bring about victory, or some event of His making; thereupon they will regret what they concealed within themselves.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 53: Those who believe will say, "Are these the ones who swore by God with their strongest oaths that they are with you?" Their works have failed, so they became losers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 54: O you who believe! Whoever of you goes back on his religion-God will bring a people whom He loves and who love Him, kind towards the believers, stern with the disbelievers. They strive in the way of God, and do not fear the blame of the critic. That is the grace of God; He bestows it upon whomever He wills. God is Embracing and Knowing.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 55: Your allies are God, and His Messenger, and those who believe-those who pray regularly, and give charity, and bow down.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 56: Whoever allies himself with God, and His Messenger, and those who believe-surely the Party of God is the victorious.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 57: O you who believe! Do not befriend those who take your religion in mockery and as a sport, be they from among those who were given the Scripture before you, or the disbelievers. And obey God, if you are believers.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 58: When you call to the prayer, they take it as a joke and a trifle. That is because they are people who do not reason.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 59: Say, "O People of the Scripture! Do you resent us only because we believe in God, and in what was revealed to us, and in what was revealed previously; and most of you are sinners?"

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 60: Say, "Shall I inform you of worse than that for retribution from God? He whom God has cursed, and with whom He became angry; and He turned some of them into apes, and swine, and idol worshipers. These are in a worse position, and further away from the right way."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 61: When they come to you, they say, "We believe," though they have entered with disbelief, and they have departed with it. But God is well aware of what they hide.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 62: You see many of them competing with one another in sin and hostility, and their consuming of what is illicit. What they have been doing is truly evil.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 63: Why do the rabbis and the priests not prevent them from speaking sinfully and from consuming forbidden wealth? Evil is what they have been doing.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 64: The Jews say, "God's hand is tied." It is their hands that are tied, and they are cursed for what they say. In fact, His hands are outstretched; He gives as He wills. Certainly, what was revealed to your from your Lord will increase many of them in defiance and blasphemy. And We placed between them enmity and hatred, until the Day of Resurrection. Whenever they kindle the fire of war, God extinguishes it. And they strive to spread corruption on earth. God does not love the corrupters.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 65: Had the People of the Scriputure believed and been righteous, We would have remitted their sins, and admitted them into the Gardens of Bliss.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 66: Had they observed the Torah, and the Gospel, and what was revealed to them from their Lord, they would have consumed amply from above them, and from beneath their feet. Among them is a moderate community, but evil is what many of them are doing.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 67: O Messenger, convey what was revealed to you from your Lord. But if you do not, then you would not have delivered His message. And God will protect you from the people. God does not guide the disbelieving people.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 68: Say, "O People of the Scripture! You have no basis until you uphold the Torah, and the Gospel, and what is revealed to you from your Lord." But what is revealed to you from your Lord will increase many of them in rebellion and disbelief, so do not be sorry for the disbelieving people.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 69: Those who believe, and the Jews, and the Sabians, and the Christians-whoever believes in God and the Last Day, and does what is right-they have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 70: We made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We sent to them messengers. Whenever a messenger came to them with what their souls did not desire, some of them they accused of lying, and others they put to death.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 71: They assumed there would be no punishment, so they turned blind and deaf. Then God redeemed them, but then again many of them turned blind and deaf. But God is Seeing of what they do.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 72: They disbelieve those who say, "God is the Messiah the son of Mary." But the Messiah himself said, "O Children of Israel, worship God, my Lord and your Lord. Whoever associates others with God, God has forbidden him Paradise, and his dwelling is the Fire. The wrongdoers have no saviors."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 73: They disbelieve those who say, "God is the third of three." But there is no deity except the One God. If they do not refrain from what they say, a painful torment will befall those among them who disbelieve.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 74: Will they not repent to God and ask His forgiveness? God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 75: The Messiah son of Mary was only a messenger, before whom other Messengers had passed away, and his mother was a woman of truth. They both used to eat food. Note how We make clear the revelations to them; then note how deluded they are.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 76: Say, "Do you worship, besides God, what has no power to harm or benefit you?" But God: He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 77: Say, "O People of the Scripture! Do not exaggerate in your religion beyond the truth; and do not follow the opinions of people who went astray before, and misled many, and themselves strayed off the balanced way."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 78: Cursed were those who disbelieved from among the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and Jesus son of Mary. That is because they rebelled and used to transgress.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 79: They used not to prevent one another from the wrongs they used to commit. Evil is what they used to do.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 80: You will see many of them befriending those who disbelieve. Terrible is what their souls prompts them to do. The wrath of God fell upon them, and in the torment they will remain.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 81: Had they believed in God and the Prophet, and in what was revealed to him, they would not have befriended them. But many of them are immoral.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 82: You will find that the people most hostile towards the believers are the Jews and the polytheists. And you will find that the nearest in affection towards the believers are those who say, "We are Christians." That is because among them are priests and monks, and they are not arrogant.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 83: And when they hear what was revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears, as they recognize the truth in it. They say, "Our Lord, we have believed, so count us among the witnesses."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 84: "And why should we not believe in God, and in the truth that has come to us, and hope that our Lord will include us among the righteous people?"
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 85: God will reward them for what they say-Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will stay forever. Such is the reward of the righteous.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 86: But as for those who disbelieve and deny Our signs-these are the inmates of the Fire.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 87: O you who believe! Do not prohibit the good things God has permitted for you, and do not commit aggression. God does not love the aggressors.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 88: And eat of the lawful and good things God has provided for you; and be conscious of God, in whom you are believers.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 89: God does not hold you accountable for your unintended oaths, but He holds you accountable for your binding oaths. The atonement for it is by feeding ten needy people from the average of what you feed your families, or by clothing them, or by freeing a slave. Anyone who lacks the means shall fast for three days. That is the atonement for breaking your oaths when you have sworn them. So keep your oaths. Thus God makes clear His Revelations to you, that you may be grateful.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 90: O you who believe! Intoxicants, gambling, idolatry, and divination are abominations of Satan's doing. Avoid them, so that you may prosper.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 91: Satan wants to provoke strife and hatred among you through intoxicants and gambling, and to prevent you from the remembrance of God, and from prayer. Will you not desist?
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 92: Obey God and obey the Messenger, and be cautious. If you turn away-know that the duty of Our Messenger is clear communication.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 93: Those who believe and do righteous deeds will not be blamed for what they may have eaten, provided they obey, and believe, and do good deeds, then maintain piety and faith, then remain righteous and charitable. God loves the charitable.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 94: O you who believe! God will test you with something of the game your hands and spears obtain, that God may know who fears Him at heart. Whoever commits aggression after that will have a painful punishment.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 95: O you who believe! do not kill game while you are in pilgrim sanctity. Whoever of you kills any intentionally, its penalty shall be a domestic animal comparable to what he killed, as determined by two honest persons among you-an offering delivered to the Kaabah. Or he may atone by feeding the needy, or its equivalent in fasting, so that he may taste the consequences of his conduct. God forgives what is past. But whoever repeats, God will take revenge on him. God is Almighty, Avenger.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 96: Permitted for you is the catch of sea, and its food-as sustenance for you and for travelers. But forbidden for you is the game of land while you are in pilgrim sanctity. And fear God, to whom you will be gathered.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 97: God has appointed the Kaabah, the Sacred House, a sanctuary for the people, and the Sacred Month, and the offerings, and the garlanded. That you may know that God knows everything in the heavens and the earth, and that God is Cognizant of all things.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 98: Know that God is severe in retribution, and that God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 99: The Messenger's sole duty is to convey. God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 100: Say: "The bad and the good are not equal, even though the abundance of the bad may impress you. So be conscious of God, O you who possess intelligence, that you may succeed."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 101: O you who believe! Do not ask about things that would trouble you if disclosed to you. But if you were to ask about them while the Quran is being revealed, they will become obvious to you. God forgives that. God is Forgiving and Clement.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 102: A people before you asked about them, but then came to reject them.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 103: God did not institute the superstitions of Bahirah, Saibah, Wasilah, or of Hami; but those who disbelieve fabricate lies about God-most of them do not understand.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 104: And when it is said to them, "Come to what God has revealed, and to the Messenger," they say, "Sufficient for us is what we found our forefathers upon." Even if their forefathers knew nothing, and were not guided?

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 105: O you who believe! You are responsible for your own souls. He who has strayed cannot harm you if you are guided. To God is you return, all of you, and He will inform you of what you used to do.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 106: O you who believe! When death approaches one of you, let two reliable persons from among you act as witnesses to the making of a bequest, or two persons from another people if you are travelling in the land and the event of death approaches you. Engage them after the prayer. If you have doubts, let them swear by God: "We will not sell our testimony for any price, even if he was a near relative, and we will not conceal God's testimony, for then we would be sinners."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 107: If it is discovered that they are guilty of perjury: let two others take their place, two from among those responsible for the claim, and have them swear by God, "Our testimony is more truthful than their testimony, and we will not be biased, for then we would be wrongdoers."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 108: That makes it more likely that they will give true testimony, fearing that their oaths might be contradicted by subsequent oaths. So fear God, and listen. God does not guide the disobedient people.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 109: On the Day when God will gather the messengers, then say, "What response were you given?" They will say, "We have no knowledge; it is you who are the Knower of the unseen."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 110: When God will say, "O Jesus son of Mary, recall My favor upon you and upon your mother, how I supported you with the Holy Spirit. You spoke to the people from the crib, and in maturity. How I taught you the Scripture and wisdom, and the Torah and the Gospel. And recall that you molded from clay the shape of a bird, by My leave, and then you breathed into it, and it became a bird, by My leave. And you healed the blind and the leprous, by My leave; and you revived the dead, by My leave. And recall that I restrained the Children of Israel from you when you brought them the clear miracles. But those who disbelieved among them said, `This is nothing but obvious sorcery.'"
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 111: "And when I inspired the disciples: `Believe in Me and in My Messenger.' They said, `We have believed, so bear witness that We have submitted.'"
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 112: "And when the disciples said, 'O Jesus son of Mary, is your Lord able to bring down for us a feast from heaven?' He said, 'Fear God, if you are believers.'"
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 113: They said, "We wish to eat from it, so that our hearts may be reassured, and know that you have told us the truth, and be among those who witness it."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 114: Jesus son of Mary said, "O God, our Lord, send down for us a table from heaven, to be a festival for us, for the first of us, and the last of us, and a sign from You; and provide for us; You are the Best of providers."
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 115: God said, "I will send it down to you. But whoever among you disbelieves thereafter, I will punish him with a punishment the like of which I never punish any other being."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 116: And God will say, "O Jesus son of Mary, did you say to the people, `Take me and my mother as gods rather than God?'" He will say, "Glory be to You! It is not for me to say what I have no right to. Had I said it, You would have known it. You know what is in my soul, and I do not know what is in your soul. You are the Knower of the hidden.

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 117: I only told them what You commanded me: that you shall worship God, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them while I was among them; but when You took me to Yourself, you became the Watcher over them-You are Witness over everything.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 118: If You punish them, they are Your servants; but if You forgive them, You are the Mighty and Wise."

Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 119: God will say, "This is a Day when the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness." They will have Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will remain forever. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is the great attainment.
Surah al-Mai'dah, Ayah 120: To God belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and what lies in them, and He has power over everything.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 1: Qaf. By the Glorious Quran.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 2: They marveled that a warner has come to them from among them. The disbelievers say, "This is something strange.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 3: When we have died and become dust? This is a farfetched return."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 4: We know what the earth consumes of them, and with Us is a comprehensive book.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 5: But they denied the truth when it has come to them, so they are in a confused state.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 6: Have they not observed the sky above them, how We constructed it, and decorated it, and it has no cracks?
Surah Qaf, Ayah 7: And the earth, how We spread it out, and set on it mountains, and grew in it all kinds of delightful pairs?
Surah Qaf, Ayah 8: A lesson and a reminder for every penitent worshiper.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 9: And We brought down from the sky blessed water, and produced with it gardens and grain to harvest.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 10: And the soaring palm trees, with clustered dates.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 11: As sustenance for the servants. And We revive thereby a dead town. Likewise is the resurrection.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 12: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, and so did the dwellers of Russ, and Thamood.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 13: And Aad, and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 14: And the Dwellers of the Woods, and the people of Tubba. They all rejected the messengers, so My threat came true.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 15: Were We fatigued by the first creation? But they are in doubt of a new creation.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 16: We created the human being, and We know what his soul whispers to him. We are nearer to him than his jugular vein.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 17: As the two receivers receive, seated to the right and to the left.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 18: Not a word does he utter, but there is a watcher by him, ready.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 19: The daze of death has come in truth: "This is what you tried to evade."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 20: And the Trumpet is blown: "This is the Promised Day."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 21: And every soul will come forward, accompanied by a driver and a witness.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 22: "You were in neglect of this, so We lifted your screen from you, and your vision today is keen."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 23: And His escort will say, "This is what I have ready with me."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 24: "Throw into Hell every stubborn disbeliever.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 25: Preventer of good, aggressor, doubter.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 26: Who fabricated another god with God; toss him into the intense agony."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 27: His escort will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him rebel, but he was far astray."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 28: He will say, "Do not feud in My presence-I had warned you in advance.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 29: The decree from Me will not be changed, and I am not unjust to the servants."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 30: On the Day when We will say to Hell, "Are you full?" And it will say, "Are there any more?"
Surah Qaf, Ayah 31: And Paradise will be brought closer to the pious, not far away.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 32: "This is what you were promised-for every careful penitent.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 33: Who inwardly feared the Most Gracious, and came with a repentant heart.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 34: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."
Surah Qaf, Ayah 35: Therein they will have whatever they desire-and We have even more.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 36: How many generations before them, who were more powerful than they, did We destroy? They explored the lands-was there any escape?
Surah Qaf, Ayah 37: In that is a reminder for whoever possesses a heart, or cares to listen and witness.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 38: We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, and no fatigue touched Us.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 39: So endure what they say, and proclaim the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun, and before sunset.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 40: And glorify Him during the night, and at the end of devotions.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 41: And listen for the Day when the caller calls from a nearby place.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 42: The Day when they will hear the Shout in all truth. That is the Day of Emergence.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 43: It is We who control life and death, and to Us is the destination.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 44: The Day when the earth will crack for them at once. That is an easy gathering for Us.
Surah Qaf, Ayah 45: We are fully aware of what they say, and you are not a dictator over them. So remind by the Quran whoever fears My warning.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 1: By the spreaders spreading.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 2: And those carrying loads.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 3: And those moving gently.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 4: And those distributing as commanded.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 5: What you are promised is true.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 6: Judgment will take place.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 7: By the sky that is woven.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 8: You differ in what you say.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 9: Averted from it is he who is averted.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 10: Perish the imposters.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 11: Those who are dazed in ignorance.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 12: They ask, "When is the Day of Judgment?"
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 13: The Day they are presented to the Fire.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 14: "Taste your ordeal. This is what you used to challenge."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 15: But the pious are amidst gardens and springs.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 16: Receiving what their Lord has given them. They were virtuous before that.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 17: They used to sleep a little at night.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 18: And at dawn, they would pray for pardon.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 19: And in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the deprived.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 20: And on earth are signs for the convinced.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 21: And within yourselves. Do you not see?
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 22: And in the heaven is your livelihood, and what you are promised.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 23: By the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is as true as the fact that you speak.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 24: Has the story of Abraham's honorable guests reached you?
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 25: When they entered upon him, they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace, strangers."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 26: Then he slipped away to his family, and brought a fatted calf.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 27: He set it before them. He said, "Will you not eat?"
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 28: And he harbored fear of them. They said, "Do not fear," and they announced to him the good news of a knowledgeable boy.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 29: His wife came forward crying. She clasped her face, and said, "A barren old woman?"
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 30: They said, "Thus spoke your Lord. He is the Wise, the Knowing."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 31: He said, "What is your business, O envoys?"
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 32: They said, "We are sent to a people guilty of sin."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 33: "To unleash upon them rocks of clay."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 34: "Marked by your Lord for the excessive."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 35: We evacuated all the believers who were in it.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 36: But found in it only one household of Muslims.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 37: And We left in it a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 38: And in Moses. We sent him to Pharaoh with a clear authority.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 39: But he turned away with his warlords, and said, "A sorcerer or a madman."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 40: So We seized him and his troops, and threw them into the sea, and He was to blame.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 41: And in Aad. We unleashed against them the devastating wind.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 42: It spared nothing it came upon, but rendered it like decayed ruins.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 43: And in Thamood. They were told, "Enjoy yourselves for a while."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 44: But they defied the command of their Lord, so the lightning struck them as they looked on.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 45: They could not rise up, nor could they find help.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 46: And before that, the people of Noah. They were immoral people.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 47: We constructed the universe with power, and We are expanding it.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 48: And the earth-We spread it out-How well We prepared it!
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 49: We created all things in pairs, so that you may reflect and ponder.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 50: "So flee towards God. I am to you from Him a clear warner."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 51: "And do not set up any other god with God. I am to you from Him a clear warner."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 52: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them, but they said, "A sorcerer or a madman."
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 53: Did they recommend it to one another? In fact, they are rebellious people.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 54: So turn away from them; you are not to blame.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 55: And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 56: I did not create the jinn and the humans except to worship Me.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 57: I need no livelihood from them, nor do I need them to feed Me.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 58: God is the Provider, the One with Power, the Strong.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 59: Those who do wrong will have their turn, like the turn of their counterparts, so let them not rush Me.
Surah adz-Dzariyat, Ayah 60: So woe to those who disbelieve because of that Day of theirs which they are promised.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 1: By the Mount.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 2: And a Book inscribed.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 3: In a published scroll.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 4: And the frequented House.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 5: And the elevated roof.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 6: And the seething sea.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 7: The punishment of your Lord is coming.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 8: There is nothing to avert it.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 9: On the Day when the heaven sways in agitation.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 10: And the mountains go into motion.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 11: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 12: Those who play with speculation.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 13: The Day when they are shoved into the Fire of Hell forcefully.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 14: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 15: Is this magic, or do you not see?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 16: Burn in it. Whether you are patient, or impatient, it is the same for you. You are only being repaid for what you used to do."
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 17: But the righteous will be amid gardens and bliss.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 18: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord has spared them the suffering of Hell.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 19: Eat and drink happily, for what you used to do.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 20: Relaxing on luxurious furnishings; and We will couple them with gorgeous spouses.

Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 21: Those who believed and their offspring followed them in faith-We will unite them with their offspring, and We will not deprive them of any of their works. Every person is hostage to what he has earned.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 22: And We will supply them with fruit, and meat; such as they desire.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 23: They will exchange therein a cup; wherein is neither harm, nor sin.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 24: Serving them will be youths like hidden pearls.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 25: And they will approach one another, inquiring.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 26: They will say, "Before this, we were fearful for our families.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 27: But God blessed us, and spared us the agony of the Fiery Winds.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 28: Before this, we used to pray to Him. He is the Good, the Compassionate."
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 29: So remind. By the grace of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 30: Or do they say, "A poet-we await for him a calamity of time"?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 31: Say, "Go on waiting; I will be waiting with you."
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 32: Or is it that their dreams compel them to this? Or are they aggressive people?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 33: Or do they say, "He made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 34: So let them produce a discourse like it, if they are truthful.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 35: Or were they created out of nothing? Or are they the creators?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 36: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? In fact, they are not certain.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 37: Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord? Or are they the controllers?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 38: Or do they have a stairway by means of which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear proof.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 39: Or for Him the daughters, and for you the sons?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 40: Or do you demand a payment from them, and they are burdened by debt?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 41: Or do they know the future, and they are writing it down?
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 42: Or are they planning a conspiracy? The conspiracy will befall the disbelievers.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 43: Or do they have a god besides God? God transcends what they associate.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 44: Even if they were to see lumps of the sky falling down, they would say, "A mass of clouds."
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 45: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be stunned.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 46: The Day when their ploys will avail them nothing; and they will not be helped.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 47: For those who do wrong, there is a punishment besides that; but most of them do not know.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 48: So patiently await the decision of your Lord, for you are before Our Eyes; and proclaim the praises of your Lord when you arise.
Surah ath-Thur , Ayah 49: And glorify Him during the night, and at the receding of the stars.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 1: By the star as it goes down.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 2: Your friend has not gone astray, nor has he erred.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 3: Nor does he speak out of desire.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 4: It is but a revelation revealed.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 5: Taught to him by the Extremely Powerful.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 6: The one of vigor. He settled.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 7: While he was at the highest horizon.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 8: Then he came near, and hovered around.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 9: He was within two bows' length, or closer.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 10: Then He revealed to His servant what He revealed.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 11: The heart did not lie about what it saw.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 12: Will you dispute with him concerning what he saw?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 13: He saw him on another descent.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 14: At the Lotus Tree of the Extremity.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 15: Near which is the Garden of Repose.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 16: As there covered the Lotus Tree what covered it.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 17: The sight did not waver, nor did it exceed.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 18: He saw some of the Great Signs of his Lord.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 19: Have you considered al-Lat and al-Uzza?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 20: And Manat, the third one, the other?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 21: Are you to have the males, and He the females?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 22: What a bizarre distribution.

Surah an-Najm, Ayah 23: These are nothing but names, which you have devised, you and your ancestors, for which God sent down no authority. They follow nothing but assumptions, and what the ego desires, even though guidance has come to them from their Lord.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 24: Or is the human being to have whatever he desires?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 25: To God belong the Last and the First.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 26: How many an angel is there in the heavens whose intercession avails nothing, except after God gives permission to whomever He wills, and approves?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 27: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels the names of females.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 28: They have no knowledge of that. They only follow assumptions, and assumptions are no substitute for the truth.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 29: So avoid him who has turned away from Our remembrance, and desires nothing but the present life.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 30: That is the extent of their knowledge. Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best who has accepted guidance.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 31: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth. He will repay those who do evil according to their deeds, and recompense those who do good with the best.

Surah an-Najm, Ayah 32: Those who avoid gross sins and indecencies-except for minor lapses-your Lord is of Vast Forgiveness. He knows you well, ever since He created you from the earth, and ever since you were embryos in your mothers' wombs. So do not acclaim your own virtue; He is fully aware of the righteous.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 33: Have you considered him who turned away?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 34: And gave a little, and held back?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 35: Does he possess knowledge of the unseen, and can therefore foresee?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 36: Or was he not informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 37: And of Abraham, who fulfilled?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 38: That no soul bears the burdens of another soul.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 39: And that the human being attains only what he strives for.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 40: And that his efforts will be witnessed.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 41: Then he will be rewarded for it the fullest reward.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 42: And that to your Lord is the finality.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 43: And that it is He who causes laughter and weeping.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 44: And that it is He who gives death and life.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 45: And that it is He who created the two kinds-the male and the female.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 46: From a sperm drop, when emitted.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 47: And that upon Him is the next existence.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 48: And that it is He who enriches and impoverishes.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 49: And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 50: And that it is He who destroyed the first Aad.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 51: And Thamood, sparing no one.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 52: And the people of Noah before that; for they were most unjust and most oppressive.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 53: And He toppled the ruined cities.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 54: And covered them with whatever covered them.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 55: So which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 56: This is a warning, just like the first warnings.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 57: The inevitable is imminent.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 58: None besides God can unveil it.
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 59: Do you marvel at this discourse?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 60: And laugh, and do not weep?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 61: Lost in your frivolity?
Surah an-Najm, Ayah 62: So bow down to God, and worship!
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 1: The Hour has drawn near, and the moon has split.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 2: Yet whenever they see a miracle, they turn away, and say, "Continuous magic."
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 3: They lied, and followed their opinions, but everything has its time.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 4: And there came to them news containing a deterrent.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 5: Profound wisdom-but warnings are of no avail.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 6: So turn away from them. On the Day when the Caller calls to something terrible.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 7: Their eyes humiliated, they will emerge from the graves, as if they were swarming locusts.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 8: Scrambling towards the Caller, the disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 9: Before them the people of Noah disbelieved. They rejected Our servant, and said, "Crazy," and he was rebuked.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 10: So he appealed to his Lord, "I am overwhelmed, so help me."
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 11: So We opened the floodgates of heaven with water pouring down.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 12: And We made the earth burst with springs, and the waters met for a purpose already destined.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 13: And We carried him on a craft of planks and nails.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 14: Sailing before Our eyes; a reward for him who was rejected.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 15: And We left it as a sign. Is there anyone who would take heed?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 16: So how were My punishment and My warnings?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 17: We made the Quran easy to learn. Is there anyone who would learn?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 18: Aad denied the truth. So how were My punishment and My warnings?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 19: We unleashed upon them a screaming wind, on a day of unrelenting misery.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 20: Plucking the people away, as though they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 21: So how were My punishment and My warnings?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 22: We made the Quran easy to remember. Is there anyone who would remember?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 23: Thamood rejected the warnings.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 24: They said, "Are we to follow one of us, a human being? We would then go astray, and end up in Hell.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 25: Was the message given to him, out of all of us? In fact, he is a wicked liar."
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 26: They will know tomorrow who the wicked liar is.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 27: We are sending the she-camel as a test for them; so watch them and be patient.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 28: And inform them that the water is to be shared between them; each share of drink made available.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 29: But they called their friend, and he dared, and he slaughtered.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 30: So how were My punishment and My warnings?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 31: We sent against them a single Scream, and they became like crushed hay.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 32: We made the Quran easy to understand. Is there anyone who would understand?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 33: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 34: We unleashed upon them a shower of stones, except for the family of Lot; We rescued them at dawn.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 35: A blessing from Us. Thus We reward the thankful.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 36: He had warned them of Our onslaught, but they dismissed the warnings.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 37: They even lusted for his guest, so We obliterated their eyes. "So taste My punishment and My warnings."
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 38: Early morning brought upon them enduring punishment.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 39: So taste My punishment and My warnings.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 40: We made the Quran easy to memorize. Is there anyone who would memorize?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 41: The warnings also came to the people of Pharaoh.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 42: They rejected Our signs, all of them, so We seized them-the seizure of an Almighty Omnipotent.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 43: Are your unbelievers better than all those? Or do you have immunity in the scriptures?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 44: Or do they say, "We are united, and we will be victorious"?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 45: The multitude will be defeated, and they will turn their backs.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 46: The Hour is their appointed time-the Hour is more disastrous, and most bitter.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 47: The wicked are in confusion and madness.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 48: The Day when they are dragged upon their faces into the Fire: "Taste the touch of Saqar."
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 49: Everything We created is precisely measured.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 50: And Our command is but once, like the twinkling of an eye.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 51: We have destroyed your likes. Is there anyone who would ponder?
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 52: Everything they have done is in the Books.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 53: Everything, small or large, is written down.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 54: The righteous will be amidst gardens and rivers.
Surah al-Qamar, Ayah 55: In an assembly of virtue, in the presence of an Omnipotent King.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 1: The Compassionate.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 2: Has taught the Quran.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 3: He created man.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 4: And taught him clear expression.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 5: The sun and the moon move according to plan.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 6: And the stars and the trees prostrate themselves.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 7: And the sky, He raised; and He set up the balance.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 8: So do not transgress in the balance.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 9: But maintain the weights with justice, and do not violate the balance.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 10: And the earth; He set up for the creatures.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 11: In it are fruits, and palms in clusters.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 12: And grains in the blades, and fragrant plants.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 13: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 14: He created man from hard clay, like bricks.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 15: And created the jinn from a fusion of fire.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 16: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 17: Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 18: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 19: He merged the two seas, converging together.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 20: Between them is a barrier, which they do not overrun.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 21: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 22: From them emerge pearls and coral.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 23: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 24: His are the ships, raised above the sea like landmarks.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 25: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 26: Everyone upon it is perishing.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 27: But will remain the Presence of your Lord, Full of Majesty and Splendor.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 28: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 29: Everyone in the heavens and the earth asks Him. Every day He is managing.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 30: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 31: We will attend to you, O prominent two.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 32: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 33: O society of jinn and humans! If you can pass through the bounds of the heavens and the earth, go ahead and pass. But you will not pass except with authorization.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 34: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 35: You will be bombarded with flares of fire and brass, and you will not succeed.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 36: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 37: When the sky splits apart, and becomes rose, like paint.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 38: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 39: On that Day, no human and no jinn will be asked about his sins.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 40: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 41: The guilty will be recognized by their marks; they will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 42: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 43: This is Hell that the guilty denied.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 44: They circulate between it and between a seething bath.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 45: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 46: But for him who feared the standing of his Lord are two gardens.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 47: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 48: Full of varieties.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 49: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 50: In them are two flowing springs.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 51: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 52: In them are fruits of every kind, in pairs.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 53: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 54: Reclining on furnishings lined with brocade, and the fruits of the two gardens are near at hand.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 55: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 56: In them are maidens restraining their glances, untouched before by any man or jinn.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 57: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 58: As though they were rubies and corals.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 59: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 60: Is the reward of goodness anything but goodness?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 61: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 62: And beneath them are two gardens.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 63: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 64: Deep green.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 65: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 66: In them are two gushing springs.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 67: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 68: In them are fruits, and date-palms, and pomegranates.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 69: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 70: In them are good and beautiful ones.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 71: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 72: Companions, secluded in the tents.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 73: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 74: Whom no human has touched before, nor jinn.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 75: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 76: Reclining on green cushions, and exquisite carpets.
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 77: So which of your Lord's marvels will you deny?
Surah ar-Rahman, Ayah 78: Blessed be the name of your Lord, Full of Majesty and Splendor.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 1: When the inevitable occurs.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 2: Of its occurrence, there is no denial.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 3: Bringing low, raising high.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 4: When the earth is shaken with a shock.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 5: And the mountains are crushed and crumbled.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 6: And they become scattered dust.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 7: And you become three classes.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 8: Those on the Right-what of those on the Right?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 9: And those on the Left-what of those on the Left?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 10: And the forerunners, the forerunners.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 11: Those are the nearest.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 12: In the Gardens of Bliss.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 13: A throng from the ancients.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 14: And a small band from the latecomers.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 15: On luxurious furnishings.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 16: Reclining on them, facing one another.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 17: Serving them will be immortalized youth.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 18: With cups, pitchers, and sparkling drinks.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 19: Causing them neither headache, nor intoxication.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 20: And fruits of their choice.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 21: And meat of birds that they may desire.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 22: And lovely companions.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 23: The likenesses of treasured pearls.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 24: As a reward for what they used to do.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 25: Therein they will hear no nonsense, and no accusations.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 26: But only the greeting: "Peace, peace."
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 27: And those on the Right-what of those on the Right?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 28: In lush orchards.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 29: And sweet-smelling plants.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 30: And extended shade.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 31: And outpouring water.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 32: And abundant fruit.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 33: Neither withheld, nor forbidden.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 34: And uplifted mattresses.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 35: We have created them of special creation.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 36: And made them virgins.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 37: Tender and un-aging.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 38: For those on the Right.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 39: A throng from the ancients.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 40: And a throng from the latecomers.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 41: And those on the Left-what of those on the Left?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 42: Amid searing wind and boiling water.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 43: And a shadow of thick smoke.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 44: Neither cool, nor refreshing.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 45: They had lived before that in luxury.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 46: And they used to persist in immense wrongdoing.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 47: And they used to say, "When we are dead and turned into dust and bones, are we to be resurrected?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 48: And our ancient ancestors too?"
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 49: Say, "The first and the last.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 50: Will be gathered for the appointment of a familiar Day."
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 51: Then you, you misguided, who deny the truth.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 52: Will be eating from the Tree of Bitterness.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 53: Will be filling your bellies with it.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 54: Will be drinking on top of it boiling water.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 55: Drinking like thirsty camels drink.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 56: That is their hospitality on the Day of Retribution.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 57: We created you-if only you would believe!
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 58: Have you seen what you ejaculate?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 59: Is it you who create it, or are We the Creator?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 60: We have decreed death among you, and We will not be outstripped.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 61: In replacing you with your likes, and transforming you into what you do not know.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 62: You have known the first formation; if only you would remember.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 63: Have you seen what you cultivate?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 64: Is it you who make it grow, or are We the Grower?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 65: If We will, We can turn it into rubble; then you will lament.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 66: "We are penalized.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 67: No, we are being deprived."
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 68: Have you seen the water you drink?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 69: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds, or are We the Sender?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 70: If We will, We can make it salty. Will you not be thankful?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 71: Have you seen the fire you kindle?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 72: Is it you who produce its tree, or are We the Producer?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 73: We have made it a reminder, and a comfort for the users.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 74: So glorify the Name of your Great Lord.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 75: I swear by the locations of the stars.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 76: It is an oath, if you only knew, that is tremendous.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 77: It is a noble Quran.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 78: In a well-protected Book.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 79: None can grasp it except the purified.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 80: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 81: Is it this discourse that you take so lightly?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 82: And you make it your livelihood to deny it?
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 83: So when it has reached the throat.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 84: As you are looking on.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 85: We are nearer to it than you are, but you do not see.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 86: If you are not held to account.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 87: Then bring it back, if you are truthful.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 88: But if he is one of those brought near.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 89: Then happiness, and flowers, and Garden of Delights.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 90: And if he is one of those on the Right.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 91: Then, "Peace upon you," from those on the Right.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 92: But if he is one of the deniers, the mistaken.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 93: Then a welcome of Inferno.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 94: And burning in Hell.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 95: This is the certain truth.
Surah al-Waqi'ah, Ayah 96: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Magnificent
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 1: Glorifying God is everything in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, the Wise.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 2: To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death, and He has power over all things.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 3: He is the First and the Last, and the Outer and the Inner, and He has knowledge of all things.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 4: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then settled over the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth, and what comes out of it, and what descends from the sky, and what ascends to it. And He is with you wherever you may be. God is Seeing of everything you do.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 5: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth, and to God all matters are referred.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 6: He merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night; and He knows what the hearts contains.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 7: Believe in God and His Messenger, and spend from what He made you inherit. Those among you who believe and give will have a great reward.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 8: What is the matter with you that you do not believe in God, when the Messenger calls you to believe in your Lord, and He has received a pledge from you, if you are believers?
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 9: It is He who sends down upon His servant clear revelations, to bring you out of darkness into the light. God is Gentle towards you, Most Compassionate.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 10: And why is it that you do not spend in the cause of God, when to God belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who contributed before the conquest, and fought. Those are higher in rank than those who contributed afterwards, and fought. But God promises both a good reward. God is Well Experienced in what you do.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 11: Who is he who will lend God a loan of goodness, that He may double it for him, and will have a generous reward?

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 12: On the Day when you see the believing men and believing women-their light radiating ahead of them, and to their right: "Good news for you today: gardens beneath which rivers flow, dwelling therein forever. That is the great triumph."

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 13: On the Day when the hypocritical men and hypocritical women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us; let us absorb some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you, and seek light." A wall will be raised between them, in which is a door; within it is mercy, and outside it is agony.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 14: They will call to them, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you cheated your souls, and waited, and doubted, and became deluded by wishful thinking, until the command of God arrived; and arrogance deceived you regarding God."
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 15: "Therefore, today no ransom will be accepted from you, nor from those who disbelieved. The Fire is your refuge. It is your companion-what an evil fate!"

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 16: Is it not time for those who believe to surrender their hearts to the remembrance of God, and to the truth that has come down, and not be like those who were given the Book previously, but time became prolonged for them, so their hearts hardened, and many of them are sinners?
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 17: Know that God revives the earth after its death. We thus explain the revelations for you, so that you may understand.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 18: The charitable men and charitable women, who have loaned God a loan of righteousness-it will be multiplied for them, and for them is a generous reward.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 19: Those who believe in God and His messengers-these are the sincere and the witnesses with their Lord; they will have their reward and their light. But as for those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations-these are the inmates of the Blaze.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 20: Know that the worldly life is only play, and distraction, and glitter, and boasting among you, and rivalry in wealth and children. It is like a rainfall that produces plants, and delights the disbelievers. But then it withers, and you see it yellowing, and then it becomes debris. While in the Hereafter there is severe agony, and forgiveness from God, and acceptance. The life of this world is nothing but enjoyment of vanity.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 21: Race towards forgiveness from your Lord; and a Garden as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for those who believe in God and His messengers. That is the grace of God; He bestows it on whomever He wills. God is the Possessor of Immense Grace.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 22: No calamity occurs on earth, or in your souls, but it is in a Book, even before We make it happen. That is easy for God.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 23: That you may not sorrow over what eludes you, nor exult over what He has given you. God does not love the proud snob.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 24: Those who are stingy, and induce people to be stingy. Whoever turns away-God is the Independent, the Praiseworthy.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 25: We sent Our messengers with the clear proofs, and We sent down with them the Book and the Balance, that humanity may uphold justice. And We sent down iron, in which is violent force, and benefits for humanity. That God may know who supports Him and His messengers invisibly. God is Strong and Powerful.
Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 26: We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and the Scripture. Some of them are guided, but many of them are sinners.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 27: Then We sent in their wake Our messengers, and followed up with Jesus son of Mary, and We gave him the Gospel, and instilled in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy. But as for the monasticism which they invented-We did not ordain it for them-only to seek God's approval. But they did not observe it with its due observance. So We gave those of them who believed their reward, but many of them are sinful.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 28: O you who believe! Fear God, and believe in His Messenger: He will give you a double portion of His mercy, and will give you a light by which you walk, and will forgive you. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Hadid, Ayah 29: That the People of the Book may know that they have no power whatsoever over God's grace, and that all grace is in God's hand; He gives it to whomever He wills. God is Possessor of Great Grace.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 1: God has heard the statement of she who argued with you concerning her husband, as she complained to God. God heard your conversation. God is Hearing and Seeing.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 2: Those of you who estrange their wives by equating them with their mothers-they are not their mothers. Their mothers are none else but those who gave birth to them. What they say is evil, and a blatant lie. But God is Pardoning and Forgiving.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 3: Those who estrange their wives by equating them with their mothers, then go back on what they said, must set free a slave before they may touch one another. To this you are exhorted, and God is well aware of what you do.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 4: But whoever cannot find the means must fast for two consecutive months before they may touch one another. And if he is unable, then the feeding of sixty needy people. This, in order that you affirm your faith in God and His Messenger. These are the ordinances of God. The unbelievers will have a painful punishment.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 5: Those who oppose God and His Messenger will be subdued, as those before them were subdued. We have revealed clear messages. The unbelievers will have a demeaning punishment.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 6: On the Day when God resurrects them all, and informs them of what they did. God has kept count of it, but they have forgotten it. God is Witness over everything.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 7: Do you not realize that God knows everything in the heavens and everything on earth? There is no secret counsel between three, but He is their fourth; nor between five, but He is their sixth; nor less than that, nor more, but He is with them wherever they may be. Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will inform them of what they did. God has knowledge of everything.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 8: Have you noted those who were prohibited from conspiring secretly, but then reverted to what they were prohibited from? They conspire to commit sin, and aggression, and defiance of the Messenger. And when they come to you, they greet you with a greeting that God never greeted you with. And they say within themselves, "Why does God not punish us for what we say?" Hell is enough for them. They will roast in it. What a miserable destiny!

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 9: O you who believe! When you converse secretly, do not converse in sin, and aggression, and disobedience of the Messenger; but converse in virtue and piety; And fear God, to Whom you will be gathered.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 10: Conspiracies are from Satan, that he may dishearten those who believe; but he will not harm them in the least, except by leave of God. So let the believers put their trust in God.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 11: O you who believe! When you are told to make room in your gatherings, make room; God will make room for you. And when you are told to disperse, disperse. God elevates those among you who believe, and those given knowledge, many steps. God is Aware of what you do.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 12: O you who believe! When you converse privately with the Messenger, offer something in charity before your conversation. That is better for you, and purer. But if you do not find the means-God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 13: Are you reluctant to offer charity before your conversation? If you do not do so, and God pardons you, then perform the prayer, and give alms, and obey God and His Messenger. God is Aware of what you do.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 14: Have you considered those who befriended a people with whom God has become angry? They are not of you, nor of them. And they swear to a lie while they know.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 15: God has prepared for them a terrible punishment. Evil is what they used to do.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 16: They took their oaths as a screen, and prevented others from God's path. They will have a shameful punishment.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 17: Neither their possessions nor their children will avail them anything against God. These are the inhabitants of the Fire, dwelling therein forever.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 18: On the Day when God will resurrect them altogether-they will swear to Him, as they swear to you, thinking that they are upon something. Indeed, they themselves are the liars.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 19: Satan has taken hold of them, and so has caused them to forget the remembrance of God. These are the partisans of Satan. Indeed, it is Satan's partisans who are the losers.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 20: Those who oppose God and His Messenger are among the lowliest.
Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 21: God has written: "I will certainly prevail, I and My messengers." God is Strong and Mighty.

Surah al-Mujadilah, Ayah 22: You will not find a people who believe in God and the Last Day, loving those who oppose God and His Messenger, even if they were their parents, or their children, or their siblings, or their close relatives. These-He has inscribed faith in their hearts, and has supported them with a spirit from Him. And He will admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will dwell forever. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. These are the partisans of God. Indeed, it is God's partisans who are the successful.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 1: Glorifying God is all that exists in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, the Most Wise.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 2: It is He who evicted those who disbelieved among the People of the Book from their homes at the first mobilization. You did not think they would leave, and they thought their fortresses would protect them from God. But God came at them from where they never expected, and threw terror into their hearts. They wrecked their homes with their own hands, and by the hands of the believers. Therefore, take a lesson, O you who have insight.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 3: Had God not decreed exile for them, He would have punished them in this life. But in the Hereafter they will have the punishment of the Fire.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 4: That is because they opposed God and His Messenger. Whoever opposes God-God is stern in retribution.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 5: Whether you cut down a tree, or leave it standing on its trunk, it is by God's will. He will surely disgrace the sinners.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 6: Whatever God has bestowed upon His Messenger from them; you spurred neither horse nor camel for them, but God gives authority to His messengers over whomever He will. God is Able to do all things.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 7: Whatever God restored to His Messenger from the inhabitants of the villages belongs to God, and to the Messenger, and to the relatives, and to the orphans, and to the poor, and to the wayfarer; so that it may not circulate solely between the wealthy among you. Whatever the Messenger gives you, accept it; and whatever he forbids you, abstain from it. And fear God. God is severe in punishment.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 8: To the poor refugees who were driven out of their homes and their possessions, as they sought the favor of God and His approval, and came to the aid of God and His Messenger. These are the sincere.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 9: And those who, before them, had settled in the homeland, and had accepted faith. They love those who emigrated to them, and find no hesitation in their hearts in helping them. They give them priority over themselves, even if they themselves are needy. Whoever is protected from his natural greed-it is they who are the successful.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 10: And those who came after them, saying, "Our Lord, forgive us, and our brethren who preceded us in faith, and leave no malice in our hearts towards those who believe. Our Lord, You are Clement and Merciful."

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 11: Have you not considered those who act hypocritically? They say to their brethren who disbelieved among the People of the Book, "If you are evicted, we will leave with you, and will not obey anyone against you; and should anyone fight you, we will certainly support you." But God bears witness that they are liars.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 12: If they are evicted, they will not leave with them; and if anyone fights them, they will not support them; and if they go to their aid, they will turn their backs and flee; then they will receive no support.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 13: Fear of you is more intense in their hearts than fear of God. That is because they are a people who do not understand.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 14: They will not fight you all together except from fortified strongholds, or from behind walls. Their hostility towards each other is severe. You would think they are united, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 15: Like those shortly before them. They experienced the consequences of their decisions. For them is a painful punishment.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 16: Like the devil, when he says to the human being, "Disbelieve." But when he has disbelieved, he says, "I am innocent of you; I fear God, the Lord of the Worlds."
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 17: The ultimate end for both of them is the Fire, where they will dwell forever. Such is the requital for the wrongdoers.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 18: O you who believe! Fear God, and let every soul consider what it has forwarded for the morrow, and fear God. God is Aware of what you do.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 19: And do not be like those who forgot God, so He made them forget themselves. These are the sinners.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 20: Not equal are the inhabitants of the Fire and the inhabitants of Paradise. It is the inhabitants of Paradise who are the winners.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 21: Had We sent this Quran down on a mountain, you would have seen it trembling, crumbling in awe of God. These parables We cite for the people, so that they may reflect.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 22: He is God. There is no god but He, the Knower of secrets and declarations. He is the Compassionate, the Merciful.

Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 23: He is God; besides Whom there is no god; the Sovereign, the Holy, the Peace-Giver, the Faith-Giver, the Overseer, the Almighty, the Omnipotent, the Overwhelming. Glory be to God, beyond what they associate.
Surah al-Hasyr, Ayah 24: He is God; the Creator, the Maker, the Designer. His are the Most Beautiful Names. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth glorifies Him. He is the Majestic, the Wise.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 1: Praise be to God, Who created the heavens and the earth, and made the darkness and the light. Yet those who disbelieve ascribe equals to their Lord.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 2: It is He who created you from clay, then decided a term-a term determined by him. Yet you doubt.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 3: He is God in the heavens and the earth. He knows what you keep secret and what you make public; and He knows what you earn.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 4: Not one of their Lord's signs comes to them, but they turn away from it.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 5: They denied the truth when it has come to them; but soon will reach them the news of what they used to ridicule.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 6: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them? We had established them on earth more firmly than We established you, and We sent the clouds pouring down abundant rain on them, and We made rivers flow beneath them. But We destroyed them for their sins, and established other civilizations after them.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 7: Had We sent down upon you a book on paper, and they had touched it with their hands, those who disbelieve would have said, "This is nothing but plain magic."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 8: And they say, "Why was an angel not sent down to him." Had We sent down an angel, the matter would have been settled, and they would not have been reprieved.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 9: Had We made him an angel, We would have made him a man, and confused them when they are already confused.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 10: Messengers before you were ridiculed, but those who mocked them became besieged by what they ridiculed.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 11: Say, "Travel the earth and observe the final fate of the deniers."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 12: Say, "To whom belongs what is in the heavens and the earth?" Say, "To God." He has inscribed for Himself mercy. He will gather you to the Day of Resurrection, in which there is no doubt. Those who lost their souls do not believe.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 13: To Him belongs whatever rests in the night and the day. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 14: Say, "Shall I take for myself a protector other than God, Originator of the heavens and the earth, and He feeds and is not fed?" Say, "I am instructed to be the first of those who submit." And do not be among the idolaters.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 15: Say, "I fear, should I defy my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 16: Whoever is spared on that Day-He had mercy on him. That is the clear victory.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 17: If God touches you with adversity, none can remove it except He. And if He touches you with good-He is Capable of everything.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 18: He is the Supreme over His servants. He is the Wise, the Expert.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 19: Say, "What thing is more solemn in testimony?" Say, "God is Witness between you and me. This Quran was revealed to me, that I may warn you with it, and whomever it may reach. Do you indeed testify that there are other gods with God?" Say, "I myself do not testify." Say, "He is but One God, and I am innocent of your idolatry."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 20: Those to whom We have given the Book recognize it as they recognize their own children; but those who have lost their souls do not believe.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 21: Who does greater wrong than someone who fabricates lies against God, or denies His revelations? The wrongdoers will not succeed.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 22: On the Day when We gather them all together, then say to the idolaters, "Where are your idols, those you used to claim?"
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 23: Then their only argument will be to say, "By God, our Lord, we were not idolaters."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 24: Look how they lied to themselves. And what they invented deserted them.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 25: Among them are those who listen to you; but We place covers over their hearts, to prevent them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. Even if they see every sign, they will not believe in it. Until, when they come to you, to argue with you, those who disbelieve will say, "These are nothing but myths of the ancients."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 26: They keep others from it, and avoid it themselves; but they ruin only their own souls, and they do not realize.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 27: If only you could see, when they are made to stand before the Fire; they will say, "If only we could be sent back, and not reject the revelations of our Lord, and be among the faithful."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 28: What they used to conceal before will become clear to them. And even if they were sent back, they would revert to what they were forbidden. They are liars.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 29: And they say, "There is nothing but our life in this world, and we will not be resurrected."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 30: If only you could see, when they are stationed before their Lord. He will say, "Is this not real?" They will say, "Yes indeed, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the torment for having disbelieved."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 31: Losers are those who deny the encounter with God. Then, when the Hour comes upon them suddenly, they will say, "Alas for us, how we have neglected it." And they will carry their burdens on their backs-evil is what they carry.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 32: The life of this world is nothing but game and distraction, but the Home of the Hereafter is better for those who are righteous. Do you not understand?
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 33: We know that what they say grieves you. It is not you they reject, but it is God's revelations that the wicked deny.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 34: Other messengers before you were rejected, but they endured rejection and persecution until Our help came to them. There can be no change to God's words. News of the Messengers has already reached you.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 35: If you find their rejection hard to bear, then if you can, seek a tunnel into the earth, or a stairway into the heaven, and bring them a sign. Had God willed, He could have gathered them to guidance. So do not be of the ignorant.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 36: Only those who listen will respond. As for the dead, God will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 37: And they say, "If only a sign could come down to him from his Lord." Say, "God is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."
