Surah al-An'am, Ayah 38: There is no animal on land, nor a bird flying with its wings, but are communities like you. We neglected nothing in the Scripture. Then to their Lord they will be gathered.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 39: Those who reject Our revelations are deaf and dumb, in total darkness. Whomever God wills, He leaves astray; and whomever He wills, He sets on a straight path.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 40: Say, "Have you considered? if God's punishment came upon you, or the Hour overtook you, would you call upon any other than God, if you are sincere?"
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 41: In fact, it is Him you will call upon; and if He wills, he will remove what you called Him for, and you will forget what you idolized.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 42: We sent messengers to communities before you, and We afflicted them with suffering and hardship, that they may humble themselves.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 43: If only, when Our calamity came upon them, they humbled themselves. But their hearts hardened, and Satan made their deeds appear good to them.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 44: Then, when they disregarded what they were reminded of, We opened for them the gates of all things. Until, when they delighted in what they were given, We seized them suddenly; and at once, they were in despair.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 45: Thus the last remnant of the people who did wrong was cut off. And praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 46: Say, "Have you considered? If God took away your hearing and your sight, and set a seal on your hearts, what god other than God would restore them to you?" Note how We explain the revelations in various ways, yet they still turn away.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 47: Say, "Have you considered? if God's punishment descended on you suddenly or gradually, would any be destroyed except the wrongdoing people?"
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 48: We sent the messengers only as bearers of good news and as warners. Those who believe and reform have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 49: But as for those who reject Our revelations, torment will afflict them because of their defiance.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 50: Say, "I do not say to you that I possess the treasuries of God, nor do I know the future, nor do I say to you that I am an angel. I only follow what is inspired to me." Say, "Are the blind and the seeing alike? Do you not think?"
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 51: And warn with it those who fear to be gathered before their Lord-they have no protector or intercessor apart from him-perhaps they will grow in piety.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 52: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord, morning and evening, seeking His attention. You are not accountable for them in any way, nor are they accountable for you in any way. If you drive them away, you would be one of the unjust.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 53: Thus We try some of them by means of others, that they may say, "Are these the ones whom God has favored from among us?" Is God not aware of the appreciative?

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 54: When those who believe in Our revelations come to you, say, "Peace be upon you, your Lord has prescribed mercy for Himself. Whoever among you does wrong out of ignorance, and then repents afterwards and reforms-He is Forgiving and Merciful."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 55: Thus We explain the revelations, and expose the path of the unrighteous.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 56: Say, "I am forbidden from worshiping those you pray to besides God." Say, "I will not follow your desires; else I would be lost and not be of those guided."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 57: Say, "I stand on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have rejected Him. I do not possess what you seek me to hasten; the decision belongs solely to God. He states the truth, and He is the Best of Judges."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 58: Say, "If I possessed what you seek me to hasten, the matter between you and me would have been settled. God is well aware of the unjust."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 59: With Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except He. And He knows everything on land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but He knows it; and there is not a single grain in the darkness of earth, nor is there anything wet or dry, but is in a clear record.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 60: It is He Who takes you by night, and He knows what you earn by day. Then He raises you up in it, until a fixed term is fulfilled. Then to Him is your return, then He will inform you of what you used to do.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 61: He is the Conqueror over His servants, and He sends guardians over you, until, when death overtakes one of you, Our envoys take him away, and they never fail.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 62: Then they are brought back to God, their True Master. Unquestionably, His is the judgment, and He is the Swiftest of reckoners.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 63: Say, "Who delivers you from the darkness of land and sea?" You call upon Him humbly and inwardly: "If He delivers us from this, We will surely be among the thankful."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 64: Say, "It is God who delivers you from it, and from every disaster. Yet then you associate others with Him."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 65: Say, "He is Able to send upon you an affliction, from above you, or from under your feet. Or He can divide you into factions, and make you taste the violence of one another. Note how We explain the revelations, so that they may understand."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 66: But your people rejected it, though it is the truth. Say, "I am not responsible for you."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 67: For every happening is a finality, and you will surely know.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 68: When you encounter those who gossip about Our revelations, turn away from them, until they engage in another topic. But should Satan make you forget, do not sit after the recollection with the wicked people.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 69: The righteous are in no way accountable for them; it is only a reminder, that they may be careful.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 70: So leave alone those who take their religion for play and pastime, and whom the worldly life has deceived. But remind with it, lest a soul becomes damned on account of what it has earned. It has no helper or intercessor besides God. Even if it offers every equivalent, none will be accepted from it. These are the ones who are delivered to perdition by their actions. They will have a drink of scalding water, and a painful punishment, because they used to disbelieve.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 71: Say, "Shall we invoke besides God something that can neither benefit us nor harm us, and turn back on our heels after God has guided us; like someone seduced by the devils and confused on earth, who has friends calling him to guidance: 'Come to us'?" Say, "The guidance of God is the guidance, and we are commanded to surrender to the Lord of the Universe."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 72: "And to perform the prayers, and to revere Him; it is to Him that you will be gathered."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 73: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in truth. On the Day when He says: "Be," it will be. His saying is the truth, and His is the sovereignty on the Day when the trumpet is blown. The Knower of secrets and declarations. He is the Wise, the Expert.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 74: Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols for gods? I see that you and your people are in evident error."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 75: Thus We showed Abraham the empire of the heavens and the earth, that he might be one of those with certainty.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 76: When the night fell over him, he saw a planet. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I do not love those that set."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 77: Then, when he saw the moon rising, he said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "If my Lord does not guide me, I will be one of the erring people."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 78: Then, when he saw the sun rising, he said, "This is my lord, this is bigger." But when it set, he said, "O my people, I am innocent of your idolatry.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 79: I have directed my attention towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth-a monotheist-and I am not of the idolaters."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 80: And his people argued with him. He said, "Do you argue with me about God, when He has guided me? I do not fear what you associate with Him, unless my Lord wills it. My Lord comprehends all things in knowledge. Will you not reconsider?

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 81: And why should I fear those you associate with Him, and you do not fear associating others with God for which He sent down to you no authority? Which side is more entitled to security, if you are aware?"
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 82: Those who believe, and do not obscure their faith with wrongdoing-those will have security, and they are guided.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 83: That was Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We elevate by degrees whomever We will. Your Lord is Wise and Informed.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 84: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob-each of them We guided. And We guided Noah previously; and from his descendants David, and Solomon, and Job, and Joseph, and Moses, and Aaron. Thus We reward the righteous.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 85: And Zechariah, and John, and Jesus, and Elias-every one of them was of the upright.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 86: And Ishmael, and Elijah, and Jonah, and Lot-We favored each one of them over all other people.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 87: And of their ancestors, and their descendants, and their siblings-We chose them, and guided them to a straight path.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 88: Such is God's guidance. He guides with it whomever He wills of His servants. Had they associated, their deeds would have gone in vain.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 89: Those are they to whom We gave the Book, and wisdom, and prophethood. If these reject them, We have entrusted them to others who do not reject them.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 90: Those are they whom God has guided, so follow their guidance. Say, "I ask of you no compensation for it; it is just a reminder for all mankind."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 91: They do not value God as He should be valued, when they say, "God did not reveal anything to any human being." Say, "Who revealed the Scripture which Moses brought-a light and guidance for humanity?" You put it on scrolls, displaying them, yet concealing much. And you were taught what you did not know-neither you, nor your ancestors. Say, "God;" then leave them toying away in their speculation.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 92: This too is a Scripture that We revealed-blessed-verifying what preceded it, that you may warn the Mother of Cities and all around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and are dedicated to their prayers.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 93: Who does greater wrong than someone who invents falsehood against God, or says, "It was revealed to me," when nothing was revealed to him, or says, "I will reveal the like of what God revealed"? If only you could see the wrongdoers in the floods of death, as the angels with arms outstretched: "Give up your souls. Today you are being repaid with the torment of shame for having said about God other than the truth, and for being too proud to accept His revelations."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 94: "You have come to Us individually, just as We created you the first time, leaving behind you everything We gave you. We do not see with you your intercessors-those you claimed were your partners. The link between you is cut, and what you had asserted has failed you."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 95: It is God Who splits the grain and the seed. He brings the living from the dead, and He brings the dead from the living. Such is God. So how could you deviate?
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 96: It is He Who breaks the dawn. And He made the night for rest, and the sun and the moon for calculation. Such is the disposition of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 97: And it is He Who created the stars for you, that you may be guided by them in the darkness of land and sea. We thus explain the revelations for people who know.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 98: And it is He who produced you from a single person, then a repository, then a depository. We have detailed the revelations for people who understand.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 99: And it is He who sends down water from the sky. With it We produce vegetation of all kinds, from which We bring greenery, from which We produce grains in clusters. And palm-trees with hanging clusters, and vineyards, and olives, and pomegranates-similar and dissimilar. Watch their fruits as they grow and ripen. Surely in this are signs for people who believe.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 100: Yet they attributed to God partners-the sprites-although He created them. And they invented for Him sons and daughters, without any knowledge. Glory be to Him. He is exalted, beyond what they describe.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 101: Originator of the heavens and the earth-how can He have a son when He never had a companion? He created all things, and He has knowledge of all things.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 102: Such is God, your Lord. There is no god except He, the Creator of all things; so worship Him. He is responsible for everything.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 103: No vision can grasp Him, but His grasp is over all vision. He is the Subtle, the Expert.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 104: "Insights have come to you from your Lord. Whoever sees, it is to the benefit of his soul; and whoever remains blind, it is to its detriment. I am not a guardian over you."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 105: We thus diversify the revelations, lest they say, "You have studied," and to clarify them for people who know.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 106: Follow what was revealed to you from your Lord. There is no god but He. And turn away from the polytheists.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 107: Had God willed, they would not have practiced idolatry. We did not appoint you as a guardian over them, and you are not a manager over them.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 108: Do not insult those they call upon besides God, lest they insult God out of hostility and ignorance. We made attractive to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them of what they used to do.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 109: They swear by God, with their most solemn oaths, that if a miracle were to come to them, they would believe in it. Say, "The miracles are only with God." But how do you know? Even if it did come, they still would not believe.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 110: And We turn away their hearts and their visions, as they refused to believe in it the first time, and We leave them blundering in their rebellion.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 111: Even if We sent down the angels to them, and the dead spoke to them, and We gathered all things before them, they still would not believe, unless God wills; but most of them are ignorant.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 112: Likewise, We have assigned for every prophet an enemy-human and jinn devils-inspiring one another with fancy words in order to deceive. But had your Lord willed, they would not have done it. So leave them to their fabrications.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 113: So that the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter may incline to it, and be content with it, and that they may perpetrate whatever they perpetrate.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 114: "Shall I seek a judge other than God, when He is the One who revealed to you the Book, explained in detail?" Those to whom We gave the Book know that it is the truth revealed from your Lord. So do not be of those who doubt.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 115: The Word of your Lord has been completed, in truth and justice. There is no changing to His words. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 116: If you were to obey most of those on earth, they would divert you from God's path. They follow nothing but assumptions, and they only conjecture.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 117: Your Lord knows best who strays from His path, and He knows best the guided ones.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 118: So eat of that over which the Name of God was pronounced, if you indeed believe in His revelations.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 119: And why should you not eat of that over which the Name of God is pronounced, when He has detailed for you what is prohibited for you, unless you are compelled by necessity? Many lead astray with their opinions, through lack of knowledge. Your Lord knows best the transgressors.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 120: So abandon sin, outward and inward. Those who commit sins will be repaid for what they used to perpetrate.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 121: And do not eat from that over which the Name of God was not pronounced, for it is abomination. The devils inspire their followers to argue with you; but if you obey them, you would be polytheists.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 122: Is he who was dead, then We gave him life, and made for him a light by which he walks among the people, like he who is in total darkness, and cannot get out of it? Thus the doings of disbelievers are made to appear good to them.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 123: And thus We set up in every city its leading wicked sinners, to conspire in it, but they conspire only against themselves, and they do not realize it.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 124: When a sign comes to them, they say, "We will not believe unless we are given the like of what was given to God's messengers." God knows best where to place His message. Humiliation from God and severe torment will afflict the criminals for their scheming.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 125: Whomever God desires to guide, He spreads open his heart to Islam; and whomever He desires to misguide, He makes his heart narrow, constricted, as though he were climbing up the sky. God thus lays defilement upon those who do not believe.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 126: This is the straight path of your Lord. We have explained the revelations in detail for people who recollect.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 127: For them is the Home of Peace with their Lord, and He is their Master-because of what they used to do.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 128: On the Day when He gathers them all together: "O assembly of jinn, you have exploited multitudes of humans." Their adherents among mankind will say, "Our Lord, we have profited from one another, but we have reached the term that you have assigned for us." He will say, "The Fire is your dwelling, wherein you will remain, except as God wills. Your Lord is Wise and Informed.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 129: Thus We make some of the wrongdoers befriend one another, because of what they used to do.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 130: "O assembly of jinn and humans, did there not come to you messengers from among you, relating to you My revelations, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "We testify against ourselves." The life of the world seduced them. They will testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 131: That is because your Lord would not destroy towns for injustice while their inhabitants are unaware.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 132: They all have ranks according to what they did; and your Lord is not unaware of what they do.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 133: Your Lord is the Rich Beyond Need, the Possessor of Mercy. If He wills, he can do away with you, and substitute whomever He wills in your place, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 134: What you are promised is coming, and you cannot thwart it.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 135: Say, "O my people! Work according to your ability, and so will I." You will come to know to whom will belong the sequel of the abode." The wrongdoers will not prevail.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 136: And they set aside for God a share of the crops and the livestock He created, and they say, "This is for God," according to their claim, "and this is for our idols." But the share of their idols does not reach God, yet the share of God reaches their idols. Evil is their judgment.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 137: Likewise, their idols entice many idolaters to kill their children, in order to lead them to their ruin, and confuse them in their religion. Had God willed, they would not have done it; so leave them to their fraud.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 138: And they say, "These animals and crops are restricted; none may eat them except those we permit," by their claims, and animals whose backs are forbidden, and animals over which they do not pronounce the name of God-fabricating lies against Him. He will repay them for what they used to invent.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 139: And they say, "What lies in the wombs of these animals is exclusively for our males, and prohibited to our wives." But if it is stillborn, they can share in it. He will surely punish them for their allegations. He is Wise and Knowing.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 140: Lost are those who kill their children foolishly, with no basis in knowledge, and forbid what God has provided for them-innovations about God. They have gone astray. They are not guided.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 141: It is He who produces gardens, both cultivated and wild, and date-palms, and crops of diverse tastes, and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of its fruit when it yields, and give its due on the day of its harvest, and do not waste. He does not love the wasteful.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 142: Among the livestock are some for transportation, and some for clothing. Eat of what God has provided for you, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. He is to you an outright enemy.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 143: Eight pairs: two of the sheep, and two of the goats. Say, "Did He forbid the two males, or the two females, or what the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you are truthful."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 144: And two of the camels, and two of the cattle. Say, "Did He forbid the two males, or the two females, or what the wombs of the two females contain? Were you present when God enjoined this upon you?" Who does greater wrong than he who invents lies and attributes them to God, in order to mislead people without knowledge? God does not guide the wicked people.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 145: Say, "In what was revealed to me, I find nothing forbidden to a consumer who eats it, except carrion, or spilled blood, or the flesh of swine-because it is impure-or a sinful offering dedicated to other than God. But if someone is compelled by necessity, without being deliberate or malicious-your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 146: For the Jews We forbade everything with claws. As of cattle and sheep: We forbade them their fat, except what adheres to their backs, or the entrails, or what is mixed with bone. This is how We penalized them for their inequity. We are indeed truthful.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 147: If they accuse you of lying, say, "Your Lord is Possessor of infinite mercy, but His wrath cannot be averted from the guilty people."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 148: The polytheists will say, "Had God willed, we would not have practiced idolatry, nor would have our forefathers, nor would we have prohibited anything." Likewise those before them lied, until they tasted Our might. Say, "Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow nothing but conjecture, and you only guess."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 149: Say, "To God belongs the conclusive argument. Had He willed, He would have guided you all."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 150: Say, "Produce your witnesses who would testify that God has prohibited this." If they testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the whims of those who deny Our revelation, and those who do not believe in the Hereafter, and those who equate others with their Lord.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 151: Say, "Come, let me tell you what your Lord has forbidden you: that you associate nothing with Him; that you honor your parents; that you do not kill your children because of poverty-We provide for you and for them; that you do not come near indecencies, whether outward or inward; and that you do not kill the soul which God has sanctified-except in the course of justice. All this He has enjoined upon you, so that you may understand."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 152: And do not come near the property of the orphan, except with the best intentions, until he reaches maturity. And give full weight and full measure, equitably. We do not burden any soul beyond its capacity. And when you speak, be fair, even if it concerns a close relative. And fulfill your covenant with God. All this He has enjoined upon you, so that you may take heed.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 153: This is My path, straight, so follow it. And do not follow the other paths, lest they divert you from His path. All this He has enjoined upon you, that you may refrain from wrongdoing.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 154: Then We gave Moses the Scripture, perfect for the righteous, and explaining everything clearly, and a beacon, and mercy, that they may believe in the encounter with their Lord.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 155: This too is a blessed Scripture that We revealed; so follow it, and be righteous, that you may receive mercy.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 156: Lest you say, "The Scripture was revealed to two parties before us, and we were unaware of their teachings."

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 157: Or lest you say, "Had the Scripture been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they." Clarification has come to you from your Lord, and guidance, and mercy. Who then does greater wrong than he who gives the lie to God's messages, and turns away from them? We will repay those who turn away from Our messages with the worst kind of punishment, because of their turning away.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 158: Are they waiting for anything but for the angels to come to them, or for your Lord to arrive, or for some of your Lord's signs to come? On the Day when some of your Lord's signs come, no soul will benefit from its faith unless it had believed previously, or had earned goodness through its faith. Say, "Wait, we too are waiting."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 159: As for those who divided their religion and became sects-you have nothing to do with them. Their case rests with God; then He will inform them of what they used to do.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 160: Whoever comes up with a good deed will have ten times its like; and whoever comes up with an evil deed will be repaid only with its equivalent-they will not be wronged.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 161: Say, "My Lord has guided me to a straight path, an upright religion, the creed of Abraham the Monotheist, who was not a polytheist."
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 162: Say, "My prayer and my worship, and my life and my death, are devoted to God, the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-An'am, Ayah 163: No associate has He. Thus I am commanded, and I am the first of those who submit.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 164: Say, "Am I to seek a Lord other than God, when He is the Lord of all things?" No soul gets except what it is due, and no soul bears the burdens of another. Then to your Lord is your return, then He will inform you regarding your disputes.

Surah al-An'am, Ayah 165: It is He who made you successors on the earth, and raised some of you in ranks over others, in order to test you through what He has given you. Your Lord is Quick in retribution, and He is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 1: O you who believe! Do not take My enemies and your enemies for supporters, offering them affection, when they have disbelieved in what has come to you of the Truth. They have expelled the Messenger, and you, because you believed in God, your Lord. If you have mobilized to strive for My cause, seeking My approval, how can you secretly love them? I know what you conceal and what you reveal. Whoever among you does that has strayed from the right way.
Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 2: Whenever they encounter you, they treat you as enemies, and they stretch their hands and tongues against you with malice. They wish that you would disbelieve.
Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 3: Neither your relatives nor your children will benefit you on the Day of Resurrection. He will separate between you. God is Observant of what you do.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 4: You have had an excellent example in Abraham and those with him; when they said to their people, "We are quit of you, and what you worship apart from God. We denounce you. Enmity and hatred has surfaced between us and you, forever, until you believe in God alone." Except for the words of Abraham to his father, "I will ask forgiveness for you, though I have no power from God to do anything for you." "Our Lord, in You we trust, and to You we repent, and to You is the ultimate resort.
Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 5: Our Lord, do not make us a target for those who disbelieve, and forgive us, our Lord. You are indeed the Mighty and Wise."
Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 6: There is an excellent example in them for you-for anyone who seeks God and the Last Day. But whoever turns away-God is the Self-Sufficient, the Most Praised.
Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 7: Perhaps God will plant affection between you and those of them you consider enemies. God is Capable. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 8: As for those who have not fought against you for your religion, nor expelled you from your homes, God does not prohibit you from dealing with them kindly and equitably. God loves the equitable.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 9: But God prohibits you from befriending those who fought against you over your religion, and expelled you from your homes, and aided in your expulsion. Whoever takes them for friends-these are the wrongdoers.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 10: O you who believe! When believing women come to you emigrating, test them. God is Aware of their faith. And if you find them to be faithful, do not send them back to the unbelievers. They are not lawful for them, nor are they lawful for them. But give them what they have spent. You are not at fault if you marry them, provided you give them their compensation. And do not hold on to ties with unbelieving women, but demand what you have spent, and let them demand what they have spent. This is the rule of God; He rules among you. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 11: If any of your wives desert you to the unbelievers, and you decide to penalize them, give those whose wives have gone away the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear God, in whom you are believers.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 12: O prophet! If believing women come to you, pledging allegiance to you, on condition that they will not associate anything with God, nor steal, nor commit adultery, nor kill their children, nor commit perjury as to parenthood, nor disobey you in anything righteous, accept their allegiance and ask God's forgiveness for them. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Mumtahanah, Ayah 13: O you who believe! Do not befriend people with whom God has become angry, and have despaired of the Hereafter, as the faithless have despaired of the occupants of the graves.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 1: Everything in the heavens and the earth praises God. He is the Almighty, the Wise.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 2: O you who believe! Why do you say what you do not do?
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 3: It is most hateful to God that you say what you do not do.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 4: God loves those who fight in His cause, in ranks, as though they were a compact structure.

Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 5: When Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you hurt me, although you know that I am God's Messenger to you?" And when they swerved, God swerved their hearts. God does not guide the sinful people.

Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 6: And when Jesus son of Mary said, "O Children of Israel, I am God's Messenger to you, confirming what preceded me of the Torah, and announcing good news of a messenger who will come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he showed them the miracles, they said, "This is obvious sorcery."
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 7: And who is a greater wrongdoer than he who attributes falsehoods to God, when he is being invited to Islam? God does not guide the wrongdoing people.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 8: They want to extinguish God's Light with their mouths; but God will complete His Light, even though the disbelievers dislike it.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 9: It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the true religion, to make it prevail over all religions, even though the idolaters dislike it.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 10: O you who believe! Shall I inform you of a trade that will save you from a painful torment?
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 11: That you believe in God and His Messenger, and strive in the cause of God with your possessions and yourselves. That is best for you, if you only knew.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 12: He will forgive you your sins; and will admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow, and into beautiful mansions in the Gardens of Eden. That is the supreme success.
Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 13: And something else you love: support from God, and imminent victory. So give good news to the believers.

Surah ash-Shaff, Ayah 14: O you who believe! Be supporters of God, as Jesus son of Mary said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters towards God?" The disciples said, "We are God's supporters." So a group of the Children of Israel believed, while another group disbelieved. We supported those who believed against their foe, so they became dominant.
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 1: Everything in the heavens and the earth glorifies God the Sovereign, the Holy, the Almighty, the Wise.

Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 2: It is He who sent among the unlettered a messenger from themselves; reciting His revelations to them, and purifying them, and teaching them the Scripture and wisdom; although they were in obvious error before that.
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 3: And others from them, who have not yet joined them. He is the Glorious, the Wise.
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 4: That is God's grace, which He grants to whomever He wills. God is Possessor of limitless grace.

Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 5: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah, but then failed to uphold it, is like the donkey carrying works of literature. Miserable is the example of the people who denounce God's revelations. God does not guide the wrongdoing people.
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 6: Say, "O you who follow Judaism; if you claim to be the chosen of God, to the exclusion of the rest of mankind, then wish for death if you are sincere."
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 7: But they will not wish for it, ever, due to what their hands have advanced. God knows well the wrongdoers.

Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 8: Say, "The death from which you flee will catch up with you; then you will be returned to the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 9: O you who believe! When the call is made for prayer on Congregation Day, hasten to the remembrance of God, and drop all business. That is better for you, if you only knew.
Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 10: Then, when the prayer is concluded, disperse through the land, and seek God's bounty, and remember God much, so that you may prosper.

Surah al-Jumu'ah, Ayah 11: Yet whenever they come across some business, or some entertainment, they scramble towards it, and leave you standing. Say, "What is with God is better than entertainment and business; and God is the Best of providers."
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 1: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you are God's Messenger." God knows that you are His Messenger, and God bears witness that the hypocrites are liars.
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 2: They treat their oaths as a cover, and so they repel others from God's path. Evil is what they do.
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 3: That is because they believed, and then disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed, and they cannot understand.

Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 4: When you see them, their appearance impresses you. And when they speak, you listen to what they say. They are like propped-up timber. They think every shout is aimed at them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. God condemns them; how deluded they are!
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 5: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of God will ask forgiveness for you," they bend their heads, and you see them turning away arrogantly.
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 6: It is the same for them, whether you ask forgiveness for them, or do not ask forgiveness for them; God will not forgive them. God does not guide the sinful people.

Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 7: It is they who say: "Do not spend anything on those who side with God's Messenger, unless they have dispersed." To God belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.

Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 8: They say, "If we return to the City, the more powerful therein will evict the weak." But power belongs to God, and His Messenger, and the believers; but the hypocrites do not know.
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 9: O you who believe! Let neither your possessions nor your children distract you from the remembrance of God. Whoever does that-these are the losers.

Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 10: And give from what We have provided for you, before death approaches one of you, and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a short while, so that I may be charitable, and be one of the righteous."
Surah al-Munafiqqun, Ayah 11: But God will not delay a soul when its time has come. God is Informed of what you do.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 1: Everything in the heavens and the earth praises God. To Him belongs the Kingdom, and to Him all praise is due, and He is Able to do all things.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 2: It is He who created you. Some of you are unbelievers, and some of you are believers. And God perceives what you do.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 3: He created the heavens and the earth with truth, and He designed you, and designed you well, and to Him is the final return.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 4: He knows everything in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what you conceal and what you reveal. And God knows what is within the hearts.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 5: Has the news not reached you, of those who disbelieved before? They tasted the ill consequences of their conduct, and a painful torment awaits them.

Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 6: That is because their messengers came to them with clear explanations, but they said, "Are human beings going to guide us?" So they disbelieved and turned away. But God is in no need. God is Independent and Praiseworthy.

Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 7: Those who disbelieve claim that they will not be resurrected. Say, "Yes indeed, by my Lord, you will be resurrected; then you will be informed of everything you did; and that is easy for God."
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 8: So believe in God and His Messenger, and the Light which We sent down. God is Aware of everything you do.

Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 9: The Day when He gathers you for the Day of Gathering-that is the Day of Mutual Exchange. Whoever believes in God and acts with integrity, He will remit his misdeeds, and will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein forever. That is the supreme achievement.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 10: But as for those who disbelieve and denounce Our revelations-these are the inmates of the Fire, dwelling therein forever; and what a miserable fate!
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 11: No disaster occurs except by God's leave. Whoever believes in God, He guides his heart. God is Aware of everything.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 12: So obey God, and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away-it is only incumbent on Our Messenger to deliver the clear message.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 13: God, there is no god but He; and in God let the believers put their trust.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 14: O you who believe! Among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon, and overlook, and forgive-God is Forgiver and Merciful.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 15: Your possessions and your children are a test, but with God is a splendid reward.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 16: So be conscious of God as much as you can, and listen, and obey, and give for your own good. He who is protected from his stinginess-these are the prosperous.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 17: If you lend God a good loan, He will multiply it for you, and will forgive you. God is Appreciative and Forbearing.
Surah at-Taghabun, Ayah 18: The Knower of the Unseen and the Seen, the Almighty, the Wise.
Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 1: O Prophet! If any of you divorce women, divorce them during their period of purity, and calculate their term. And be pious before God, your Lord. And do not evict them from their homes, nor shall they leave, unless they have committed a proven adultery. These are the limits of God-whoever oversteps God's limits has wronged his own soul. You never know; God may afterwards bring about a new situation.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 2: Once they have reached their term, either retain them honorably, or separate from them honorably. And call to witness two just people from among you, and give upright testimony for God. By that is exhorted whoever believes in God and the Last Day. And whoever fears God-He will make a way out for him.
Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 3: And will provide for him from where he never expected. Whoever relies on God-He will suffice him. God will accomplish His purpose. God has set a measure to all things.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 4: As for those of your women who have reached menopause, if you have any doubts, their term shall be three months-and also for those who have not yet menstruated. As for those who are pregnant, their term shall be until they have delivered. Whoever fears God-He will make things easy for him.
Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 5: This is the ordinance of God, which He sent down to you. Whoever fears God-He will remit his sins, and will amplify his reward.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 6: Allow them to reside where you reside, according to your means, and do not harass them in order to make things difficult for them. If they are pregnant, spend on them until they give birth. And if they nurse your infant, give them their payment. And conduct your relation in amity. But if you disagree, then let another woman nurse him.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 7: The wealthy shall spend according to his means; and he whose resources are restricted shall spend according to what God has given him. God never burdens a soul beyond what He has given it. God will bring ease after hardship.
Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 8: How many a town defied the command of its Lord and His messengers? So We held it strictly accountable, and We punished it with a dreadful punishment.
Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 9: It tasted the result of its decisions, and the outcome of its decisions was perdition.
Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 10: God has prepared for them a severe retribution. So beware of God, O you who possess intellect and have faith. God has sent down to you a Reminder.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 11: A messenger who recites to you God's Verses, clear and distinct, that he may bring those who believe and work righteousness from darkness into light. Whoever believes in God and acts with integrity, He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow, therein to abide forever. God has given him an excellent provision.

Surah ath-Thalaq, Ayah 12: God is He Who created seven heavens, and their like of earth. The command descends through them, so that you may know that God is Capable of everything, and that God Encompasses everything in knowledge.
Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 1: O prophet! Why do you prohibit what God has permitted for you, seeking to please your wives? God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 2: God has decreed for you the dissolution of your oaths. God is your Master. He is the All-Knowing, the Most Wise.

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 3: The Prophet told something in confidence to one of his wives. But when she disclosed it, and God made it known to him; he communicated part of it, and he avoided another part. Then, when he informed her of it, she said, "Who informed you of this?" He said, "The All-Knowing, the All-Informed, informed me."

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 4: If you repent to God, then your hearts have listened. But if you band together against him, then God is his Ally, as is Gabriel, and the righteous believers. In addition, the angels will assist him.

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 5: Perhaps, if he divorces you, his Lord will give him in exchange wives better than you: submissive, believing, obedient, penitent, devout, fasting-previously married, or virgins.

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 6: O you who believe! Protect yourselves and your families from a Fire, whose fuel is people and stones. Over it are angels, fierce and powerful. They never disobey God in anything He commands them, and they carry out whatever they are commanded.
Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 7: O you who disbelieved! Make no excuses today. You are being repaid for what you used to do.

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 8: O you who believe! Repent to God with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remit your sins, and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the Day when God will not disappoint the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light streaming before them, and to their right, they will say, "Our Lord, complete our light for us, and forgive us; You are capable of all things."
Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 9: O prophet! Strive hard against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be stern with them. Their abode is Hell. What a miserable destination!

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 10: God illustrates an example of those who disbelieve: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants, but they betrayed them. They availed them nothing against God, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who are entering."

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 11: And God illustrates an example of those who believe: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me, with you, a house in Paradise, and save me from Pharaoh and his works, and save me from the wrongdoing people."

Surah at-Tahrim, Ayah 12: And Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her womb, and so We breathed into her of Our Spirit; and she believed in the truth of her Lord's Words and His Books, and was one of the devout.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 1: Blessed is He in whose hand is the sovereignty, and Who has power over everything.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 2: He who created death and life-to test you-as to which of you is better in conduct. He is the Almighty, the Forgiving.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 3: He who created seven heavens in layers. You see no discrepancy in the creation of the Compassionate. Look again. Can you see any cracks?
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 4: Then look again, and again, and your sight will return to you dazzled and exhausted.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 5: We have adorned the lower heaven with lanterns, and made them missiles against the devils; and We have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 6: For those who reject their Lord, there is the torment of Hell. What an evil destination!
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 7: When they are thrown into it, they will hear it roaring, as it seethes.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 8: It almost bursts with fury. Every time a batch is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them, "Has no warner come to you?"
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 9: They will say, "Yes, a warner did come to us, but we disbelieved, and said, 'God did not send down anything; you are very much mistaken.'"
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 10: And they will say, "Had we listened or reasoned, we would not have been among the inmates of the Blaze."
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 11: So they will acknowledge their sins. So away with the inmates of the Blaze.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 12: As for those who fear their Lord in secret-for them is forgiveness and a great reward.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 13: Whether you keep your words secret, or declare them-He is Aware of the inner thoughts.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 14: Would He not know, He Who created? He is the Refined, the Expert.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 15: It is He who made the earth manageable for you, so travel its regions, and eat of His provisions. To Him is the Resurgence.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 16: Are you confident that the One in heaven will not cause the earth to collapse beneath you as it spins?
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 17: Or are you confident that the One in Heaven will not unleash against you a violent storm? Then you will know what My warning is like.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 18: Those before them also denied the truth; and how was My disapproval?
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 19: Have they not seen the birds above them, spreading their wings, and folding them? None holds them except the Compassionate. He is Perceiver of everything.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 20: Or who is this who is a force for you to protect you against the Compassionate? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 21: Or who is this that will provide for you, if He withholds His provision? Yet they persist in defiance and aversion.
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 22: Is he who walks bent on his own design better guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 23: Say, "It is He who produced you; and made for you the hearing, and the vision, and the organs. But rarely do you give thanks."
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 24: Say, "It is He who scattered you on earth, and to Him you will be rounded up."
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 25: And they say, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 26: Say, "Knowledge is with God, and I am only a clear warner."
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 27: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieved will turn gloomy, and it will be said, "This is what you used to call for."
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 28: Say, "Have you considered? Should God make me perish, and those with me; or else He bestows His mercy on us; who will protect the disbelievers from an agonizing torment?"
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 29: Say, "He is the Compassionate. We have faith in Him, and in Him we trust. Soon you will know who is in evident error."
Surah al-Mulk, Ayah 30: Say, "Have you considered? If your water drains away, who will bring you pure running water?"
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 1: Noon. By the pen, and by what they inscribe.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 2: By the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 3: In fact, you will have a reward that will never end.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 4: And you are of a great moral character.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 5: You will see, and they will see.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 6: Which of you is the afflicted.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 7: Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best the well-guided.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 8: So do not obey the deniers.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 9: They would like you to compromise, so they would compromise.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 10: And do not obey any vile swearer.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 11: Backbiter, spreader of slander.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 12: Preventer of good, transgressor, sinner.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 13: Rude and fake besides.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 14: Just because he has money and children.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 15: When Our Verses are recited to him, he says, "Myths of the ancients!"
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 16: We will brand him on the muzzle.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 17: We tested them, as We tested the owners of the garden, when they vowed to harvest it in the morning.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 18: Without any reservation.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 19: But a calamity from your Lord went around it while they slept.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 20: And in the morning it was as if picked.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 21: In the morning, they called to one another.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 22: "Go early to your plantation, if you are going to harvest."
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 23: So off they went, murmuring to one another.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 24: "No poor person is to enter it upon you today."
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 25: And early they went, resolved in intent.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 26: But when they saw it, they said, "We were wrong.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 27: We are now deprived."
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 28: The most reasonable of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'if only you would glorify?'"
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 29: They said, "Glory to our Lord-We were indeed in the wrong."
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 30: Then they turned to one another, blaming one another.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 31: They said, "Woe to us-we were indeed domineering.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 32: Perhaps our Lord will give us a better substitute for it. We are turning to our Lord."
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 33: Such is the punishment; but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 34: For the righteous are Gardens of Delight with their Lord.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 35: Shall We treat the Muslims like the villains?
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 36: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 37: Or do you have a scripture in which you study.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 38: Wherein there is whatever you choose?
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 39: Or do you have oaths from Us, binding until the Day of Resurrection, that you will have whatever you demand?
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 40: Ask them, which of them will guarantee that.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 41: Or do they have partners? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 42: On the Day when the Shin will be exposed, and they will be called to bow down, but they will be unable.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 43: Their eyes subdued, shame will cover them. They were invited to bow down when they were sound.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 44: So leave Me to those who reject this discourse; We will proceed against them gradually, from where they do not know.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 45: And I will give them respite. My plan is firm.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 46: Or do you ask them for a fee, so they are burdened with debt?
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 47: Or do they know the future, and so they write it down?
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 48: So wait patiently for the Decision of your Lord, and do not be like the Fellow of the Fish who cried out in despair.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 49: Were it not for his Lord's favor that reached him, he would have been thrown into the wilderness, fully despised.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 50: But his Lord chose him, and made him one of the righteous.
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 51: Those who disbelieve almost stab you with their glances when they hear the message, and say, "He is crazy!"
Surah al-Qalam, Ayah 52: But it is no less than a reminder to all the Worlds.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 1: The Reality.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 2: What is the Reality?
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 3: What will make you understand what the Reality is?
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 4: Thamood and Aad denied the Catastrophe.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 5: As for Thamood, they were annihilated by the Overwhelming.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 6: And as for Aad; they were annihilated by a furious, roaring wind.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 7: He unleashed it upon them for seven nights and eight days, in succession. You could see the people tossed around, as though they were stumps of hollow palm-trees.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 8: Can you see any remnant of them?
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 9: Then Pharaoh came, and those before him, and the Overturned Cities steeped in sin.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 10: But they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with an overpowering grip.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 11: When the waters overflowed, We carried you in the cruising ship.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 12: To make it a lesson for you-so that retaining ears may retain it.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 13: Then, when the Trumpet is sounded a single time.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 14: And the earth and the mountains are lifted up, and crushed, with a single crush.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 15: On that Day, the Event will come to pass.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 16: And the heaven will crack; so on that Day it will be frail.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 17: And the angels will be ranged around its borders, while eight will be carrying the Throne of your Lord above them that Day.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 18: On that Day you will be exposed, and no secret of yours will remain hidden.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 19: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, "Here, take my book and read it.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 20: I knew I would be held accountable."
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 21: So he will be in pleasant living.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 22: In a lofty Garden.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 23: Its pickings are within reach.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 24: "Eat and drink merrily for what you did in the days gone by."
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 25: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, "I wish I was never given my book.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 26: And never knew what my account was.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 27: If only it was the end.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 28: My money cannot avail me.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 29: My power has vanished from me."
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 30: "Take him and shackle him.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 31: Then scorch him in the Blaze.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 32: Then in a chain which length is seventy cubits tie him up.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 33: For he would not believe in God the Great.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 34: Nor would he advocate the feeding of the destitute.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 35: So he has no friend here today.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 36: And no food except scum.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 37: Which only the sinners eat."
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 38: Indeed, I swear by what you see.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 39: And by what you do not see.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 40: It is the speech of a noble messenger.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 41: And it is not the speech of a poet-little do you believe.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 42: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer-little do you take heed.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 43: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 44: Had he falsely attributed some statements to Us.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 45: We would have seized him by the right arm.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 46: Then slashed his lifeline.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 47: And none of you could have restrained Us from him.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 48: Surely, it is a message for the righteous.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 49: And We know that some of you will reject it.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 50: And it is surely a source of grief for the unbelievers.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 51: Yet it is the absolute truth.
Surah al-Haqqah, Ayah 52: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Magnificent.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 1: Alif, Lam, Meem, Saad.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 2: A Scripture was revealed to you, so let there be no anxiety in your heart because of it. You are to warn with it-and a reminder for the believers.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 3: Follow what is revealed to you from your Lord, and do not follow other masters beside Him. Little you recollect.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 4: How many a town have We destroyed? Our might came upon them by night, or while they were napping.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 5: When Our might came upon them, their only cry was, "We were indeed wrongdoers."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 6: We will question those to whom messengers were sent, and We will question the messengers.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 7: We will narrate to them with knowledge, for We were never absent.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 8: The scales on that Day will be just. Those whose weights are heavy-it is they who are the successful.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 9: But as for those whose weights are light-it is they who have lost their souls, because they used to mistreat Our revelations.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 10: We have established you firmly on earth, and made for you in it livelihood-but rarely do you give thanks.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 11: We created you, then We shaped you, then We said to the angels, "Bow down before Adam;" so they bowed down, except for Satan; he was not of those who bowed down.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 12: He said, "What prevented you from bowing down when I have commanded you?" He said, "I am better than he; You created me from fire, and You created him from mud."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 13: He said, "Get down from it! It is not for you to act arrogantly in it. Get out! You are one of the lowly!"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 14: He said, "Give me respite, until the Day they are resurrected."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 15: He said, "You are of those given respite."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 16: He said, "Because you have lured me, I will waylay them on Your straight path.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 17: Then I will come at them from before them, and from behind them, and from their right, and from their left; and you will not find most of them appreciative."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 18: He said, "Get out of it, despised and vanquished. Whoever among them follows you-I will fill up Hell with you all.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 19: And you, Adam, inhabit the Garden, you and your wife, and eat whatever you wish; but do not approach this tree, lest you become sinners."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 20: But Satan whispered to them, to reveal to them their nakedness, which was invisible to them. He said, "Your Lord has only forbidden you this tree, lest you become angels, or become immortals."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 21: And he swore to them, "I am a sincere advisor to you."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 22: So he lured them with deceit. And when they tasted the tree, their nakedness became evident to them, and they began covering themselves with the leaves of the Garden. And their Lord called out to them, "Did I not forbid you from this tree, and say to you that Satan is a sworn enemy to you?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 23: They said, "Our Lord, we have done wrong to ourselves. Unless You forgive us, and have mercy on us, we will be among the losers."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 24: He said, "Fall, some of you enemies to one another. On earth you will have residence and livelihood for a while."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 25: He said, "In it you will live, and in it you will die, and from it you will be brought out."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 26: O children of Adam! We have provided you with clothing to cover your bodies, and for luxury. But the clothing of piety-that is best. These are some of God's revelations, so that they may take heed.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 27: O Children of Adam! Do not let Satan seduce you, as he drove your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their garments, to show them their nakedness. He sees you, him and his clan, from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils friends of those who do not believe.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 28: And when they commit an indecency, they say, "We found our parents doing this, and God has commanded us to do it." Say, "God does not command indecencies. Are you attributing to God what you do not know?"

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 29: Say, "My Lord commands justice, and to stand devoted at every place of worship. So call upon Him, and dedicate your faith to Him alone. Just as He originated you, so you will return."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 30: Some He has guided, and some have deserved misguidance. They have adopted the devils for patrons rather than God, and they assume that they are guided.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 31: O Children of Adam! Dress properly at every place of worship, and eat and drink, but do not be excessive. He does not love the excessive.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 32: Say, "Who forbade God's finery which He has produced for His servants, and the delights of livelihood?" Say, "They are for those who believe, in this present world, but exclusively theirs on the Day of Resurrection." We thus detail the revelations for people who know.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 33: Say, "My Lord has forbidden immoralities-both open and secret-and sin, and unjustified aggression, and that you associate with God anything for which He revealed no sanction, and that you say about God what you do not know."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 34: For every nation is an appointed time. When their time has come, they cannot delay it by one hour, nor can they advance it.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 35: O Children of Adam! When messengers from among you come to you, relating to you My revelations-whoever practices piety and reforms-upon them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 36: But as for those who reject Our revelations, and are too proud to accept them-these are the inmates of the Fire, where they will remain forever.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 37: Who does greater wrong than he who invents lies about God, or denies His revelations? These-their share of the decree will reach them. Until, when Our envoys come to them, to take their souls away, they will say, "Where are they whom you used to pray to besides God?" They will say, "They have abandoned us," and they will testify against themselves that they were faithless.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 38: He will say, "Join the crowds of jinn and humans who have gone into the Fire before you." Every time a crowd enters, it will curse its sister-crowd. Until, when they are all in it, the last of them will say to the first of them, "Our Lord, these are the ones who misled us, so inflict on them a double punishment in the Fire." He will say, "Each will have a double, but you do not know."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 39: The first of them will say to the last of them, "You have no advantage over us, so taste the torment for what you used to earn."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 40: Those who reject Our revelations and are too arrogant to uphold them-the doors of Heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise, until the camel passes through the eye of the needle. Thus We repay the guilty.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 41: For them is a couch of hell, and above them are sheets of fire. Thus We repay the wrongdoers.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 42: As for those who believe and do righteous works-We never burden any soul beyond its capacity-these are the inhabitants of the Garden; abiding therein eternally.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 43: We will remove whatever rancor is in their hearts. Rivers will flow beneath them. And they will say, "Praise be to God, who has guided us to this. Had God not guided us, we would never be guided. The messengers of our Lord did come with the truth." And it will be proclaimed to them, "This is the Garden you are made to inherit, on account of what you used to do."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 44: And the inhabitants of the Garden will call out to the inmates of the Fire, "We found what our Lord promised us to be true; did you find what your Lord promised you to be true?" They will say, "Yes." Thereupon a caller will announce in their midst, "The curse of God is upon the wrongdoers."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 45: "Those who hinder from the path of God, and seek to distort it, and who deny the Hereafter."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 46: And between them is a partition, and on the Elevations are men who recognize everyone by their features. They will call to the inhabitants of the Garden, "Peace be upon you." They have not entered it, but they are hoping.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 47: And when their eyes are directed towards the inmates of the Fire, they will say, "Our Lord, do not place us among the wrongdoing people."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 48: And the dwellers of the Elevations will call to men they recognize by their features, saying, "Your hoardings did not avail you, nor did your arrogance."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 49: "Are these the ones you swore God will not touch with mercy?" "Enter the Garden; you have nothing to fear, and you will not grieve."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 50: The inmates of the Fire will call on the inhabitants of the Garden, "Pour some water over us, or some of what God has provided for you." They will say, "God has forbidden them for the disbelievers."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 51: Those who took their religion lightly, and in jest, and whom the worldly life deceived. Today We will ignore them, as they ignored the meeting on this Day of theirs, and they used to deny Our revelations.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 52: We have given them a Scripture, which We detailed with knowledge-guidance and mercy for people who believe.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 53: Are they waiting for anything but its fulfillment? The Day its fulfillment comes true, those who disregarded it before will say, "The messengers of our Lord did come with the truth. Have we any intercessors to intercede for us? Or, could we be sent back, to behave differently from the way we behaved before?" They ruined their souls, and what they used to invent has failed them.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 54: Your Lord is God; He who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then established Himself on the Throne. The night overtakes the day, as it pursues it persistently; and the sun, and the moon, and the stars are subservient by His command. His is the creation, and His is the command. Blessed is God, Lord of all beings.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 55: Call upon your Lord humbly and privately. He does not love the aggressors.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 56: And do not corrupt on earth after its reformation, and pray to Him with fear and hope. God's mercy is close to the doers of good.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 57: It is He who sends the wind ahead of His mercy. Then, when they have gathered up heavy clouds, We drive them to a dead land, where We make water come down, and with it We bring out all kinds of fruits. Thus We bring out the dead-perhaps you will reflect.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 58: As for the good land, it yields its produce by the leave of its Lord. But as for the bad, it produces nothing but hardship and misery. Thus We explain the revelations in various ways for people who are thankful.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 59: We sent Noah to his people. He said, "O my people! Worship God; you have no god other than Him. I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 60: The dignitaries among his people said, "We see that you are in obvious error."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 61: He said, "O my people, I am not in error, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 62: "I deliver to you the messages of my Lord, and I advise you, and I know from God what you do not know."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 63: "Do you wonder that a reminder has come to you from your Lord, through a man from among you, to warn you, and to lead you to righteousness, so that you may attain mercy?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 64: But they called him a liar. So We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and We drowned those who rejected Our revelations. They were blind people.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 65: And to Aad, their brother Hud. He said, "O my people! Worship God; you have no god other than Him. Will you not take heed?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 66: The elite of his people who disbelieved said, "We see foolishness in you, and we think that you are a liar."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 67: He said, "O my people! There is no foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 68: "I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I am a trustworthy adviser to you."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 69: "Are you surprised that a reminder has come to you from your Lord, through a man from among you, to warn you? Remember how He made you successors after the people of Noah, and increased you greatly in stature. And remember God's blessings, so that you may prosper."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 70: They said, "Did you come to us to make us worship God alone, and abandon what our ancestors used to worship? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are truthful."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 71: He said, "Condemnation and wrath have befallen you from your Lord. Are you arguing with me over names, which you and your ancestors invented, for which God sent down no authority? Just wait; I am waiting with you."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 72: So We saved him and those with him, by mercy from Us, and We cut off the roots of those who rejected Our revelations and were not believers.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 73: And to Thamood, their brother Saleh. He said, "O my people! Worship God; you have no god other than Him. Clarification has come to you from your Lord. This she-camel of God is a sign for you. So leave her to graze on God's earth, and do her no harm, lest a painful penalty seizes you."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 74: "And remember how He made you successors after Aad, and settled you in the land. You make for yourselves mansions on its plains, and carve out dwellings in the mountains. So remember God's benefits, and do not roam the earth corruptingly."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 75: The elite of his people, who were arrogant, said to the common people who had believed, "Do you know that Saleh is sent from his Lord?" They said, "We are believers in what he was sent with."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 76: Those who were arrogant said, "We reject what you believe in."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 77: So they hamstrung the she-camel, and defied the command of their Lord, and said, "O Saleh, bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are one of the messengers."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 78: Whereupon the quake overtook them, and they became lifeless bodies in their homes.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 79: Then he turned away from them, and said, "O my people, I have delivered to you the message of my Lord, and I have advised you, but you do not like those who give advice."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 80: And Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit lewdness no people anywhere have ever committed before you?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 81: "You lust after men rather than women. You are an excessive people."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 82: And his people's only answer was to say, "Expel them from your town; they are purist people."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 83: But We saved him and his family, except for his wife; she was of those who lagged behind.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 84: And We rained down on them a rain; note the consequences for the sinners.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 85: And to Median, their brother Shuaib. He said, "O my people, worship God; you have no god other than Him. A clear proof has come to you from your Lord. Give full measure and weight, and do not cheat people out of their rights, and do not corrupt the land once it has been set right. This is better for you, if you are believers."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 86: "And do not lurk on every path, making threats and turning away from the path of God those who believe in Him, seeking to distort it. And remember how you were few, and how He made you numerous. So note the consequences for the corrupters."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 87: "Since some of you believed in what I was sent with, and some did not believe, be patient until God judges between us; for He is the Best of Judges."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 88: The arrogant elite among his people said, "O Shuaib, We will evict you from our town, along with those who believe with you, unless you return to our religion." He said, "Even if we are unwilling?"

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 89: "We would be fabricating falsehood against God, if we were to return to your religion, after God has saved us from it. It is not for us to return to it, unless God, our Lord, wills. Our Lord embraces all things in knowledge. In God we place our trust. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, for You are the Best of Deciders."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 90: The elite of his people who disbelieved said, "If you follow Shuaib, you will be losers."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 91: Thereupon, the quake struck them; and they became lifeless bodies in their homes.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 92: Those who rejected Shuaib-as if they never prospered therein. Those who rejected Shuaib-it was they who were the losers.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 93: So he turned away from them, and said, "O my people, I have delivered to you the messages of my Lord, and I have advised you, so why should I grieve over a disbelieving people?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 94: We did not send any prophet to any town but We afflicted its people with misery and adversity, so that they may humble themselves.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 95: Then We substituted prosperity in place of hardship. Until they increased in number, and said, "Adversity and prosperity has touched our ancestors." Then We seized them suddenly, while they were unaware.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 96: Had the people of the towns believed and turned righteous, We would have opened for them the blessings of the heaven and the earth; but they rejected the truth, so We seized them by what they were doing.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 97: Do the people of the towns feel secure that Our might will not come upon them by night, while they sleep?
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 98: Do the people of the towns feel secure that Our might will not come upon them by day, while they play?
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 99: Do they feel safe from God's plan? None feel safe from God's plan except the losing people.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 100: Is it not guidance for those who inherit the land after its inhabitants, that if We willed, We could strike them for their sins? And seal up their hearts, so that they would not hear?

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 101: These towns-We narrate to you some of their tales. Their messengers came to them with the clear signs, but they would not believe in what they had rejected previously. Thus God seals the hearts of the disbelievers.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 102: We found most of them untrue to their covenants; We found most of them corrupt.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 103: Then, after them, We sent Moses with Our miracles to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they denounced them. So consider the end of the evildoers.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 104: Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the Worlds."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 105: "It is only proper that I should not say about God anything other than the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with me."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 106: He said, "If you brought a miracle, then present it, if you are truthful."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 107: So he threw his staff, and it was an apparent serpent.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 108: And He pulled out his hand, and it was white to the onlookers.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 109: The notables among Pharaoh's people said, "This is really a skilled magician."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 110: "He wants to evict you from your land, so what do you recommend?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 111: They said, "Put him off, and his brother, and send heralds to the cities."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 112: "And let them bring you every skillful magician."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 113: The magicians came to Pharaoh, and said, "Surely there is a reward for us, if we are the victors."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 114: He said, "Yes, and you will be among my favorites."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 115: They said, "O Moses! Either you throw, or we are the ones to throw."
