Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 116: He said, "You throw!" And when they threw, they beguiled the eyes of the people, and intimidated them, and produced a mighty magic.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 117: And We inspired Moses: "Throw your staff." And at once, it swallowed what they were faking.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 118: So the truth came to pass, and what they were producing came to nothing.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 119: There they were defeated, and utterly reduced.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 120: And the magicians fell to their knees.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 121: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the Worlds."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 122: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 123: Pharaoh said, "Did you believe in Him before I have given you permission? This is surely a conspiracy you schemed in the city, in order to expel its people from it. You will surely know."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 124: "I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will crucify you all."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 125: They said, "It is to our Lord that we will return."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 126: "You are taking vengeance on us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they have come to us." "Our Lord! Pour out patience upon us, and receive our souls in submission."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 127: The chiefs of Pharaoh's people said, "Will you let Moses and his people cause trouble in the land, and forsake you and your gods?" He said, "We will kill their sons, and spare their women. We have absolute power over them."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 128: Moses said to his people, "Seek help in God, and be patient. The earth belongs to God. He gives it in inheritance to whomever He wills of His servants, and the future belongs to the righteous."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 129: They said, "We were persecuted before you came to us, and after you came to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy, and make you successors in the land; then He will see how you behave."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 130: And We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with barren years, and with shortage of crops, that they may take heed.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 131: When something good came their way, they said, "This is ours." And when something bad happened to them, they ascribed the evil omen to Moses and those with him. In fact, their omen is with God, but most of them do not know.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 132: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us, to bewitch us with, we will not believe in you."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 133: So We let loose upon them the flood, and the locusts, and the lice, and the frogs, and blood-all explicit signs-but they were too arrogant. They were a sinful people.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 134: Whenever a plague befell them, they would say, "O Moses, pray to your Lord for us, according to the covenant He made with you. If you lift the plague from us, we will believe in you, and let the Children of Israel go with you."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 135: But when We lifted the plague from them, for a term they were to fulfill, they broke their promise.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 136: So We took vengeance on them, and drowned them in the sea-because they rejected Our signs, and paid no heed to them.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 137: And We made the oppressed people inherit the eastern and western parts of the land, which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the Children of Israel was fulfilled, because of their endurance. And We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had built, and what they had harvested.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 138: And We delivered the Children of Israel across the sea. And when they came upon a people who were devoted to some statues of theirs, they said, "O Moses, make for us a god, as they have gods." He said, "You are truly an ignorant people."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 139: "What these people are concerned with is perdition, and their deeds are based on falsehoods."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 140: He said, "Shall I seek for you a god other than God, when He has favored you over all other people?"

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 141: Remember how We saved you from Pharaoh's people, who subjected you to the worst of sufferings-killing your sons and sparing your women. In that was a tremendous trial from your Lord.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 142: And We appointed to Moses thirty nights, and completed them with ten; and thus the time appointed by his Lord was forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron: "Take my place among my people, and be upright, and do not follow the way of the mischief-makers."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 143: And when Moses came to Our appointment, and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, allow me to look and see You." He said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it stays in its place, you will see Me." But when his Lord manifested Himself to the mountain, He turned it into dust, and Moses fell down unconscious. Then, when he recovered, he said, "Glory be to you, I repent to you, and I am the first of the believers."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 144: He said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over all people for My messages and for My Words. So take what I have given you, and be one of the thankful."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 145: And We inscribed for him in the Tablets all kinds of enlightenments, and decisive explanation of all things. "Hold fast to them, and exhort your people to adopt the best of them. I will show you the fate of the sinners."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 146: I will turn away from My revelations those who behave proudly on earth without justification. Even if they see every sign, they will not believe in it; and if they see the path of rectitude, they will not adopt it for a path; and if they see the path of error, they will adopt it for a path. That is because they denied Our revelations, and paid no attention to them.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 147: Those who deny Our revelations and the meeting of the Hereafter-their deeds will come to nothing. Will they be repaid except according to what they used to do?

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 148: In his absence, the people of Moses adopted a calf made from their ornaments-a body which lowed. Did they not see that it could not speak to them, nor guide them in any way? They took it for worship. They were in the wrong.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 149: Then, when they regretted, and realized that they had erred, they said, "Unless our Lord extends His mercy to us, and forgives us, we will be among the losers."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 150: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and disappointed, he said, "What an awful thing you did in my absence. Did you forsake the commandments of your Lord so hastily?" And he threw down the tablets; and he took hold of his brother's head, dragging him towards himself. He said, "Son of my mother, the people have overpowered me, and were about to kill me; so do not allow the enemies to gloat over me, and do not count me among the unjust people."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 151: He said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother, and admit us into Your mercy; for you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 152: Those who idolized the calf have incurred wrath from their Lord, and humiliation in this life. We thus requite the innovators.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 153: As for those who commit sins, and then repent afterwards and believe-your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 154: When the anger abated in Moses, he took up the tablets. In their transcript is guidance and mercy for those in awe of their Lord.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 155: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. When the tremor shook them, he said, "My Lord, had You willed, You could have destroyed them before, and me too. Will you destroy us for what the fools among us have done? This is but Your test-with it You misguide whomever You will, and guide whomever You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us, and have mercy on us. You are the Best of Forgivers."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 156: "And inscribe for us goodness in this world, and in the Hereafter. We have turned to You." He said, "My punishment-I inflict it upon whomever I will, but My mercy encompasses all things. I will specify it for those who act righteously and practice regular charity, and those who believe in Our signs."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 157: Those who follow the Messenger, the Unlettered Prophet, whom they find mentioned in the Torah and the Gospel in their possession. He directs them to righteousness, and deters them from evil, and allows for them all good things, and prohibits for them wickedness, and unloads the burdens and the shackles that are upon them. Those who believe in him, and respect him, and support him, and follow the light that came down with him-these are the successful.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 158: Say, "O people, I am the Messenger of God to you all-He to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. There is no god but He. He gives life and causes death." So believe in God and His Messenger, the Unlettered Prophet, who believes in God and His words. And follow him, that you may be guided.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 159: Among the people of Moses is a community that guides by truth, and thereby does justice.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 160: We divided them into twelve tribal communities. And We inspired Moses, when his people asked him for something to drink: "Strike the rock with your staff." Whereupon twelve springs gushed from it. Each group recognized its drinking-place. And We shaded them with clouds, and We sent down upon them manna and quails: "Eat of the good things We have provided for you." They did not wrong Us, but they used to wrong their own selves.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 161: And it was said to them, "Settle this town, and eat therein whatever you wish, and speak modestly, and enter the gate in humility-We will forgive your sins, and will promote the righteous."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 162: But the wicked among them substituted other words for the words given to them; so We sent down upon them a plague from the sky, because of their wrongdoing.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 163: Ask them about the town by the sea, when they violated the Sabbath. When they observed the Sabbath, their fish would come to them abundantly. But when they violated the Sabbath, their fish would not come to them. Thus We tried them because they disobeyed.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 164: And when a group of them said, "Why do you counsel a people whom God will annihilate, or punish with a severe punishment?" They said, "As an excuse to your Lord, and so that they may become righteous."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 165: Then, when they neglected what they were reminded of, We saved those who prohibited evil, and We seized those who did wrong with a terrible punishment, because of their sinfulness.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 166: Then, when they rebelled against the commands to refrain, We said to them, "Be despicable apes."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 167: Your Lord has announced that, He would send against them, until the Day of Resurrection, those who would inflict terrible suffering upon them. Your Lord is swift in retribution, yet He is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 168: And We scattered them into communities on earth. Some of them righteous, and some of them short of that. And We tested them with fortunes and misfortunes, so that they may return.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 169: They were succeeded by generations who inherited the Scripture and chose the materials of this world, saying, "We will be forgiven." And should similar materials come their way, they would again seize them. Did they not make a covenant to uphold the Scripture, and to not say about God except the truth? Did they not study its contents? But the Home of the Hereafter is better for the cautious; will you not understand?
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 170: Those who adhere to the Scripture, and practice prayer-We will not waste the reward of the reformers.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 171: And when We suspended the mountain over them, as if it was an umbrella, and they thought it would fall on them: "Hold fast to what We have given you, and remember what it contains, so that you may be saved."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 172: And when Your Lord summoned the descendants of Adam, and made them testify about themselves. "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we testify." Thus you cannot say on the Day of Resurrection, "We were unaware of this."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 173: Nor can you Say, "Our ancestors practiced idolatry before; and we are their descendants who came after them; will you destroy us for what the falsifiers did?"
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 174: We thus elaborate the revelations, so that they may return.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 175: And relate to them the story of him to whom We delivered Our signs, but he detached himself from them, so Satan went after him, and he became one of the perverts.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 176: Had We willed, We could have elevated him through them; but he clung to the ground, and followed his desires. His metaphor is that of a dog: if you chase it, it pants; and if you leave it alone, it pants. Such is the metaphor of the people who deny Our signs. So tell the tale, so that they may ponder.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 177: Evil is the metaphor of the people who reject Our signs and wrong themselves.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 178: Whomever God guides is the guided one. And whomever He sends astray-these are the losers.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 179: We have destined for Hell multitudes of jinn and humans. They have hearts with which they do not understand. They have eyes with which they do not see. They have ears with which they do not hear. These are like cattle. In fact, they are further astray. These are the heedless.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 180: To God belong the Most Beautiful Names, so call Him by them, and disregard those who blaspheme His names. They will be repaid for what they used to do.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 181: Among those We created is a community-they guide by truth, and do justice thereby.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 182: As for those who reject Our messages, We will gradually lead them from where they do not know.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 183: And I will encourage them. My plan is firm.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 184: Do they not think? There is no madness in their friend. He is but a plain warner.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 185: Have they not observed the government of the heavens and the earth, and all the things that God created, and that their time may have drawn near? Which message, besides this, will they believe in?
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 186: Whomever God misguides has no guide. And He leaves them blundering in their transgression.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 187: They ask you about the Hour, "When will it come?" Say, "Knowledge of it rests with my Lord. None can reveal its coming except He. It weighs heavily on the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except suddenly." They ask you as if you are responsible for it. Say, "Knowledge of it rests with God," but most people do not know.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 188: Say, "I have no control over any benefit or harm to myself, except as God wills. Had I known the future, I would have acquired much good, and no harm would have touched me. I am only a warner, and a herald of good news to a people who believe."

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 189: It is He who created you from a single person, and made from it its mate, that he may find comfort with her. Then, when he has covered her, she conceives a light load, and she carries it around. But when she has grown heavy, they pray to God their Lord, "if You give us a good child, we will be among the thankful."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 190: But when He has given them a good child, they attribute partners to Him in what He has given them. God is exalted above what they associate.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 191: Do they idolize those who create nothing, and are themselves created?
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 192: And can neither help them, nor help their own selves?
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 193: And if you invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is the same for you, whether you invite them, or remain silent.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 194: Those you call upon besides God are servants like you. So call upon them, and let them answer you, if you are truthful.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 195: Do they have feet with which they walk? Or do they have hands with which they strike? Or do they have eyes with which they see? Or do they have ears with which they hear? Say, "Call upon your partners, then plot against me, and do not wait."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 196: "My Master is God, He Who sent down the Book, and He takes care of the righteous."
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 197: Those you call upon besides Him cannot help you, nor can they help themselves.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 198: And if you call them to guidance, they will not hear. And you see them looking at you, yet they do not see.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 199: Be tolerant, and command decency, and avoid the ignorant.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 200: And when a suggestion from Satan assails you, take refuge with God. He is Hearing and Knowing.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 201: Those who are righteous-when an impulse from Satan strikes them, they remind themselves, and immediately see clearly.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 202: But their brethren lead them relentlessly into error, and they never stop short.

Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 203: If you do not produce a miracle for them, they say, "Why don't you improvise one." Say, "I only follow what is inspired to me from my Lord." These are insights from your Lord, and guidance, and mercy, for a people who believe.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 204: When the Quran is recited, listen to it, and pay attention, so that you may experience mercy.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 205: And remember your Lord within yourself, humbly and fearfully, and quietly, in the morning and the evening, and do not be of the neglectful.
Surah al-A'raf , Ayah 206: Those who are in the presence of your Lord are not too proud to worship Him. They recite His praises, and to Him they bow down.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 1: A questioner questioned the imminent torment.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 2: For the disbelievers; none can repel it.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 3: From God, Lord of the Ways of Ascent.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 4: Unto Him the angels and the Spirit ascend on a Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 5: So be patient, with sweet patience.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 6: They see it distant.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 7: But We see it near.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 8: On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 9: And the mountains will be like tufted wool.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 10: No friend will care about his friend.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 11: They will be shown each other. The criminal wishes he would be redeemed from the punishment of that Day by his children.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 12: And his spouse, and his brother.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 13: And his family that sheltered him.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 14: And everyone on earth, in order to save him.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 15: By no means! It is a Raging Fire.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 16: It strips away the scalps.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 17: It invites him who once turned his back and fled.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 18: And accumulated and hoarded.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 19: Man was created restless.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 20: Touched by adversity, he is fretful.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 21: Touched by good, he is ungenerous.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 22: Except the prayerful.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 23: Those who are constant at their prayers.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 24: And those in whose wealth is a rightful share.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 25: For the beggar and the deprived.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 26: And those who affirm the Day of Judgment.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 27: And those who fear the punishment of their Lord.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 28: Their Lord's punishment is not to be taken for granted.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 29: And those who guard their chastity.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 30: Except from their spouses or those living under their control, for then they are free of blame.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 31: But whoever seeks to go beyond that-these are the transgressors.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 32: And those who honor their trusts and their pledges.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 33: And those who stand by their testimonies.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 34: And those who are dedicated to their prayers.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 35: These will be honored in Gardens.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 36: What is with those who disbelieve, stretching their necks towards you.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 37: From the right, and from the left, banding together?
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 38: Is every one of them aspiring to be admitted into a Garden of Bliss?
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 39: No indeed! We created them from what they know.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 40: I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests, that We are Able.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 41: To replace them with better than they, and We are not to be outdone.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 42: So leave them to blunder and play, until they meet their Day which they are promised.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 43: The Day when they will emerge from the tombs in a rush, as though they were hurrying towards a target.
Surah al-Ma'arij, Ayah 44: Their eyes cast down; overwhelmed by humiliation. This is the Day which they were promised.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 1: We sent Noah to his people: "Warn your people before there comes upon them a painful punishment."
Surah Nuh, Ayah 2: He said, "O my people, I am to you a clear warner.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 3: Worship God and reverence Him, and obey me.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 4: And He will forgive you of your sins, and reprieve you until a stated term. God's term cannot be deferred once it has arrived, if you only knew."
Surah Nuh, Ayah 5: He said, "My Lord, I have called my people night and day.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 6: But my call added only to their flight.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 7: Whenever I called them to Your forgiveness, they thrust their fingers into their ears, and wrapped themselves in their garments, and insisted, and became more and more arrogant.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 8: Then I called them openly.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 9: Then I appealed to them publicly, and I spoke to them privately.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 10: I said, 'Ask your Lord for forgiveness; He is Forgiving.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 11: He will let loose the sky upon you in torrents.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 12: And provide you with wealth and children, and allot for you gardens, and allot for you rivers.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 13: What is the matter with you, that you do not appreciate God's Greatness?
Surah Nuh, Ayah 14: Although He created you in stages.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 15: Do you not realize that God created seven heavens in layers?
Surah Nuh, Ayah 16: And He set the moon in their midst for light, and He made the sun a lamp.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 17: And God germinated you from the earth like plants.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 18: Then He will return you into it, and will bring you out again.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 19: And God made the earth a spread for you.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 20: That you may travel its diverse roads.'"
Surah Nuh, Ayah 21: Noah said, "My Lord, they have defied me, and followed him whose wealth and children increase him only in perdition."
Surah Nuh, Ayah 22: And they schemed outrageous schemes.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 23: And they said, "Do not give up your gods; do not give up Wadd, nor Souwa, nor Yaghoos, and Yaooq, and Nassr.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 24: They have misled many, so do not increase the wrongdoers except in confusion."
Surah Nuh, Ayah 25: Because of their wrongs, they were drowned, and were hurled into a Fire. They did not find apart from God any helpers.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 26: Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave of the unbelievers a single dweller on earth.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 27: If You leave them, they will mislead your servants, and will breed only wicked unbelievers.
Surah Nuh, Ayah 28: My Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and anyone who enters my home in faith, and all the believing men and believing women; and do not increase the wrongdoers except in perdition."
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 1: Say, "It was revealed to me that a band of jinn listened in, and said, 'We have heard a wondrous Quran.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 2: It guides to rectitude, so we have believed in it; and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 3: And Exalted is the Grandeur of our Lord-He never had a mate, nor a child.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 4: But the fools among us used to say nonsense about God.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 5: And we thought that humans and jinn would never utter lies about God.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 6: Some individual humans used to seek power through some individual jinn, but they only increased them in confusion.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 7: They thought, as you thought, that God would never resurrect anyone.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 8: We probed the heaven, and found it filled with stern guards and projectiles.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 9: We used to take up positions to listen in; but whoever listens now finds a projectile in wait for him.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 10: We do not know whether ill is intended for those on earth, or if their Lord intends goodness for them.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 11: Some of us are righteous, but some of us are less than that; we follow divergent paths.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 12: We realized that we cannot defeat God on earth, and that we cannot escape Him by fleeing.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 13: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord fears neither loss, nor burden.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 14: Among us are those who are submitting, and among us are the compromisers. As for those who have submitted-it is they who pursue rectitude.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 15: But as for the compromisers-they will be firewood for Hell.'"
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 16: Had they kept true to the Path, We would have given them plenty water to drink.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 17: To test them with it. Whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will direct him to torment ever mounting.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 18: The places of worship are for God. So do not call, besides God, upon anyone else.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 19: And when the servant of God got up calling on Him, they almost fell on him in a mass.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 20: Say, "I pray only to my Lord, and I never associate anyone with Him."
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 21: Say, "It is not in my power to harm you, nor to bring you to right conduct."
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 22: Say, "No one can protect me from God, and I will not find any refuge except with Him.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 23: Except for a proclamation from God and His messages. He who defies God and His Messenger-for him is the Fire of Hell, in which they will dwell forever."
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 24: Until, when they see what they were promised, they will know who is weaker in helpers, and fewer in numbers.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 25: Say, "I do not know whether what you are promised is near, or whether my Lord will extend it for a period."
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 26: The Knower of the Invisible; He does not disclose His Invisible to anyone.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 27: Except to a Messenger of His choosing. He then dispatches guards before him and behind him.
Surah al-Jinn, Ayah 28: That He may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses what they have, and has tallied everything by number.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 1: O you Enwrapped one.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 2: Stay up during the night, except a little.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 3: For half of it, or reduce it a little.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 4: Or add to it; and chant the Quran rhythmically.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 5: We are about to give you a heavy message.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 6: The vigil of night is more effective, and better suited for recitation.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 7: In the daytime, you have lengthy work to do.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 8: So remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 9: Lord of the East and the West. There is no god but He, so take Him as a Trustee.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 10: And endure patiently what they say, and withdraw from them politely.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 11: And leave Me to those who deny the truth, those of luxury, and give them a brief respite.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 12: With Us are shackles, and a Fierce Fire.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 13: And food that chokes, and a painful punishment.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 14: On the Day when the earth and the mountains tremble, and the mountains become heaps of sand.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 15: We have sent to you a messenger, a witness over you, as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 16: But Pharaoh defied the Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 17: So how will you, if you persist in unbelief, save yourself from a Day which will turn the children gray-haired?
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 18: The heaven will shatter thereby. His promise is always fulfilled.
Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 19: This is a reminder. So whoever wills, let him take a path to his Lord.

Surah al-Muzzammil, Ayah 20: Your Lord knows that you stay up nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, along with a group of those with you. God designed the night and the day. He knows that you are unable to sustain it, so He has pardoned you. So read of the Quran what is possible for you. He knows that some of you may be ill; and others travelling through the land, seeking God's bounty; and others fighting in God's cause. So read of it what is possible for you, and observe the prayers, and give regular charity, and lend God a generous loan. Whatever good you advance for yourselves, you will find it with God, better and generously rewarded. And seek God's forgiveness, for God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 1: O you Enrobed one.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 2: Arise and warn.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 3: And magnify your Lord.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 4: And purify your clothes.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 5: And abandon abominations.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 6: And show no favor seeking gain.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 7: And be constant for your Lord.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 8: When the Trumpet is blown.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 9: That Day will be a difficult day.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 10: For the disbelievers-not easy.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 11: Leave Me to him whom I created alone.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 12: And gave him vast wealth.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 13: And children as witnesses.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 14: And smoothed things for him.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 15: Then he wants Me to add yet more!
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 16: By no means! He was stubborn towards Our revelations.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 17: I will exhaust him increasingly.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 18: He thought and analyzed.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 19: May he perish, how he analyzed.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 20: Again: may he perish, how he analyzed.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 21: Then he looked.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 22: Then he frowned and whined.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 23: Then he turned back and was proud.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 24: And said, "This is nothing but magic from the past.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 25: This is nothing but the word of a mortal."
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 26: I will roast him in Saqar.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 27: But what will explain to you what Saqar is?
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 28: It neither leaves, nor spares.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 29: It scorches the flesh.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 30: Over it are Nineteen.

Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 31: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and caused their number to be a stumbling block for those who disbelieve; so that those given the Scripture may attain certainty; and those who believe may increase in faith; and those given the Scripture and the believers may not doubt; and those in whose hearts is sickness and the unbelievers may say, "What did God intend by this parable?" Thus God leads astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. None knows the soldiers of your Lord except He. This is nothing but a reminder for the mortals.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 32: Nay! By the moon.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 33: And the night as it retreats.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 34: And the morning as it lights up.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 35: It is one of the greatest.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 36: A warning to the mortals.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 37: To whomever among you wishes to advance, or regress.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 38: Every soul is hostage to what it has earned.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 39: Except for those on the Right.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 40: In Gardens, inquiring.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 41: About the guilty.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 42: "What drove you into Saqar?"
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 43: They will say, "We were not of those who prayed.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 44: Nor did we feed the destitute.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 45: And we used to indulge with those who indulge.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 46: And we used to deny the Day of Judgment.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 47: Until the Inevitable came upon us."
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 48: But the intercession of intercessors will not help them.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 49: Why are they turning away from the Reminder?
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 50: As though they were panicked donkeys.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 51: Fleeing from a lion?
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 52: Yet every one of them desires to be given scrolls unrolled.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 53: No indeed! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 54: Nevertheless, it is a reminder.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 55: So whoever wills, shall remember it.
Surah al-Muddatstsir, Ayah 56: But they will not remember, unless God wills. He is the Source of Righteousness, and the Source of Forgiveness.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 1: I swear by the Day of Resurrection.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 2: And I swear by the blaming soul.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 3: Does man think that We will not reassemble his bones?
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 4: Yes indeed; We are Able to reconstruct his fingertips.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 5: But man wants to deny what is ahead of him.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 6: He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 7: When vision is dazzled.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 8: And the moon is eclipsed.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 9: And the sun and the moon are joined together.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 10: On that Day, man will say, "Where is the escape?"
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 11: No indeed! There is no refuge.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 12: To your Lord on that Day is the settlement.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 13: On that Day man will be informed of everything he put forward, and everything he left behind.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 14: And man will be evidence against himself.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 15: Even as he presents his excuses.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 16: Do not wag your tongue with it, to hurry on with it.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 17: Upon Us is its collection and its recitation.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 18: Then, when We have recited it, follow its recitation.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 19: Then upon Us is its explanation.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 20: Alas, you love the fleeting life.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 21: And you disregard the Hereafter.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 22: Faces on that Day will be radiant.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 23: Looking towards their Lord.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 24: And faces on that Day will be gloomy.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 25: Realizing that a back-breaker has befallen them.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 26: Indeed, when it has reached the breast-bones.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 27: And it is said, "Who is the healer?"
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 28: And He realizes that it is the parting.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 29: And leg is entwined with leg.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 30: To your Lord on that Day is the drive.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 31: He neither believed nor prayed.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 32: But he denied and turned away.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 33: Then he went to his family, full of pride.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 34: Woe to you; and woe.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 35: Then again: Woe to you; and woe.
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 36: Does man think that he will be left without purpose?
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 37: Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen?
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 38: Then he became a clot. And He created and proportioned?
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 39: And made of him the two sexes, the male and the female?
Surah al-Qiyamah, Ayah 40: Is He not Able to revive the dead?
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 1: Has there come upon man a period of time when he was nothing to be mentioned?
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 2: We created man from a liquid mixture, to test him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 3: We guided him to the way, be he appreciative or unappreciative.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 4: We have prepared for the faithless chains, and yokes, and a Searing Fire.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 5: But the righteous will drink from a cup whose mixture is aroma.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 6: A spring from which the servants of God will drink, making it gush abundantly.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 7: They fulfill their vows, and dread a Day whose ill is widespread.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 8: And they feed, for the love of Him, the poor, and the orphan, and the captive.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 9: "We only feed you for the sake of God. We want from you neither compensation, nor gratitude.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 10: We dread from our Lord a frowning grim Day."
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 11: So God will protect them from the ills of that Day, and will grant them radiance and joy.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 12: And will reward them for their patience with a Garden and silk.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 13: Reclining therein on the thrones; experiencing therein neither sun, nor frost.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 14: Its shade hovering over them, and its fruit brought low within reach.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 15: Passing around them are vessels of silver, and cups of crystal.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 16: Crystal of silver-they measured them exactly.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 17: They will be served therein with a cup whose flavor is Zanjabeel.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 18: A spring therein named Salsabeel.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 19: Passing among them are eternalized youths. If you see them, you would think them sprinkled pearls.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 20: Wherever you look, you see bliss, and a vast kingdom.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 21: Upon them are garments of green silk, and satin. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Lord will offer them a pure drink.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 22: "This is a reward for you. Your efforts are well appreciated."
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 23: It is We who sent down the Quran upon you-a gradual revelation.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 24: So be patient for the decision of your Lord, and do not obey the sinner or the blasphemer among them.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 25: And mention the Name of your Lord, morning and evening.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 26: And for part of the night, prostrate yourself to Him, and glorify Him long into the night.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 27: As for these: they love the fleeting life, and leave behind a Heavy Day.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 28: We created them, and strengthened their frame; and whenever We will, We can replace them with others like them.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 29: This is a reminder; so whoever wills, let him take a path to his Lord.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 30: Yet you cannot will, unless God wills. God is Knowing and Wise.
Surah al-Insan, Ayah 31: He admits into His mercy whomever He wills. But as for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 1: By those unleashed in succession.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 2: Storming turbulently.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 3: Scattering far and wide.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 4: Separating decisively.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 5: Delivering a message.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 6: Excusing or warning.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 7: Surely what you are promised will happen.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 8: When the stars are obliterated.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 9: And the sky is fractured.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 10: And the mountains are blown away.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 11: And the messengers are alerted.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 12: Until which day is it deferred?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 13: Until the Day of Decision.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 14: And what will teach you what the Day of Decision is?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 15: Woe on that Day to the liars.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 16: Did We not destroy the ancients?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 17: Then succeeded them with the others?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 18: This is how We deal with the guilty.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 19: Woe on that Day to the rejecters.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 20: Did We not create you from an insignificant fluid?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 21: Then lodged it in a secure place?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 22: For a known term?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 23: We measured precisely. We are the best to measure.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 24: Woe on that Day to the falsifiers.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 25: Did We not make the earth a homestead?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 26: For the living and the dead?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 27: And set on it lofty mountains, and given you pure water to drink?
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 28: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 29: "Proceed to what you used to deny."
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 30: "Proceed to a shadow of three different masses."
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 31: Offering no shade, and unavailing against the flames.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 32: It shoots sparks as castles.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 33: As if they were yellow camels.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 34: Woe on that Day to the liars.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 35: This is a Day when they will not speak.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 36: And they will not be allowed to apologize.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 37: Woe on that Day to the rejecters.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 38: This is the Day of Separation; We have gathered you, together with the ancients.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 39: So if you have a strategy, use it against Me.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 40: Woe on that Day to the falsifiers.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 41: The righteous will be amidst shades and fountains.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 42: And fruits as they desire.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 43: "Eat and drink pleasantly, for what you used to do."
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 44: This is how We reward the doers of good.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 45: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 46: "Eat and enjoy yourselves a little; you are indeed criminals."
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 47: Woe on that Day to the liars.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 48: And when it is said to them, "Kneel", they do not kneel.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 49: Woe on that Day to the rejecters.
Surah al-Mursalat, Ayah 50: In what message, beyond this, will they believe?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 1: What are they asking one another about?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 2: About the Great Event.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 3: About which they disagree.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 4: Surely, they will find out.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 5: Most certainly, they will find out.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 6: Did We not make the earth a cradle?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 7: And the mountains pegs?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 8: And created you in pairs?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 9: And made your sleep for rest?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 10: And made the night a cover?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 11: And made the day for livelihood?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 12: And built above you seven strong ones?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 13: And placed a blazing lamp?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 14: And brought down from the clouds pouring water?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 15: To produce with it grains and vegetation?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 16: And luxuriant gardens?
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 17: The Day of Sorting has been appointed.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 18: The Day when the Trumpet is blown, and you will come in droves.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 19: And the sky is opened up, and becomes gateways.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 20: And the mountains are set in motion, and become a mirage.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 21: Hell is lying in ambush.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 22: For the oppressors, a destination.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 23: Where they will remain for eons.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 24: They will taste therein neither coolness, nor drink.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 25: Except boiling water, and freezing hail.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 26: A fitting requital.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 27: For they were not anticipating any reckoning.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 28: And they denied Our signs utterly.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 29: But We have enumerated everything in writing.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 30: So taste! We will increase you only in suffering.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 31: But for the righteous there is triumph.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 32: Gardens and vineyards.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 33: And splendid spouses, well matched.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 34: And delicious drinks.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 35: They will hear therein neither gossip, nor lies.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 36: A reward from your Lord, a fitting gift.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 37: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them-The Most Merciful-none can argue with Him.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 38: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels stand in row. They will not speak, unless it be one permitted by the Most Merciful, and he will say what is right.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 39: That is the Day of Reality. So whoever wills, let him take a way back to his Lord.
Surah an-Naba', Ayah 40: We have warned you of a near punishment-the Day when a person will observe what his hands have produced, and the faithless will say, "O, I wish I were dust."
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 1: By those who snatch violently.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 2: And those who remove gently.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 3: And those who glide smoothly.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 4: And those who race swiftly.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 5: And those who regulate events.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 6: On the Day when the Quake quakes.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 7: And is followed by the Successor.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 8: Hearts on that Day will be pounding.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 9: Their sights downcast.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 10: They say, "Are we to be restored to the original condition?
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 11: When we have become hollow bones?"
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 12: They say, "This is a losing proposition."
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 13: But it will be only a single nudge.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 14: And they will be awake.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 15: Has the story of Moses reached you?
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 16: When His Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 17: "Go to Pharaoh-he has transgressed."
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 18: And say, "Do you care to be cleansed?
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 19: And I will guide you to your Lord, and you will turn reverent."
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 20: He showed him the Greatest Miracle.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 21: But he denied and defied.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 22: Then turned his back, and tried.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 23: And gathered and proclaimed.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 24: He said, "I am your Lord, the most high."
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 25: So God seized him with an exemplary punishment, in the last and in the first.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 26: In this is a lesson for whoever fears.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 27: Are you more difficult to create, or the heaven? He constructed it.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 28: He raised its masses, and proportioned it.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 29: And He dimmed its night, and brought out its daylight.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 30: And the earth after that He spread.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 31: And from it, He produced its water and its pasture.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 32: And the mountains, He anchored.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 33: A source of enjoyment for you and for your animals.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 34: But when the Great Cataclysm arrives.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 35: A Day when man will remember what he has endeavored.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 36: And Hell will be displayed to whoever sees.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 37: As for him who was defiant.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 38: And preferred the life of this world.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 39: Then Hell is the shelter.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 40: But as for him who feared the Standing of his Lord, and restrained the self from desires.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 41: Then Paradise is the shelter.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 42: They ask you about the Hour, "When will it take place?"
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 43: You have no knowledge of it.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 44: To your Lord is its finality.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 45: You are just a warner for whoever dreads it.
Surah an-Nazi'at, Ayah 46: On the Day when they witness it-as though they only stayed an evening, or its morning.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 1: They ask you about the bounties. Say, "The bounties are for God and the Messenger." So be mindful of God, and settle your differences, and obey God and His Messenger, if you are believers.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 2: The believers are those whose hearts tremble when God is mentioned, and when His revelations are recited to them, they strengthen them in faith, and upon their Lord they rely.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 3: Those who perform the prayer; and from Our provisions to them, they spend.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 4: These are the true believers. They have high standing with their Lord, and forgiveness, and a generous provision.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 5: Even as your Lord brought you out of your home with the truth, some believers were reluctant.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 6: Arguing with you about the truth after it was made clear, as if they were being driven to death as they looked on.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 7: God has promised you one of the two groups-that it would be yours-but you wanted the unarmed group to be yours. God intends to prove the truth with His words, and to uproot the disbelievers.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 8: In order to confirm the truth and nullify falsehood, even though the guilty dislike it.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 9: When you appealed to your Lord for help, He answered you, "I am reinforcing you with one thousand angels in succession."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 10: God only made it a message of hope, and to set your hearts at rest. Victory comes only from God. God is Mighty and Wise.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 11: He made drowsiness overcome you, as a security from Him. And He sent down upon you water from the sky, to cleanse you with it, and to rid you of Satan's pollution, and to fortify your hearts, and to strengthen your foothold.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 12: Your Lord inspired the angels: "I am with you, so support those who believe. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve. So strike above the necks, and strike off every fingertip of theirs."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 13: That is because they opposed God and His Messenger. Whoever opposes God and His Messenger-God is severe in retribution.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 14: "Here it is; so taste it." For the disbelievers there is the suffering of the Fire.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 15: O you who believe! When you meet those who disbelieve on the march, never turn your backs on them.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 16: Anyone who turns his back on them on that Day, except while maneuvering for battle, or to join another group, has incurred wrath from God, and his abode is Hell-what a miserable destination!

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 17: It was not you who killed them, but it was God who killed them. And it was not you who launched when you launched, but it was God who launched. That He may bestow upon the believers an excellent reward. God is Hearing and Knowing.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 18: Such is the case. God will undermine the strategy of the disbelievers.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 19: If you desire a verdict, the verdict has come to you. And if you desist, it would be best for you. And if you return, We will return; and your troops, however numerous, will not benefit you. God is with the believers.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 20: O you who believe! Obey God and His Messenger, and do not turn away from him when you hear.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 21: And be not like those who say, "We hear," when they do not hear.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 22: The worst of animals to God are the deaf and dumb-those who do not reason.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 23: Had God recognized any good in them, He would have made them hear; and had He made them hear, they would have turned away defiantly.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 24: O you who believe! Respond to God and to the Messenger when He calls you to what will revive you. And know that God stands between a man and his heart, and that to Him you will be gathered.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 25: And beware of discord which does not afflict the wrongdoers among you exclusively; and know that God is severe in retribution.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 26: And remember when you were few, oppressed in the land, fearing that people may capture you; but He sheltered you, and supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things-so that you may be thankful.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 27: O you who believe! Do not betray God and the Messenger, nor betray your trusts, while you know.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 28: And know that your possessions and your children are a test, and that God possesses an immense reward.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 29: O you who believe! If you remain conscious of God, He will give you a criterion, and will remit from you your sins, and will forgive you. God is possessor of infinite grace.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 30: When the disbelievers plotted against you, to imprison you, or kill you, or expel you. They planned, and God planned, but God is the Best of planners.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 31: And when Our revelations are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. Had we wanted, we could have said the like of this; these are nothing but myths of the ancients."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 32: And they said, "Our God, if this is the truth from You, then rain down on us stones from the sky, or visit us with a painful affliction."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 33: But God would not punish them while you are amongst them. And God would not punish them as long as they seek forgiveness.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 34: Yet why should God not punish them, when they are turning others away from the Sacred Mosque, although they are not its custodians? Its rightful custodians are the pious; but most of them do not know.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 35: Their prayer at the House was nothing but whistling and clapping-so taste the punishment for your blasphemy.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 36: Those who disbelieve spend their wealth to repel from God's path. They will spend it, then it will become a source of sorrow for them, and then they will be defeated. Those who disbelieve will be herded into Hell.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 37: That God may distinguish the bad from the good, and heap the bad on top of one another, and pile them together, and throw them in Hell. These are the losers.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 38: Say to those who disbelieve: if they desist, their past will be forgiven. But if they persist-the practice of the ancients has passed away.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 39: Fight them until there is no more persecution, and religion becomes exclusively for God. But if they desist-God is Seeing of what they do.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 40: And if they turn away, know that God is your Protector. The Best Protector, and the Best Supporter.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 41: And know that whatever spoils you gain, to God belongs its fifth, and to the Messenger, and the relatives, and the orphans, and the poor, and to the wayfarer, provided you believe in God and in what We revealed to Our servant on the Day of Distinction, the day when the two armies met. God is Capable of everything.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 42: Recall when you were on the nearer bank, and they were on the further bank, and the caravan was below you. Had you planned for this meeting, you would have disagreed on the timing, but God was to carry out a predetermined matter, so that those who perish would perish by clear evidence, and those who survive would survive by clear evidence. God is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 43: God made them appear in your dream as few. Had He made them appear as many, you would have lost heart, and disputed in the matter. But God saved the situation. He knows what the hearts contain.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 44: When you met, He made them appear as few in your eyes, and made you appear fewer in their eyes, so that God may conclude a predetermined matter. To God all matters revert.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 45: O you who believe! When you meet a force, stand firm, and remember God much, so that you may prevail.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 46: And obey God and His Messenger, and do not dispute, lest you falter and lose your courage. And be steadfast. God is with the steadfast.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 47: And do not be like those who left their homes boastfully, showing off before the people, and barring others from the path of God. God comprehends what they do.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 48: Satan made their deeds appear good to them, and said, "You cannot be defeated by any people today, and I am at your side." But when the two armies came in sight of one another, he turned on his heels, and said, "I am innocent of you; I see what you do not see; I fear God; God is severe in punishment."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 49: The hypocrites and those in whose hearts is sickness said, "Their religion has deluded these people." But whoever puts his trust in God-God is Mighty and Wise.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 50: If only you could see, as the angels take away those who disbelieve, striking their faces and their backs: "Taste the agony of the Burning."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 51: "That is because of what your hands have committed, and because God is not unjust to the servants."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 52: Like the behavior of the people of Pharaoh, and those before them. They rejected the signs of God, so God seized them for their sins. God is Powerful, Severe in punishment.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 53: That is because God would never change a blessing He has bestowed on a people unless they change what is within themselves, and because God is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 54: Such was the case with the people of Pharaoh, and those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We annihilated them for their wrongs, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh-they were all evildoers.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 55: The worst of creatures in God's view are those who disbelieve. They have no faith.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 56: Those of them with whom you made a treaty, but they violate their agreement every time. They are not righteous.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 57: If you confront them in battle, make of them a fearsome example for those who follow them, that they may take heed.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 58: If you fear treachery on the part of a people, break off with them in a like manner. God does not like the treacherous.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 59: Let not the disbelievers assume that they are ahead. They will not escape.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 60: And prepare against them all the power you can muster, and all the cavalry you can mobilize, to terrify thereby God's enemies and your enemies, and others besides them whom you do not know, but God knows them. Whatever you spend in God's way will be repaid to you in full, and you will not be wronged.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 61: But if they incline towards peace, then incline towards it, and put your trust in God. He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 62: If they intend to deceive you-God is sufficient for you. It is He who supported you with His aid, and with the believers.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 63: And He united their hearts. Had you spent everything on earth, you would not have united their hearts, but God united them together. He is Mighty and Wise.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 64: O prophet! Count on God, and on the believers who have followed you.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 65: O prophet! Rouse the believers to battle. If there are twenty steadfast among you, they will defeat two hundred; and if there are a hundred of you, they will defeat a thousand of those who disbelieve; because they are a people who do not understand.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 66: God has now lightened your burden, knowing that there is weakness in you. If there are a hundred steadfast among you, they will defeat two hundred; and if there are a thousand of you, they will defeat two thousand by God's leave. God is with the steadfast.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 67: It is not for a prophet to take prisoners before he has subdued the land. You desire the materials of this world, but God desires the Hereafter. God is Strong and Wise.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 68: Were it not for a predetermined decree from God, an awful punishment would have afflicted you for what you have taken.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 69: So consume what you have gained, legitimate and wholesome; and remain conscious of God. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 70: O prophet! Say to those you hold prisoners, "If God finds any good in your hearts, He will give you better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you. God is Forgiving and Merciful."
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 71: But if they intend to betray you, they have already betrayed God, and He has overpowered them. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 72: Those who believed, and emigrated, and struggled in God's cause with their possessions and their persons, and those who provided shelter and support-these are allies of one another. As for those who believed, but did not emigrate, you owe them no protection, until they have emigrated. But if they ask you for help in religion, you must come to their aid, except against a people with whom you have a treaty. God is Seeing of what you do.
Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 73: As for those who disbelieve, they are allies of one another. Unless you do this, there will be turmoil in the land, and much corruption.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 74: Those who believed, and emigrated, and struggled for God's cause, and those who gave shelter and support-these are the true believers. They will have forgiveness, and a bountiful provision.

Surah al-Anfal, Ayah 75: As for those who believed afterwards, and emigrated and struggled with you-these belong with you. But family members are nearer to one another in the Book of God. God is Cognizant of everything.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 1: He frowned and turned away.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 2: When the blind man approached him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 3: But how do you know? Perhaps he was seeking to purify himself.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 4: Or be reminded, and the message would benefit him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 5: But as for him who was indifferent.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 6: You gave him your attention.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 7: Though you are not liable if he does not purify himself.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 8: But as for him who came to you seeking.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 9: In awe.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 10: To him you were inattentive.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 11: Do not. This is a Lesson.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 12: Whoever wills, shall remember it.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 13: On honorable pages.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 14: Exalted and purified.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 15: By the hands of scribes.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 16: Noble and devoted.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 17: Perish man! How thankless he is!
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 18: From what did He create him?
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 19: From a sperm drop He created him, and enabled him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 20: Then He eased the way for him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 21: Then He puts him to death, and buries him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 22: Then, when He wills, He will resurrect him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 23: But no, he did not fulfill what He has commanded him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 24: Let man consider his food.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 25: We pour down water in abundance.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 26: Then crack the soil open.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 27: And grow in it grains.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 28: And grapes and herbs.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 29: And olives and dates.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 30: And luscious gardens.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 31: And fruits and vegetables.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 32: Enjoyment for you, and for your livestock.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 33: But when the Deafening Noise comes to pass.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 34: The Day when a person will flee from his brother.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 35: And his mother and his father.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 36: And his consort and his children.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 37: Every one of them, on that Day, will have enough to preoccupy him.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 38: Faces on that Day will be radiant.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 39: Laughing and rejoicing.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 40: And Faces on that Day will be covered with misery.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 41: Overwhelmed by remorse.
Surah 'Abasa, Ayah 42: These are the faithless, the vicious.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 1: When the sun is rolled up.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 2: When the stars are dimmed.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 3: When the mountains are set in motion.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 4: When the relationships are suspended.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 5: When the beasts are gathered.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 6: When the oceans are set aflame.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 7: When the souls are paired.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 8: When the girl, buried alive, is asked:
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 9: For what crime was she killed?
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 10: When the records are made public.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 11: When the sky is peeled away.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 12: When the Fire is set ablaze.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 13: When Paradise is brought near.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 14: Each soul will know what it has readied.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 15: I swear by the galaxies.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 16: Precisely running their courses.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 17: And by the night as it recedes.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 18: And by the morn as it breathes.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 19: This is the speech of a noble messenger.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 20: Endowed with power, eminent with the Lord of the Throne.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 21: Obeyed and honest.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 22: Your friend is not possessed.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 23: He saw him on the luminous horizon.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 24: And He does not withhold knowledge of the Unseen.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 25: And it is not the word of an accursed devil.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 26: So where are you heading?
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 27: It is only a Reminder to all mankind.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 28: To whoever of you wills to go straight.
Surah at-Takwir, Ayah 29: But you cannot will, unless God wills-The Lord of the Worlds.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 1: When the sky breaks apart.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 2: When the planets are scattered.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 3: When the oceans are exploded.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 4: When the tombs are strewn around.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 5: Each soul will know what it has advanced, and what it has deferred.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 6: O man! What deluded you concerning your Lord, the Most Generous?
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 7: He Who created you, and formed you, and proportioned you?
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 8: In whatever shape He willed, He assembled you.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 9: But you reject the religion.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 10: Though over you are watchers.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 11: Honest recorders.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 12: They know everything you do.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 13: The virtuous will be in bliss.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 14: While the wicked will be in Hell.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 15: They will enter it on the Day of Justice.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 16: And they will not be absent from it.
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 17: But what will convey to you what the Day of Justice is?
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 18: Then again, what will convey to you what the Day of Justice is?
Surah al-Infithar, Ayah 19: The Day when no soul will avail another soul anything; and the decision on that Day is God's.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 1: Woe to the defrauders.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 2: Those who, when they take a measure from people, they take in full.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 3: But when they measure or weigh to others, they cheat.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 4: Do these not know that they will be resurrected?
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 5: For a Great Day?
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 6: The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the Worlds?
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 7: Not at all. The record of the wicked is in Sijjeen.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 8: But how can you know what Sijjeen is?
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 9: A numerical book.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 10: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 11: Those who deny the Day of Reckoning.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 12: But none denies it except the sinful aggressor.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 13: When Our revelations are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the ancients."
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 14: Not at all. Their hearts have become corroded by what they used to earn.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 15: Not at all. On that Day, they will be screened from their Lord.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 16: Then they will roast in Hell.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 17: Then it will be said, "This is what you used to deny."
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 18: No indeed; the record of the righteous is in Elliyyeen.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 19: But how can you know what Elliyyoon is?
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 20: A numerical book.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 21: Witnessed by those brought near.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 22: Indeed, the righteous will be amid bliss.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 23: On thrones, looking on.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 24: You will recognize on their faces the radiance of bliss.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 25: They will be given to drink a sealed wine.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 26: Whose seal is musk-this is what competitors should compete for.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 27: Its mixture is of Tasneem.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 28: A spring from which those brought near drink.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 29: Those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 30: And when they passed by them, they would wink at one another.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 31: And when they went back to their families, they would go back exulting.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 32: And if they saw them, they would say, "These people are lost."
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 33: Yet they were not sent as guardians over them.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 34: But on that Day, those who believed will laugh at the unbelievers.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 35: On luxurious furnishings, looking on.
Surah al-Muthaffifin, Ayah 36: Have the unbelievers been repaid for what they used to do?
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 1: When the sky is ruptured.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 2: And hearkens to its Lord, as it must.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 3: And when the earth is leveled out.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 4: And casts out what is in it, and becomes empty.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 5: And hearkens to its Lord, as it must.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 6: O man! You are laboring towards your Lord, and you will meet Him.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 7: As for him who is given his book in his right hand.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 8: He will have an easy settlement.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 9: And will return to his family delighted.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 10: But as for him who is given his book behind his back.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 11: He will call for death.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 12: And will enter the Blaze.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 13: He used to be happy among his family.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 14: He thought he would never return.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 15: In fact, his Lord was watching him.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 16: I swear by the twilight.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 17: And by the night, and what it covers.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 18: And by the moon, as it grows full.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 19: You will mount stage by stage.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 20: What is the matter with them that they do not believe?
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 21: And when the Quran is read to them, they do not bow down?
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 22: In fact, those who disbelieve are in denial.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 23: But God knows what they hide inside.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 24: So inform them of a painful punishment.
Surah al-Insyiqaq, Ayah 25: Except those who believe and do good deeds; they will have an undiminished reward.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 1: By the sky with the constellations.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 2: And by the Promised Day.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 3: And by the witness and the witnessed.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 4: Destroyed were the People of the Trench.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 5: The fire supplied with fuel.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 6: While they sat around it.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 7: And were witnessing what they did to the believers.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 8: They begrudged them only because they believed in God the Almighty, the Praiseworthy.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 9: To Whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. God is witness over everything.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 10: Those who tempt the believers, men and women, then do not repent; for them is the punishment of Hell; for them is the punishment of Burning.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 11: Those who believe and do righteous deeds will have Gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great triumph.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 12: The onslaught of your Lord is severe.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 13: It is He who begins and repeats.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 14: And He is the Forgiving, the Loving.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 15: Possessor of the Glorious Throne.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 16: Doer of whatever He wills.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 17: Has there come to you the story of the legions?
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 18: Of Pharaoh and Thamood?
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 19: In fact, those who disbelieve are in denial.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 20: And God encloses them from beyond.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 21: In fact, it is a Glorious Quran.
Surah al-Buruj, Ayah 22: In a Preserved Tablet.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 1: By the sky and at-Tariq.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 2: But what will let you know what at-Tariq is?
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 3: The Piercing Star.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 4: There is no soul without a Protector over it.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 5: Let man consider what he was created from.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 6: He was created from gushing liquid.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 7: Issuing from between the backbone and the breastbones.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 8: He is certainly able to return him.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 9: On the Day when the secrets are disclosed.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 10: He will have no strength, and no supporter.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 11: By the sky that returns.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 12: And the earth that cracks open.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 13: It is a Decisive Word.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 14: It is no joke.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 15: They plot and scheme.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 16: But I plot and scheme.
Surah ath-Thariq, Ayah 17: Therefore, give the blasphemers respite, a brief respite.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 1: Praise the Name of your Lord, the Most High.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 2: He who creates and regulates.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 3: He who measures and guides.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 4: He who produces the pasture.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 5: And then turns it into light debris.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 6: We will make you read, so do not forget.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 7: Except what God wills. He knows what is declared, and what is hidden.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 8: We will ease you into the Easy Way.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 9: So remind, if reminding helps.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 10: The reverent will remember.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 11: But the wretched will avoid it.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 12: He who will enter the Gigantic Fire.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 13: Where he will neither die, nor live.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 14: Successful is he who purifies himself.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 15: And mentions the name of his Lord, and prays.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 16: But you prefer the present life.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 17: Though the Hereafter is better, and more lasting.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 18: This is in the former scriptures.
Surah al-A'la, Ayah 19: The Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 1: Has there come to you the news of the overwhelming?
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 2: Faces on that Day will be shamed.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 3: Laboring and exhausted.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 4: Roasting in a scorching Fire.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 5: Given to drink from a flaming spring.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 6: They will have no food except thorns.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 7: That neither nourishes, nor satisfies hunger.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 8: Faces on that Day will be joyful.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 9: Satisfied with their endeavor.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 10: In a lofty Garden.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 11: In it you will hear no nonsense.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 12: In it is a flowing spring.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 13: In it are raised beds.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 14: And cups set in place.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 15: And cushions set in rows.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 16: And carpets spread around.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 17: Do they not look at the camels-how they are created?
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 18: And at the sky-how it is raised?
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 19: And at the mountains-how they are installed?
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 20: And at the earth-how it is spread out?
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 21: So remind. You are only a reminder.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 22: You have no control over them.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 23: But whoever turns away and disbelieves.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 24: God will punish him with the greatest punishment.
Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 25: To Us is their return.
