Surah al-Ghasyiyah, Ayah 26: Then upon Us rests their reckoning.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 1: By the daybreak.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 2: And ten nights.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 3: And the even and the odd.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 4: And the night as it recedes.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 5: Is there in this an oath for a rational person?
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 6: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with Aad?
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 7: Erum of the pillars.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 8: The like of which was never created in the land.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 9: And Thamood-those who carved the rocks in the valley.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 10: And Pharaoh of the Stakes.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 11: Those who committed excesses in the lands.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 12: And spread much corruption therein.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 13: So your Lord poured down upon them a scourge of punishment.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 14: Your Lord is on the lookout.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 15: As for man, whenever his Lord tests him, and honors him, and prospers him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 16: But whenever He tests him, and restricts his livelihood for him, he says, "My Lord has insulted me."
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 17: Not at all. But you do not honor the orphan.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 18: And you do not urge the feeding of the poor.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 19: And you devour inheritance with all greed.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 20: And you love wealth with immense love.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 21: No-when the earth is leveled, pounded, and crushed.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 22: And your Lord comes, with the angels, row after row.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 23: And on that Day, Hell is brought forward. On that Day, man will remember, but how will remembrance avail him?
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 24: He will say, "If only I had forwarded for my life."
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 25: On that Day, none will punish as He punishes.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 26: And none will shackle as He shackles.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 27: But as for you, O tranquil soul.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 28: Return to your Lord, pleased and accepted.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 29: Enter among My servants.
Surah al-Fajr, Ayah 30: Enter My Paradise.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 1: A declaration of immunity from God and His Messenger to the polytheists with whom you had made a treaty.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 2: So travel the land for four months, and know that you cannot escape God, and that God will disgrace the disbelievers.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 3: And a proclamation from God and His Messenger to the people on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage, that God has disowned the polytheists, and so did His Messenger. If you repent, it will be better for you. But if you turn away, know that you cannot escape God. And announce to those who disbelieve a painful punishment.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 4: Except for those among the polytheists with whom you had made a treaty, and did not violate any of its terms, nor aided anyone against you. So fulfill the treaty with them to the end of its term. God loves the righteous.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 5: When the Sacred Months have passed, kill the polytheists wherever you find them. And capture them, and besiege them, and lie in wait for them at every ambush. But if they repent, and perform the prayers, and pay the alms, then let them go their way. God is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 6: And if anyone of the polytheists asks you for protection, give him protection so that he may hear the Word of God; then escort him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 7: How can there be a treaty with the polytheists on the part of God and His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at the Sacred Mosque? As long as they are upright with you, be upright with them. God loves the pious.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 8: How? Whenever they overcome you, they respect neither kinship nor treaty with you. They satisfy you with lip service, but their hearts refuse, and most of them are immoral.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 9: They traded away God's revelations for a cheap price, so they barred others from His path. How evil is what they did.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 10: Towards a believer they respect neither kinship nor treaty. These are the transgressors.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 11: But if they repent, and perform the prayers, and give the obligatory charity, then they are your brethren in faith. We detail the revelations for a people who know.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 12: But if they violate their oaths after their pledge, and attack your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief-they have no faith-so that they may desist.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 13: Will you not fight a people who violated their oaths, and planned to exile the Messenger, and initiated hostilities against you? Do you fear them? It is God you should fear, if you are believers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 14: Fight them. God will punish them at your hands, and humiliate them, and help you against them, and heal the hearts of a believing people.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 15: And He will remove the anger of their hearts. God redeems whomever He wills. God is Knowledgeable and Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 16: Or do you think that you will be left alone, without God identifying which of you will strive, and take no supporters apart from God, His Messenger, and the believers? God is well Aware of what you do.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 17: It is not for the polytheists to attend God's places of worship while professing their disbelief. These-their works are in vain, and in the Fire they will abide.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 18: The only people to attend God's places of worship are those who believe in God and the Last Day, and pray regularly, and practice regular charity, and fear none but God. These are most likely to be guided.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 19: Do you consider giving water to pilgrims and maintaining the Sacred Mosque the same as believing in God and the Last Day and striving in God's path? They are not equal in God's sight. God does not guide the unjust people.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 20: Those who believe, and emigrate, and strive in God's path with their possessions and their persons, are of a higher rank with God. These are the winners.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 21: Their Lord announces to them good news of mercy from Him, and acceptance, and gardens wherein they will have lasting bliss.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 22: Abiding therein forever. With God is a great reward.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 23: O you who believe! Do not ally yourselves with your parents and your siblings if they prefer disbelief to belief. Whoever of you allies himself with them-these are the wrongdoers.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 24: Say, "If your parents, and your children, and your siblings, and your spouses, and your relatives, and the wealth you have acquired, and a business you worry about, and homes you love, are more dear to you than God, and His Messenger, and the struggle in His cause, then wait until God executes His judgment." God does not guide the sinful people.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 25: God has given you victory in numerous regions; but on the day of Hunayn, your great number impressed you, but it availed you nothing; and the land, as spacious as it was, narrowed for you; and you turned your backs in retreat.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 26: Then God sent down His serenity upon His Messenger, and upon the believers; and He sent down troops you did not see; and He punished those who disbelieved. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 27: Then, after that, God will relent towards whomever He wills. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 28: O you who believe! The polytheists are polluted, so let them not approach the Sacred Mosque after this year of theirs. And if you fear poverty, God will enrich you from His grace, if He wills. God is Aware and Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 29: Fight those who do not believe in God, nor in the Last Day, nor forbid what God and His Messenger have forbidden, nor abide by the religion of truth-from among those who received the Scripture-until they pay the due tax, willingly or unwillingly.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 30: The Jews said, "Ezra is the son of God," and the Christians said, "The Messiah is the son of God." These are their statements, out of their mouths. They emulate the statements of those who blasphemed before. May God assail them! How deceived they are!

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 31: They have taken their rabbis and their priests as lords instead of God, as well as the Messiah son of Mary. Although they were commanded to worship none but The One God. There is no god except He. Glory be to Him; High above what they associate with Him.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 32: They want to extinguish God's light with their mouths, but God refuses except to complete His light, even though the disbelievers dislike it.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 33: It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, in order to make it prevail over all religions, even though the idolaters dislike it.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 34: O you who believe! Many of the rabbis and priests consume people's wealth illicitly, and hinder from God's path. Those who hoard gold and silver, and do not spend them in God's cause, inform them of a painful punishment.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 35: On the Day when they will be heated in the Fire of Hell, then their foreheads, and their sides, and their backs will be branded with them: "This is what you hoarded for yourselves; so taste what you used to hoard."

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 36: The number of months, according to God, is twelve months-in the decree of God-since the Day He created the heavens and the earth, of which four are sacred. This is the correct religion. So do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight the polytheists collectively, as they fight you collectively, and know that God is with the righteous.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 37: Postponement is an increase in disbelief-by which those who disbelieve are led astray. They allow it one year, and forbid it another year, in order to conform to the number made sacred by God, thus permitting what God has forbidden. The evil of their deeds seems good to them. God does not guide the disbelieving people.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 38: O you who believe! What is the matter with you, when it is said to you, "Mobilize in the cause of God," you cling heavily to the earth? Do you prefer the present life to the Hereafter? The enjoyment of the present life, compared to the Hereafter, is only a little.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 39: Unless you mobilize, He will punish you most painfully, and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all. God has power over all things.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 40: If you do not help him, God has already helped him, when those who disbelieved expelled him, and he was the second of two in the cave. He said to his friend, "Do not worry, God is with us." And God made His tranquility descend upon him, and supported him with forces you did not see, and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the Word of God is the Highest. God is Mighty and Wise.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 41: Mobilize, light or heavy, and strive with your possessions and your lives in the cause of God. That is better for you, if you only knew.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 42: Had the gain been immediate, and the journey shorter, they would have followed you; but the distance seemed too long for them. Still they swear by God: "Had we been able, we would have marched out with you." They damn their own souls, and God knows that they are lying.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 43: May God pardon you! Why did you give them permission before it became clear to you who are the truthful ones, and who are the liars?
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 44: Those who believe in God and the Last Day do not ask you for exemption from striving with their possessions and their lives. God is fully aware of the righteous.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 45: Only those who do not believe in God and the Last Day ask you for exemption. Their hearts are full of doubts, so they waver in their doubts.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 46: Had they wanted to mobilize, they would have made preparations for it; but God disliked their participation, so he held them back, and it was said, "Stay behind with those who stay behind."

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 47: Had they mobilized with you, they would have added only to your difficulties, and they would have spread rumors in your midst, trying to sow discord among you. Some of you are avid listeners to them. God is Aware of the wrongdoers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 48: They tried to cause conflict before, and they hatched plots against you, until the truth prevailed, and the command of God became evident-in spite of their dislike.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 49: Among them is he who says, "Excuse me, and do not trouble me." In fact, they sunk into trouble. In fact, Hell will engulf the disbelievers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 50: If something good happens to you, it upsets them; and if a calamity befalls you, they say, "We took our precautions in advance," and they depart, happy.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 51: Say, "Nothing will happen to us except what God has ordained for us; He is our Protector." In God let the faithful put their trust.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 52: Say, "Are you expecting for us anything other than one of the two excellences? As for us: we are expecting that God will afflict you with a punishment from Himself, or at our hands. So wait, we are waiting with you."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 53: Say, "Whether you spend willingly or unwillingly, it will not be accepted from you. You are evil people."

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 54: What prevents the acceptance of their contributions is nothing but the fact that they disbelieved in God and His Messenger, and that they do not approach the prayer except lazily, and that they do not spend except grudgingly.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 55: Let neither their possessions nor their children impress you. God intends to torment them through them in this worldly life, and that their souls depart while they are disbelievers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 56: They swear by God that they are of you. But they are not of you. They are divisive people.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 57: Were they to find a shelter, or a cave, or a hideout, they would go to it, rushing.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 58: And among them are those who criticize you in regard to charities. If they are given some of it, they become pleased; but if they are not given any, they grow resentful.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 59: If only they were content with what God and His Messenger have given them, and said, "God is sufficient for us; God will give us of His bounty, and so will His Messenger; to God we eagerly turn."

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 60: Charities are for the poor, and the destitute, and those who administer them, and for reconciling hearts, and for freeing slaves, and for those in debt, and in the path of God, and for the traveler in need-an obligation from God. God is All-Knowing, Most Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 61: And among them are those who insult the Prophet, and say, "He is all ears." Say, "He listens for your own good. He believes in God, and trusts the believers, and is mercy for those of you who believe." Those who insult the Messenger of God will have a painful penalty.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 62: They swear to you by God to please you. But it is more proper for them to please God and His Messenger, if they are believers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 63: Do they not know that whoever opposes God and His Messenger, will have the Fire of Hell, abiding in it forever? That is the supreme disgrace.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 64: The hypocrites worry lest a chapter may be revealed about them, informing them of what is in their hearts. Say, "Go on mocking; God will bring out what you fear."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 65: If you ask them, they will say, "We were just joking and playing." Say, "Were you making jokes about God, His revelations, and His Messenger?"
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 66: Do not apologize. You have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon some of you, We will punish others, because they are guilty.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 67: The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They advocate evil, and prohibit righteousness, and withhold their hands. They forgot God, so He forgot them. The hypocrites are the sinners.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 68: God has promised the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the disbelievers, the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever. It is their due. And God has cursed them. They will have a lasting punishment.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 69: Like those before you. They were more powerful than you, and had more wealth and children. They enjoyed their share, and you enjoyed your share, as those before you enjoyed their share. And you indulged, as they indulged. It is they whose works will fail in this world and in the Hereafter. It is they who are the losers.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 70: Have they not heard the stories of those before them? The people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood; and the people of Abraham, and the inhabitants of Median, and the Overturned Cities? Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs. God never wronged them, but they used to wrong their own selves.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 71: The believing men and believing women are friends of one another. They advocate virtue, forbid evil, perform the prayers, practice charity, and obey God and His Messenger. These-God will have mercy on them. God is Noble and Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 72: God promises the believers, men and women, gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever, and fine homes in the Gardens of Eden. But approval from God is even greater. That is the supreme achievement.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 73: O Prophet! Strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be stern with them. Their abode is Hell-what a miserable destination!

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 74: They swear by God that they said nothing; but they did utter the word of blasphemy, and they renounced faith after their submission. And they plotted what they could not attain. They were resentful only because God and His Messenger have enriched them out of His grace. If they repent, it would be best for them; but if they turn away, God will afflict them with a painful punishment-in this life and in the Hereafter-and they will have on earth no protector and no savior.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 75: Among them are those who promised God: "If He gives us of His bounty, we will donate and be among the upright."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 76: But when He has given them of His bounty, they became stingy with it, and turned away in aversion.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 77: So He penalized them with hypocrisy in their hearts, until the Day they face Him-because they broke their promise to God, and because they used to lie.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 78: Do they not know that God knows their secrets and their conspiracies? And that God is the Knower of the unseen?

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 79: Those who criticize the believers who give charity voluntarily, and ridicule those who find nothing to give except their own efforts-God ridicules them. They will have a painful punishment.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 80: Whether you ask forgiveness for them, or do not ask forgiveness for them-even if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times, God will not forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in God and His Messenger. God does not guide the immoral people.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 81: Those who stayed behind rejoiced at their staying behind the Messenger of God. And they hated to strive with their wealth and their lives in God's way. And they said, "Do not venture out in the heat." Say, "The Fire of Hell is much hotter, if they only understood."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 82: Let them laugh a little, and weep much; in recompense for what they used to earn.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 83: If God brings you back to a party of them, and they ask your permission to go out, say, "You will not go out with me, ever, nor will you ever fight an enemy with me. You were content to sit back the first time, so sit back with those who stay behind."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 84: You are never to pray over anyone of them who dies, nor are you to stand at his graveside. They rejected God and His Messenger, and died while they were sinners.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 85: Do not let their possessions and their children impress you. God desires to torment them through them in this world, and their souls expire while they are disbelievers.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 86: When a chapter is revealed, stating: "Believe in God and strive with His Messenger," the prominent among them ask you for exemption. They say, "Allow us to stay with those who stay behind."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 87: They prefer to be with those who stay behind. Their hearts were sealed, so they do not understand.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 88: But the Messenger and those who believe with him struggle with their possessions and their lives. These have deserved the good things. These are the successful.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 89: God has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great victory.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 90: Some of the Desert-Arabs came to make excuses, asking to be granted exemption, while those who were untrue to God and His Messenger stayed behind. A painful punishment will afflict those among them who disbelieved.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 91: There is no blame on the weak, nor on the sick, nor on those who have nothing to give, provided they are true to God and His Messenger. In no way can the righteous be blamed. God is Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 92: Nor on those who approach you, wishing to ride with you, and you said, "I have nothing to carry you on." So they went away, with their eyes overflowing with tears, sorrowing for not finding the means to spend.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 93: But blame is on those who ask you for exemption, although they are rich. They are content to be with those who stay behind. God has sealed their hearts, so they do not know.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 94: They present excuses to you when you return to them. Say, "Do not offer excuses; we do not trust you; God has informed us of you. And God will watch your actions, and so will the Messenger; then you will be returned to the Knower of the Invisible and the Visible, and He will inform you of what you used to do."

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 95: They will swear to you by God, when you return to them, that you may leave them alone. So leave them alone. They are a disgrace, and their destiny is Hell; a reward for what they used to earn.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 96: They will swear to you that you may accept them. But even if you accept them, God does not accept the wicked people.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 97: The Desert-Arabs are the most steeped in disbelief and hypocrisy, and the most likely to ignore the limits that God revealed to His Messenger. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 98: And among the Desert-Arabs are those who consider their contribution to be a fine. And they wait for a reversal of your fortunes. Upon them will fall the cycle of misfortune. God is Hearing and Knowing.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 99: Yet among the Desert-Arabs are those who believe in God and the Last Day, and consider their contribution to be a means towards God, and the prayers of the Messenger. Surely it will draw them closer, and God will admit them into His mercy. God is Forgiving and Compassionate.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 100: The Pioneers-The first of the Migrants and the Supporters, and those who followed them in righteousness. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. He has prepared for them Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will abide forever. That is the sublime triumph.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 101: Among the Desert-Arabs around you there are some hypocrites, and among the inhabitants of Medina too. They have become adamant in hypocrisy. You do not know them, but We know them. We will punish them twice; then they will be returned to a severe torment.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 102: Others have confessed their sins, having mixed good deeds with bad deeds. Perhaps God will redeem them. God is Forgiving and Merciful.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 103: Receive contributions from their wealth, to purify them and sanctify them with it; and pray for them. Your prayer is comfort for them. God is Hearing and Knowing.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 104: Do they not know that God accepts the repentance of His servants, and that He receives the contributions, and that God is the Acceptor of Repentance, the Merciful?

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 105: Say, "Work. God will see your work, and so will His Messenger, and the believers. Then you will be returned to the Knower of secrets and declarations, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 106: Others are held in suspense, awaiting God's decree, as to whether He will punish them, or accept their repentance. God is Aware and Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 107: Then there are those who establish a mosque to cause harm, and disbelief, and disunity among the believers, and as an outpost for those who fight God and His Messenger. They will swear: "Our intentions are nothing but good." But God bears witness that they are liars.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 108: Do not stand in it, ever. A mosque founded upon piety from the first day is worthier of your standing in it. In it are men who love to be purified. God loves those who purify themselves.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 109: Is he who founds his structure upon piety and acceptance from God better, or he who founds his structure on the brink of a cliff that is about to tumble, so it tumbles with him into the Fire of Hell? God does not guide the unjust people.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 110: The structure which they built will remain questionable in their hearts, until their hearts are stopped. God is Knowing and Wise.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 111: God has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties in exchange for Paradise. They fight in God's way, and they kill and get killed. It is a promise binding on Him in the Torah, and the Gospel, and the Quran. And who is more true to his promise than God? So rejoice in making such an exchange-that is the supreme triumph.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 112: Those who repent, those who worship, those who praise, those who journey, those who kneel, those who bow down, those who advocate righteousness and forbid evil, and those who keep God's limits-give good news to the believers.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 113: It is not for the Prophet and those who believe to ask forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they are near relatives, after it has become clear to them that they are people of Hellfire.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 114: Abraham asked forgiveness for his father only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was kind and clement.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 115: God would never lead a people astray, after He had guided them, until He makes clear to them what they should guard against. God has knowledge of all things.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 116: To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He gives life, and He causes death. And besides God, you have neither protector, nor supporter.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 117: God has redeemed the Prophet, and the Emigrants, and the Supporters-those who followed him in the hour of difficulty-after the hearts of some of them almost swerved. Then He pardoned them. He is Kind towards them, Compassionate.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 118: Also towards the three who were left behind. Then, when the earth, as vast as it is, closed in on them, and their very souls closed in on them, and they realized that there was no refuge from God, except in Him, He redeemed them, so that they may repent. God is the Redeemer, the Merciful.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 119: O you who believe! Be conscious of God, and be with the sincere.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 120: It is not for the inhabitants of Medina and the Desert-Arabs around them to stay behind the Messenger of God, nor to prefer themselves to him. That is because they never suffer any thirst, nor fatigue, nor hunger in the cause of God, nor do they take one step that enrages the disbelievers, nor do they gain anything from an enemy, but it is recorded to their credit as a righteous deed. God does not waste the reward of the righteous.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 121: Nor do they spend any expenditure, small or large, nor do they cross any valley, but it is recorded to their credit. That God may reward them in accordance with the best of their deeds.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 122: It is not advisable for the believers to march out altogether. Of every division that marches out, let a group remain behind, to gain understanding of the religion, and to notify their people when they have returned to them, that they may beware.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 123: O you who believe! Fight those of the disbelievers who attack you, and let them find severity in you, and know that God is with the righteous.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 124: Whenever a chapter is revealed, some of them say, "Which of you has this increased in faith?" As for those who believe: it increases them in faith, and they rejoice.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 125: But as for those in whose hearts is sickness: it adds disgrace to their disgrace, and they die as unbelievers.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 126: Do they not see that they are tested once or twice every year? Yet they do not repent, and they do not learn.

Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 127: And whenever a chapter is revealed, they look at one another, "Does anyone see you?" Then they slip away. God has diverted their hearts, because they are a people who do not understand.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 128: There has come to you a messenger from among yourselves, concerned over your suffering, anxious over you. Towards the believers, he is compassionate and merciful.
Surah at-Taubah, Ayah 129: If they turn away, say, "God is enough for me; there is no god except He; in Him I have put my trust; He is the Lord of the Sublime Throne."
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 1: I swear by this land.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 2: And you are a resident of this land.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 3: And by a father and what he fathered.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 4: We created man in distress.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 5: Does he think that no one has power over him?
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 6: He says, "I have used up so much money."
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 7: Does he think that no one sees him?
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 8: Did We not give him two eyes?
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 9: And a tongue, and two lips?
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 10: And We showed him the two ways?
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 11: But he did not brave the ascent.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 12: And what will explain to you what the ascent is?
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 13: The freeing of a slave.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 14: Or the feeding on a day of hunger.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 15: An orphan near of kin.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 16: Or a destitute in the dust.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 17: Then he becomes of those who believe, and advise one another to patience, and advise one another to kindness.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 18: These are the people of happiness.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 19: But as for those who defy Our revelations-these are the people of misery.
Surah al-Balad, Ayah 20: Upon them is a padlocked Fire.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 1: By the sun and its radiance.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 2: And the moon as it follows it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 3: And the day as it reveals it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 4: And the night as it conceals it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 5: And the sky and He who built it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 6: And the earth and He who spread it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 7: And the soul and He who proportioned it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 8: And inspired it with its wickedness and its righteousness.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 9: Successful is he who purifies it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 10: Failing is he who corrupts it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 11: Thamood denied in its pride.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 12: When it followed its most wicked.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 13: The messenger of God said to them, "This is the she-camel of God, so let her drink."
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 14: But they called him a liar, and hamstrung her. So their Lord crushed them for their sin, and leveled it.
Surah asy-Syams, Ayah 15: And He does not fear its sequel.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 1: By the night as it covers.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 2: And the day as it reveals.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 3: And He who created the male and the female.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 4: Your endeavors are indeed diverse.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 5: As for him who gives and is righteous.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 6: And confirms goodness.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 7: We will ease his way towards ease.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 8: But as for him who is stingy and complacent.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 9: And denies goodness.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 10: We will ease his way towards difficulty.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 11: And his money will not avail him when he plummets.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 12: It is upon Us to guide.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 13: And to Us belong the Last and the First.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 14: I have warned you of a Fierce Blaze.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 15: None will burn in it except the very wicked.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 16: He who denies and turns away.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 17: But the devout will avoid it.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 18: He who gives his money to become pure.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 19: Seeking no favor in return.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 20: Only seeking the acceptance of his Lord, the Most High.
Surah  al-Lail , Ayah 21: And he will be satisfied.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 1: By the morning light.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 2: And the night as it settles.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 3: Your Lord did not abandon you, nor did He forget.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 4: The Hereafter is better for you than the First.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 5: And your Lord will give you, and you will be satisfied.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 6: Did He not find you orphaned, and sheltered you?
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 7: And found you wandering, and guided you.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 8: And found you in need, and enriched you?
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 9: Therefore, do not mistreat the orphan.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 10: Nor rebuff the seeker.
Surah ad-Dhuha, Ayah 11: But proclaim the blessings of your Lord.
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 1: Did We not soothe your heart?
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 2: And lift from you your burden.
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 3: Which weighed down your back?
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 4: And raised for you your reputation?
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 5: With hardship comes ease.
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 6: With hardship comes ease.
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 7: When your work is done, turn to devotion.
Surah al-Insyirah , Ayah 8: And to your Lord turn for everything.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 1: By the fig and the olive.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 2: And Mount Sinai.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 3: And this safe land.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 4: We created man in the best design.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 5: Then reduced him to the lowest of the low.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 6: Except those who believe and do righteous deeds; for them is a reward without end.
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 7: So why do you still reject the religion?
Surah at-Tin, Ayah 8: Is God not the Wisest of the wise?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 1: Read: In the Name of your Lord who created.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 2: Created man from a clot.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 3: Read: And your Lord is the Most Generous.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 4: He who taught by the pen.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 5: Taught man what he never knew.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 6: In fact, man oversteps all bounds.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 7: When he considers himself exempt.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 8: But to your Lord is the return.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 9: Have you seen him who prevents?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 10: A servant when he prays?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 11: Do you think he is upon guidance?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 12: Or advocates righteousness?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 13: Do you see how he disbelieved and turned away?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 14: Does he not know that God sees?
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 15: No. If he does not desist, We will drag him by the forelock.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 16: A deceitful, sinful forelock.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 17: Let him call on his gang.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 18: We will call the Guards.
Surah al-'Alaq, Ayah 19: No, do not obey him; but kneel down, and come near.
Surah al-Qadr, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Qadr, Ayah 1: We sent it down on the Night of Decree.
Surah al-Qadr, Ayah 2: But what will convey to you what the Night of Decree is?
Surah al-Qadr, Ayah 3: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
Surah al-Qadr, Ayah 4: In it descend the angels and the Spirit, by the leave of their Lord, with every command.
Surah al-Qadr, Ayah 5: Peace it is; until the rise of dawn.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 1: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, and the Polytheists, were not apart, until the Clear Evidence came to them.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 2: A messenger from God reciting purified scripts.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 3: In them are valuable writings.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 4: Those who were given the Scripture did not splinter, except after the Clear Evidence came to them.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 5: They were commanded only to worship God, devoting their faith to Him alone, and to practice regular prayer, and to give alms. That is the upright religion.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 6: Those who disbelieve among the People of the Scripture, and the Polytheists, will be in the Fire of Hell, where they will abide forever. These are the worst of creatures.
Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 7: As for those who believe and lead a righteous life-these are the best of creatures.

Surah al-Bayyinah, Ayah 8: Their reward is with their Lord: Gardens of Eternity beneath which rivers flow, where they will abide forever. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is for whoever fears His Lord.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 1: When the earth is shaken with its quake.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 2: And the earth brings out its loads.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 3: And man says, "What is the matter with it?"
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 4: On that Day, it will tell its tales.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 5: For your Lord will have inspired it.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 6: On that Day, the people will emerge in droves, to be shown their works.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 7: Whoever has done an atom's weight of good will see it.
Surah al-Zalzalah, Ayah 8: And whoever has done an atom's weight of evil will see it.
